title: Richard III
description: Richard, Duke of York, plots murders, marriages, and other intrigues in order to secure his own place on the throne. This tale of ruthless ambition is part of Shakespeare's cycle of plays about the Wars of the Roses.

title: Love for Love
description: The playboy Valentine prepares, at least nominally, to give up his inheritance in order to continue an irresponsible life and to court the beautiful Angelica, in William Congreve's Restoration comedy and social satire.

title: The Beggar's Opera
description: The outlaw Macheath is repeatedly betrayed and sent to prison, only to avoid hanging in a satirically happy ending, in John Gay's 1728 opera, which served as the inspiration for Kurt Weill and Bertolt Brecht's The Threepenny Opera.

title: The Beaux Stratagem
description: Two impoverished young gentlemen plan to travel through small towns romancing and collecting money from rich women, which leads to comic complications, in George Farquhar's 1707 comedy.

title: A Bold Stroke for a Wife
Othello
description: Othello, a Moor who has become a general in the Venetian army, sees his happy marriage to the beautiful Desdemona destroyed when his seemingly trustworthy ensign, Iago, suggests to him that she may be unfaithful, in William Shakespeare's tragedy of revenge, jealousy and intrigue.

title: King Lear
description:
In William Shakespeare's royal-family tragedy, the aging King Lear divides his estate between
his three daughters, ultimately refusing his youngest and favorite her share because she won't
publicly admit her love for him. The decision leads to chaos and treachery within the kingdom and madness for its monarch.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: King Henry IV, Part I
description: Henry IV's son, Prince Hal, must put aside his preference for drunken carousing with Sir John Falstaff and other lowlifes when his father's throne is threatened by the rebel Hotspur.

title: Cymbeline
description: King Cymbeline's daughter has secretly married her childhood friend, a man of low low birth. The outraged king banishes her suitor, and the soured union sets in motion a tragic tale of innocence, jealousy and betrayal.

title: The Taming of the Shrew
description: A wandering braggart out to marry for money ends up with the shrewish daughter of a rich man, whom he must "tame" even as he falls for her, in William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: King Henry IV, Part I
description: Henry IV's son, Prince Hal, must put aside his preference for drunken carousing with Sir John Falstaff and other lowlifes when his father's throne is threatened by the rebel Hotspur.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: She Stoops to Conquer
description: In Oliver Goldsmith's 1773 comedy, a wealthy English countryman attempts to match his daughter up with a wealthy London resident, but when the daughter learns her suitor prefers lower-class women, she must "stoop to conquer" her man by pretending to be a maid.

title: The Rivals
description: Wealthy captain Jack Absolute pretends to be poor officer Ensign Beverley to win the romantic Lydia in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1775 comedy, which also features such characters as oafish Bob Acres, temper-prone Sir Lucius O'Trigger and Mrs. Malaprop, whose frequent confusion of words and their meanings coined the term "malapropism."

title: The School for Scandal
description: The gossip, backbiting and romantic scheming of London society are satirized in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1777 comedy.

title: The Critic
description: A critic is besieged with requests for support from various playwrights before watching a laughably bad play by an acquaintance, in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1779 comedy.

title: As You Like It
description: Rosalind, banished from her father's kingdom by her usurping uncle, disguises herself as a boy while falling for one, the similarly exiled duke Orlando.

title: Much Ado About Nothing
description: The anti-romantic wits Beatrice and Benedick, who profess to hate each other, are forced by their friends' trickery to admit their true feelings as they help to save the wedding of his fellow soldier Claudio and her cousin Hero.

title: Julius Caesar
description: In William Shakespeare's tragedy of political ambition, corruption and betrayal, Roman senators Brutus and Cassius lead a group effort to assassinate the powerful Julius Caesar, then battle with Mark Antony over control of the state.

description: King Henry VIII of England's decision to divorce Katharine of Aragon and marry Anne Boleyn, in defiance of the Roman Catholic Church, is supported by Cardinal Wolsey, who later regrets his decision, in William Shakespeare's play.

description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

title: Richard III

description: Having defeated Hotspur, Prince Hal becomes King Henry V upon the death of his father, but in order to become a proper king, he must now reject Sir John Falstaff, the drunk and petty criminal with whom he had kept company in younger days.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

description: An aesthetic poet is pursued by many maidens but loves only a milkmaid who disdains the idea of love, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

description: Greek princess Electra waits for her brother, Orestes, to return home and help her plan revenge on their mother, Clytemnestra, for her murdering of their father, Agamemnon, in Sophocles' tragedy.

title: A Doll's House
description: Nora Helmer, a childlike wife and mother accustomed to an existence built around her husband Torvald, comes to confront the truth of her marriage, in Henrik Ibsen's groundbreaking 1879 play.

description: During the Serbio-Bulgarian War of 1885, a Bulgarian woman who is engaged to a hero of the war encounters a Serbian captain who is retreating from the war because he despises it. He teaches her to see beyond the romantic ideals of war, in George Bernard Shaw's 1894 play.

title: An Ideal Husband
description: Sir Robert Chiltern, a newly married and upstanding politician, is threatened when a past scandal is revealed and he must turn to his old friend (who is his wife's former lover) for help, in Oscar Wilde's satire of politics and social intrigue.

title: An Enemy of the People
description: When Dr. Thomas Stockmann discovers toxic contamination in the water used at the local baths, he expects to be hailed as a hero. But since the baths are the town's main source of revenue, the community fights to silence him — and Dr. Stockmann learns there are forces more powerful than truth.

title: The Strange Adventures of Miss Brown

description: A spy for the Union Army during the Civil War falls in love with a daughter of the Confederacy, and then is caught.

description: Ibsen's Hedda Gabler presents a psychological study of a cultivated woman, recently returned from her honeymoon, whose boredom and dissatisfaction in a stifling environment lead her to destroy others — and herself.

description: Nora Helmer, a childlike wife and mother accustomed to an existence built around her husband Torvald, comes to confront the truth of her marriage, in Henrik Ibsen's groundbreaking 1879 play.

title: How He Lied to Her Husband
John Bull's Other Island
description: An Irish civil engineer and his English business partner return to the Irishman's hometown to develop land. While the Irishman would rather forget his home, the ambitious but charming business partner enchants the locals, in George Bernard Shaw's 1904 comedy.

title: Twelfth Night
description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

title: The Taming of the Shrew
description: A wandering braggart out to marry for money ends up with the shrewish daughter of a rich man, whom he must "tame" even as he falls for her, in William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

description: A young lady discovers that the mother who gave her such a high-toned upbringing is, in fact, the madam of a brothel. Far from being ashamed of her profession, Mrs. Warren defends it as the epitome of capitalism.

title: Much Ado About Nothing
description: The anti-romantic wits Beatrice and Benedick, who profess to hate each other, are forced by their friends' trickery to admit their true feelings as they help to save the wedding of his fellow soldier Claudio and her cousin Hero.

title: Hindle Wakes
description: It’s “Wakes Week” in Hindle; the mill is closed and the workers are idle. Fanny Hawthorn is relaxing at the seashore with a girlfriend when she runs into Alan Jeffcote, the mill owner’s son. Alan takes Fanny to an hotel in Wales for a few days of fun, but the fun stops when their parents find out. Of course, Alan should marry Fanny—no matter that Alan is engaged already. Should Alan do the right thing and make an honest woman of Fanny, or should he do the right thing and stand by his fiancé? Hindle Wakes mixes questions of ethics, class, custom and morals into an effervescent fizz of comic realism.

description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

description: A banker who was imprisoned for embezzling money from clients returns to find his wife and sister-in-law warring over his affections and those of his son, in Henrik Ibsen's 1896 play.

title: You Never Can Tell
description: The children of a suffragette, who don't know their father, scheme to find and invite him to lunch, while the modern-thinking daughter is courted by a 19th-century-style ladies' man.

title: H.M.S. Pinafore
description: The daughter of the captain of Her Majesty's Ship Pinafore is in love with a humble sailor, despite her father's hopes that she will marry a better-born suitor, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: Arms and the Man
description: During the Serbio-Bulgarian War of 1885, a Bulgarian woman who is engaged to a hero of the war encounters a Serbian captain who is retreating from the war because he despises it. He teaches her to see beyond the romantic ideals of war, in George Bernard Shaw's 1894 play.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Candida
description: A minister's wife becomes an object of infatuation for an idealistic young poet, in George Bernard Shaw's comedic look at the changing views on gender and social equality.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: Sherlock Holmes
description: Sharp-witted detective Sherlock Holmes and his trusted companion Doctor Watson prepare to rescue Miss Faulkner from the clutches of the dastardly Moriarty, in Arthur Conan Doyle and William Gillette's play based on Conan Doyle's legendary literary character.

title: Secret Service
description: A spy for the Union Army during the Civil War falls in love with a daughter of the Confederacy, and then is caught.

title: Major Barbara
description: Wealthy Lady Britomart must reunite with her estranged arms manufacturer husband in order to marry off her daughters, including Salvation Army major Barbara, in George Bernard Shaw's critique of capitalism, war, religion and other political issues.

title: Peter Pan
description: The boy who would not grow up visits the Darling children and takes them on a magical adventure to Never Land in this adaptation of the classic J.M. Barrie play.

title: Very Good Eddie
description: Two couples of differing heights cross paths on a boat headed to a honeymoon inn in Poughkeepsie, accidentally trading partners in a farcical manner, in this intimate musical comedy that was one of a noted series Jerome Kern composed for the Princess Theatre.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: King Henry VIII
description: King Henry VIII of England's decision to divorce Katharine of Aragon and marry Anne Boleyn, in defiance of the Roman Catholic Church, is supported by Cardinal Wolsey, who later regrets his decision, in William Shakespeare's play.

title: Captain Brassbound's Conversion
description: A bloodthirsty pirate meets his match in a British lady adventurer.

title: The Tempest
description: The magician and former duke Prospero, who has been exiled on an island with his daughter Miranda for years, plots revenge on the brother who usurped his throne with the help of the magical island creatures in his thrall, in one of William Shakespeare's final plays.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: The Seagull
description: Famous actress Irina Arkadina is obsessed with a callous lover, dismissive of her frustrated son and suspicious of an admiring young woman. Anton Chekhov's 1895 play explores the tensions between mothers, sons, lovers, friends and servants.

title: Getting Married
description: The family of a bishop whose youngest daughter is getting married debate their views on matrimony on the morning of her wedding.

title: The Yellow Jacket
description: J. Harry Benrimo and George C. Hazelton dramatize the efforts of an American medical team to find the cause of yellow fever, which killed more soldiers during the Spanish-American War than battle injuries.

title: The Nest
description: Exploring the moral and environmental ramifications of our modern materialism and desire to nest, The Nest is a cutting new adaptation of the classic German text by Conor McPherson. Kurt and Martha are overjoyed soon-to-be parents, determined that their child will want for nothing. Understanding the need to do so, they put in the hard work to ensure that they can buy the very latest in appliances for their youngster. But when offered a mysterious side job to gain some easy extra money, the boundaries of Kurt’s drive are pushed to breaking point – will his rashness catch up with him, and his entire community?

description: English nobility seek out marriage proposals — and proof of extramarital philandering — at a stately country club.

description: The gossip, backbiting and romantic scheming of London society are satirized in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1777 comedy.

title: Sally
description: A humble dishwasher attends a fancy party pretending to be a ballerina, finding love and a contract with the Ziegfeld Follies, in Jerome Kern, Clifford Grey, P.G. Wodehouse and Guy Bolton's musical.

description: King Cymbeline's daughter has secretly married her childhood friend, a man of low low birth. The outraged king banishes her suitor, and the soured union sets in motion a tragic tale of innocence, jealousy and betrayal.

title: Oedipus Rex
description: The people of Thebes ask their king, Oedipus, for help in saving their kingdom from plague, leading Oedipus to discover a shocking secret from his past, in Sophocles' Greek tragedy.

title: Cyrano de Bergerac
description: Cyrano is a poet, philosopher and swordsman of incredible wit, but his sizable nose renders him too shy to pursue the beautiful Roxane. Instead, he provides the poetry and eloquence to woo her vicariously through his inarticulate friend Christian.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: The Lady from the Sea
description: The wife of a doctor moves to a small Norwegian town in the mountains, away from the seaside fjord where she grew up.  When her former fiancé, a sailor, returns after a long absence, she is forced to choose between her former and her present life, in Henrik Ibsen's 1889 play.

title: Ghosts
description: In Henrik Ibsen's 1881 play, Mrs. Alving plans to dedicate an orphanage to the memory of her late husband, but confesses to Pastor Manders that her supposedly upstanding husband was actually a philanderer. The effects of his indiscretions are still apparent in their disease-afflicted son and the maid he has fallen for.

title: Saint Joan
description: Set in 15th century France, Saint Joan follows a country girl whose mysterious visions propel her into elite circles. When the nation’s rulers become threatened by her popularity and influence, they unite to bring her down and she finds herself on trial for her life.

title: An Enemy of the People
description: When Dr. Thomas Stockmann discovers toxic contamination in the water used at the local baths, he expects to be hailed as a hero. But since the baths are the town's main source of revenue, the community fights to silence him — and Dr. Stockmann learns there are forces more powerful than truth.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: Ivanov
description: In Anton Chekhov's 1887 drama, a man attempts to escape his dying wife by playing cards with an attractive young woman on a nearby estate, ultimately becoming disgusted at his own conduct.

title: Enough Stupidity in Every Wise Man
The Living Mask
description: In Luigi Pirandello's play, a nobleman shaken by an accident believes himself to be the German Emperor Henry IV, and he continues pretending to be even after the delusional episode ends so that he may consciously avoid reality.

title: Uncle Vanya
description: Longtime academic Vanya comes to question his devotion to an aging professor, whose wife Vanya loves even as she is drawn to the enigmatic doctor Astrov, in Anton Chekhov's 1897 play.

title: The Show Off
description: A clerk at New York's Penn Station is given to exaggerating his own role at the station in George Kelly's satire.

description: An aspiring classical composer is bogged down by odd jobs and nagging in-laws in George S. Kaufman and Marc Connelly's comic dissection of the eternal art vs. commerce dilemma.

description: A man who marries a higher-born wife must endure her extravagant whims — and affairs — in Moliere's 1668 comedy.

description: In Anton Chekhov's 1887 drama, a man attempts to escape his dying wife by playing cards with an attractive young woman on a nearby estate, ultimately becoming disgusted at his own conduct.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: An Enemy of the People
description: When Dr. Thomas Stockmann discovers toxic contamination in the water used at the local baths, he expects to be hailed as a hero. But since the baths are the town's main source of revenue, the community fights to silence him — and Dr. Stockmann learns there are forces more powerful than truth.

title: Enough Stupidity in Every Wise Man
Uncle Vanya
description: Longtime academic Vanya comes to question his devotion to an aging professor, whose wife Vanya loves even as she is drawn to the enigmatic doctor Astrov, in Anton Chekhov's 1897 play.

title: The Man in the Bowler Hat
All God's Chillun Got Wings
description: The interracial marriage of childhood sweethearts ends tragically in New York in Eugene O'Neill's 1924 drama.

title: Hedda Gabler
description: Ibsen's Hedda Gabler presents a psychological study of a cultivated woman, recently returned from her honeymoon, whose boredom and dissatisfaction in a stifling environment lead her to destroy others — and herself.

title: She Stoops to Conquer
description: In Oliver Goldsmith's 1773 comedy, a wealthy English countryman attempts to match his daughter up with a wealthy London resident, but when the daughter learns her suitor prefers lower-class women, she must "stoop to conquer" her man by pretending to be a maid.

title: The Crime in the Whistler Room
S.S. Glencairn
description:
An evening of four one-acts by Eugene O'Neill, set on the same tramp steamer, including Bound East for Cardiff, In the Zone, The Moon of the Carabees and The Long Voyage Home.


In Bound East for Cardiff, a sailor takes a fatal fall and reflects bitterly on the life he is leaving, despite his shipmates' attempts to comfort him.
In In the Zone, a seaman secretively removes a black box, leading his fellow mates to conclude he is a spy.
In The Moon of the Carabees, the ship is anchored off an island in the West Indies and the sailors come to blows over the favor of some native girls. 
In The Long Voyage Home, a sailor gets drunk with his mates in a London bar, excited over his plans to leave the seafaring life, until he is slipped a mickey and taken aboard the worst ship possible.

title: Peter Pan
description: The boy who would not grow up visits the Darling children and takes them on a magical adventure to Never Land in this adaptation of the classic J.M. Barrie play.

title: The Taming of the Shrew
description: A wandering braggart out to marry for money ends up with the shrewish daughter of a rich man, whom he must "tame" even as he falls for her, in William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: Desire Under the Elms
description: In Eugene O'Neill's modern retelling of Greek tragedy, a widowed farmer brings home a young bride. Initially his grown son abhors the new stepmother, but soon his hatred turns to lust.

title: They Knew What They Wanted
description: An aging Italian vineyard owner in California proposes to a waitress via letter, sending her a picture of his handsome hired hand.  Romantic and emotional complications ensue when she agrees to marry and live with the Italian in Sidney Howard's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: The Student Prince
description: A German prince falls for a waitress while completing his university education in a small town in 1860, in Sigmund Romberg and Dorothy Donnelly's operetta.

title: Candida
description: A minister's wife becomes an object of infatuation for an idealistic young poet, in George Bernard Shaw's comedic look at the changing views on gender and social equality.

title: Patience
description: An aesthetic poet is pursued by many maidens but loves only a milkmaid who disdains the idea of love, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: Othello
description: Othello, a Moor who has become a general in the Venetian army, sees his happy marriage to the beautiful Desdemona destroyed when his seemingly trustworthy ensign, Iago, suggests to him that she may be unfaithful, in William Shakespeare's tragedy of revenge, jealousy and intrigue.

title: The Wild Duck
description: A wealthy merchant's son returns home after a time to discover that his old schoolmate has married and has a daughter with the family servant, whom the merchant's wife believed had an affair with her husband, in Henrik Ibsen's 1884 play.

title: Beggar on Horseback
description: An aspiring classical composer is bogged down by odd jobs and nagging in-laws in George S. Kaufman and Marc Connelly's comic dissection of the eternal art vs. commerce dilemma.

title: Love for Love
description: The playboy Valentine prepares, at least nominally, to give up his inheritance in order to continue an irresponsible life and to court the beautiful Angelica, in William Congreve's Restoration comedy and social satire.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Caesar and Cleopatra
description: Roman emperor Julius Caesar meets the young Egyptian queen Cleopatra, courts her and tutors her in the ways of the politics of his land in George Bernard Shaw's 1898 play.

title: Aren't We All?
description: English nobility seek out marriage proposals — and proof of extramarital philandering — at a stately country club.

title: The Critic
description: A critic is besieged with requests for support from various playwrights before watching a laughably bad play by an acquaintance, in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1779 comedy.

title: Love for Love
description: The playboy Valentine prepares, at least nominally, to give up his inheritance in order to continue an irresponsible life and to court the beautiful Angelica, in William Congreve's Restoration comedy and social satire.

title: Arms and the Man
description: During the Serbio-Bulgarian War of 1885, a Bulgarian woman who is engaged to a hero of the war encounters a Serbian captain who is retreating from the war because he despises it. He teaches her to see beyond the romantic ideals of war, in George Bernard Shaw's 1894 play.

title: No, No, Nanette
description: A Bible salesman, his wife, their lawyer friend and his wife, and the salesman's young ward, Nanette, get into various romantic entanglements and misunderstandings in 1920s Atlantic City.

title: The Vagabond King
description: The 15th-century French outlaw Francois Villon is appointed king for a day so that he may lead the people of France against the Duke of Burgundy's army, in Rudolf Friml, Brian Hooker, Russell Janney and W.H. Post's operetta.

title: Hay Fever
description: Members of a theatrical family each invite a guest for a weekend on their country estate, leading to many complications and clashes between the culture of the theatre and the culture of the rest of the world.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Craig's Wife
description: A materialistic woman's marriage crumbles because of her obsession with preserving her possessions, in George Kelly's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: The Grand Duchess and the Waiter
The School for Scandal
description: The gossip, backbiting and romantic scheming of London society are satirized in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1777 comedy.

title: The Man with a Load of Mischief
Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Candida
description: A minister's wife becomes an object of infatuation for an idealistic young poet, in George Bernard Shaw's comedic look at the changing views on gender and social equality.

title: The Master Builder
description: An aging architect is haunted by memories and fears until a figure from his past returns.

title: The School for Scandal
description: The gossip, backbiting and romantic scheming of London society are satirized in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1777 comedy.

title: Lysistrata
description: A Greek woman persuades her fellow female citizens to withhold sex from their husbands so that they may peacefully end the Peloponnesian War, in Aristophanes' comic look at the eternal battle of the sexes.

title: The Dybbuk
description: S. Ansky dramatizes the old Jewish belief that the spirit of a dead man who has suffered injustice in life can inhabit the body of a living person as a means of crying out for the justice to be righted.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: The Makropoulos Secret
description: The daughter of the German emperor, who fled court life with a life-lengthening potion to become a great opera singer, contributes important information to a case between warring families, in Tyrone Guthrie's adaptation of Karel Capek's play.

title: The Great God Brown
description: Billy Brown and Dion Anthony, childhood friends and sons of business partners, both fall in love with Margaret and use different masks (physical and metaphorical) to change their personalities and win her at different times. Billy poses as Dion until he is discovered and abandoned, forgetting his true identity.

title: Hedda Gabler
description: Ibsen's Hedda Gabler presents a psychological study of a cultivated woman, recently returned from her honeymoon, whose boredom and dissatisfaction in a stifling environment lead her to destroy others — and herself.

title: John Gabriel Borkman
description: A banker who was imprisoned for embezzling money from clients returns to find his wife and sister-in-law warring over his affections and those of his son, in Henrik Ibsen's 1896 play.

title: Cyrano de Bergerac
description: Cyrano is a poet, philosopher and swordsman of incredible wit, but his sizable nose renders him too shy to pursue the beautiful Roxane. Instead, he provides the poetry and eloquence to woo her vicariously through his inarticulate friend Christian.

title: Juno and the Paycock
description: Unemployed Captain Boyle would rather drink his days away with his friend Joxer than get a job to provide for his wife Juno and their children. Sean O'Casey's tale traces the effects of the 1920s Irish civil war on its working-class people.

title: Ghosts
description: In Henrik Ibsen's 1881 play, Mrs. Alving plans to dedicate an orphanage to the memory of her late husband, but confesses to Pastor Manders that her supposedly upstanding husband was actually a philanderer. The effects of his indiscretions are still apparent in their disease-afflicted son and the maid he has fallen for.

title: H.M.S. Pinafore
description: The daughter of the captain of Her Majesty's Ship Pinafore is in love with a humble sailor, despite her father's hopes that she will marry a better-born suitor, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: The Importance of Being Earnest
description: Two wealthy London bachelors each pretend to be a fictitious man called Earnest in order to win over two eligible young ladies, despite the ladies' avowed preference for that name alone — and the interference of the intimidatingly proper Lady Bracknell — in Oscar Wilde's "trivial comedy for serious people."

title: The Younger Generation / Half an Hour
King Henry IV, Part I
description: Henry IV's son, Prince Hal, must put aside his preference for drunken carousing with Sir John Falstaff and other lowlifes when his father's throne is threatened by the rebel Hotspur.

title: Broadway
description: The main hoofer at the Paradise Club competes with a gangster for the hand of a pretty new dancer.

title: The Master Builder
description: An aging architect is haunted by memories and fears until a figure from his past returns.

title: The Play's the Thing
description: In Ferenc Molnar's farce, a young playwright is distraught when he overhears the actress he loves having an affair with another man. His mentor must convince him that she is only rehearsing a play — and that he must write her a better one.

title: The Three Sisters
description: Sisters Olga, Masha and Irina long to leave their provincial military town for Moscow and grapple with frustrated love and disappointment, in Anton Chekhov's 1901 drama.

title: Oh, Kay!
description: This classic Gershwin musical depicts the adventures of two bootleggers — Lady Kay and her brother, the Duke of Durham — in Prohibition-era Long Island.

title: John Gabriel Borkman
description: A banker who was imprisoned for embezzling money from clients returns to find his wife and sister-in-law warring over his affections and those of his son, in Henrik Ibsen's 1896 play.

title: Pygmalion
description: In George Bernard Shaw's play, based on a classical myth, a blustering phonetics professor bets that he can turn a Cockney flower girl into a passable society lady in three months.

title: The Constant Wife
description: W. Somerset Maugham's 1926 comedy of marital manners focuses on a cuckolded Constance Middleton, who pretends not to know her doctor husband is playing doctor with her best friend — until that friend's jealous husband confronts her.

title: The Desert Song
description: Pierre, the seemingly mild-mannered son of a French general, masquerades as the "Red Shadow," the leader of a group of Arab bandits in the Middle East, in order to have adventures and seduce his beloved Margot.

title: La Locandiera (the Mistress of the Inn)
The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: The Dybbuk
description: S. Ansky dramatizes the old Jewish belief that the spirit of a dead man who has suffered injustice in life can inhabit the body of a living person as a means of crying out for the justice to be righted.

title: The Dybbuk
description: S. Ansky dramatizes the old Jewish belief that the spirit of a dead man who has suffered injustice in life can inhabit the body of a living person as a means of crying out for the justice to be righted.

title: Twelfth Night
description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

title: Ghosts
description: In Henrik Ibsen's 1881 play, Mrs. Alving plans to dedicate an orphanage to the memory of her late husband, but confesses to Pastor Manders that her supposedly upstanding husband was actually a philanderer. The effects of his indiscretions are still apparent in their disease-afflicted son and the maid he has fallen for.

title: Trelawny of the "Wells"
description: A popular British star of melodramas gives up the stage for marriage, only to flee her husband's traditional family for the footlights again.

title: Right You Are If You Think You Are
description: A woman's identity is kept a secret, with two distinctly different possibilites, in Luigi Pirandello's play.

title: Patience
description: An aesthetic poet is pursued by many maidens but loves only a milkmaid who disdains the idea of love, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: Julius Caesar
description: In William Shakespeare's tragedy of political ambition, corruption and betrayal, Roman senators Brutus and Cassius lead a group effort to assassinate the powerful Julius Caesar, then battle with Mark Antony over control of the state.

title: Burlesque
description: A married couple is doing well performing in burlesque until the male comic gets a lead in a Broadway show and begins to neglect his loving but increasingly impatient wife.

title: Good News
description: Romance, passing exams, winning the football game and doing the "Varsity Drag" are the main focuses of a group of students at Tait College in the 1920s.  Note: The 1974 revival re-set the action to the 1930s.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: An Enemy of the People
description: When Dr. Thomas Stockmann discovers toxic contamination in the water used at the local baths, he expects to be hailed as a hero. But since the baths are the town's main source of revenue, the community fights to silence him — and Dr. Stockmann learns there are forces more powerful than truth.

title: Dracula
description: Bram Stoker's classic novel about a charming Transylvanian count who is really a vampire out to seduce women for their blood is adapted for the stage by Hamilton Deane and John L. Balderston.

title: The Five O'Clock Girl
description: A poor shop girl wins the heart of a wealthy playboy through a series of anonymous phone conversations at 5 o'clock.

title: The Taming of the Shrew
description: A wandering braggart out to marry for money ends up with the shrewish daughter of a rich man, whom he must "tame" even as he falls for her, in William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: La Bohème
description: A group of bohemian artists struggle to survive the cold Paris winter, as romance between poet Rodolfo and seamstress Mimi heads for tragedy and painter Marcello's affair with unfaithful singer Musetta provides comedy in the landmark Giacomo Puccini opera.

title: The King Can Do No Wrong
A Midsummer Night's Dream
description: William Shakespeare's comedy brings together a group of star-crossed lovers, an inept band of actors led by the pompous Bottom, and the king and queen of the fairies and their impish henchman Puck, who creates romantic and comic havoc for all.

title: Much Ado About Nothing
description: The anti-romantic wits Beatrice and Benedick, who profess to hate each other, are forced by their friends' trickery to admit their true feelings as they help to save the wedding of his fellow soldier Claudio and her cousin Hero.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: The Plough and the Stars
description: Residents of an Irish tenement look forward to Ireland's liberation before and after the Easter Uprising in Dublin in 1916, in Sean O'Casey's drama.

title: Fallen Angels
description: Two Englishwomen, who are in respectable but dull marriages, reunite with the Frenchman who seduced both of them before they were married.

title: Electra
description: Greek princess Electra waits for her brother, Orestes, to return home and help her plan revenge on their mother, Clytemnestra, for her murdering of their father, Agamemnon, in Sophocles' tragedy.

title: At the Gate of the Kingdom
Juno and the Paycock
description: Unemployed Captain Boyle would rather drink his days away with his friend Joxer than get a job to provide for his wife Juno and their children. Sean O'Casey's tale traces the effects of the 1920s Irish civil war on its working-class people.

title: Danton's Tod
description: Georg Buchner dramatizes the conflict between French Revolution leader Danton and left-wing bourgeois politician Robespierre.

title: Show Boat
description: Jerome Kern and Oscar Hammerstein II's groundbreaking musical version of Edna Ferber's novel examines the lives of Cap'n Andy and his troupe of traveling show boat performers, including his naïve daughter Magnolia, her gambling husband Gaylord Ravenal, the tragic mixed-race actress Julie, and black stevedore Joe, who marvels at the constancy of the "Ol' Man River" they travel on.

title: The Royal Family
description: In this thinly veiled parody of the Barrymore family circa 1927, a flamboyant theatrical family must cope with the dumbfounding fact that one of them wishes to marry someone outside of show business.

title: Oh, Kay!
description: This classic Gershwin musical depicts the adventures of two bootleggers — Lady Kay and her brother, the Duke of Durham — in Prohibition-era Long Island.

title: Marco Millions
description: Eugene O'Neill's story of a Westerner's culture shock and adjustment upon encountering the Eastern world for the first time, based on the history of Marco Polo's expeditions.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: Strange Interlude
description: A professor's daughter, haunted by the loss of her fiancé in World War I, embarks on a series of affairs and a placid marriage, becoming a mother under murky circumstances and ignoring the novelist who truly loves her. She and other characters in Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize-winning play communicate their private thoughts to the audience.

title: Sherlock Holmes
description: Sharp-witted detective Sherlock Holmes and his trusted companion Doctor Watson prepare to rescue Miss Faulkner from the clutches of the dastardly Moriarty, in Arthur Conan Doyle and William Gillette's play based on Conan Doyle's legendary literary character.

title: Dr. Knock
description: A French classic satire on the medical profession and public gullibility.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: The Three Musketeers
description: The young d'Artagnan becomes a Musketeer of the Guard of Louis XIII, joining Athos, Porthos and Aramis. They fight to recover Queen Anne's brooch, which has been stolen by Cardinal Richelieu as a form of blackmail, in the Rudolf Friml operetta based on the Alexandre Dumas novel.

title: King Henry V
description: William Shakespeare's play portrays the victory of the English King Henry V over the French at the Battle of Agincourt during the Hundred Years' War.

title: Hedda Gabler
description: Ibsen's Hedda Gabler presents a psychological study of a cultivated woman, recently returned from her honeymoon, whose boredom and dissatisfaction in a stifling environment lead her to destroy others — and herself.

title: The Beggar's Opera
description: The outlaw Macheath is repeatedly betrayed and sent to prison, only to avoid hanging in a satirically happy ending, in John Gay's 1728 opera, which served as the inspiration for Kurt Weill and Bertolt Brecht's The Threepenny Opera.

title: The Play's the Thing
description: In Ferenc Molnar's farce, a young playwright is distraught when he overhears the actress he loves having an affair with another man. His mentor must convince him that she is only rehearsing a play — and that he must write her a better one.

title: Volpone
description: A Venetian gentleman pretends to be dying in order to dupe the friends who hope to be heirs to his great fortune, in Ben Jonson's satire of greed.

title: The Old Lady Shows Her Medals
The Father
description: A captain and his wife disagree over how to raise their daughter, with the wife going so far as to insinuate the daughter is not her husband's in order to drive him insane and get her way, in August Strindberg's 1887 indictment of marriage and religion.

title: She Stoops to Conquer
description: In Oliver Goldsmith's 1773 comedy, a wealthy English countryman attempts to match his daughter up with a wealthy London resident, but when the daughter learns her suitor prefers lower-class women, she must "stoop to conquer" her man by pretending to be a maid.

title: The Beaux Stratagem
description: Two impoverished young gentlemen plan to travel through small towns romancing and collecting money from rich women, which leads to comic complications, in George Farquhar's 1707 comedy.

title: Patience
description: An aesthetic poet is pursued by many maidens but loves only a milkmaid who disdains the idea of love, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: The Front Page
description: A managing editor of a Chicago newspaper fights to keep his star reporter on the story of a condemned anarchist's jailbreak, when the reporter is ready to quit and get married.

title: Machinal
description: For the Young Woman, a stenographer in the industrial, male-dominated world of the 1920s, life is nothing like she hoped it would be. Restless and unfulfilled in a passionless marriage and unwanted motherhood, she finds her only joy in the form of an illicit love affair. But when reality sets in and she must return to her routine existence, she’ll go to any lengths to regain her freedom.

title: The New Moon
description: In 1788 New Orleans, a French nobleman wanted for murder builds up a revolutionary following who rescue him and his ladylove when they are caught and sent back to France on the boat The New Moon.

title: The Would-be Gentleman
description: A self-made, wealthy merchant is determined to be a proper gentleman, in Moliere's 1670 comedy.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: An Enemy of the People
description: When Dr. Thomas Stockmann discovers toxic contamination in the water used at the local baths, he expects to be hailed as a hero. But since the baths are the town's main source of revenue, the community fights to silence him — and Dr. Stockmann learns there are forces more powerful than truth.

title: The Yellow Jacket
description: J. Harry Benrimo and George C. Hazelton dramatize the efforts of an American medical team to find the cause of yellow fever, which killed more soldiers during the Spanish-American War than battle injuries.

title: The Wild Duck
description: A wealthy merchant's son returns home after a time to discover that his old schoolmate has married and has a daughter with the family servant, whom the merchant's wife believed had an affair with her husband, in Henrik Ibsen's 1884 play.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: Major Barbara
description: Wealthy Lady Britomart must reunite with her estranged arms manufacturer husband in order to marry off her daughters, including Salvation Army major Barbara, in George Bernard Shaw's critique of capitalism, war, religion and other political issues.

title: Peter Pan
description: The boy who would not grow up visits the Darling children and takes them on a magical adventure to Never Land in this adaptation of the classic J.M. Barrie play.

title: Holiday
description: An up-and-coming Wall Street lawyer plans to enjoy life once he's made enough money, a prospect that doesn't thrill his well-born fiancée but excites her more unconventional sister.

title: Whoopee!
description: A hypochondriac seeking a cure for his health in California inadvertently elopes with a rancher's daughter who is avoiding marriage to a sheriff but in love with an American Indian, causing plenty of comic complications in this musical farce.

title: Cyrano de Bergerac
description: Cyrano is a poet, philosopher and swordsman of incredible wit, but his sizable nose renders him too shy to pursue the beautiful Roxane. Instead, he provides the poetry and eloquence to woo her vicariously through his inarticulate friend Christian.

title: Hedda Gabler
description: Ibsen's Hedda Gabler presents a psychological study of a cultivated woman, recently returned from her honeymoon, whose boredom and dissatisfaction in a stifling environment lead her to destroy others — and herself.

title: The Octoroon
description: The nephew of a deceased Southern judge finds his uncle's plantation financially strapped. He falls for the daughter of his uncle and a slave, who is also desired by the man who plans to sell the plantation's slaves and buy the daughter himself.

title: The Lady from the Sea
description: The wife of a doctor moves to a small Norwegian town in the mountains, away from the seaside fjord where she grew up.  When her former fiancé, a sailor, returns after a long absence, she is forced to choose between her former and her present life, in Henrik Ibsen's 1889 play.

title: Journey's End
description: A group of World War I British officers in the trenches in St. Quentin, France, contemplates an impending attack.

title: The Seagull
description: Famous actress Irina Arkadina is obsessed with a callous lover, dismissive of her frustrated son and suspicious of an admiring young woman. Anton Chekhov's 1895 play explores the tensions between mothers, sons, lovers, friends and servants.

title: The Camel Through the Needle's Eye
The Flag Station / the Lemonade Boy / the Monkey's Paw
Uncle Vanya
description: Longtime academic Vanya comes to question his devotion to an aging professor, whose wife Vanya loves even as she is drawn to the enigmatic doctor Astrov, in Anton Chekhov's 1897 play.

title: The Seagull
description: Famous actress Irina Arkadina is obsessed with a callous lover, dismissive of her frustrated son and suspicious of an admiring young woman. Anton Chekhov's 1895 play explores the tensions between mothers, sons, lovers, friends and servants.

title: Sweethearts
description: A princess is hidden as a baby while her kingdom is at war and raised by a laundress without knowing her true identity, leading to various political and romantic complications when she comes of age.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: Robin Hood
description: The story of the English outlaw Robin Hood and his band of Merry Men, who steal from the rich to give to the poor during the time of King Richard the Lionhearted, becomes an operetta by Reginald De Koven and Harry B. Smith.

title: The Game of Love and Death
Sherlock Holmes
description: Sharp-witted detective Sherlock Holmes and his trusted companion Doctor Watson prepare to rescue Miss Faulkner from the clutches of the dastardly Moriarty, in Arthur Conan Doyle and William Gillette's play based on Conan Doyle's legendary literary character.

title: The Merry Widow
description: The baron who serves as ambassador of the kingdom of Marsovia wishes his attaché Prince Danilo would wed the wealthy widow Sonia to help the kingdom's finances, and the couple falls in love despite themselves, in Franz Lehar's operetta.

title: The First Mrs. Fraser
description: A married couple heads to the divorce courts when the wife is accused of adultery. The husband's first wife appears in court to provide conclusive evidence of her successor's infidelity and reunites with her ex-husband when the divorce is complete.

title: The Playboy of the Western World
description: A mysterious man stumbles into an Irish pub, claiming he is fleeing his farm after killing his father. The locals, including a barmaid who is attracted to the man, are more interested in enjoying the man's story than in condemning him, in John Millington Synge's play.

title: The Chocolate Soldier
description: During the Serbio-Bulgarian War of 1885, a Bulgarian woman who is engaged to a war hero encounters a Serbian captain who is retreating from the war because he despises it. He teaches her to see beyond the romantic ideals of war in this operetta, adapted from George Bernard Shaw's Arms and the Man.

title: Topaze
description: A disgraced teacher becomes secretary to a politician of questionable ethics, and ultimately starts some shady, secret business practices of his own that outmaneuver his employer's.

title: The Apple Cart
description: An English king outwits a prime minister and his cabinet who plan to strip the monarchy of its political influence.

title: The Seagull
description: Famous actress Irina Arkadina is obsessed with a callous lover, dismissive of her frustrated son and suspicious of an admiring young woman. Anton Chekhov's 1895 play explores the tensions between mothers, sons, lovers, friends and servants.

title: Marco Millions
description: Eugene O'Neill's story of a Westerner's culture shock and adjustment upon encountering the Eastern world for the first time, based on the history of Marco Polo's expeditions.

title: Volpone
description: A Venetian gentleman pretends to be dying in order to dupe the friends who hope to be heirs to his great fortune, in Ben Jonson's satire of greed.

title: The Rivals
description: Wealthy captain Jack Absolute pretends to be poor officer Ensign Beverley to win the romantic Lydia in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1775 comedy, which also features such characters as oafish Bob Acres, temper-prone Sir Lucius O'Trigger and Mrs. Malaprop, whose frequent confusion of words and their meanings coined the term "malapropism."

title: A Month in the Country
description: Natalya discovers that she is passionately in love with her son's tutor while spending a month on a country estate in Ivan Turgenev's 1872 play.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: Twelfth Night
description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: Richard III
description: Richard, Duke of York, plots murders, marriages, and other intrigues in order to secure his own place on the throne. This tale of ruthless ambition is part of Shakespeare's cycle of plays about the Wars of the Roses.

title: King Lear
description:
In William Shakespeare's royal-family tragedy, the aging King Lear divides his estate between
his three daughters, ultimately refusing his youngest and favorite her share because she won't
publicly admit her love for him. The decision leads to chaos and treachery within the kingdom and madness for its monarch.

title: The Taming of the Shrew
description: A wandering braggart out to marry for money ends up with the shrewish daughter of a rich man, whom he must "tame" even as he falls for her, in William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: As You Like It
description: Rosalind, banished from her father's kingdom by her usurping uncle, disguises herself as a boy while falling for one, the similarly exiled duke Orlando.

title: Julius Caesar
description: In William Shakespeare's tragedy of political ambition, corruption and betrayal, Roman senators Brutus and Cassius lead a group effort to assassinate the powerful Julius Caesar, then battle with Mark Antony over control of the state.

title: Maurice Chevalier
description: Maurice Chevalier headlines this evening of songs and sketches.

title: Uncle Vanya
description: Longtime academic Vanya comes to question his devotion to an aging professor, whose wife Vanya loves even as she is drawn to the enigmatic doctor Astrov, in Anton Chekhov's 1897 play.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: The House with the Twisty Windows
When the Roll Is Called Up Yonder
The Man Who Married a Dumb Wife
The Little Father of the Wilderness
Lysistrata
description: A Greek woman persuades her fellow female citizens to withhold sex from their husbands so that they may peacefully end the Peloponnesian War, in Aristophanes' comic look at the eternal battle of the sexes.

title: Topaze
description: A disgraced teacher becomes secretary to a politician of questionable ethics, and ultimately starts some shady, secret business practices of his own that outmaneuver his employer's.

title: Uncle Vanya
description: Longtime academic Vanya comes to question his devotion to an aging professor, whose wife Vanya loves even as she is drawn to the enigmatic doctor Astrov, in Anton Chekhov's 1897 play.

title: Once in a Lifetime
description: A down-on-their-luck vaudeville trio goes to Hollywood shortly after the talking-pictures revolution to make their fortunes, and end up posing as vocal coaches for a major producer.

title: The Greeks Had a Word for It
The Violet and One, Two, Three
Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: Twelfth Night
description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: The New Yorkers
description: Bullets fly and bathtub gin flows in Cole Porter’s 1930 Prohibition jape The New Yorkers, a gleefully amoral celebration of speakeasies, gangsters, society dames, and the great city they love. The musical centers on featherbrained socialite Alice Wentworth, whose bootlegger beau leads her on a madcap romp from Park Avenue to Sing Sing and back again. The New Yorkers produced a number of standards—“I Happen to Like New York,” “Love for Sale”—but much of the original material has been lost, making this Encores!’s most ambitious musical reconstruction ever. Don’t miss an evening of sophisticated Depression-era madness.

description: Rosalind, banished from her father's kingdom by her usurping uncle, disguises herself as a boy while falling for one, the similarly exiled duke Orlando.

title: Electra
description: Greek princess Electra waits for her brother, Orestes, to return home and help her plan revenge on their mother, Clytemnestra, for her murdering of their father, Agamemnon, in Sophocles' tragedy.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: Private Lives
description: Divorcees Elyot and Amanda unexpectedly meet while honeymooning with their respective new spouses and discover that their passion for — and irritation with — each other is just as strong as ever.

title: The Student Prince
description: A German prince falls for a waitress while completing his university education in a small town in 1860, in Sigmund Romberg and Dorothy Donnelly's operetta.

title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
description: The romance of the English poets Elizabeth Barrett and Robert Browning, despite her mysterious illness and tyrannical father, is the subject of Rudolf Besier's play.

title: She Lived Next to the Firehouse
Topaze
description: A disgraced teacher becomes secretary to a politician of questionable ethics, and ultimately starts some shady, secret business practices of his own that outmaneuver his employer's.

title: Getting Married
description: The family of a bishop whose youngest daughter is getting married debate their views on matrimony on the morning of her wedding.

title: Dracula
description: Bram Stoker's classic novel about a charming Transylvanian count who is really a vampire out to seduce women for their blood is adapted for the stage by Hamilton Deane and John L. Balderston.

title: Six Characters in Search of an Author
The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: H.M.S. Pinafore
description: The daughter of the captain of Her Majesty's Ship Pinafore is in love with a humble sailor, despite her father's hopes that she will marry a better-born suitor, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: Patience
description: An aesthetic poet is pursued by many maidens but loves only a milkmaid who disdains the idea of love, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: The Merry Widow
description: The baron who serves as ambassador of the kingdom of Marsovia wishes his attaché Prince Danilo would wed the wealthy widow Sonia to help the kingdom's finances, and the couple falls in love despite themselves, in Franz Lehar's operetta.

title: The Chocolate Soldier
description: During the Serbio-Bulgarian War of 1885, a Bulgarian woman who is engaged to a war hero encounters a Serbian captain who is retreating from the war because he despises it. He teaches her to see beyond the romantic ideals of war in this operetta, adapted from George Bernard Shaw's Arms and the Man.

title: The Streets of New York, Or Poverty Is No Crime
Mourning Becomes Electra
description: Eugene O'Neill retells the Greek trilogy The Oresteia as the tale of the Mannon family, who lives in New England just after the Civil War and must cope with incestuous and murderous feelings among their various members.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: The School for Scandal
description: The gossip, backbiting and romantic scheming of London society are satirized in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1777 comedy.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: Julius Caesar

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Little Women
description: Jo March and her sisters Meg, Beth, and Amy grow up, find themselves, and find love during and after the Civil War, in this adaptation of the classic Louisa May Alcott novel.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: The Bride the Sun Shines on
Hay Fever
description: Members of a theatrical family each invite a guest for a weekend on their country estate, leading to many complications and clashes between the culture of the theatre and the culture of the rest of the world.

title: Electra
description: Greek princess Electra waits for her brother, Orestes, to return home and help her plan revenge on their mother, Clytemnestra, for her murdering of their father, Agamemnon, in Sophocles' tragedy.

title: Lady Windermere's Fan
description: An English woman suspects her husband of infidelity and takes a lover herself in retaliation, in Oscar Wilde's play.

title: Robin Hood
description: The story of the English outlaw Robin Hood and his band of Merry Men, who steal from the rich to give to the poor during the time of King Richard the Lionhearted, becomes an operetta by Reginald De Koven and Harry B. Smith.

title: Maurice Chevalier
description: Maurice Chevalier headlines this evening of songs and sketches.

title: The Moon in the Yellow River
Too True to Be Good
description: An idle rich young woman tries hedonism and then religion in an attempt to find purpose, in George Bernard Shaw's indictment of modern wealth and morality.

title: The Man Who Changed His Name
Mourning Becomes Electra
description: Eugene O'Neill retells the Greek trilogy The Oresteia as the tale of the Mannon family, who lives in New England just after the Civil War and must cope with incestuous and murderous feelings among their various members.

title: Show Boat
description: Jerome Kern and Oscar Hammerstein II's groundbreaking musical version of Edna Ferber's novel examines the lives of Cap'n Andy and his troupe of traveling show boat performers, including his naïve daughter Magnolia, her gambling husband Gaylord Ravenal, the tragic mixed-race actress Julie, and black stevedore Joe, who marvels at the constancy of the "Ol' Man River" they travel on.

title: Troilus and Cressida
description: The Trojans Troilus and Cressida have an affair during the Trojan War but are separated when Cressida is exchanged for a Greek prisoner of war, in William Shakespeare's tragedy.

title: The Man Who Reclaimed His Head
Dinner at Eight
description: A couple in financial trouble invite a variety of socially prominent, social-climbing and socially fading characters to a dinner party at their home.

title: The Late Christopher Bean
description: Yankee practicality collides with New York's sophisticated Art World as all hell breaks loose when a celebrated painter's early works are traced to the humble home of a country doctor.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
description: William Shakespeare's comedy brings together a group of star-crossed lovers, an inept band of actors led by the pompous Bottom, and the king and queen of the fairies and their impish henchman Puck, who creates romantic and comic havoc for all.

title: Alice in Wonderland
description: Eva Le Gallienne's production, from a script she co-adapted, contains elements of Lewis Carroll's novel Alice in Wonderland, in which a young English girl travels down the rabbit hole into a magical dreamland, as well as the book's sequel, Through the Looking Glass.

title: The Show Off
description: A clerk at New York's Penn Station is given to exaggerating his own role at the station in George Kelly's satire.

title: Cyrano de Bergerac
description: Cyrano is a poet, philosopher and swordsman of incredible wit, but his sizable nose renders him too shy to pursue the beautiful Roxane. Instead, he provides the poetry and eloquence to woo her vicariously through his inarticulate friend Christian.

title: Goodbye Again
description: A famous writer's now-married old flame revisits him in an attempt to rekindle their affair.

title: Twentieth Century
description: A struggling Broadway producer tries to get a former lover, now a Hollywood star, to sign a contract to star in his latest (and as yet un-conceived) play as they travel on the luxury train Twentieth Century Limited from Chicago to New York.

title: Design for Living
description: Artists Gilda, Otto and Leo rotate partners while on an excursion through Europe in Noel Coward's scandalous "ménage à trois" dark comedy.

title: The Miraculous Birth and the Midwives
The Lamentation of the Virgin Mary
Run, Little Chillun
description: Religious and pagan forces conflict in a black Southern town, in this play written and featuring music by African-American spiritual composer Hall Johnson.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: Threepenny Opera
description:
The outlaw Macheath is repeatedly betrayed and sent to prison, only to receive a last-minute reprieve from Queen Victoria, in Kurt Weill and Bertolt Brecht's darkly satirical adaptation of
John Gay's The Beggar's Opera.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Ghosts
description: In Henrik Ibsen's 1881 play, Mrs. Alving plans to dedicate an orphanage to the memory of her late husband, but confesses to Pastor Manders that her supposedly upstanding husband was actually a philanderer. The effects of his indiscretions are still apparent in their disease-afflicted son and the maid he has fallen for.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: Ah, Wilderness!
description: In a small New England town at the turn of the 20th century, an intense, poetic and sensitive young man falls in love, drives his mother crazy, and sparks his parents to recall their own romance and youth.

title: The School for Husbands and The Dream of Sganarelle
Tobacco Road
description: The Lester family of Georgia sharecroppers are the subject of Jack Kirkland's adaptation of Erskine Caldwell's novel.

title: A Hat, a Coat, a Glove
The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: The Lady from the Sea
description: The wife of a doctor moves to a small Norwegian town in the mountains, away from the seaside fjord where she grew up.  When her former fiancé, a sailor, returns after a long absence, she is forced to choose between her former and her present life, in Henrik Ibsen's 1889 play.

title: The Chocolate Soldier
description: During the Serbio-Bulgarian War of 1885, a Bulgarian woman who is engaged to a war hero encounters a Serbian captain who is retreating from the war because he despises it. He teaches her to see beyond the romantic ideals of war in this operetta, adapted from George Bernard Shaw's Arms and the Man.

title: The Milky Way
description: A young boxer is embarrassed to have been knocked out by a mild-mannered milkman, and when the milkman returns to apologize, he quickly turns him into a professional whom he can beat in the ring.

title: Invitation to a Murder
description: Two families visit the South Shore of Long Island for the marriage of their children. But the bride keeps falling asleep, especially when the groom talks about their safe, secure future, and is only woken up by the kiss of a poor and free-spirited young man.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: H.M.S. Pinafore
description: The daughter of the captain of Her Majesty's Ship Pinafore is in love with a humble sailor, despite her father's hopes that she will marry a better-born suitor, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Patience
description: An aesthetic poet is pursued by many maidens but loves only a milkmaid who disdains the idea of love, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: Ted Shawn and His Male Dancers
The Plough and the Stars
description: Residents of an Irish tenement look forward to Ireland's liberation before and after the Easter Uprising in Dublin in 1916, in Sean O'Casey's drama.

title: The Playboy of the Western World
description: A mysterious man stumbles into an Irish pub, claiming he is fleeing his farm after killing his father. The locals, including a barmaid who is attracted to the man, are more interested in enjoying the man's story than in condemning him, in John Millington Synge's play.

title: Anything Goes
description: An evangelist-turned-nightclub singer, a lovelorn stockbroker wooing a lovely debutante, the debutante's British lord fiancé, and a gangster disguised as a minister all turn up on a luxury cruise liner to sing, dance and romance.

title: Juno and the Paycock
description: Unemployed Captain Boyle would rather drink his days away with his friend Joxer than get a job to provide for his wife Juno and their children. Sean O'Casey's tale traces the effects of the 1920s Irish civil war on its working-class people.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: Accent on Youth
description: A successful playwright in his 50s finds love and inspiration in his much-younger secretary. But when his new muse becomes a leading lady in his latest play, she begins to fall for her costar, a man closer to her age.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: The Petrified Forest
description: A dangerous gangster on the run with his band holds up an Arizona diner full of various characters, including a dying intellectual and a waitress striving for a more cultured life, in Robert E. Sherwood's play.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: A poor Russian man plans to kill an unscrupulous pawnbroker and use her money to do good deeds to counteract his crime, believing he is justified in the murder because of his admirable goals, in this adaptation of Fyodor Dostoyevsky's novel.

title: Three Men on a Horse
description: A meek writer of greeting cards has a knack for picking the winning horse at the race track, which brings him to the attention of some gamblers down on their luck, in this Depression-era farce.

title: The Simpleton of the Unexpected Isles
Awake and Sing!
description: The battle lines for a lower-middle-class Jewish family in the Depression-era Bronx are drawn between the string-pulling parents who think they know best and their resistant offspring who have hatched their own dreams of the future.

title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
description: The romance of the English poets Elizabeth Barrett and Robert Browning, despite her mysterious illness and tyrannical father, is the subject of Rudolf Besier's play.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.
