title: Othello
description: Othello, a Moor who has become a general in the Venetian army, sees his happy marriage to the beautiful Desdemona destroyed when his seemingly trustworthy ensign, Iago, suggests to him that she may be unfaithful, in William Shakespeare's tragedy of revenge, jealousy and intrigue.

title: The Taming of the Shrew
description: A wandering braggart out to marry for money ends up with the shrewish daughter of a rich man, whom he must "tame" even as he falls for her, in William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: Porgy and Bess
description: George Gershwin, Ira Gershwin and DuBose Heyward's operatic adaptation of Heyward's play Porgy follows the lives of the inhabitants of Catfish Row, an African-American section of Charleston, South Carolina, including the crippled Porgy, his beloved Bess, who is under the thrall of the dangerous Crown, and the sinewy drug dealer Sportin' Life.

title: Boy Meets Girl
description: Two Hollywood screenwriters scheme to cast the unborn child of a studio waitress in a new film, then scramble to cook up a scandal when they are bought out by the studio, in Sam and Bella Spewack's satire on the wiles of the film industry.

description: In Henrik Ibsen's 1881 play, Mrs. Alving plans to dedicate an orphanage to the memory of her late husband, but confesses to Pastor Manders that her supposedly upstanding husband was actually a philanderer. The effects of his indiscretions are still apparent in their disease-afflicted son and the maid he has fallen for.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: A Room in Red and White
Saint Joan
description: Set in 15th century France, Saint Joan follows a country girl whose mysterious visions propel her into elite circles. When the nation’s rulers become threatened by her popularity and influence, they unite to bring her down and she finds herself on trial for her life.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: On Your Toes
description: A former vaudevillian, now working as a music professor, convinces the Russian Ballet director to stage his student's jazz ballet, ultimately performing the lead in the ballet and arousing the jealousy of the prima ballerina's boyfriend — as well as the disappointment of the female music student who loves him.

title: Macbeth

title: Trial by Jury & the Pirates of Penzance
description: An evening of two Gilbert and Sullivan operettas.

title: Night Must Fall
description: A disturbed bellboy charms — and murders — several women at an English country house, carrying the head of one of his victims around with him, in Emlyn Williams, thriller, which is based on a real-life case.

title: H.M.S. Pinafore
description: The daughter of the captain of Her Majesty's Ship Pinafore is in love with a humble sailor, despite her father's hopes that she will marry a better-born suitor, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: Cox and Box / H.M.S. Pinafore
description: An evening of two Gilbert and Sullivan operettas.

description: An aesthetic poet is pursued by many maidens but loves only a milkmaid who disdains the idea of love, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: Hamlet

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Hedda Gabler
description: Ibsen's Hedda Gabler presents a psychological study of a cultivated woman, recently returned from her honeymoon, whose boredom and dissatisfaction in a stifling environment lead her to destroy others — and herself.

title: Johnny Johnson
description: A peaceful American stonecutter retains his idealism in the face of World War I horrors in Kurt Weill and Paul Green's anti-war musical.

title: Tonight at 8:30
description:
An evening of one-act plays by Noel Coward.  In Ways and Means, a debt-plagued gambler and his wife are saved from final disgrace when a chauffeur who had planned to rob them saves them instead.  Still Life depicts the frustrated secret affair between two married middle-class people.  Fumed Oak follows a middle-aged salesman who has earned enough money to tell off his wife, mother-in-law and daughter and to leave them.
Note: The original 1936 production of Tonight at 8:30 contained nine one-act plays performed over three evenings, including We Were Dancing, The Astonished Heart, Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Shadow Play, Ways and Means and Still Life. Six one-acts (Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Family Album, Shadow Play, and Ways and Means) were performed in a 1948 revival.  Only three of the one-acts were performed in the 1967 revival.

An evening of one-act plays by Noel Coward.  In Ways and Means, a debt-plagued gambler and his wife are saved from final disgrace when a chauffeur who had planned to rob them saves them instead.  Still Life depicts the frustrated secret affair between two married middle-class people.  Fumed Oak follows a middle-aged salesman who has earned enough money to tell off his wife, mother-in-law and daughter and to leave them.
Note: The original 1936 production of Tonight at 8:30 contained nine one-act plays performed over three evenings, including We Were Dancing, The Astonished Heart, Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Shadow Play, Ways and Means and Still Life. Six one-acts (Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Family Album, Shadow Play, and Ways and Means) were performed in a 1948 revival.  Only three of the one-acts were performed in the 1967 revival.

description:
An evening of one-act plays by Noel Coward.  In Ways and Means, a debt-plagued gambler and his wife are saved from final disgrace when a chauffeur who had planned to rob them saves them instead.  Still Life depicts the frustrated secret affair between two married middle-class people.  Fumed Oak follows a middle-aged salesman who has earned enough money to tell off his wife, mother-in-law and daughter and to leave them.
Note: The original 1936 production of Tonight at 8:30 contained nine one-act plays performed over three evenings, including We Were Dancing, The Astonished Heart, Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Shadow Play, Ways and Means and Still Life. Six one-acts (Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Family Album, Shadow Play, and Ways and Means) were performed in a 1948 revival.  Only three of the one-acts were performed in the 1967 revival.

title: The Country Wife
description: The cad Horner pretends to be impotent to seduce the married women of London, and he finds the naïve Margery Pinchwife, visiting from the country, particularly besotted with him in William Wycherley's Restoration comedy.

title: You Can't Take It With You
description: An eccentric family allows each member to pursue his own ambition in the home, but their routine is disrupted when a daughter with a regular job wants to bring her fiancé and his Wall Street family to dinner in George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy.

title: The Women
description: Park Avenue society can't stop gossiping about Mary Haines' husband's affair with shop girl Crystal Allen in Clare Boothe Luce's biting look at the cattier side of the fairer sex.

title: Othello
description: Othello, a Moor who has become a general in the Venetian army, sees his happy marriage to the beautiful Desdemona destroyed when his seemingly trustworthy ensign, Iago, suggests to him that she may be unfaithful, in William Shakespeare's tragedy of revenge, jealousy and intrigue.

title: But for the Grace of God
Naughty Naught '00
description: A Yale student tries to undermine a champion rower by plying him with spiked drinks and getting a vamp to flirt with him in front of his beloved, in this musical homage to innocent college fun in the early 20th century.

title: King Richard II
description: The thoughtful but weak English King Richard II loses his throne to Henry Bolingbroke in William Shakespeare's play.

title: An Enemy of the People
description: When Dr. Thomas Stockmann discovers toxic contamination in the water used at the local baths, he expects to be hailed as a hero. But since the baths are the town's main source of revenue, the community fights to silence him — and Dr. Stockmann learns there are forces more powerful than truth.

title: London Assurance
description: London widower Sir Harcourt Courtly falls for a Gloucestershire heiress — the same heiress his son is pursuing — in Dion Boucicault's 1841 comedy.

title: The Show Off
description: A clerk at New York's Penn Station is given to exaggerating his own role at the station in George Kelly's satire.

title: Candida
description: A minister's wife becomes an object of infatuation for an idealistic young poet, in George Bernard Shaw's comedic look at the changing views on gender and social equality.

title: Ghosts
description: In Henrik Ibsen's 1881 play, Mrs. Alving plans to dedicate an orphanage to the memory of her late husband, but confesses to Pastor Manders that her supposedly upstanding husband was actually a philanderer. The effects of his indiscretions are still apparent in their disease-afflicted son and the maid he has fallen for.

title: Cuando Los Hijos De Eva No Son Lo Hijos De Adan
The Plough and the Stars
description: Residents of an Irish tenement look forward to Ireland's liberation before and after the Easter Uprising in Dublin in 1916, in Sean O'Casey's drama.

title: Susan and God
description: A self-centered woman unexpectedly connects with her alcoholic husband and unhappy daughter after joining a religious cult.

title: One Act Plays of the Sea
As You Like It
description: Rosalind, banished from her father's kingdom by her usurping uncle, disguises herself as a boy while falling for one, the similarly exiled duke Orlando.

title: Golden Boy
description: Clifford Odets' Golden Boy is the story of Joe Bonaparte, a young, gifted violinist who is torn between pursuing a career in music and earning big money as a prize fighter.

title: Julius Caesar
description: In William Shakespeare's tragedy of political ambition, corruption and betrayal, Roman senators Brutus and Cassius lead a group effort to assassinate the powerful Julius Caesar, then battle with Mark Antony over control of the state.

title: In a Train / The Playboy of the Western World
Of Mice and Men
description: Two migrant field hands, the average-looking but smart George and the strong but mentally challenged Lennie, find work on a farm in California during the Great Depression, seeing their dreams lead to tragedy when Lennie gets too close to the wife of the boss's son, in John Steinbeck's adaptation of his novel.

title: Juno and the Paycock
description: Unemployed Captain Boyle would rather drink his days away with his friend Joxer than get a job to provide for his wife Juno and their children. Sean O'Casey's tale traces the effects of the 1920s Irish civil war on its working-class people.

title: A Doll's House
description: Nora Helmer, a childlike wife and mother accustomed to an existence built around her husband Torvald, comes to confront the truth of her marriage, in Henrik Ibsen's groundbreaking 1879 play.

title: The Cradle Will Rock
description: A Brechtian allegory of corruption and corporate greed, The Cradle Will Rock follows the efforts of Larry Foreman to unionize local workers and combat wicked, greedy businessman Mr. Mister, who controls the town's factory, press, church and social organizations.

title: Time and the Conways
description: In 1919 Britain, Mrs. Conway is full of optimism during her daughter’s lavish twenty-first birthday celebration. The Great War is over, wealth is in the air, and the family’s dreams bubble over like champagne. Jump nineteen years into the future, though, and the Conways’ lives have transformed unimaginably.

title: True Blue Or the Press Gang
Pygmalion
description: In George Bernard Shaw's play, based on a classical myth, a blustering phonetics professor bets that he can turn a Cockney flower girl into a passable society lady in three months.

title: Captain Jinks of the Horse Marines
On Borrowed Time
description: An old man chases Death (called Mr. Brink) up a tree so he can spend more time with his grandson, in Paul Osborn's fantasy based on L.E. Watkin's novel.

title: Our Town
description: The Stage Manager guides audiences through a small New England town in the early 1900s, as its inhabitants grow up, get married and discover the beauty of life, in Thornton Wilder's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: How to Get Tough About It
The Seagull
description: Famous actress Irina Arkadina is obsessed with a callous lover, dismissive of her frustrated son and suspicious of an admiring young woman. Anton Chekhov's 1895 play explores the tensions between mothers, sons, lovers, friends and servants.

title: The Wild Duck
description: A wealthy merchant's son returns home after a time to discover that his old schoolmate has married and has a daughter with the family servant, whom the merchant's wife believed had an affair with her husband, in Henrik Ibsen's 1884 play.

title: The Circle
description: A titled English lady, who eloped with a former Parliament official, returns with her new husband to the estate — and the husband and son — she abandoned, only to find that the son's wife may soon run off with her own lover.

title: Heartbreak House
description: On the eve of World War I, unlikely romantic encounters occur during a most unusual country weekend.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Abe Lincoln in Illinois
description: Abraham Lincoln's journey from unremarkable Illinois businessman to president of the United States is charted in Robert E. Sherwood's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: A Woman's a Fool - to Be Clever
Danton's Tod
description: Georg Buchner dramatizes the conflict between French Revolution leader Danton and left-wing bourgeois politician Robespierre.

title: Where Do We Go from Here?
The Boys from Syracuse
description: Rodgers and Hart's musical comedy, adapted from Shakespeare's The Comedy of Errors, follows master-and-slave sets of twins, separated at birth and causing confusion with their various spouses and love interests in ancient Greece.

title: Awake and Sing!
description: The battle lines for a lower-middle-class Jewish family in the Depression-era Bronx are drawn between the string-pulling parents who think they know best and their resistant offspring who have hatched their own dreams of the future.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Patience
description: An aesthetic poet is pursued by many maidens but loves only a milkmaid who disdains the idea of love, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: The Importance of Being Earnest
description: Two wealthy London bachelors each pretend to be a fictitious man called Earnest in order to win over two eligible young ladies, despite the ladies' avowed preference for that name alone — and the interference of the intimidatingly proper Lady Bracknell — in Oscar Wilde's "trivial comedy for serious people."

title: The Coggerers / Mr. Banks of Birmingham / The Red Velvet Goat
Naughty Naught '00
description: A Yale student tries to undermine a champion rower by plying him with spiked drinks and getting a vamp to flirt with him in front of his beloved, in this musical homage to innocent college fun in the early 20th century.

title: King Henry IV, Part I
description: Henry IV's son, Prince Hal, must put aside his preference for drunken carousing with Sir John Falstaff and other lowlifes when his father's throne is threatened by the rebel Hotspur.

title: The Little Foxes
description: Southern belle Regina Giddens and her brothers scheme to outwit Regina's husband Horace, who opposes their attempts to profit from a cotton factory in partnership with a Chicago businessman, in Lillian Hellman's look at the power of money to destroy lives.

title: Awake and Sing!
description: The battle lines for a lower-middle-class Jewish family in the Depression-era Bronx are drawn between the string-pulling parents who think they know best and their resistant offspring who have hatched their own dreams of the future.

title: The Philadelphia Story
description: A wealthy socialite sees her second wedding disrupted by her ex-husband and a nosy reporter and photographer.

title: The Devil and Daniel Webster / Filling Station
Life and Death of an American
Journey's End
description: A group of World War I British officers in the trenches in St. Quentin, France, contemplates an impending attack.

title: They Knew What They Wanted
description: An aging Italian vineyard owner in California proposes to a waitress via letter, sending her a picture of his handsome hired hand.  Romantic and emotional complications ensue when she agrees to marry and live with the Italian in Sidney Howard's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: The Three Sisters
description: Sisters Olga, Masha and Irina long to leave their provincial military town for Moscow and grapple with frustrated love and disappointment, in Anton Chekhov's 1901 drama.

title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
description: An acerbic theatre critic breaks his leg while on a lecture tour in the Midwest and is forced to stay a bit longer at the home of his host family, ultimately taking over the house with his demands and visiting Broadway luminary friends.

title: The Time of Your Life
description: A group of eccentrics inhabit a dive bar in San Francisco, developing friendships and romances, in William Saroyan's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Morning's at Seven
description: Four sisters who live near each other in a Midwestern suburb find their existence disrupted when one's son wants to leave home to get married and another tells her husband she wants to live apart from the sister who shares a house with them.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Juno and the Paycock
description: Unemployed Captain Boyle would rather drink his days away with his friend Joxer than get a job to provide for his wife Juno and their children. Sean O'Casey's tale traces the effects of the 1920s Irish civil war on its working-class people.

title: The Taming of the Shrew
description: A wandering braggart out to marry for money ends up with the shrewish daughter of a rich man, whom he must "tame" even as he falls for her, in William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: Ladies in Retirement
description: In a cheery old cottage lives the ex-courtesan, Leonora, and her housekeeper-companion. The companion, obsessed with the need to protect her two dotty sisters, devises a terrifying solution for her problem. This is a 1930's suspense classic that combines the tension of the detective mystery with the terror of a ghost story.

title: King Richard II
description: The thoughtful but weak English King Richard II loses his throne to Henry Bolingbroke in William Shakespeare's play.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: Love for Love
description: The playboy Valentine prepares, at least nominally, to give up his inheritance in order to continue an irresponsible life and to court the beautiful Angelica, in William Congreve's Restoration comedy and social satire.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: Original Ballet Russe, Colonel De Basil's
Twelfth Night
description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

title: The Corn Is Green
description: A Welsh schoolteacher fights to nurture the writing talent in a local miner.

title: Old Acquaintance
description: Two childhood friends have grown into successful authors — one a critical darling and the other a prolific bestseller. When they reunite as adults, their simmering professional jealousy tests the boundaries of friendship and manners.

title: Pal Joey
description: Joey, a second-rate Chicago entertainer, two-times a married society dame and a naïve chorus girl. Based on the novel by John O'Hara and scored by Rodgers & Hart.

title: The Lady Who Came to Stay
Arsenic and Old Lace
description: A drama critic must deal with his eccentric family, including two sweet aunts who cheerfully poison elderly men with elderberry wine.

title: Watch on the Rhine
description: A peace activist exiled from pre-World War II Nazi Germany and a conservative Romanian unsure of how real a threat the Nazis pose meet in the Washington, D.C. home of the German's mother-in-law, in Lillian Hellman's tense drama.

title: Ah, Wilderness!
description: In a small New England town at the turn of the 20th century, an intense, poetic and sensitive young man falls in love, drives his mother crazy, and sparks his parents to recall their own romance and youth.

title: As You Like It
description: Rosalind, banished from her father's kingdom by her usurping uncle, disguises herself as a boy while falling for one, the similarly exiled duke Orlando.

title: Blithe Spirit
description: Researching material for a new novel, Charles engages Madame Arcati, a spiritual medium of uncertain talent, to conduct a séance in his home. Quite by accident, she summons the spirit of Charles's first wife and cannot make the disruptive spirit go away.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: Twelfth Night
description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

title: Angel Street
description: A prosperous couple in Victorian London is driven apart when the husband starts to convince his wife she is going mad, in Patrick Hamilton's thriller, which was filmed using its British title, Gaslight.

title: The Rivals
description: Wealthy captain Jack Absolute pretends to be poor officer Ensign Beverley to win the romantic Lydia in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1775 comedy, which also features such characters as oafish Bob Acres, temper-prone Sir Lucius O'Trigger and Mrs. Malaprop, whose frequent confusion of words and their meanings coined the term "malapropism."

title: Porgy and Bess
description: George Gershwin, Ira Gershwin and DuBose Heyward's operatic adaptation of Heyward's play Porgy follows the lives of the inhabitants of Catfish Row, an African-American section of Charleston, South Carolina, including the crippled Porgy, his beloved Bess, who is under the thrall of the dangerous Crown, and the sinewy drug dealer Sportin' Life.

title: Cafe Crown
description: A variety of Yiddish theatrical types, most notably an impresario who plans to "improve" King Lear, gather regularly at a Second Avenue café.

title: Hedda Gabler
description: Ibsen's Hedda Gabler presents a psychological study of a cultivated woman, recently returned from her honeymoon, whose boredom and dissatisfaction in a stifling environment lead her to destroy others — and herself.

title: The Mikado / The Big City / A Ball in Old Vienna
They Should Have Stood in Bed
The Pirates of Penzance / The Prodigal Son
Candida
description: A minister's wife becomes an object of infatuation for an idealistic young poet, in George Bernard Shaw's comedic look at the changing views on gender and social equality.

title: The Strings, My Lord, Are False
The Merry Widow
description: The baron who serves as ambassador of the kingdom of Marsovia wishes his attaché Prince Danilo would wed the wealthy widow Sonia to help the kingdom's finances, and the couple falls in love despite themselves, in Franz Lehar's operetta.

title: Across the Board on Tomorrow Morning and Talking to You
The New Moon
description: In 1788 New Orleans, a French nobleman wanted for murder builds up a revolutionary following who rescue him and his ladylove when they are caught and sent back to France on the boat The New Moon.

title: Tobacco Road
description: The Lester family of Georgia sharecroppers are the subject of Jack Kirkland's adaptation of Erskine Caldwell's novel.

title: Three Men on a Horse
description: A meek writer of greeting cards has a knack for picking the winning horse at the race track, which brings him to the attention of some gamblers down on their luck, in this Depression-era farce.

title: The Time, the Place and the Girl
New Opera Co.: Ballet Imperial / The Fair at Sorochinsk
The Skin of Our Teeth
description: The modern-looking Antrobus family and their seductive maid, Sabina, survive many ancient disasters, including the Ice Age, Noah's flood, war and famine, always able to start over and begin anew, in Thornton Wilder's Pulitzer Prize-winning dark comedy.

title: The Three Sisters
description: Sisters Olga, Masha and Irina long to leave their provincial military town for Moscow and grapple with frustrated love and disappointment, in Anton Chekhov's 1901 drama.

title: The Patriots
description: Sidney S. Kingsley dramatizes Thomas Jefferson's battle for democratic ideals in the nascent American political arena, first as George Washington's secretary of state and then as a presidential candidate.

title: Harriet
description: Harriet Beecher marries Professor Calvin Stowe and begins writing to escape her overbearing family. She finds fame, wealth, and a cause with her anti-slavery novel Uncle Tom's Cabin.

title: Richard III
description: Richard, Duke of York, plots murders, marriages, and other intrigues in order to secure his own place on the throne. This tale of ruthless ambition is part of Shakespeare's cycle of plays about the Wars of the Roses.

title: Oklahoma!
description: A confident cowboy competes with a surly, mysterious farmhand for the honor of taking a lovely young farm woman to a dance in Rodgers and Hammerstein's 1943 musical adaptation of Green Grow the Lilacs.

title: The Corn Is Green
description: A Welsh schoolteacher fights to nurture the writing talent in a local miner.

title: The Student Prince
description: A German prince falls for a waitress while completing his university education in a small town in 1860, in Sigmund Romberg and Dorothy Donnelly's operetta.

title: The Milky Way
description: A young boxer is embarrassed to have been knocked out by a mild-mannered milkman, and when the milkman returns to apologize, he quickly turns him into a professional whom he can beat in the ring.

title: Those Endearing Young Charms
description: A World War II pilot meets his best friend's girlfriend while on leave and uses his proven Casanova techniques to win her over, although he only succeeds when he promises to change his roving ways.

title: Boy Meets Girl
description: Two Hollywood screenwriters scheme to cast the unborn child of a studio waitress in a new film, then scramble to cook up a scandal when they are bought out by the studio, in Sam and Bella Spewack's satire on the wiles of the film industry.

title: The Vagabond King
description: The 15th-century French outlaw Francois Villon is appointed king for a day so that he may lead the people of France against the Duke of Burgundy's army, in Rudolf Friml, Brian Hooker, Russell Janney and W.H. Post's operetta.

title: Try and Get It
description: A kept woman asks a cookie saleswoman to trade places with her when her sugar daddy asks her to entertain an old friend of his. Comic complications result when the friend turns out to be a handsome young soldier.

title: The Two Mrs. Carrolls
description: The wife of an artist gradually realizes, with the help of his former spouse, that he is trying to drive her insane and ultimately murder her, in Martin Vale's thriller.

title: The Merry Widow
description: The baron who serves as ambassador of the kingdom of Marsovia wishes his attaché Prince Danilo would wed the wealthy widow Sonia to help the kingdom's finances, and the couple falls in love despite themselves, in Franz Lehar's operetta.

title: Run, Little Chillun
description: Religious and pagan forces conflict in a black Southern town, in this play written and featuring music by African-American spiritual composer Hall Johnson.

title: Murder Without Crime
description: A sadistic landlord tries to get a neurotic tenant to admit that he killed his mistress and is hiding the body, only to discover after the man leaves that the woman is only wounded and not dead.

title: The Snark Was a Boojum
description: The women of a family, including its dog, are all simultaneously pregnant in the hopes that their child will be the first-born and the first to inherit the dead uncle's money.

title: Tobacco Road
description: The Lester family of Georgia sharecroppers are the subject of Jack Kirkland's adaptation of Erskine Caldwell's novel.

title: Blithe Spirit
description: Researching material for a new novel, Charles engages Madame Arcati, a spiritual medium of uncertain talent, to conduct a séance in his home. Quite by accident, she summons the spirit of Charles's first wife and cannot make the disruptive spirit go away.

title: Laugh Time
description: Frank Fay, Ethel Waters, Bert Wheeler, and the dance team Buck and Bubbles headline this vaudeville-style revue of songs, dances and sketches.

title: My Dear Public
description: A zipper manufacturer reluctantly becomes the backer for a new musical.

title: Porgy and Bess
description: George Gershwin, Ira Gershwin and DuBose Heyward's operatic adaptation of Heyward's play Porgy follows the lives of the inhabitants of Catfish Row, an African-American section of Charleston, South Carolina, including the crippled Porgy, his beloved Bess, who is under the thrall of the dangerous Crown, and the sinewy drug dealer Sportin' Life.

title: Tropical Revue
description: Katherine Dunham and her dance company present an evening of Afro-Caribbean dance.

title: Land of Fame
description: Albert and Mary Bein's play follows the efforts of Greek guerilla warfare against the invading Nazis.

title: One Touch of Venus
description: A barber places a ring on a statue of Venus that brings the goddess of love to life in modern-day New York City, in Kurt Weill, Ogden Nash and S.J. Perelman's musical.

title: Othello
description: Othello, a Moor who has become a general in the Venetian army, sees his happy marriage to the beautiful Desdemona destroyed when his seemingly trustworthy ensign, Iago, suggests to him that she may be unfaithful, in William Shakespeare's tragedy of revenge, jealousy and intrigue.

title: The Naked Genius
description: A burlesque stripper copes with the demands of her career and her entourage as she balances a need for a more respectable life.

title: Slightly Married
description: A 17-year-old girl thinks she has married an underage soldier and gotten pregnant, causing embarrassment for her parents.

title: Manhattan Nocturne
description: A down-and-out writer asks a call girl to appear in his bedroom as correspondent in a divorce suit, but he finds himself drawn to her and willing to help her out of her sad circumstances.

title: Victory Belles
description: A mother, worried about the lack of men around to marry her daughter after World War II, tries to cook up plans of her own and gets mixed up with a butler pretending to be an F.B.I. spy.

title: The Petrified Forest
description: A dangerous gangster on the run with his band holds up an Arizona diner full of various characters, including a dying intellectual and a waitress striving for a more cultured life, in Robert E. Sherwood's play.

title: Outrageous Fortune
description: A wealthy Jewish family copes with marital and romantic difficulties, homosexuality, and unrequited love, in Rose Franken's play.

title: Goodbye Again
description: A famous writer's now-married old flame revisits him in an attempt to rekindle their affair.

title: What's Up?
description: The head of a mysterious foreign country is visiting America when his plane crashes on the grounds of a girls' school, leading to various comic complications in Frederick Loewe, Alan Jay Lerner, and Arthur Pierson's musical.

title: The Innocent Voyage
description: Five English children are sailing to England from Jamaica when their ship is overtaken by pirates; the children run amok and one causes the death of a Swedish sea captain.

title: Winged Victory
description: Moss Hart's play details the stories of six soldiers inducted into the U.S. Air Force during World War II.

title: Lovers and Friends
description: A long marriage is tested when the husband confesses a love affair to his wife, in Dodie Smith's play.

title: Carmen Jones
description: As the Second World War rages, parachute maker Carmen Jones wages her own quarrel involving an airman and a boxer. Using the score from Georges Bizet’s opera Carmen, this adaptation by Oscar Hammerstein II resets the story with an all African-American cast, and is the first major New York revival since its debut on Broadway 75 years ago.

title: The Voice of the Turtle
description: A young actress is forced to entertain a soldier for the evening when her friend, who was supposed to do so, cancels.  The passion of the moment leads to a sexual encounter and love blooms, in John Van Druten's play.

title: Pillar to Post
description: An army lieutenant is caught in a compromising position with a young woman, forcing them to pretend to be a married couple.

title: Susan and God
description: A self-centered woman unexpectedly connects with her alcoholic husband and unhappy daughter after joining a religious cult.

title: The Patriots
description: Sidney S. Kingsley dramatizes Thomas Jefferson's battle for democratic ideals in the nascent American political arena, first as George Washington's secretary of state and then as a presidential candidate.

title: Listen, Professor
description: An idealistic youth converts a suspicious intellectual into a supporter of the Russian Revolution, in Alexander Nikolayevitch Afinogenov's play.

title: Martha Graham and Company
description: Martha Graham and her modern dance company perform in concert on Broadway.

title: South Pacific
description: A torpedoed black seaman lands on an island in the South Pacific and is content to stay with the natives rather than return to fight for a war he doesn't care about, until his captain companion is killed on another mission.

title: Paul Draper and Larry Adler
description: Tap dancer Paul Draper and harmonica player Larry Adler perform together on Broadway.

title: Over 21
description: A female novelist and screenwriter is married to a successful newspaper editor and secretly takes over writing his editorials when he enlists in World War II, in Ruth Gordon's play.

title: Ramshackle Inn
description: A spinster librarian saves money to buy a dilapidated hotel near the ocean, which turns out to be haunted by benevolent spirits.

title: Our Town
description: The Stage Manager guides audiences through a small New England town in the early 1900s, as its inhabitants grow up, get married and discover the beauty of life, in Thornton Wilder's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Storm Operation
description: An American soldier stationed in North Africa buys an Arab woman who helps his unit in battle, in Maxwell Anderson's play.

title: Suds in Your Eye
description: Two unhappy women move in with a junkyard-dealer female friend and live happily despite tax collectors.

title: The Duke in Darkness
description: A 16th-century French duke and his servant have been imprisoned by a rival duke for 15 years, but their new guard appears to be an ally who can help them escape — for a terrible price.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: Wallflower
description: A married couple's two daughters, each from a spouse's previous marriage, compete for the attention of the same boy at college.

title: Mexican Hayride
description: A numbers racketeer is on the run in Mexico where he must dodge the police in various disguises, even after he is mistakenly selected as an American goodwill ambassador at a bullfight.

title: Peepshow
description: A cad fights with his conscience over whether to seduce his best friend's wife over a bridge game that also involves his friend and his own fiancée.

title: The American Ballad Singers
description: The American Ballad Singers perform an evening of American folk music.

title: Porgy and Bess
description: George Gershwin, Ira Gershwin and DuBose Heyward's operatic adaptation of Heyward's play Porgy follows the lives of the inhabitants of Catfish Row, an African-American section of Charleston, South Carolina, including the crippled Porgy, his beloved Bess, who is under the thrall of the dangerous Crown, and the sinewy drug dealer Sportin' Life.

title: Take It as It Comes
description: A New Jersey family with a kind neighbor is selected as the ideal American family in a magazine broadcast, which takes place the night their neighbor is gunned down by fellow gangsters after having given a large sum of money to the family's youngest child.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Cox and Box / the Pirates of Penzance
Right Next to Broadway
description: A snobbish and overly confident woman endeavors to take over her father's garment business but runs into several business and personal difficulties.

title: Martha
description: One of Queen Anne's maids-of-honor and her girlfriend masquerade as servants at a country fair and begin working for two farmers, each of whom falls in love with his new charge, in Friedrich von Flotow's opera.

title: Patience
description: An aesthetic poet is pursued by many maidens but loves only a milkmaid who disdains the idea of love, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: Mrs. Kimball Presents
description: Two young actors take on different identities in order to impress the wealthy backer of their latest play, in Alonzo Price's comedy.

title: Thank You, Svoboda
description: A simple-minded porter is the only resident of a small Czech town to protest its takeover by the Nazis, who ship him off to a concentration camp but turn him into a surprisingly stronger person.

title: The House in Paris
description: Eleven years after driving an artist she loved to suicide, a French woman agrees to raise the man's illegitimate son.

title: Mrs. January and Mr. X
description: A wealthy widow impulsively decides to live modestly in half of a New England two-family house with her family and entourage, exasperating and fascinating her landlord, who turns out to be a disgraced former president who could stand to be more broad-minded.

title: Only the Heart
description: A domineering mother in 1920s Texas is ultimately abandoned by her family and has only the wealth from the oil on her property to console her.

title: Public Relations
description: A divorced, former silent-film star couple converges in their old mansion along with their son, his new wife and devious fan, and the husband's long-lost daughter.

title: The Searching Wind
description: A diplomat accepts Mussolini's takeover of Rome while beginning a long affair with his wife's best friend, leading to personal tensions as political storm clouds gather, in Lillian Hellman's play.

title: Pretty Little Parlor
description: A coldhearted, ambitious woman drives her husband to drink, out of his job with the railroad, and to tragedy, but she then meets her match with the railroad's president.

title: Sheppey
description: To the consternation of his family, a London barber decides to live a strict Christian existence after winning the Irish sweepstakes.

title: Carmen
description: The soldier Don Jose is destroyed by his love for the beautiful Gypsy temptress Carmen, in Georges Bizet's opera.

title: Rigoletto
description: A jester mocks the courtiers who are fooled by a philandering duke, only to realize that the duke is in pursuit of his own daughter, in Giuseppe Verdi's opera.

title: Il Trovatore
description: A troubadour and a count compete for the love of a princess's lady-in-waiting, in Giuseppe Verdi's opera.

title: La Bohème
description: A group of bohemian artists struggle to survive the cold Paris winter, as romance between poet Rodolfo and seamstress Mimi heads for tragedy and painter Marcello's affair with unfaithful singer Musetta provides comedy in the landmark Giacomo Puccini opera.

title: La Tosca
description: An opera singer loves a painter who sympathizes with her brother, a leader of the Italian resistance against Napoleon's coming invasion. When a sadistic chief of police arrests the painter, the singer is prepared to sleep with him to gain her beloved's freedom, in Giacomo Puccini's opera.

title: Cavalleria Rusticana
description: An Italian villager carries on affairs with two women who are nearly destroyed by their love and jealousy, in Pietro Mascagni's one-act opera.

title: Pick-Up Girl
description: A 15-year-old girl is put on trial for sleeping with a much older man, after being turned in by a neighbor who is afraid her son is falling under the girl's influence, in Elsa Shelley's play.

title: Martha Graham and Company
description: Martha Graham and her modern dance company perform in concert on Broadway.

title: The Maid as Mistress / The Secret of Suzanne
description:
An evening of two one-act operettas, including The Maid as Mistress by G.B. Pergolesi and The Secret of Suzanne by Ermanno Wolf-Ferrari.
In The Maid as Mistress, an 18th-century Italian gentleman asks his servant to find him a wife and to help her maintain her status as mistress of the house through an elaborate pretend scenario.
In The Secret of Suzanne, a countess illicitly smokes cigarettes, but when her husband smells the scent, he believes she is having an affair.

title: The New Moon
description: In 1788 New Orleans, a French nobleman wanted for murder builds up a revolutionary following who rescue him and his ladylove when they are caught and sent back to France on the boat The New Moon.

title: That Old Devil
description: A dull townsman's wife and neighbors suspect him of being the father of the baby of an English girl who comes to stay with his family.

title: Slightly Scandalous
description: A woman who has had three children, each by a different lover, has told them that the man in a painting she purchased is their father, but when they are of marriageable age, she decides to legitimize them by summoning all three former lovers and asking her children whom she should marry.

title: For Keeps
description: A mature-beyond-her-years teenager visits her father and stepmother and captivates one of her photographer father's models — until he learns her real age.

title: Take a Bow
description: Chico Marx headlines this vaudeville-style revue of songs, dances, and sketches.

title: Love on Leave
description: A child psychologist's 15-year-old daughter tries on her older sister's clothes and makeup and sneaks out to Times Square to attempt to pick up a soldier.

title: Hats Off to Ice
description: Sonja Henie co-produces this musical ice-skating revue.

title: Ten Little Indians
description: A group of 10 people are called to the isolated mansion of a mysterious gentleman and told that each has committed a crime and must pay for it with their lives, in Agatha Christie's adaptation of her novel And Then There Were None.

title: School for Brides
description: A much-married millionaire's promoter friend sets up a training school as a gimmick for finding the millionaire's next wife but is flummoxed when his own wife joins the chorus of auditioning cuties and passes her courses with flying colors.

title: Catherine Was Great
description: Current-day soldiers ponder what Catherine the Great was like and imagine her dealings with both international and romantic problems as Empress of Russia.

title: Good Morning Corporal
description: A woman marries a marine, a soldier, and a sailor before each is shipped off to fight World War II, causing many complications when they return.

title: Song of Norway
description: Edvard Grieg's music is used to tell the fictionalized story of the Norwegian composer's life and his romantic choice between a simple girl from home and a glamorous opera singer.

title: Lower North
description: Martin Bidwell's play follows a group of young men attending Quartermasters' School at a California naval training station.

title: Anna Lucasta
description: A black prostitute seeks the forgiveness of her family in Phillip Yordan's play.

title: Sleep No More
description: A conman dodges the cops and enlists three barber friends to help him peddle an illegal pill that keeps people awake.

title: Last Stop
description: The owner of an old-ladies' home, who years earlier helped murder her predecessor to gain control of the place, is prepared to sell it and move the occupants elsewhere — unless they have something to say about it.

title: The Day Will Come
description: Nazi officers, upon occupying a Russian village, find the only survivor to be an old Jewish man who appears to be the legendary Wandering Jew. They introduce him to Hitler hoping that the meeting will end the war.

title: Down to Miami
description: A Christian boy and a Jewish girl come to Miami with their families, who are hoping to make suitable matches for them and are horrified when the two fall in love with each other.

title: Star Time
description: This vaudeville-style musical revue features songs, dances, and sketches.

title: While the Sun Shines
description: A British earl serving in the navy brings a drunken American officer home with him in hopes of giving him to his mistress so he may be free to marry his fiancée.

title: Harriet
description: Harriet Beecher marries Professor Calvin Stowe and begins writing to escape her overbearing family. She finds fame, wealth, and a cause with her anti-slavery novel Uncle Tom's Cabin.

title: The Odds on Mrs. Oakley
description: A divorced couple agrees to rotate charge of their racehorse for three months at a time.  The wife's gambler uncle then realizes the horse always wins when the wife's in charge and loses when under the husband's keep, and he conspires to keep the two from remarrying.

title: Men to the Sea
description: The wives of a group of Navy men live together near the Brooklyn Navy Yard and cope in different ways with the anguish and sexual frustration of being away from their husbands.

title: Soldier's Wife
description: A soldier who has been sent home to recover from stomach wounds tells his wife that a dying friend whose father is a publisher read her love letters and thinks they should be published.

title: Pearl Primus
description: The African-influenced dancer and choreographer Pearl Primus performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Bloomer Girl
description: The daughter of an upstate New York hoop skirt manufacturer falls for a Southern slave owner, despite being influenced by the feminist, anti-slavery politics (and revolutionary undergarments) of her aunt, Dolly Bloomer.

title: The Merry Widow
description: The baron who serves as ambassador of the kingdom of Marsovia wishes his attaché Prince Danilo would wed the wealthy widow Sonia to help the kingdom's finances, and the couple falls in love despite themselves, in Franz Lehar's operetta.

title: Meet a Body
description: A man appears at a funeral parlor to pay his funeral expenses in advance before turning up dead five minutes later, with three possible murder suspects.

title: The Visitor
description: A boy who ran out on his mother and stepfather mysteriously returns three years later, with his motives and even his identity in question, in Kenneth White's adaptation of Leane Zugsmith and Carl Randau's novel.

title: I Remember Mama
description: A Norwegian immigrant family, settling into 1910s San Francisco and held together by its indomitable Mama, is the subject of John Van Druten's adaptation of Kathryn Forbes' novel Mama's Bank Account.

title: Violet
description: A twice-married laundryman wants to get married again but his two ex-wives, precocious teenage daughter, and four other children interfere with his attempts.

title: Snafu
description: A 15-year-old war hero is quickly shipped home once his age is revealed and must readjust to civilian life, in Louis Solomon and Harold Buchman's play.

title: No Way Out
description: A doctor married his mistress after being just inattentive enough to her dying husband, and he now wants to avoid prescribing his rich stepdaughter a remedy for her Addison's Disease in hopes of using her money to pay off his bad investments.

title: Embezzled Heaven
description: A humble woman has served as cook to a countess for 30 years, sending money to her nephew in the hope that he will join the priesthood, only to find that he has run away to join a carnival.

title: Harvey
description: A harmless, alcoholic middle-aged man drives his sister crazy by insisting that his friendship with an invisible white rabbit is real, in Mary Chase's comic fantasy.

title: Sleep My Pretty One
description: A wealthy woman is confined to her home since having a stroke following her husband's death on the Titanic. She keeps her son from marrying and leaving her, until his latest fiancée outwits her.

title: Robin Hood
description: The story of the English outlaw Robin Hood and his band of Merry Men, who steal from the rich to give to the poor during the time of King Richard the Lionhearted, becomes an operetta by Reginald De Koven and Harry B. Smith.

title: Manon Lescaut
description: A wealthy student risks everything for the love of a general's mistress who loves him but cannot give up her taste for luxury, in Giacomo Puccini's opera, adapted from Marcel Prevost's novel.

title: La Bohème
description: A group of bohemian artists struggle to survive the cold Paris winter, as romance between poet Rodolfo and seamstress Mimi heads for tragedy and painter Marcello's affair with unfaithful singer Musetta provides comedy in the landmark Giacomo Puccini opera.

title: Cavalleria Rusticana
description: An Italian villager carries on affairs with two women who are nearly destroyed by their love and jealousy, in Pietro Mascagni's one-act opera.

title: Pagliacci
description: An actor in a commedia dell'arte troupe is driven insane when he suspects his wife of infidelity in Ruggiero Leoncavallo's opera.

title: In Bed We Cry
description: The love life of an ambitious cosmetician is the subject of Ilka Chase's adaptation of her novel.

title: The Gypsy Baron
description: In the Temesvar Province, a landowner returned from exile marries a gypsy girl who is revealed to be the daughter of a Turkish Pasha and the rightful owner of a hidden treasure, in Johann Strauss' opera.

title: La Tosca
description: An opera singer loves a painter who sympathizes with her brother, a leader of the Italian resistance against Napoleon's coming invasion. When a sadistic chief of police arrests the painter, the singer is prepared to sleep with him to gain her beloved's freedom, in Giacomo Puccini's opera.

title: Sadie Thompson
description: A defiant Pago Pago prostitute resists the efforts of a parson to reform her, ultimately exposing his hypocrisy, in Arthur Schwartz, Howard Dietz and Rouben Mamoulian's musical adaptation of the Somerset Maugham story and play Rain.

title: The Streets Are Guarded
description: A pharmacist recovering from war wounds remembers how he and fellow Americans and Allies were stranded on a Pacific island when a mysterious stranger helped them to their rescue and then disappeared.

title: Rhapsody
description: A wily lady at Francis I's Austrian court brings in Casanova to cause trouble, leading Queen Maria Theresa to straighten things out.

title: The Man Who Had All the Luck
description: A young Midwesterner is blessed with continuing good fortune as all around him suffer life's disappointments in this meditation on the burden of luck, the first play by Arthur Miller.

title: The Late George Apley
description: A snobbish graduate of Harvard and resident of Boston cannot stand to see his son court a girl from Worcester and his daughter date a Yale student.

title: Hand in Glove
description: A sadistic killer in Yorkshire, England, uses a mentally disabled man to avoid the police.

title: A Bell for Adano
description: Paul Osborn's adaptation of John Hersey's story focuses on the occupation of a small Italian town by American forces during World War II.

title: Seven Lively Arts
description: Beatrice Lillie, Bert Lahr, Benny Goodman and Dolores Gray headline this revue of Cole Porter songs, dances, and sketches by George S. Kaufman, Moss Hart and others.

title: Spook Scandals
description: Michael Todd produces this revue of songs, dances, and showgirls.

title: Dark Hammock
description: A Florida woman marries an older man whom she plans to slowly poison for his money, but two women who visit her unexpectedly decide to stay longer when they realize what is going on.

title: Little Women
description: Jo March and her sisters Meg, Beth, and Amy grow up, find themselves, and find love during and after the Civil War, in this adaptation of the classic Louisa May Alcott novel.

title: Dear Ruth
description: A teenage girl has a pen-pal romance with a soldier during World War II, signing her older sister's name to the letters and sending him a picture of the sister, who is forced to play along when the soldier shows up on a two-day leave eager to propose.

title: Laffing Room Only
description: Chic Johnson and Ole Olsen co-wrote and starred in this revue of slapstick, jokes, and songs by Burton Lane.

title: Sophie
description: A widowed Czech immigrant and her family become the focus of a dyed-in-the-wool American neighbor's prejudices.

title: Tropical Revue
description: Katherine Dunham and her dance company present an evening of Afro-Caribbean dance.

title: Sing Out, Sweet Land
description: Alfred Drake and Burl Ives head the cast of this musical revue of American folk songs from Puritan days to contemporary times.

title: On the Town
description: Three sailors on shore leave in New York City during World War II find romance and adventure while helping one of them track down the elusive Miss Turnstiles poster girl, in the first Broadway musical written by Leonard Bernstein, Betty Comden and Adolph Green.

title: Trio
description: A college professor keeps a young female protégé close to her, until a graduate student falls in love with her and threatens their relationship.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: The Hasty Heart
description: A Scottish soldier is wounded on the Burma front and brought to a makeshift hospital with an international group of fellow convalescents. While they are friendly, he distrusts them, even after they and a nurse reveal to him the seriousness of his condition.

title: Many Happy Returns
description: A 45-year-old man discovers that he will be a grandfather just as his son and daughter-in-law get in an argument over the son's female client. The client causes further trouble when the wife catches her kissing the father.

title: A Lady Says Yes
description: A Navy lieutenant hallucinates during nasal surgery, imagining himself back in Renaissance Venice, unable to marry his fiancée because of his nose and forced to prove his virility with the local floozy.

title: Good Night, Ladies
description: A professor who cannot stand the sight of exposed female flesh has his patience severely tested by the wild goings-on at a Turkish bath he is attending. This play was adapted from Avery Hopwood and Charlton Andrews' 1920 farce Ladies Night.

title: Rebecca
description: A British landowner's second marriage is threatened by his housekeeper's obsessive loyalty to his dead first wife, whom she believes he killed, in Daphne Du Maurier's adaptation of her novel.

title: A Goose for the Gander
description: A wife goes to a milk farm to rejuvenate herself, only to return to find her husband having an affair with a younger woman. She turns the tables on them by inviting the girl to stay at the house and asking several male friends over as guests.

title: The Tempest
description: The magician and former duke Prospero, who has been exiled on an island with his daughter Miranda for years, plots revenge on the brother who usurped his throne with the help of the magical island creatures in his thrall, in one of William Shakespeare's final plays.

title: Up in Central Park
description: A New York Times reporter investigates the crooked political machine of Boss Tweed, including the business fraud that surrounded the construction of Central Park, while falling for a daughter of one of the Boss's ward healers.

title: Alice in Arms
description: A WAC returns from overseas after World War II and confesses an affair with a corporal to her stuffy fiancé. The fiancé is prepared to forgive and forget until the corporal turns up in their small town.

title: The Overtons
description: A happily married woman misreads the situation when she sees a lovely young woman undressing in her husband's boathouse and decides to have an affair of her own, in Vincent Lawrence's comedy.

title: Hope for the Best
description: A popular newspaper columnist longs to report on politics rather than gossip, and he finds encouragement from a young war plant worker that he fails to get from his conservative fiancée.

title: One-man Show
description: A New York art gallery owner wants to keep his daughter close to him, quashing every possible romance until a young diplomat makes that impossible, in Augustus and Ruth Goetz's play.

title: The Stranger
description: The notorious Jack the Ripper is rumored to be a foreign man, and a shoemaker who fits the description falls under suspicion, in Leslie Reade's play.

title: Signature
description: A brutal murder in 1850s rural Virginia is pinned on a local hired hand and his girlfriend, but the judge who really committed it is haunted by guilt.

title: And Be My Love
description: A widowed female scientist and noted actor run off for two weeks, under assumed identities, to Connecticut, but when the scientist's daughter and prudish sister appear, they must pretend to be married.

title: Calico Wedding
description: A captain stationed at an Alaskan outpost during World War II recalls his neglected, jealous wife's decision to have a fling with an Antarctic explorer seven years earlier.

title: It's a Gift
description: A professor learns that the sister he disowned for having an illegitimate child has died and will leave money to him and his family of 12 children if the eldest female has her own illegitimate child.

title: Foolish Notion
description: A man, who joined the British army when his actress wife fell for her leading man and disappeared unexpectedly, returns five years later as his wife and her lover are prepared to wed.

title: Dark of the Moon
description: A witch's son falls for a human girl and begs to be allowed to turn mortal to court her. When he turns mortal and marries her, their baby is discovered to be a witch, leading to tragedy for the couple, in Howard Richardson and William Berney's folk play.

title: Happily Ever After
description: A parson who performs elaborate marriage ceremonies in Maryland is revealed to be a fake by intrusive reporters.

title: The Deep Mrs. Sykes
description: A woman becomes convinced that her husband is the person who delivered white lilacs to the newlywed singer who lives across the street, despite all evidence to the contrary, in George Kelly's play.

title: Kiss Them for Me
description: Three Navy men are given shore leave in San Francisco during World War II and want to use it for fun instead of making the morale-building speeches their office chaperone wishes.

title: The Firebrand of Florence
description: Sculptor Benvenuto Cellini has romantic, sexual, and political adventures after gaining a last-minute reprieve for a hanging crime in 1535 Florence.

title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
description: The romance of the English poets Elizabeth Barrett and Robert Browning, despite her mysterious illness and tyrannical father, is the subject of Rudolf Besier's play.

title: You Can't Take It With You
description: An eccentric family allows each member to pursue his own ambition in the home, but their routine is disrupted when a daughter with a regular job wants to bring her fiancé and his Wall Street family to dinner in George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy.

title: Lady in Danger
description: A Japanese-born mystery novelist is suspected of the murder of a Japanese sympathizer and his chauffeur in Australia during World War II, in Max Afford and Alexander Kirkland's thriller.

title: The Glass Menagerie
description: Tennessee Williams’s autobiographical “memory play” looks at the WIngfield family—frustrated writer Tom, his nagging mother, Amanda, who is often lost in memories of her Southern-belle past, and his painfully shy sister, Laura—and the effect a visit from a “gentleman caller” for Laura has on all their lives.

title: A Place of Our Own
description: A conservative businessman presents a small-town paper to his liberal son-in-law as a wedding gift but drives him to distraction by trying to influence the paper's editorials.

title: Star-Spangled Family
description: A war widow angers her dead husband's mother by remarrying, leading the elderly woman to attempt to poison her eight-year-old grandson's mind against his mother and stepfather.

title: Carousel
description: Brash carousel barker Billy Bigelow and Julie Jordan, a quiet girl who works in the mill, fall in love, marry, and have a stormy relationship that leads to tragedy and an attempt at mending old wounds from beyond the grave, in Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical adaptation of Ferenc Molnar's play, Liliom.

title: Common Ground
description: A USO troupe is brought to an abandoned Italian castle after being captured by the Nazis. The group's Jewish comedian is sent to a concentration camp and the others are given the choice of performing propaganda or dying.

title: Too Hot for Maneuvers
description: A discharged colonel takes over his family's military academy just as a scandal arises when several upperclassmen are seen coming from the home of a countess who performed a notorious dance at the World's Fair.

title: Carmen Jones
description: As the Second World War rages, parachute maker Carmen Jones wages her own quarrel involving an airman and a boxer. Using the score from Georges Bizet’s opera Carmen, this adaptation by Oscar Hammerstein II resets the story with an all African-American cast, and is the first major New York revival since its debut on Broadway 75 years ago.

title: Martha Graham
description: Martha Graham's dance company performs an evening of modern dance on Broadway.

title: Blue Holiday
description: Ethel Waters, Josh White and the Katherine Dunham Dancers headline this all-black musical revue, featuring musical interpolations by Duke Ellington.

title: Othello
description: Othello, a Moor who has become a general in the Venetian army, sees his happy marriage to the beautiful Desdemona destroyed when his seemingly trustworthy ensign, Iago, suggests to him that she may be unfaithful, in William Shakespeare's tragedy of revenge, jealousy and intrigue.

title: Foxhole in the Parlor
description: A promising pianist who interrupted his career to fight in World War II has been discharged after a breakdown following a friend's death. His friends, sister, and uncle clash over how he should be treated.

title: Memphis Bound!
description: A 19th-century group of black performers are marooned when their Memphis-bound ship hits a sandbar, so they put on a performance of H.M.S. Pinafore to raise money for the ship's release.

title: Round Trip
description: A New York actor directs an amateur production in Ohio while seducing the group's wealthy, married patroness in hopes that she will underwrite his new play.

title: Hollywood Pinafore
description: A Hollywood starlet is in love with a struggling writer but promised in marriage by her director father to the head of the studio, in George S. Kaufman's update of Gilbert and Sullivan's H.M.S. Pinafore.

title: Oh, Brother!
description: A burglar who needs money to compete in a chess tournament has one of his cohorts pose as the long-lost brother of an heiress who can only keep her fortune if her brother is not found.

title: The Wind Is Ninety
description: A World War II soldier whose plane is shot down returns to his parents and wife in invisible ghostly form to attempt to comfort them before they learn the news, with the help of the ghost of the Unknown Soldier.

title: As You Like It
description: Rosalind, banished from her father's kingdom by her usurping uncle, disguises herself as a boy while falling for one, the similarly exiled duke Orlando.

title: Marinka
description: This musical adds a happy ending to the events of the Mayerling incident, in which Crown Prince Rudolph of Austria and his lover Baroness Maria Vetsera were found dead in 1889, apparently after making a murder-suicide pact.

title: Mr. Strauss Goes to Boston
description: The composer Johann Strauss's visit to the World Peace Jubilee in Boston in 1872 is musicalized and fictionalized, with several Strauss waltzes included.

title: A Boy Who Lived Twice
description: A young man who was killed in a horse-riding accident is brought back to life by his mystical sister, but he appears to have switched souls with a lieutenant who died in a plane crash at the same moment.

title: Devils Galore
description: A womanizing publisher is struck dead while trying to seduce a young female author, but he is brought back to life by the devil's assistant to finish the seduction — until the assistant falls for the author.

title: Make Yourself at Home
description: A fading movie star takes over a Manhattan apartment to prepare for a Broadway play, but she finds that she has sublet the apartment to a Wall Street broker and his mistress and the play is a flop.

title: The Ryan Girl
description: A gangster who had been wanted for murder returns from Venezuela when the son he abandoned is given the Congressional Medal of Honor, forcing the boy's mother to defend her son's honor before it is tarnished by his father's presence.

title: You Touched Me
description: An eccentric former sea captain lives in England with his daughter and uptight sister, hoping his adopted son, who has returned from the Royal Air Force, will keep his daughter from turning out like her aunt.

title: Deep Are the Roots
description: A black G.I. returns to the Southern plantation he grew up on expecting a warm welcome, only to find himself denied a scholarship and run out of town on a trumped-up charge of stealing.

title: Carib Song
description: A married Caribbean woman cheats on her husband with a married fisherman, whose jealous wife reveals the affair to the woman's husband, in Baldwin Bergersen and William Archibald's musical.

title: La Tosca
description: An opera singer loves a painter who sympathizes with her brother, a leader of the Italian resistance against Napoleon's coming invasion. When a sadistic chief of police arrests the painter, the singer is prepared to sleep with him to gain her beloved's freedom, in Giacomo Puccini's opera.

title: Cavalleria Rusticana
description: An Italian villager carries on affairs with two women who are nearly destroyed by their love and jealousy, in Pietro Mascagni's one-act opera.

title: Pagliacci
description: An actor in a commedia dell'arte troupe is driven insane when he suspects his wife of infidelity in Ruggiero Leoncavallo's opera.

title: Live Life Again
description: A Midwestern farm boy is so grief-stricken over his mother's death that he suspects she was murdered and goes after his father, who has remarried a Swedish serving girl, in Dan Tetheroh's blank-verse update of the Hamlet story.

title: La Bohème
description: A group of bohemian artists struggle to survive the cold Paris winter, as romance between poet Rodolfo and seamstress Mimi heads for tragedy and painter Marcello's affair with unfaithful singer Musetta provides comedy in the landmark Giacomo Puccini opera.

title: Carmen
description: The soldier Don Jose is destroyed by his love for the beautiful Gypsy temptress Carmen, in Georges Bizet's opera.

title: Polonaise
description: Tadeusz Kosciuszko, the Polish man who volunteered to fight in the American Revolution, is the subject of this musical, featuring the music of Frederic Chopin with contemporary lyrics by John La Touche.

title: The Gypsy Baron
description: In the Temesvar Province, a landowner returned from exile marries a gypsy girl who is revealed to be the daughter of a Turkish Pasha and the rightful owner of a hidden treasure, in Johann Strauss' opera.

title: Therese
description: Thomas Job adapts Emile Zola's novel Therese Raquin, in which an unhappily married woman and her lover conspire to murder her husband but are haunted by guilt.

title: The Red Mill
description: A pair of American tourists who are stuck without money in a Dutch town must work at a local inn to pay off their hotel bill, ultimately playing matchmaker for the innkeeper's daughter, in Victor Herbert, Henry Blossom and Forman Brown's operetta.

title: The Assassin
description: The assassination of French Navy Admiral Jean Louis Darlan by members of the French Resistance in 1942 is the subject of Irwin Shaw's play.

title: Beggars Are Coming to Town
description: A Prohibition racketeer gets out of prison 14 years later to find his partner, who avoided jail, has used his money to operate a swanky nightclub by himself.

title: The Next Half Hour
description: An Irish woman gifted with second sight senses that her son will die while having an affair with a married woman, but her efforts to prevent nature's course lead to tragedy, in Mary Chase's play.

title: The Secret Room
description: A refugee whose baby was abducted by the Nazis becomes a governess to three American children, whom she tries to make into the replacements for her own child, with dangerous results.

title: The Girl from Nantucket
description: A housepainter is selected by mistake to paint a mural at a museum, resulting in various comic complications.

title: The Rich Full Life
description: A high school senior tries to defy her frail constitution to go to her prom with the most popular boy in school.

title: Are You with It?
description: A mild-mannered insurance man is fired from his job but persuaded to join the circus.

title: The Rugged Path
description: A newspaper editor becomes a liberal activist after spending time in England as they enter World War II. He clashes with his brother-in-law, who now owns his paper, and the paper's conservative business manager and ultimately goes off to fight in the Pacific.

title: Skydrift
description: A group of paratroopers who were killed in a plane crash make ghostly returns to their surviving loved ones, despite their sergeant's objections.

title: State of the Union
description: An idealistic millionaire is selected to run for president, despite the fact that he is estranged from his sharp-tongued wife and involved with another woman, in Howard Lindsay and Russel Crouse's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy.

title: A Sound of Hunting
description: A group of eight soldiers stationed in Cassino during World War II are ready to be shipped back to America but band together to search when one of their own goes missing.

title: Marriage Is for Single People
description: A naïve girl from the California vineyards falls for a caddish playwright-turned-naval-officer and goes with him to meet his rich New York family, ultimately ending up with his nicer brother.

title: The Day Before Spring
description: A married couple returns to their college for a reunion, and the wife tries to run away with an old sweetheart as she did 10 years earlier, in Lerner and Loewe's musical.

title: The Mermaids Singing
description: A young woman and her fiancé meet a playwright at the out-of-town tryout of his latest infidelity comedy, leading the woman to fall for the married playwright and confess her love when her husband leaves.

title: Strange Fruit
description: The son of a Southern white doctor has an affair with a black girl but deserts her and marries her off to a houseboy after getting her pregnant, with tragic results, in Lillian and Esther Smith's adaptation of Lillian Smith's novel.

title: The French Touch
description: During the Nazi occupation of France in World War II, a down-and-out French actor and his third wife are asked by his first wife and her Nazi-officer boyfriend to write a piece of Nazi propaganda, which the actor hopes to change at the last minute despite dangerous warning signs.

title: Brighten the Corner
description: A rich inventor drops in on his newly married nephew just after the nephew's wife storms out following an argument and their neighbor's wife has come in to use their shower, leading to various comic complications.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Oedipus Rex
description: The people of Thebes ask their king, Oedipus, for help in saving their kingdom from plague, leading Oedipus to discover a shocking secret from his past, in Sophocles' Greek tragedy.

title: Billion Dollar Baby
description: A young woman schemes to get rich in 1920s New York, in Morton Gould, Betty Comden and Adolph Green's musical.

title: Little Women
description: Jo March and her sisters Meg, Beth, and Amy grow up, find themselves, and find love during and after the Civil War, in this adaptation of the classic Louisa May Alcott novel.

title: Pygmalion
description: In George Bernard Shaw's play, based on a classical myth, a blustering phonetics professor bets that he can turn a Cockney flower girl into a passable society lady in three months.

title: Dunnigan's Daughter
description: A tycoon plans to avert irrigation water in the Mexican countryside away from the farmers' land toward his own expanding mine operation, but his efforts are thwarted when an idealistic government worker inspires the farmers to action, in S.N. Behrman's play.

title: Home of the Brave
description: A Jewish G.I. is psychologically paralyzed after an attempt to map out an island full of Japanese soldiers for invasion with a group of other soldiers, one of whom is anti-Semitic, in Arthur Laurents' play.

title: Show Boat
description: Jerome Kern and Oscar Hammerstein II's groundbreaking musical version of Edna Ferber's novel examines the lives of Cap'n Andy and his troupe of traveling show boat performers, including his naïve daughter Magnolia, her gambling husband Gaylord Ravenal, the tragic mixed-race actress Julie, and black stevedore Joe, who marvels at the constancy of the "Ol' Man River" they travel on.

title: A Joy Forever
description: An artist, who retreated from public life after a racy painting caused problems for its model, turns up 30 years later living in anonymity with his model-mistress, and he becomes the subject of another publicity storm.

title: The Desert Song
description: Pierre, the seemingly mild-mannered son of a French general, masquerades as the "Red Shadow," the leader of a group of Arab bandits in the Middle East, in order to have adventures and seduce his beloved Margot.

title: The Would-be Gentleman
description: A self-made, wealthy merchant is determined to be a proper gentleman, in Moliere's 1670 comedy.

title: The Winter's Tale
description: A jealous king irrationally believes that his wife and best friend are having an affair, leading to tragedy that is not righted until his abandoned daughter returns 16 years later, in William Shakespeare's romance.

title: Nellie Bly
description: This James Van Heusen, Johnny Burke, Jack Emmanuel, and Joseph Quillan musical depicts Nellie Bly, the female journalist who was the first reporter to travel the around the world in 1889.

title: Martha Graham
description: Martha Graham's dance company performs an evening of modern dance on Broadway.

title: The Magnificent Yankee
description: Emmet Lavery's play is based on the life of Supreme Court Justice Oliver Wendell Holmes.

title: O Mistress Mine
description: A liberal young Englishman, who evacuated to Canada for five years during World War I, returns to find his mother living with a conservative politician and businessman who espouses all the values he despises, in Terence Rattigan's play.

title: The Mayor of Zalemea
