description: Spanish soldiers march into Portugal to enforce Philip II's annexation, which eventually leads to a peasant's election to mayor, in Calderon's dramatization of historical events. A reading of Pedro Calderón de la Barca's The Mayor of Zalamea, as translated by Edward Fitzgerald.

title: Born Yesterday
description: A millionaire junk dealer with designs on Washington politics hires a sophisticated writer to educate his dumb-blonde girlfriend, Billie Dawn, who ends up falling for the writer and turning the tables on her boyfriend's shady business deals.

title: January Thaw
description: A liberal New York couple purchases and renovates a Connecticut farmhouse but are unexpectedly visited by the arch-conservative couple who previously owned and abandoned the place but are allowed, through a loophole clause, to continue to stay in the house if they so wish.

title: Apple of His Eye
description: A widowed Indiana farmer hires a younger woman to keep house for him and falls in love with her, to the chagrin of his daughter-in-law and neighbor.

title: Lute Song
description: A young Chinese student abandons his wife and parents to make his fortune, becoming a noted magistrate and marrying a princess whose father forbids him to contact his former family, in this musical adaptation of the 14th-century Chinese play Pi-Pa-Ki.

title: The Duchess Misbehaves
description: Frank Black and Gladys Shelley's musical depicts the romance between Spanish painter Francisco de Goya and the Duchess of Alba, told within a contemporary framework.

title: Antigone
description: Oedipus' daughter defies her uncle in insisting on a proper burial for her brothers, whom he killed in order to take the throne, in Sophocles' tragedy.

title: Jeb
description: A black soldier returns to his Southern town after World War II to find it rife with the prejudice he expected to be gone, forcing him to face down the Ku Klux Klan in order to marry his sweetheart and forge a life for himself, in Robert Ardrey's play.

title: Truckline Cafe
description: Two married couples in a California highway diner cope with the changes in their relationships caused by World War II, in Maxwell Anderson's play.

title: Little Brown Jug
description: An eccentric handyman happens to see a woman accidentally slap her son-in-law, causing him to fall out the window to his death. This leads the handyman to decide to blackmail the woman and her daughter, in Marie Baumer's thriller.

title: Three to Make Ready
description: Morgan Lewis and Nancy Hamilton wrote the songs and sketches for this musical revue, which followed One for the Money and Two for the Show.

title: Flamingo Road
description: A Southern politician hounds a beleaguered carnival dancer for years until their climatic showdown, in Robert Wilder and Sally Wilder's adaptation of Robert Wilder's novel.

title: He Who Gets Slapped
description: A brilliant scientist, whose wife cheats on him with his best friend, runs away to join the circus, where he falls for a young rider whose father is desperate to match her up with a rich baron.

title: I Like It Here
description: A European handyman inspires a henpecked professor to assert his authority in his home and matches the professor's daughter up with a better mate than her stuffy fiancé.

title: The Song of Bernadette
description: Walter and Jean Kerr adapt Franz Werfel's novel about Bernadette Soubirous, who was canonized by the Catholic Church after seeing a vision of the Virgin Mary in Lourdes, France.

title: Walk Hard
description: A young boxer is so angry and desperate to rise above his circumstances that he almost ruins his chances.

title: St. Louis Woman
description: A successful black jockey falls for the girlfriend of an abusive bar owner in early 20th century St. Louis.

title: Candida
description: A minister's wife becomes an object of infatuation for an idealistic young poet, in George Bernard Shaw's comedic look at the changing views on gender and social equality.

title: Carmen Jones
description: As the Second World War rages, parachute maker Carmen Jones wages her own quarrel involving an airman and a boxer. Using the score from Georges Bizet’s opera Carmen, this adaptation by Oscar Hammerstein II resets the story with an all African-American cast, and is the first major New York revival since its debut on Broadway 75 years ago.

title: Woman Bites Dog
description: A competitive, conservative family of newspaper publishers is taken advantage of by a returning veteran and former small-town newspaper editor, who pretends that his town has been taken over by Communists and gets the family's reporter to play along.

title: Call Me Mister
description: Former World War II soldiers and U.S.O. entertainers make up the cast of this musical revue, featuring songs and sketches that comment on readjusting to civilian life.

title: This, Too, Shall Pass
description: A Midwestern family welcomes their son home from fighting in the Pacific, along with a Jewish fellow soldier who wants to marry his friend's sister, despite their mother's prejudiced objections.

title: Madame Butterfly
description: In Giacomo Puccini's opera, U.S. naval officer marries a young Japanese girl but abandons her shortly thereafter. The girl bears his son and waits for his return, with tragic results.

title: Carmen
description: The soldier Don Jose is destroyed by his love for the beautiful Gypsy temptress Carmen, in Georges Bizet's opera.

title: Il Trovatore
description: A troubadour and a count compete for the love of a princess's lady-in-waiting, in Giuseppe Verdi's opera.

title: Rigoletto
description: A jester mocks the courtiers who are fooled by a philandering duke, only to realize that the duke is in pursuit of his own daughter, in Giuseppe Verdi's opera.

title: La Bohème
description: A group of bohemian artists struggle to survive the cold Paris winter, as romance between poet Rodolfo and seamstress Mimi heads for tragedy and painter Marcello's affair with unfaithful singer Musetta provides comedy in the landmark Giacomo Puccini opera.

title: King Henry IV, Part I
description: Henry IV's son, Prince Hal, must put aside his preference for drunken carousing with Sir John Falstaff and other lowlifes when his father's throne is threatened by the rebel Hotspur.

title: La Tosca
description: An opera singer loves a painter who sympathizes with her brother, a leader of the Italian resistance against Napoleon's coming invasion. When a sadistic chief of police arrests the painter, the singer is prepared to sleep with him to gain her beloved's freedom, in Giacomo Puccini's opera.

title: King Henry IV, Part II
description: Having defeated Hotspur, Prince Hal becomes King Henry V upon the death of his father, but in order to become a proper king, he must now reject Sir John Falstaff, the drunk and petty criminal with whom he had kept company in younger days.

title: The Barber of Seville
description: A count pursues a well-born young lady with the help of his former servant, now a barber, who can sneak the count into the girl's home past her controlling guardian, who wants her for himself.

title: On Whitman Avenue
description: A black family meets strong opposition, and only limited support, when they move into a white neighborhood, in Maxine Wood's play.

title: Cavalleria Rusticana
description: An Italian villager carries on affairs with two women who are nearly destroyed by their love and jealousy, in Pietro Mascagni's one-act opera.

title: Pagliacci
description: An actor in a commedia dell'arte troupe is driven insane when he suspects his wife of infidelity in Ruggiero Leoncavallo's opera.

title: Rigoletto
description: A jester mocks the courtiers who are fooled by a philandering duke, only to realize that the duke is in pursuit of his own daughter, in Giuseppe Verdi's opera.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: Uncle Vanya
description: Longtime academic Vanya comes to question his devotion to an aging professor, whose wife Vanya loves even as she is drawn to the enigmatic doctor Astrov, in Anton Chekhov's 1897 play.

title: Swan Song
description: An aspiring pianist who was committed to a mental institution after his sister, a more talented pianist, mysteriously died, is released from the hospital and begs his sister's professor to help him resume his career.

title: Madame Butterfly
description: In Giacomo Puccini's opera, U.S. naval officer marries a young Japanese girl but abandons her shortly thereafter. The girl bears his son and waits for his return, with tragic results.

title: Annie Get Your Gun
description: Sharp-shooting country girl Annie Oakley is such a natural with a gun that she ultimately becomes the star of Buffalo Bill's Wild West show — to the consternation of the man she loves but can out-shoot, Frank Butler.

title: The Critic
description: A critic is besieged with requests for support from various playwrights before watching a laughably bad play by an acquaintance, in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1779 comedy.

title: Oedipus Rex
description: The people of Thebes ask their king, Oedipus, for help in saving their kingdom from plague, leading Oedipus to discover a shocking secret from his past, in Sophocles' Greek tragedy.

title: Around the World
description: The English gentleman Phileas Fogg decides to travel the world in 80 days but is pursued by the dogged Inspector Fix, who believes he is using the money for his trip to plan a bank robbery, in the Cole Porter-Orson Welles musical adaptation of Jules Verne's novel Around the World in 80 Days.

title: Second Best Bed
description: The first years of William Shakespeare and Anne Hathaway's marriage are the subject of N. Richard Nash's play.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: The Dancer
description: A great ballet dancer has been kept in seclusion by his producer for years due to mental illness and criminal suspicion, but his family's intrusion and the producer's increasing paranoia lead him to take a stand, with tragic results.

title: Icetime
description: Sonja Henie co-produces this musical ice-skating revue.

title: Tidbits of 1946
description: The comic Joey Faye and the Latin American song-and-dance team Carmen and Rolando headline this musical revue of songs and sketches.

title: Maid in the Ozarks
description: Two youngsters from the Ozarks attempt to find romance against the hardscrabble background of their upbringing.

title: The Front Page
description: A managing editor of a Chicago newspaper fights to keep his star reporter on the story of a condemned anarchist's jailbreak, when the reporter is ready to quit and get married.

title: A Flag Is Born
description: Two aging survivors of the Holocaust journey to Palestine, encountering the spirits of Biblical heroes and a younger survivor who becomes inspired to join the Zionist cause.

title: Yours Is My Heart
description: A Chinese prince has a doomed romance with a Parisian opera singer, in this adaptation of Franz Lehar's operetta The Land of Smiles.

title: Gypsy Lady
description: A gypsy woman deals with her Romany lover and scoundrel father, in Robert Wright, George Forrest and Harry B. Smith's musical update of two Victor Herbert operettas, The Fortune Teller and The Serenade.

title: Hidden Horizon
description: Two murders occur on a pleasure cruise on the Nile, in Agatha Christie's play.

title: The Bees and the Flowers
description: A woman does not tell her three daughters she has married again and brings her new husband to the home as a supposed guest, leading the oldest daughter to pursue him and the younger two to keep hope that she will reunite with their father.

title: Ballet Theatre
description:
Ballet Theatre, the forerunner to the American Ballet Theatre dance company, performs an evening of four dances, including Interplay, choreographed by Jerome Robbins; Pillar of Fire, choreographed by Anthony Tudor; "Pas de Deux" from Swan Lake, choreographed by Anton Dolin; and Fancy Free, choreographed by Jerome Robbins.
In Interplay, a group of dancers perform dance games incorporating classical and jazz elements.
Fancy Free, a ballet that depicts the adventures of sailors on leave with girls in a bar, was the inspiration for the musical On the Town.

title: Obsession
description: A newly married man is driven insane by his wife's close relationship to her guardian, in Jamie Hinton's adaptation of Louis Verneuil's French play, previously seen on Broadway adapted by A.H. Woods under the title Jealousy.

title: Hear That Trumpet
description: Orin Jannings' play depicts the racial tensions involved in integrating jazz bands.

title: Cyrano de Bergerac
description: Cyrano is a poet, philosopher and swordsman of incredible wit, but his sizable nose renders him too shy to pursue the beautiful Roxane. Instead, he provides the poetry and eloquence to woo her vicariously through his inarticulate friend Christian.

title: The Iceman Cometh
description: Set in the summer of 1912 at Harry Hope's saloon on New York's lower west side, this is O'Neill's classic story of a freespending, boisterous salesman who compels his fellow barflies to confront their pipe dreams.

title: The Constant Wife
description: W. Somerset Maugham's 1926 comedy of marital manners focuses on a cuckolded Constance Middleton, who pretends not to know her doctor husband is playing doctor with her best friend — until that friend's jealous husband confronts her.

title: Mr. Peebles and Mr. Hooker
description: The humble Mr. Peebles and the wicked Mr. Hooker vie over control of events surrounding a brother, his pious grandson, a rich woman who wants to seduce the grandson, and her husband, who dominates union meetings.

title: Ariadne Auf Naxos
description: A burlesque troupe and a "serious" opera company are forced to perform simultaneously for the richest man in Vienna, with the burlesque girls offering comic relief in the story of Ariadne, abandoned by Theseus on the island of Naxos but soon the object of the god Bacchus's love, in Richard Strauss's opera.

title: Lady Windermere's Fan
description: An English woman suspects her husband of infidelity and takes a lover herself in retaliation, in Oscar Wilde's play.

title: The Duchess of Malfi
description: A Duchess secretly marries beneath her station, leading her brothers to take revenge with tragic consequences.

title: Loco
description: A successful, married businessman takes a young model to his hunting lodge, where she comes down with the measles but talks him into returning to his wife and forgiving his pregnant daughter, in Dale Eunson and Katherine Albert's comedy that partly inspired the film How to Marry a Millionaire.

title: Lysistrata
description: A Greek woman persuades her fellow female citizens to withhold sex from their husbands so that they may peacefully end the Peloponnesian War, in Aristophanes' comic look at the eternal battle of the sexes.

title: Naughty Naught '00
description: A Yale student tries to undermine a champion rower by plying him with spiked drinks and getting a vamp to flirt with him in front of his beloved, in this musical homage to innocent college fun in the early 20th century.

title: Made in Heaven
description: A long-married couple comes to the verge of a breakup after an argument at a cocktail party, after which they find themselves the recipients of attentions from two other guests at the party.

title: The Playboy of the Western World
description: A mysterious man stumbles into an Irish pub, claiming he is fleeing his farm after killing his father. The locals, including a barmaid who is attracted to the man, are more interested in enjoying the man's story than in condemning him, in John Millington Synge's play.

title: Present Laughter
description: Noel Coward's totally-irresistible and semi-autobiographical comedy follows a self-obsessed actor in the midst of a mid-life crisis. Freely indulging his considerable appetite for wine, women and sleeping late, the theatre’s favorite leading man suddenly finds himself caught between fawning ingénues, crazed playwrights, secret trysts and unexpected twists.

title: Happy Birthday
description: In Anita Loos' play, a spinsterish librarian follows the man of her dreams into a bar and takes a drink for the first time, discovering the joy in fun.

title: Park Avenue
description: The multiple marriages and divorces of the Park Avenue set cause a young couple to rethink their own wedding plans in musical adaptation of Nunnally Johnson's short story "Holy Matrimony."

title: King Henry VIII
description: King Henry VIII of England's decision to divorce Katharine of Aragon and marry Anne Boleyn, in defiance of the Roman Catholic Church, is supported by Cardinal Wolsey, who later regrets his decision, in William Shakespeare's play.

title: Bal Negre
description: Katherine Dunham's dance company performs an evening of Afro-Caribbean and African-American dances.

title: John Gabriel Borkman
description: A banker who was imprisoned for embezzling money from clients returns to find his wife and sister-in-law warring over his affections and those of his son, in Henrik Ibsen's 1896 play.

title: The Haven
description: A man makes a mail-order marriage with a young spinster while planning to murder her for her money, but when he is forced to commit another murder first, circumstances work against him.

title: Joan of Lorraine
description: An actress preparing to play Joan of Arc disagrees with her director and fellow actors over how the role should be played, in Maxwell Anderson's play.

title: The Fatal Weakness
description: A woman is so fascinated by her husband's affair with another woman that she is unable to break it up in George Kelly's comedy.

title: Another Part of the Forest
description: Lillian Hellman's prequel to her play The Little Foxes depicts the Hubbard family, whose patriarch got his money from exploiting fellow Southerners during the Civil War and wants to keep his clever daughter Regina at home when she would rather go to Chicago.

title: No Exit
description: A man and three women, each of whom died with the weight of various sins, are put in a waiting room and interrogate each other about why they are there, ultimately realizing that this situation will be their hell, in Jean-Paul Sartre's existentialist play.

title: A Family Affair
description: A middle-aged married couple are shocked when their son writes a play portraying their marriage as lacking romance, leading both to have flings with other people to bring spice back into their lives.

title: Christopher Blake
description: A young boy retreats into fantasy to avoid facing the reality of choosing which of his divorcing parents he will live with.

title: Years Ago
description: A young Boston woman is determined to become an actress despite her parents' objections, in Ruth Gordon's autobiographical play.

title: If the Shoe Fits
description: Sonja Henie co-produces the return engagement of the musical ice-skating revue Icetime.

title: Ruth Mata, Eugene Hari
description: The comic dance team of Ruth Mata and Eugene Hari perform in concert on Broadway.

title: Land's End
description: A Cornish man falls in love with an upwardly mobile, working-class girl, to the consternation of his more traditional fiancée. Tragic consequences, with an overlay of mysticism and mystery, form the crux of Thomas Job's adaptation of Mary Ellen Chase's novel Lyonesse.

title: A Pound on Demand / Androcles and the Lion
description:
An evening of two one-act plays, Sean O'Casey's A Pound on Demand and George Bernard Shaw's Androcles and the Lion.
A Pound on Demand is a comedy in which a drunk and his sober sidekick must settle the matter of his account in a Dublin post office.
In Androcles and the Lion, a Christian slave in ancient Rome is thrown to the lions but saved by the lion's mercy.

title: Lovely Me
description: An aging movie star is desperate for a rich husband and, with her daughter's help, hopes to marry an apparently wealthy man in her apartment building, but she is hounded by her two ex-husbands in the process.

title: Wonderful Journey
description: A young prizefighter who is taken to heaven 50 years before his time is sent to spend the rest of that time on Earth in the body of a millionaire, in Harry Segall's adaptation of the 1941 film Here Comes Mr. Jordan.

title: Burlesque
description: A married couple is doing well performing in burlesque until the male comic gets a lead in a Broadway show and begins to neglect his loving but increasingly impatient wife.

title: Toplitzky of Notre Dame
description: An angel in disguise is sent to play for the Notre Dame football team but is nearly taken back to heaven when he falls for a female student.

title: Beggar's Holiday
description: The raffish denizens of the New York underworld, both black and white, are the subject of Duke Ellington and John La Touche's musical update of John Gay's The Beggar's Opera.

title: Temper the Wind
description: An American lieutenant colonel occupying Bavaria after World War II refuses to let a factory reopen when he realizes its executives still have Nazi sympathies.

title: Love Goes to Press
description: Two female war correspondents have romantic troubles overseas while covering World War II, in this comedy written by Martha Gellhorn and Virginia Cowles, two real-life war correspondents.

title: Jose Limon
description: Modern dancer and choreographer Jose Limon performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Bloomer Girl
description: The daughter of an upstate New York hoop skirt manufacturer falls for a Southern slave owner, despite being influenced by the feminist, anti-slavery politics (and revolutionary undergarments) of her aunt, Dolly Bloomer.

title: The Big Two
description: An American reporter and a Soviet officer meet in Russian-occupied Austria, where the reporter is looking for an American who gave pro-Nazi radio broadcasts, and they fall in love despite conflicting ideologies.

title: Street Scene
description: This operatic adaptation of Elmer Rice's Pulitzer Prize-winning play follows the inhabitants of a tenement building in New York, including a wife and mother whose extramarital affair ends tragically and a daughter who is torn between a studious neighbor and a smooth-operator boss.

title: Finian's Rainbow
description: A blend of romantic fantasy and social commentary, Finian's Rainbow follows the adventures of an Irishman and his daughter, who hope to strike it rich in America using a pot of gold stolen from a leprechaun.

title: Little A
description: A mild-mannered man finds his way, in Hugh White's play.

title: Sweethearts
description: A princess is hidden as a baby while her kingdom is at war and raised by a laundress without knowing her true identity, leading to various political and romantic complications when she comes of age.

title: All My Sons
description: In the years following World War II, the Keller family continues to hope for their MIA son Larry to turn up alive. Amidst accusations of war crimes and the impending reality that Larry will never return, the Kellers confront a host of family secrets.

title: It Takes Two
description: A married couple reaches an impasse when the husband wants to move away and be an engineer, leading to a series of real estate deals that lead each to believe the other is unfaithful.

title: John Loves Mary
description: An ex-G.I. marries an English girl in order to bring her over to America for the fellow soldier she really loves, hoping to get a quick divorce so they can marry and he can marry the girl of his dreams, in Norman Krasna's comedy.

title: The Story of Mary Surratt
description: John Patrick's play depicts Mary Surratt, who ran the boardinghouse where the conspirators involved in Abraham Lincoln's assassination met and was convicted and sentenced to hang when there was little evidence to prove her innocence.

title: Craig's Wife
description: A materialistic woman's marriage crumbles because of her obsession with preserving her possessions, in George Kelly's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: King Lear
description:
In William Shakespeare's royal-family tragedy, the aging King Lear divides his estate between
his three daughters, ultimately refusing his youngest and favorite her share because she won't
publicly admit her love for him. The decision leads to chaos and treachery within the kingdom and madness for its monarch.

title: As You Like It
description: Rosalind, banished from her father's kingdom by her usurping uncle, disguises herself as a boy while falling for one, the similarly exiled duke Orlando.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: O'Daniel
description: An opportunistic man rises through the ranks of military jobs during World War II, eventually winning the presidency a few years into the future by rousing discontented war veterans to, it is implied, be ready to take over the country.

title: Volpone
description: A Venetian gentleman pretends to be dying in order to dupe the friends who hope to be heirs to his great fortune, in Ben Jonson's satire of greed.

title: Martha Graham
description: Martha Graham's dance company performs an evening of modern dance on Broadway.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: The Importance of Being Earnest
description: Two wealthy London bachelors each pretend to be a fictitious man called Earnest in order to win over two eligible young ladies, despite the ladies' avowed preference for that name alone — and the interference of the intimidatingly proper Lady Bracknell — in Oscar Wilde's "trivial comedy for serious people."

title: Parlor Story
description: A newspaper editor quits his job to become a journalism professor, and his former publisher uses an editorial written by the professor's prospective son-in-law to stop the professor from becoming the university's president.

title: The Mystery of Theodosia Burr
description: Jeanne Welty wrote, directed and starred in this one-woman play about Theodosia Burr, the daughter of controversial Vice President Aaron Burr, who mysteriously disappeared shortly after her father was tried for treason and lived in exile in Europe.

title: Maurice Chevalier
description: Maurice Chevalier headlines this evening of songs and sketches.

title: The Chocolate Soldier
description: During the Serbio-Bulgarian War of 1885, a Bulgarian woman who is engaged to a war hero encounters a Serbian captain who is retreating from the war because he despises it. He teaches her to see beyond the romantic ideals of war in this operetta, adapted from George Bernard Shaw's Arms and the Man.

title: Brigadoon
description: Two Americans game-hunting in Scotland happen upon a mysterious village in which the people dress and speak as if from another era. One of the Americans is drawn to one of the Scottish lasses and must choose between the magical Brigadoon and his conventional fiancée back in New York.

title: The Eagle Has Two Heads
description: The queen of a mythical country falls in love with a man who once attempted to kill her leading to a tragic fate for both, in Ronald Duncan's adaptation of Jean Cocteau's play.

title: Bathsheba
description: Jacques Deval dramatizes the Biblical story of King David's lust for the beautiful, married Bathsheba, which leads him to sleep with her and send her kindhearted husband to be killed in battle.

title: The Whole World Over
description: An aging Russian architect's former tenant, a colonel, moves back in with him after the war, allowing the architect's daughter to escape her loveless engagement to marry him.

title: The Great Campaign
description: A farmer runs for president because of his objection to the phony politician he ends up running against, but his son sabotages his campaign by turning his big speech over to his opponents.

title: Tenting Tonight
description: A group of former GIs have trouble getting safely enrolled in college because they can't find a satisfactory place to live.

title: Barefoot Boy with Cheek
description: Sidney Lippman, Sylvia Dee and Max Shulman's musical depicts the campus politics of the University of Minnesota students.

title: Alice in Wonderland
description: Eva Le Gallienne's production, from a script she co-adapted, contains elements of Lewis Carroll's novel Alice in Wonderland, in which a young English girl travels down the rabbit hole into a magical dreamland, as well as the book's sequel, Through the Looking Glass.

title: Andrea Chenier
description: Umberto Giordano's opera is loosely based on the life of Andrea Chenier, the French poet and political activist who was executed during the French Revolution.

title: Virginia Reel
description: A young woman who ran away from home eight years earlier returns to seek a position in the family store, which her sister now runs.

title: Message for Margaret
description: A book publisher dies in an accident with the last words "Tell Margaret I love her."  But did he mean his wife or his mistress, a writer working under a nom de plume?

title: The Flies
description: The Electra myth, in which the Argan princess Electra and her brother Orestes avenge the murder of their father by killing his murderers — their mother and her new husband — is given an existentialist slant by Jean-Paul Sartre.

title: Barbara
description: The comic dancer Trudi Schoop and her company perform their latest piece.

title: Carmen
description: The soldier Don Jose is destroyed by his love for the beautiful Gypsy temptress Carmen, in Georges Bizet's opera.

title: Madame Butterfly
description: In Giacomo Puccini's opera, U.S. naval officer marries a young Japanese girl but abandons her shortly thereafter. The girl bears his son and waits for his return, with tragic results.

title: Miracle in the Mountains
description: A servant girl meets a strange man who can bring the dead back to life, in Ferenc Molnar's play.

title: Rigoletto
description: A jester mocks the courtiers who are fooled by a philandering duke, only to realize that the duke is in pursuit of his own daughter, in Giuseppe Verdi's opera.

title: Il Trovatore
description: A troubadour and a count compete for the love of a princess's lady-in-waiting, in Giuseppe Verdi's opera.

title: La Bohème
description: A group of bohemian artists struggle to survive the cold Paris winter, as romance between poet Rodolfo and seamstress Mimi heads for tragedy and painter Marcello's affair with unfaithful singer Musetta provides comedy in the landmark Giacomo Puccini opera.

title: A Young Man's Fancy
description: A shy, bookish boy figures out how to outwit his more boisterous bunkmates at sleepaway camp, in Harry Thurschell and Alfred Golden's comedy.

title: Pagliacci
description: An actor in a commedia dell'arte troupe is driven insane when he suspects his wife of infidelity in Ruggiero Leoncavallo's opera.

title: Cavalleria Rusticana
description: An Italian villager carries on affairs with two women who are nearly destroyed by their love and jealousy, in Pietro Mascagni's one-act opera.

title: La Tosca
description: An opera singer loves a painter who sympathizes with her brother, a leader of the Italian resistance against Napoleon's coming invasion. When a sadistic chief of police arrests the painter, the singer is prepared to sleep with him to gain her beloved's freedom, in Giacomo Puccini's opera.

title: Heads or Tails
description: A stuffy diplomat plans to kill himself for a variety of reasons, with his mother-in-law taking out a hefty insurance on his life. When the insurance company discovers the plan, they send a spy to try to prevent the suicide, as many other comic complications ensue.

title: The Barber of Seville
description: A count pursues a well-born young lady with the help of his former servant, now a barber, who can sneak the count into the girl's home past her controlling guardian, who wants her for himself.

title: Portrait in Black
description: A woman bewitches her doctor-lover into helping her murder her husband and then her attorney. The doctor grows progressively uneasy about the situation when letters congratulating the woman on the murders begin to appear.

title: Up in Central Park
description: A New York Times reporter investigates the crooked political machine of Boss Tweed, including the business fraud that surrounded the construction of Central Park, while falling for a daughter of one of the Boss's ward healers.

title: Love for Love
description: The playboy Valentine prepares, at least nominally, to give up his inheritance in order to continue an irresponsible life and to court the beautiful Angelica, in William Congreve's Restoration comedy and social satire.

title: Nataraj Vashi, Pra-veena
description: The dance impresario Nataraj Vashi presents an evening of traditional Indian dance.

title: Icetime of 1948
description: Sonja Henie co-produces the return engagement of the musical ice-skating revue Icetime.

title: Louisiana Lady
description: During Mardi Gras, a pirate falls for a daughter of the madam of a popular Louisiana bordello, who is also being pursued by a crooked politician, in this musical adaptation of the play Creoles.

title: Open House
description: An elderly widow holds an open house, which leaves her vulnerable to the scheming of neighbors and con artists.

title: Laura
description: A detective investigates the murder of a successful female advertiser, only to discover her death is not what it appears to be, in Vera Caspary and George Sklar's adaptation of Caspary's novel.

title: The Magic Touch
description: Two young and underpaid employees of an unscrupulous publisher air their grievances about their wages and working conditions.

title: Anna Lucasta
description: A black prostitute seeks the forgiveness of her family in Phillip Yordan's play.

title: I Gotta Get Out
description: Three desperate racetrack gamblers take over the kitchen of a strait-laced Long Island spinster to conduct their operations, in Joseph A. Fields and Ben Sher's comedy.

title: Our Lan'
description: A group of freed slaves take over a Georgia plantation believing it will belong to them, only to find themselves cheated out of owning the land they work.

title: The Heiress
description: Plain Catherine Sloper, who lives a spinster's life with her unloving father and eccentric aunt, is courted by the dashing Morris Townsend, seemingly for love and not for money, in this adaptation of the Henry James novel Washington Square.

title: How I Wonder
description: An astronomer and college professor engage in arguments with a person representing his own mind about the Earth's future in the age of the atom bomb.

title: Command Decision
description: A U.S. general in World War II must choose between what looks good for the military and what is the right way to go about defeating Germany.

title: Music in My Heart
description: Peter Tchaikovsky pines for a French singer as he is commissioned by the Russian Czar to compose a ballet for the Royal Opera House, in this biographical musical using Tchaikovsky's own music.

title: Under the Counter
description: A British musical star gives charity performances at home while also finagling a work transfer for her boyfriend from Paris to London and taking part in some low-grade black market schemes.

title: Dear Judas
description: Robinson Jeffers depicts a version of the events both before and after Christ's crucifixion, adapted by Michael Myerberg.

title: Duet for Two Hands
description: A surgeon replaces the mangled hands of a poet with the hands of a convicted murderer, whose personality seems to take over the poet.

title: Man and Superman
description: A confirmed bachelor is pursued by a woman in George Bernard Shaw's play depicting the eternal battle of the sexes.  The play's controversial third act, Don Juan in Hell, features a debate between a Puritanical Don Juan (played by the same actor who plays the bachelor) and the Devil.

title: High Button Shoes
description: Two conmen hound an all-American family all the way to Atlantic City in 1913 in musical adaptation of Stephen Longstreet's semi-autobiographical novel The Sisters Liked Them Handsome.

title: Allegro
description: The son of a small-town doctor becomes a successful practitioner in the big city, spurred on by his materialistic wife and father-in-law, before ultimately realizing the value of the life he has abandoned, in Rodgers and Hammerstein's abstract musical play.

title: Medea
description: A barbarian sorceress is abandoned by her war-hero husband for a Greek princess, turning to the ultimate murder for revenge in Euripedes' tragedy.

title: An Inspector Calls
description: An inspector visits an engagement party in a middle-class home in the English countryside to question the guests about the recent suicide of a young woman, in J.B. Priestly's thriller.

title: The Druid Circle
description: An embittered British college professor finds a student's love letter and uses it to torture the boy who wrote it and the girl it was meant for, in John van Druten's play.

title: The Winslow Boy
description: In Terence Rattigan's play, based on a real-life incident, an English father fights to clear his son's name after he is expelled from boarding school, accused of stealing a five-shilling postal order.

title: Edith Piaf
description: The French singer Edith Piaf performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Iris Mabry
description: The dancer Iris Mabry performs in concert on Broadway.

title: This Time Tomorrow
description: A young scientist working on cancer research falls for a girl who is dying of tuberculosis but seems to be keeping herself alive purely by a desire to reproduce.

title: Trial Honeymoon
description: A young woman schemes to marry a meek man and, in the various complications leading up to the ceremony, finds herself falling for his best man.

title: For Love or Money
description: A young girl is driven into the home of an aging matinee idol when her car breaks down in a storm and enchants the rogue with her innocence.

title: The First Mrs. Fraser
description: A married couple heads to the divorce courts when the wife is accused of adultery. The husband's first wife appears in court to provide conclusive evidence of her successor's infidelity and reunites with her ex-husband when the divorce is complete.

title: Harald Kreutzberg
description: German dancer Harald Kreutzberg performs an evening of dance on Broadway.

title: Eastward in Eden
description: Dorothy Gardner's play, based on the life and work of Emily Dickinson, imagines the reclusive poet conducting a romance.

title: A Streetcar Named Desire
description: Fragile Southern belle Blanche DuBois moves to New Orleans to live with her sister, Stella, and her brutish brother-in-law, Stanley Kowalski, in a dingy apartment.  Temperaments clash, fireworks fly and secrets are revealed in Tennessee Williams' Pulitzer Prize-winning drama.

title: Caribbean Carnival
description: A white photographer tries to get into a Caribbean voodoo ceremony in this calypso musical.

title: Galileo
description: The astronomer Galileo battles the Catholic Church for his right to express his theory of how the planets move around the sun.

title: The Gentleman from Athens
description: A rough-and-tumble man from the West Coast finds himself elected to the United States Congress.

title: Angel in the Wings
description: Performing couple Paul and Grace Hartman and Elaine Stritch are among the headliners of this revue of songs and sketches.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: A poor Russian man plans to kill an unscrupulous pawnbroker and use her money to do good deeds to counteract his crime, believing he is justified in the murder because of his admirable goals, in this adaptation of Fyodor Dostoyevsky's novel.

title: The Cradle Will Rock
description: A Brechtian allegory of corruption and corporate greed, The Cradle Will Rock follows the efforts of Larry Foreman to unionize local workers and combat wicked, greedy businessman Mr. Mister, who controls the town's factory, press, church and social organizations.

title: Topaze
description: A disgraced teacher becomes secretary to a politician of questionable ethics, and ultimately starts some shady, secret business practices of his own that outmaneuver his employer's.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Lament for Ignacio Sanches Mejias
description: Jose Limon performs a modern dance piece based on Fernando Garcia Lorca's poem mourning the death of the Spanish bullfighter Ignacio Sanches Mejias.

title: Skipper Next to God
description: Jan de Hartog's play depicts a captain taking European Jews out to America during World War II.

title: Trial by Jury & the Pirates of Penzance
description: An evening of two Gilbert and Sullivan operettas.

title: Volpone
description: A Venetian gentleman pretends to be dying in order to dupe the friends who hope to be heirs to his great fortune, in Ben Jonson's satire of greed.

title: Iva Kitchell
description: The comic dancer Iva Kitchell performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Harvest of Years
description: A Swedish mother calmly oversees the romantic and personal travails of her family as they run a California vineyard.

title: Power Without Glory
description: A young man is startled to discover that he has committed a murder — and so is his family when they find out.

title: Strange Bedfellows
description: In 1896 San Francisco, the son of a senator who is adamantly opposed to women's suffrage marries a committed suffragette, who compels the women of her family to join her cause and deny men sex until they get the right to vote.

title: Make Mine Manhattan
description: The songs and sketches of this musical revue focus on the island of Manhattan in all its many facets.

title: The Men We Marry
description: Three school chums get together to prevent one's daughter from marrying a snobbish doctor, only to see the scheme backfire.

title: Cox and Box / H.M.S. Pinafore
description: An evening of two Gilbert and Sullivan operettas.

title: H.M.S. Pinafore
description: The daughter of the captain of Her Majesty's Ship Pinafore is in love with a humble sailor, despite her father's hopes that she will marry a better-born suitor, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: The Survivors
description: Four Mississippi brothers return from prison after the Civil War intent on fighting back against the neighbor, a former Union Army officer, whom they believe let them be captured.

title: Angel Street
description: A prosperous couple in Victorian London is driven apart when the husband starts to convince his wife she is going mad, in Patrick Hamilton's thriller, which was filmed using its British title, Gaslight.

title: The Last Dance
description: A captain and his wife draw her visiting cousin into their dangerous marital games in August Strindberg's 1901 play, also known in English as Dance of Death.

title: Look, Ma, I'm Dancin'!
description: A millionairess and former vaudevillian gives a million dollars to a Russian ballet company so that she can perform in it, and her hoofer friend modernizes the company's dance style and wins a Hollywood contract.

title: Kathleen
description: An Irish professor's daughter pretends to be pregnant to test the fidelity of her three suitors, only to find each of them willing to claim paternity and marry her for various reasons.

title: A Long Way from Home
description: A preacher inspires the citizens of black community to hope for a better life, but they return to their lives of crime and disappointment when he leaves them, in Randolph Goodman and Walter Carroll's adaptation of Maxim Gorky's The Lower Depths.

title: Patience
description: An aesthetic poet is pursued by many maidens but loves only a milkmaid who disdains the idea of love, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: John Bull's Other Island
description: An Irish civil engineer and his English business partner return to the Irishman's hometown to develop land. While the Irishman would rather forget his home, the ambitious but charming business partner enchants the locals, in George Bernard Shaw's 1904 comedy.

title: Doctor Social
description: A plastic surgeon falls in love with a patient and is inspired to abandon his work and go into cancer research.

title: Ghosts
description: In Henrik Ibsen's 1881 play, Mrs. Alving plans to dedicate an orphanage to the memory of her late husband, but confesses to Pastor Manders that her supposedly upstanding husband was actually a philanderer. The effects of his indiscretions are still apparent in their disease-afflicted son and the maid he has fallen for.

title: The Old Lady Says "no!"
description: The 18th-century Irish revolutionary Robert Emmet is led on a nightmarish tour through what Ireland would look like as a free state, in Denis Johnston's play.

title: Martha Graham
description: Martha Graham's dance company performs an evening of modern dance on Broadway.

title: Mister Roberts
description: A combat officer looks out for his bored troops who man a cargo ship supplying Pacific troops during World War II, even as he hopes to get permission from his tyrannical captain to transfer and see some action himself.

title: Tonight at 8:30
description:
An evening of one-act plays by Noel Coward.  In Ways and Means, a debt-plagued gambler and his wife are saved from final disgrace when a chauffeur who had planned to rob them saves them instead.  Still Life depicts the frustrated secret affair between two married middle-class people.  Fumed Oak follows a middle-aged salesman who has earned enough money to tell off his wife, mother-in-law and daughter and to leave them.
Note: The original 1936 production of Tonight at 8:30 contained nine one-act plays performed over three evenings, including We Were Dancing, The Astonished Heart, Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Shadow Play, Ways and Means and Still Life. Six one-acts (Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Family Album, Shadow Play, and Ways and Means) were performed in a 1948 revival.  Only three of the one-acts were performed in the 1967 revival.

title: Tonight at 8:30
description:
An evening of one-act plays by Noel Coward.  In Ways and Means, a debt-plagued gambler and his wife are saved from final disgrace when a chauffeur who had planned to rob them saves them instead.  Still Life depicts the frustrated secret affair between two married middle-class people.  Fumed Oak follows a middle-aged salesman who has earned enough money to tell off his wife, mother-in-law and daughter and to leave them.
Note: The original 1936 production of Tonight at 8:30 contained nine one-act plays performed over three evenings, including We Were Dancing, The Astonished Heart, Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Shadow Play, Ways and Means and Still Life. Six one-acts (Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Family Album, Shadow Play, and Ways and Means) were performed in a 1948 revival.  Only three of the one-acts were performed in the 1967 revival.

title: Hedda Gabler
description: Ibsen's Hedda Gabler presents a psychological study of a cultivated woman, recently returned from her honeymoon, whose boredom and dissatisfaction in a stifling environment lead her to destroy others — and herself.

title: Where Stars Walk
description: A retired actress helps a local theater company put on a play about the legendary princess Etáin and her fairy lover Midir, who are working as the actress's maid and butler.

title: Me and Molly
description: Gertrude Berg brings Molly Goldberg, the beloved character she created on 1940s radio, to the stage, where the lower-middle-class Jewish mother deals with educating herself, seeing her children through life's milestones, and saving her husband's business.

title: Maurice Chevalier in an Evening of Songs and Impressions
The Linden Tree
description: A professor and his family cope in different styles with the changing ways of England, in J.B. Priestley's play.

title: The Hallams
description: A middle-class New York grandmother tries to keep her family together even as her grandchildren make rash marriage decisions, in Rose Franken's sequel to her 1932 play Another Language.

title: A Temporary Island
description: A professor becomes besotted with a circus and its attractive lead performer, almost giving up his career to follow her.

title: The Happy Journey to Trenton and Camden and the Respectful Prostitute
description:
An evening of one-act plays, including The Happy Journey to Trenton and Camden by Thornton Wilder and The Respectful Prostitute by Jean-Paul Sartre.
The Happy Journey to Trenton and Camden follows a seemingly pleasant car ride that masks a family's grief.
In The Respectful Prostitute, a prostitute moves from the North to the South and feels guilt about agreeing to frame a black man for her rape, which a white man attempted.

title: You Never Can Tell
description: The children of a suffragette, who don't know their father, scheme to find and invite him to lunch, while the modern-thinking daughter is courted by a 19th-century-style ladies' man.

title: Joy to the World
description: When a Hollywood production executive finds himself speaking out against censorship, his girlfriend encourages him to stand by his words when he lands in hot water with the big boss.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: Six O'Clock Theatre
description:
An evening of three one-act plays, including Hope Is the Thing with Feathers by Richard Harrity, Celebration by Horton Foote and Afternoon Storm by E.P. Conkle.
In Hope Is the Thing with Feathers, a group of tramps and vagabonds comically struggle to catch a duke in Central Park pond and cook it.
In Celebration, a brother and sister return to their Texas hometown from college to a party thrown by their alcoholic, black-sheep older sister.
In Afternoon Storm, Abe Lincoln takes a walk to calm his nerves before marrying Mary Todd.

title: Carmen
description: The soldier Don Jose is destroyed by his love for the beautiful Gypsy temptress Carmen, in Georges Bizet's opera.

title: Rigoletto
description: A jester mocks the courtiers who are fooled by a philandering duke, only to realize that the duke is in pursuit of his own daughter, in Giuseppe Verdi's opera.

title: Madame Butterfly
description: In Giacomo Puccini's opera, U.S. naval officer marries a young Japanese girl but abandons her shortly thereafter. The girl bears his son and waits for his return, with tragic results.

title: La Bohème
description: A group of bohemian artists struggle to survive the cold Paris winter, as romance between poet Rodolfo and seamstress Mimi heads for tragedy and painter Marcello's affair with unfaithful singer Musetta provides comedy in the landmark Giacomo Puccini opera.

title: The Barber of Seville
description: A count pursues a well-born young lady with the help of his former servant, now a barber, who can sneak the count into the girl's home past her controlling guardian, who wants her for himself.

title: Il Trovatore
description: A troubadour and a count compete for the love of a princess's lady-in-waiting, in Giuseppe Verdi's opera.

title: La Tosca
description: An opera singer loves a painter who sympathizes with her brother, a leader of the Italian resistance against Napoleon's coming invasion. When a sadistic chief of police arrests the painter, the singer is prepared to sleep with him to gain her beloved's freedom, in Giacomo Puccini's opera.

title: Cavalleria Rusticana
description: An Italian villager carries on affairs with two women who are nearly destroyed by their love and jealousy, in Pietro Mascagni's one-act opera.

title: The Rats of Norway
description: An instructor at an English prep school has a tragic affair with his headmaster's wife, one of many affairs the other instructors have in Keith Winter's play.

title: Charles Weidman Dancers
description: The Charles Weidman Dancers perform a concert of Weidman's uniquely American style of modern dance.

title: The Cup of Trembling
description: Despite her loved ones' best efforts, a woman's alcoholism leads her to the depths of despair before psychiatry and Alcoholics Anonymous help her see the light, in Louis Paul's adaptation of his novel Breakdown.

title: Marie Marchowsky
description: Marie Marchowsky's dance company performs an evening of her modern dance pieces.

title: Holiday on Broadway
description: Legendary jazz singer Billie Holiday performs in concert on Broadway.

title: The Play's the Thing
description: In Ferenc Molnar's farce, a young playwright is distraught when he overhears the actress he loves having an affair with another man. His mentor must convince him that she is only rehearsing a play — and that he must write her a better one.

title: Inside U.S.A.
description: The songs and sketches in this musical revue each focuses on an American state.

title: The Dybbuk
description: S. Ansky dramatizes the old Jewish belief that the spirit of a dead man who has suffered injustice in life can inhabit the body of a living person as a means of crying out for the justice to be righted.

title: Hold It!
description: A college boy is playing the lead in a drag show, and his friend submits a picture of him in drag to a screen-test competition. When the boy is selected to test, complications ensue.

title: Sally
description: A humble dishwasher attends a fancy party pretending to be a ballerina, finding love and a contract with the Ziegfeld Follies, in Jerome Kern, Clifford Grey, P.G. Wodehouse and Guy Bolton's musical.

title: The Alchemist
description: A London gentleman must flee temporarily to the country to escape the plague. He leaves his townhouse in the care of his butler, who uses it to carry out illicit acts with a con-man and prostitute, in Ben Jonson's 1610 comedy.

title: David's Crown
description: King David's son, Absalom, avenges his half-sister's rape by their brother in hopes that he will become king, but his efforts end in tragedy, in Pedro Calderón's 1634 play.

title: Rosario and Antonio
description: The Spanish flamenco dancers Rosario and Antonio perform in concert on Broadway.

title: Ballet Ballads
description:
An evening of three music and dance pieces, featuring songs by Jerome Moross and John Latouche. Susanna and the Elders, choreographed by Katherine Litz, Willie the Weeper by Paul Godkin, and The Eccentricities of Davy Crockett by Hanya Holm.
Susanna and the Elders is set at a revival meeting, in which the parson retells the story from the Book of Daniel about a beautiful Jewish wife whose lusting admirers publicly accused her of adultery when she refuses to sleep with them.
In Willie the Weeper, the drug-addicted man's various hallucinations are interpreted through song and dance.
The Eccentricities of Davy Crockett celebrates the life of the legendary frontiersman.

title: Hope's the Thing
description:
An evening of three one-act plays by Richard Harrity, including Hope Is the Thing with Feathers, Gone Tomorrow and Home Life of a Buffalo.
In Hope Is the Thing with Feathers, a group of tramps and vagabonds comically struggle to catch a duck in a Central Park pond and cook it.
In Gone Tomorrow, an Irish-American uncle on his deathbed refuses to die, and his plans for what to do with his estate contrast with his relatives' ideas.
In Home Life of a Buffalo, a vaudeville couple on their last legs struggle to continue performing and train their son in the family business, despite its dead-end future.

title: The Golem
description: A 16th-century rabbi creates a monster to protect Prague's Jews from the plot against them.

title: S.S. Glencairn
description:
An evening of four one-acts by Eugene O'Neill, set on the same tramp steamer, including Bound East for Cardiff, In the Zone, The Moon of the Carabees and The Long Voyage Home.


In Bound East for Cardiff, a sailor takes a fatal fall and reflects bitterly on the life he is leaving, despite his shipmates' attempts to comfort him.
In In the Zone, a seaman secretively removes a black box, leading his fellow mates to conclude he is a spy.
In The Moon of the Carabees, the ship is anchored off an island in the West Indies and the sailors come to blows over the favor of some native girls. 
In The Long Voyage Home, a sailor gets drunk with his mates in a London bar, excited over his plans to leave the seafaring life, until he is slipped a mickey and taken aboard the worst ship possible.

title: The Vigil
description: A man accused of moving Christ's body out of its tomb after the crucifixion goes to trial, with the various characters from the story taking the witness stand.

title: Oedipus Rex
description: The people of Thebes ask their king, Oedipus, for help in saving their kingdom from plague, leading Oedipus to discover a shocking secret from his past, in Sophocles' Greek tragedy.

title: Seeds in the Wind
description: Children who have escaped the World War II massacre in the Czech village of Lidice hide out in the Carpathian mountains and plan to construct a new civilization in which children take over from their elders, but their plans are questioned by a kind Czech patriot who appears in their cave.

title: Sleepy Hollow
description: A plain-looking schoolmaster is spurned by the local beauty and meets his fate against the terrifying Headless Horseman in a small, colonial-era New York town, in this musical adaptation of Washington Irving's story "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow."

title: The Insect Comedy
description: A wanderer falls into a drunken sleep in a forest and dreams that he can observe the lives of the insects, which have many of the same characteristics in their relationships as human lives do.

title: Howdy, Mr. Ice
description: Sonja Henie produces this musical ice-skating revue.

title: Sundown Beach
description: Several flier veterans of World War II are destroyed by personal problems upon getting out of service and go to a Florida hospital for treatment.

title: Show Boat
description: Jerome Kern and Oscar Hammerstein II's groundbreaking musical version of Edna Ferber's novel examines the lives of Cap'n Andy and his troupe of traveling show boat performers, including his naïve daughter Magnolia, her gambling husband Gaylord Ravenal, the tragic mixed-race actress Julie, and black stevedore Joe, who marvels at the constancy of the "Ol' Man River" they travel on.

title: Hilarities
description: Morey Amsterdam headlined and co-wrote sketches for this musical revue.

title: Small Wonder
description: Tom Ewell and Mary McCarty headline this musical revue of songs, dances and sketches.

title: Heaven on Earth
description: A man who lives in a Central Park treehouse has trouble finding more suitable living quarters for himself and his bride-to-be.

title: Magdalena
description: A bus driver falls for a spirited, wealthy woman in South America, in this operetta-styled musical.

title: A Story for Strangers
description: A dastardly gang in a small Michigan town reforms its ways and lets the nice guy and girl get married when the boy's horse reveals that it can talk and show them the right path.

title: Grandma's Diary
description: A World War II veteran and his wife are both indulging in affairs, and the wife uses her affair with a local radio crooner to get on the air to read the saucy diary of her Viennese grandmother.

title: Town House
description: Three very different married couples share a New York City mansion and bicker sharply with each other, in Gertrude Tokonogy's adaptation of John Cheever's stories.

title: Time for Elizabeth
description: A man decides to retire and move to Florida but he returns to work once he discovers the dull life and limited income available to him, in Norman Krasna and Groucho Marx's comedy.

title: Edward, My Son
description: A powerful business tycoon stoops to unscrupulous business practices and personal conduct in the hopes of making life better for his son Edward, who turns out to be just as ruthless as his father.

title: Private Lives
description: Divorcees Elyot and Amanda unexpectedly meet while honeymooning with their respective new spouses and discover that their passion for — and irritation with — each other is just as strong as ever.

title: Summer and Smoke
description: A repressed minister's daughter nurses a longtime unrequited love for the boy next door, who grows up into a playboy whose nature is completely at odds with hers.

title: Love Life
description: A married couple and their two children encounter changes in each other and their marriage over a period lasting from 1790 to 1948, during which they do not age, in Kurt Weill and Alan Jay Lerner's musical.

title: Where's Charley?
description: An Oxford student is forced to dress in drag as his own aunt, visiting from Brazil, when she does not appear in time to chaperone him, his friends, and their beloveds.  Romantic, farcical complications ensue in Frank Loesser and George Abbott's musical adaptation of Brandon Thomas's play Charley's Aunt.

title: The Leading Lady
description: A great couple of the stage returns after the husband's long illness, but the husband dies suddenly and the wife retires until a young playwright tempts her back to the stage.

title: My Romance
description: A minister falls for an opera diva in Sigmund Romberg and Rowland Leigh's musical adaptation of Edward Sheldon's 1913 play Romance.

title: Life with Mother
description: After over 20 years of marriage, mother Vinnie labors to finally get an engagement ring, which her husband, Father, had always considered a bad investment, in Howard Lindsay and Russel Crouse's sequel to the popular family comedy Life with Father.

title: Minnie and Mr. Williams
description: A young girl is sent by the devil to visit a reverend and his wife in hopes of getting the reverend to go to hell with her.

title: Set My People Free
description: A slave who was once an African prince is inspired to plan an uprising against the white population of Charleston, S.C., until the head house slave reluctantly warns the master.

title: Bravo!
description: A Hungarian immigrant playwright struggles to recreate his European theater troupe with the eccentric New York showfolk with whom he lives in a theatrical boarding house.

title: As the Girls Go
description: The first female president's husband makes a mess of protocol, but dodges his wife's enemies' efforts to make him have, and be caught in, an affair.

title: For Heaven's Sake, Mother!
description: An average wife and mother has always wanted to be on the stage and desperately tries to get a part in her actor-husband's new play, bound for London.

title: Goodbye, My Fancy
description: A congresswoman and former reporter returns to her alma mater to receive an honorary diploma while juggling a long-nursed yen for the college's president with the attentions of a photographer and former colleague.

title: Light Up the Sky
description: An idealistic playwright sees his magnum opus comically eviscerated by a series of events and clashes of artists' egos, in Moss Hart's satire.

title: The Young and Fair
description: A former student of a Boston junior college for women returns as a teacher and discovers her younger sister, a student, falsely accused of stealing by a group of trustees' daughters attempting to cover their own crimes.

title: The Silver Whistle
description: A vagabond brightens the lives of the residents of a home for elderly people.

title: Red Gloves
description: A young revolutionary becomes the secretary of a European dictator with the goal of assassinating him, but his feelings become conflicted as his wife becomes more devoted to the leader's ideals.

title: The Telephone / The Medium
description: An evening of two one-act operas by Gian-Carlo Menotti.

title: Anne of the Thousand Days
description: King Henry VIII looks over his relationship with and marriage to Anne Boleyn as he decides whether or not to execute her, in Maxwell Anderson's play.

title: Lend an Ear
description: Charles Gaynor wrote the songs, dances and sketches for this musical revue, which featured Carol Channing and Gene Nelson in the cast and choreography by Gower Champion.

title: Make Way for Lucia
description: A pretentious Englishwoman starts up a rivalry with the woman from whom she is renting a summer house as to who shall be the leader of local civic enterprises.

title: Jenny Kissed Me
description: A charming eight-year-old girl comes to live with a priest, who struggles with comic consequences to make her palatable to friends and suitors her own age.

title: Oh, Mr. Meadowbrook!
description: A psychiatrist encourages a mild-mannered English taxidermist to be bolder with women, leading him to the maid of a Connecticut playwright and his wife.

title: Don't Listen, Ladies
description: A Parisian antique dealer's suspicions about his wife's outside activities lead to farcical consequences.

title: The Rape of Lucretia
description: A Roman general's wife is driven to despair and suicide after being raped by a prince, in Benjamin Britten and Ronald Duncan's operatic adaptation of the classic story.

title: Kiss Me, Kate
description: Two divorced — and flamboyantly egocentric — performers find themselves starring opposite each other in a musical version of Taming of the Shrew in Cole Porter and Sam and Bella Spewack's tribute to the theatre, in all its greasepaint and glory.

title: The Smile of the World
description: A formerly rebellious lawyer has become a stuffy justice, leading his wife to fall for his young clerk.

title: Along Fifth Avenue
description: Nancy Walker, Jackie Gleason and Carol Bruce headline this musical revue of songs, dances and sketches.

title: The Shop at Sly Corner
description: An ex-convict runs a London antique shop as a cover for his secret operations, strangling an assistant who discovers him and poisoning himself in haste when he thinks a police inspector has caught on to him.

title: Leaf and Bough
description: The son of a dysfunctional family struggles to win approval from the family of the pure farm girl he wishes to marry.

title: All for Love
description: Singing couple Paul and Grace Hartman headline this musical revue of songs, dances and sketches.

title: Forward the Heart
description: A blinded veteran of World War II falls in love with his mother's black maid, who also loves him despite her awareness of how doomed their married life would be.

title: Richard III
description: Richard, Duke of York, plots murders, marriages, and other intrigues in order to secure his own place on the throne. This tale of ruthless ambition is part of Shakespeare's cycle of plays about the Wars of the Roses.

title: My Name Is Aquilon
description: An exaggerating Frenchman lies his way into becoming a secretary for a wealthy man who deals in black market currency and subsequently falls in love with his daughter.

title: Death of a Salesman
description: Salesman Willy Loman finds his career crumbling and his relationships with his wife and sons severely tested in Arthur Miller's dream-like meditation on the cost of the American dream.

title: They Knew What They Wanted
description: An aging Italian vineyard owner in California proposes to a waitress via letter, sending her a picture of his handsome hired hand.  Romantic and emotional complications ensue when she agrees to marry and live with the Italian in Sidney Howard's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Carousel
description: Brash carousel barker Billy Bigelow and Julie Jordan, a quiet girl who works in the mill, fall in love, marry, and have a stormy relationship that leads to tragedy and an attempt at mending old wounds from beyond the grave, in Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical adaptation of Ferenc Molnar's play, Liliom.

title: The Big Knife
description: A movie studio uses blackmail and other dastardly actions to keep its latest star under long-term contract, though he would rather get out of town.

title: Anybody Home
description: Robert Pyzel dramatizes a Westchester County couple's difficult marriage.

title: Two Blind Mice
description: Two old women continue to operate an Office of Medicinal Herbs in Washington, D.C., even though it had been abolished by Congress a few years earlier.

title: At War with the Army
description: A soldier is reluctantly separated from his pregnant wife to go into basic training with a group of ragtag fellow recruits, in James Allardice's comedy.

title: Detective Story
description: A dedicated detective pursues several cases related to underworld criminals, and he discovers and he discovers and abortionist his wife visited some years earlier, in Sidney Kingsley's drama.

title: The Biggest Thief in Town
description: The meanest and richest old man in a small Colorado town dies, leading the local undertaker and doctor to grab the corpse before a Denver company does — until the corpse revives.

title: The Traitor
description: A young atomic scientist plans to turn over atomic bomb secrets and samples to Russian spies, believing it is better for the world if both sides have the bomb, but he is caught by Naval intelligence and ends up reversing his view, with tragic consequences.

title: The Ivy Green
description: Mervyn Nelson dramatizes Charles Dickens' relationship with his wife Catherine, which deteriorates over time as he becomes infatuated first with her sister and then with the actress Ellen Ternan.

title: South Pacific
description: South Pacific follows the lives of U.S. military men, nurses and residents of a Polynesian island during World War II, based on James Michener's Tales of the South Pacific and featuring a score by Rodgers and Hammerstein.

title: Magnolia Alley
description: The inhabitants of a Southern boardinghouse, including a religious woman, a prizefighter, his wicked wife, and the nice girl who loves him, are the subjects of George Batson's play.

title: The Happiest Years
description: A married couple lives with the bride's parents while the husband goes to college under the G.I. Bill, exciting the suspicions of his mother-in-law for the time he spends with an attractive female student.

title: Medea
description: A barbarian sorceress is abandoned by her war-hero husband for a Greek princess, turning to the ultimate murder for revenge in Euripedes' tragedy.

title: Mrs. Gibbons' Boys
description: A kind-hearted woman can only see her three sons as good, even though two have broken out of jail and one is on parole.

title: Concerto for Fun
description: Henry L. Scott performs an evening of classical piano interlaced with comedy monologues.

title: Gayden
description: A wickedly charming young man ruins the lives of all around him but retains the adoration of his oblivious mother.

title: Man and Superman
description: A confirmed bachelor is pursued by a woman in George Bernard Shaw's play depicting the eternal battle of the sexes.  The play's controversial third act, Don Juan in Hell, features a debate between a Puritanical Don Juan (played by the same actor who plays the bachelor) and the Devil.

title: Mr. Adam
description: An atomic explosion has left every man in the world sterile except for one who survived it in a lead mine, who is then drafted into repopulating the nation with its still-fertile women.

title: Howdy, Mr. Ice of 1950
description: Sonja Henie produces this return engagement of the musical ice-skating revue Howdy, Mr. Ice.

title: Cabalgata
description: This musical revue originated in Madrid and highlights the Spanish-themed music of Ramon Bastida.

title: Miss Liberty
description: A photographer for the New York newspaper The Herald seeks out the original French model for the Statue of Liberty in Paris at his girlfriend's suggestion, ultimately finding the wrong girl but falling for her, in Irving Berlin and Robert E. Sherwood's musical.

title: Blackouts of 1949
description: Ken Murray wrote the sketches for this musical revue, featuring a chorus line of "Glamourlovelies," which previously played a very successful run in Hollywood.

title: Twelfth Night
description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

title: Yes, M'Lord
description: An English earl runs for the Parliament seat that has been held by his ancestors for generations, but loses it to a commoner. The earl's American fiancée puts his butler up for a by-election when the commoner is elected to the peerage, which the butler wins, causing the earl to contest the seat for a different party and with the loving support of his maid.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Roland Petit's Les Ballets De Paris
description: Roland Petit's dance company Les Ballets de Paris performs four of his ballets, including Carmen, L'Oeuf a la Coque, Pas d'Action and Le Combat.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: The Browning Version / Harlequinade
description:
An evening of two one-act plays by Terence Rattigan, including The Browning Version and Harlequinade.
In The Browning Version, an aging British schoolteacher prepares to end his career without a pension, in addition to coping with the understanding that his wife is being unfaithful with a younger teacher.
In Harlequinade, a man who is preparing to play Romeo opposite his wife's Juliet in the English countryside learns that he is still married to a previous wife, with whom he has a daughter who now has a child of her own.

title: Touch and Go
description: Jay Gorney and Walter and Jean Kerr wrote the songs and sketches for this musical revue, which spoofs current show-business hits.

title: Montserrat
description: A Spanish junior officer must act on good conscience when an atrocity is committed during Spain's 1812 occupation of Venezuela, in Lillian Hellman's adaptation of Emmanuel Robles' French play.

title: Lost in the Stars
description: Two South African families, one black and one white, are brought together by a tragic murder charge in the age of apartheid, in Kurt Weill and Maxwell Anderson's musical adaptation of Alan Paton's novel Cry the Beloved Country.

title: Regina
description: Southern belle Regina Giddens and her brothers Oscar and Leo Hubbard scheme to outwit Regina's husband, Horace, who opposes their efforts to profit from a cotton factory in partnership with a Chicago businessman, in Marc Blitzstein's opera, adapted from Lillian Hellman's play The Little Foxes.

title: I Know My Love
description: A married Boston couple, seen from their courting years to their dotage, celebrates their 50th wedding anniversary.

title: Love Me Long
description: Two couples, one a glamorous pair of socialites and the other a more down-to-earth pair who have been taken advantage of by their fast-living friends, confront each other over an apartment.

title: The Father
description: A captain and his wife disagree over how to raise their daughter, with the wife going so far as to insinuate the daughter is not her husband's in order to drive him insane and get her way, in August Strindberg's 1887 indictment of marriage and religion.

title: That Lady
description: Ana de Mendoza, the widowed Princess of Eboli, begins an affair with Antonio Perez, the Spanish Secretary of State, which arouses the jealousy of King Philip II of Spain, who is also in love with Ana, in Kate O'Brien's adaptation of her historical novel.

title: Texas, Li'l Darlin'
description: An Air Force veteran falls for the daughter of the man he is running against for the Texas senate.

title: Uday Shankar and His Hindu Ballet
description: Uday Shankar and his Hindu Ballet dance company perform dances based on Hindu folklore and mythology.

title: The Closing Door
description: A man who is near insanity agrees with his wife that he should go to a sanitarium, only to run away and send someone else to the sanitarium in his name, leading to terrifying consequences.

title: Clutterbuck
description: Two married couples unexpectedly reunite with a married couple on a cruise and discover that both women slept with the man before their marriages and both men slept with the man's wife.

title: Metropole
description: The ill-tempered editor of an established magazine is the subject of William Walden's play, which was inspired by The New Yorker and its editor, Harold Ross.

title: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes
description: Gold-digging showgirl Lorelei Lee and her friend Dorothy set out to snare wealthy husbands on a luxury cruise in this musical version of the Anita Loos novel.

title: Caesar and Cleopatra
description: Roman emperor Julius Caesar meets the young Egyptian queen Cleopatra, courts her and tutors her in the ways of the politics of his land in George Bernard Shaw's 1898 play.

title: The Rat Race
description: A girl on the brink of despair in New York meets a blindingly optimistic aspiring saxophone player, in Garson Kanin's play.

title: The Velvet Glove
description: A mother superior and a priest clash over concerns about a convent college professor's ideas on the Christian obligations of wealth, which seem Communistic to influential and rich members of the diocese (whose interests the bishop supports and the mother superior fights against).

title: How Long Till Summer
description: A black attorney runs for Congress but falls prey to an unscrupulous racketeering politico in the hopes of providing a better life for his son.

title: She Stoops to Conquer
description: In Oliver Goldsmith's 1773 comedy, a wealthy English countryman attempts to match his daughter up with a wealthy London resident, but when the daughter learns her suitor prefers lower-class women, she must "stoop to conquer" her man by pretending to be a maid.

title: The Member of the Wedding
