description: A lonely young Southern girl escapes into fantasy with her black cook and young cousin, hoping to join her brother and his fiancée on their honeymoon for more fantastic adventures.

title: Happy as Larry
description: An Irish tailor discusses marriage with his friends and tells the story of his grandfather, who was poisoned by a doctor in love with his wife. But through various fantastical coincidences, he comes back to life a widower and marries a seemingly nicer but marriage-desperate widow.

title: The Corn Is Green
description: A Welsh schoolteacher fights to nurture the writing talent in a local miner.

title: Alive and Kicking
description: This musical revue features songs, sketches, and dances choreographed and performed by Jack Cole and his company of dancers, including Gwen Verdon in her Broadway debut.

title: The Enchanted
description: A schoolteacher falls in love with a man who turns out to be a ghost under investigation for murder.

title: The Man
description: An old woman takes an interest in the young man she has hired to clean her house, who turns out to have paranoid spells to the point of imprisoning the woman in her own house.

title: Dance Me a Song
description: This musical revue features comic Wally Cox and dancers Bob Fosse, Joan McCracken and Mary Ann Niles.

title: The Cocktail Party
description: The guests at a fashionable cocktail party discover that the hostess is missing and a strange guest has taken over her flat, in T.S. Eliot's dissection of London society.

title: Design for a Stained Glass Window
description: Margaret Clitherow, a Catholic who became a martyr for her faith under Elizabeth I's reign in England, is the subject of William Berney and Howard Richardson's play.

title: The Happy Time
description: A boy grows up in French Canada with a fun-loving French father and relatives and a stricter Scottish mother, in Samuel Taylor's adaptation of Robert Fontaine's novel.

title: As You Like It
description: Rosalind, banished from her father's kingdom by her usurping uncle, disguises herself as a boy while falling for one, the similarly exiled duke Orlando.

title: Mr. Barry's Etchings
description: A well-intentioned man who has produced a lifelike etching of a $50 bill distributes copies of it, as if it were real money, to the business and philanthropic outposts of his financially beleaguered town.

title: The Innocents
description: A repressed woman becomes a governess for two children in a mysterious country house, becoming convinced that they are possessed by the spirits of deceased former staff members, in Wiliam Archibald's adaptation of Henry James' short novel The Turn of the Screw.

title: Arms and the Girl
description: A high-spirited American girl falls for a Hessian soldier during the Revolutionary War while attempting to save the American army from a British spy.

title: The Heiress
description: Plain Catherine Sloper, who lives a spinster's life with her unloving father and eccentric aunt, is courted by the dashing Morris Townsend, seemingly for love and not for money, in this adaptation of the Henry James novel Washington Square.

title: All You Need Is One Good Break
description: A lower-middle-class boy has big dreams but winds up in jail when his ambitions take him on a wrong turn.

title: Come Back, Little Sheba
description: Marie, an attractive young boarder, gives new meaning to the lives of Doc and Lola Delaney, married for 20 years and grindingly unhappy. For Lola, Marie is the child she never had. Doc, a recovering alcoholic, has less than paternal feelings.

title: Ladies Night in a Turkish Bath
description: A professor who cannot stand the sight of exposed female flesh has his patience severely tested by the wild goings-on at a Turkish bath he is attending. This play was adapted from Avery Hopwood and Charlton Andrews' 1920 farce Ladies Night.

title: The Devil's Disciple
description: A town drunkard substitutes himself for the minister British soldiers are attempting to capture and hang, in George Bernard Shaw's 1897 satire of New England Puritanism and political self-importance during the Revolutionary War.

title: The Bird Cage
description: A man gains control of a tawdry nightclub through nefarious means, abuses his power and attempts to frame his partner when the club runs into financial problems, in Arthur Laurents' play.

title: Now I Lay Me Down to Sleep
description: Elaine Ryan's adaptation of Ludwig Bemelmans' novel depicts the relationship between an impulsive Ecuadorian general and a proper English governess as they travel from Biaritz to South America.

title: Tobacco Road
description: The Lester family of Georgia sharecroppers are the subject of Jack Kirkland's adaptation of Erskine Caldwell's novel.

title: The Consul
description: A political dissident in a European totalitarian country flees the authorities but tells his wife that he will not leave the country until she, his mother, and child are safely out.

title: Great to Be Alive!
description: The living and the ghosts of the dead commingle happily in an old mansion in Robert Russell Bennett, Abraham Ellstein, Walter Bullock and Sylvia Regan's musical.

title: Cry of the Peacock
description: A family of rich sophisticates, all of whom are cheating on each other and unhappy, gather at a French chateau after discovering that their spinsterish sister has fallen for a hunchbacked tutor.

title: With a Silk Thread
description: A retired actress, whose doctor husband often has affairs, has an affair of her own with her son's college friend, whom she books to costar with her in a local mounting of Shaw's Candida.

title: Katherine Dunham and Her Company
description: Katherine Dunham and her African-influenced modern dance company perform an evening built around her ballet Caribbean Rhapsody.

title: Peter Pan
description: The boy who would not grow up visits the Darling children and takes them on a magical adventure to Never Land in this adaptation of the classic J.M. Barrie play.

title: A Phoenix Too Frequent / Freight
description:
An evening of two one-act plays, including A Phoenix Too Frequent, adapted by Christopher Fry from Petronius' story, and Freight by Kenneth White.
In A Phoenix Too Frequent, an ancient Roman widow plans to starve herself to join her husband in death, until a soldier guarding the husband's tomb charms her back into living.
In Freight, a group of black Southerners have a tense encounter with a white man on a train.

title: Tickets, Please!
description: Performing couple Paul and Grace Harman headline this revue of songs, dances and sketches.

title: Brigadoon
description: Two Americans game-hunting in Scotland happen upon a mysterious village in which the people dress and speak as if from another era. One of the Americans is drawn to one of the Scottish lasses and must choose between the magical Brigadoon and his conventional fiancée back in New York.

title: The Liar
description: A Venetian returns home after years away and courts both daughters of a wealthy doctor, concocting outrageous lies to convince each one he really loves her, in this musical adaptation of Carlo Goldoni's play.

title: A Streetcar Named Desire
description: Fragile Southern belle Blanche DuBois moves to New Orleans to live with her sister, Stella, and her brutish brother-in-law, Stanley Kowalski, in a dingy apartment.  Temperaments clash, fireworks fly and secrets are revealed in Tennessee Williams' Pulitzer Prize-winning drama.

title: The Show Off
description: A clerk at New York's Penn Station is given to exaggerating his own role at the station in George Kelly's satire.

title: Julius Caesar
description: In William Shakespeare's tragedy of political ambition, corruption and betrayal, Roman senators Brutus and Cassius lead a group effort to assassinate the powerful Julius Caesar, then battle with Mark Antony over control of the state.

title: The Telephone / The Medium
description: An evening of two one-act operas by Gian-Carlo Menotti.

title: The Lady from the Sea
description: The wife of a doctor moves to a small Norwegian town in the mountains, away from the seaside fjord where she grew up.  When her former fiancé, a sailor, returns after a long absence, she is forced to choose between her former and her present life, in Henrik Ibsen's 1889 play.

title: Roland Petit's Les Ballets De Paris
description: Roland Petit's dance company Les Ballets de Paris performs four of his ballets, including Carmen, L'Oeuf a la Coque, Pas d'Action and Le Combat.

title: Arms and the Man
description: During the Serbio-Bulgarian War of 1885, a Bulgarian woman who is engaged to a hero of the war encounters a Serbian captain who is retreating from the war because he despises it. He teaches her to see beyond the romantic ideals of war, in George Bernard Shaw's 1894 play.

title: The Country Girl
description: Washed-up actor Frank Elgin receives a final chance for a comeback from a young director who remembers Elgin at his best. Elgin's career, future and relationship with his beleaguered wife lay at the mercy of his struggles with alcohol.

title: A Story for a Sunday Evening
Guys and Dolls
description: A fly-by-night gambler attempts to woo a Salvation Army missioner for a $1,000 bet. Meanwhile, a beleaguered showgirl tries to hook her fiancé of 14 years, the founder of "the oldest, established, permanent, floating crap game in New York."

title: Twentieth Century
description: A struggling Broadway producer tries to get a former lover, now a Hollywood star, to sign a contract to star in his latest (and as yet un-conceived) play as they travel on the luxury train Twentieth Century Limited from Chicago to New York.

title: King Lear
description:
In William Shakespeare's royal-family tragedy, the aging King Lear divides his estate between
his three daughters, ultimately refusing his youngest and favorite her share because she won't
publicly admit her love for him. The decision leads to chaos and treachery within the kingdom and madness for its monarch.

title: Captain Brassbound's Conversion
description: A bloodthirsty pirate meets his match in a British lady adventurer.

title: An Enemy of the People
description: When Dr. Thomas Stockmann discovers toxic contamination in the water used at the local baths, he expects to be hailed as a hero. But since the baths are the town's main source of revenue, the community fights to silence him — and Dr. Stockmann learns there are forces more powerful than truth.

title: The Royal Family
description: In this thinly veiled parody of the Barrymore family circa 1927, a flamboyant theatrical family must cope with the dumbfounding fact that one of them wishes to marry someone outside of show business.

title: King Richard II
description: The thoughtful but weak English King Richard II loses his throne to Henry Bolingbroke in William Shakespeare's play.

title: Peer Gynt
description: The son of a wandering salesman is the focus of his mother's hopes of paying back his father's debts, though he would rather drink and play the field, in Henrik Ibsen's 1867 adaptation of a Norwegian fairy tale.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Where's Charley?
description: An Oxford student is forced to dress in drag as his own aunt, visiting from Brazil, when she does not appear in time to chaperone him, his friends, and their beloveds.  Romantic, farcical complications ensue in Frank Loesser and George Abbott's musical adaptation of Brandon Thomas's play Charley's Aunt.

title: The Rose Tattoo
description: A Sicilian seamstress mourning her husband's death finds love again with a passionate truck driver.

title: Razzle Dazzle
description: Musical Revue. Song-and-dance sequences in Fosse, country-western, latin, nostalgic modes.  Plus magic, juggling, impressions, and ventriloquism,

title: The Moon is Blue
description: This 1951 comedy caused a ruckus by using words like "mistress" and "seduce" in its dialogue. A New York architect's attempts at romancing a "professional virgin" are thwarted by the arrival of his ex-fiancee's father.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: The School for Wives
description: An aging man who is afraid of women makes clumsy advances toward the young ward he wants to marry in Moliere's 1662 comedy.

title: The King and I
description: Welsh schoolteacher Anna Leonowens travels from England to Siam to serve as governess to the king's many children. Their clash of wills and the lessons they learn from each other are examined in this Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, based on Leonowens's account of her experiences.

title: The Taming of the Shrew
description: A wandering braggart out to marry for money ends up with the shrewish daughter of a rich man, whom he must "tame" even as he falls for her, in William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: Getting Married
description: The family of a bishop whose youngest daughter is getting married debate their views on matrimony on the morning of her wedding.

title: Oklahoma!
description: A confident cowboy competes with a surly, mysterious farmhand for the honor of taking a lovely young farm woman to a dance in Rodgers and Hammerstein's 1943 musical adaptation of Green Grow the Lilacs.

title: Saint Joan
description: Set in 15th century France, Saint Joan follows a country girl whose mysterious visions propel her into elite circles. When the nation’s rulers become threatened by her popularity and influence, they unite to bring her down and she finds herself on trial for her life.

title: Don Juan in Hell
description: The third act of George Bernard Shaw's play Man and Superman, featuring a debate between a puritanical Don Juan and the Devil.

title: The Constant Wife
description: W. Somerset Maugham's 1926 comedy of marital manners focuses on a cuckolded Constance Middleton, who pretends not to know her doctor husband is playing doctor with her best friend — until that friend's jealous husband confronts her.

title: Caesar and Cleopatra
description: Roman emperor Julius Caesar meets the young Egyptian queen Cleopatra, courts her and tutors her in the ways of the politics of his land in George Bernard Shaw's 1898 play.

title: The Wild Duck
description: A wealthy merchant's son returns home after a time to discover that his old schoolmate has married and has a daughter with the family servant, whom the merchant's wife believed had an affair with her husband, in Henrik Ibsen's 1884 play.

title: Pal Joey
description: Joey, a second-rate Chicago entertainer, two-times a married society dame and a naïve chorus girl. Based on the novel by John O'Hara and scored by Rodgers & Hart.

title: Kiss Me, Kate
description: Two divorced — and flamboyantly egocentric — performers find themselves starring opposite each other in a musical version of Taming of the Shrew in Cole Porter and Sam and Bella Spewack's tribute to the theatre, in all its greasepaint and glory.

title: Desire Under the Elms
description: In Eugene O'Neill's modern retelling of Greek tragedy, a widowed farmer brings home a young bride. Initially his grown son abhors the new stepmother, but soon his hatred turns to lust.

title: Anna Christie
description: A weary former prostitute seeks out her estranged sea captain father, hoping to find forgiveness from him, while hiding her past from a stoker she loves in Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Emlyn Williams as Charles Dickens
description: Acclaimed actor Emlyn Williams impersonates the novelist Charles Dickens on one of his famous lecture tours, reading selections from his celebrated novels.

title: Golden Boy
description: Clifford Odets' Golden Boy is the story of Joe Bonaparte, a young, gifted violinist who is torn between pursuing a career in music and earning big money as a prize fighter.

title: Don Juan in Hell
description: The third act of George Bernard Shaw's play Man and Superman, featuring a debate between a puritanical Don Juan and the Devil.

title: Betty Hutton and Her All-Star International Show
Candida
description: A minister's wife becomes an object of infatuation for an idealistic young poet, in George Bernard Shaw's comedic look at the changing views on gender and social equality.

title: Much Ado About Nothing
description: The anti-romantic wits Beatrice and Benedick, who profess to hate each other, are forced by their friends' trickery to admit their true feelings as they help to save the wedding of his fellow soldier Claudio and her cousin Hero.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: Dial "M" for Murder
description: A retired tennis pro plots the murder of his own wife—but when she turns the tables on her attempted assailant, she is convicted of murder. Can the police detective who brought her to trial now decipher the clues that will save her life? The play that inspired Hitchcock’s suspense classic weaves an ever tightening web of danger and deception.

title: The Deep Blue Sea
description: A married woman leaves her husband for a passionate but ultimately tragic relationship with a young pilot.

title: Electra
description: Greek princess Electra waits for her brother, Orestes, to return home and help her plan revenge on their mother, Clytemnestra, for her murdering of their father, Agamemnon, in Sophocles' tragedy.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Danny Kaye
description: Danny Kaye performs in a revue also featuring The Dunhills, The Marquis Family, Senor Wences and The Johnny Mann Singers.

title: The Crucible
description: Arthur Miller's tale of the Salem witch trials, in which a group of girls accuse upstanding women in the town of witchcraft to divert suspicion from their own activities, has been seen as an allegory for Senator Joseph McCarthy's anti-Communist crusades of the 1950s.

title: On Borrowed Time
description: An old man chases Death (called Mr. Brink) up a tree so he can spend more time with his grandson, in Paul Osborn's fantasy based on L.E. Watkin's novel.

title: Picnic
description: A sexy drifter shakes up a Kansas town, particularly its female inhabitants, including a beautiful young girl who yearns for a more exciting life, her plain and bookish sister, and a moralistic but sexually frustrated schoolteacher.

title: Wonderful Town
description: Ruth, an aspiring writer, and Eileen, her prettier, aspiring-actress younger sister, arrive in New York from Ohio in the 1930s and find frustration, career hopes and romance in the city of their dreams.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: Porgy and Bess
description: George Gershwin, Ira Gershwin and DuBose Heyward's operatic adaptation of Heyward's play Porgy follows the lives of the inhabitants of Catfish Row, an African-American section of Charleston, South Carolina, including the crippled Porgy, his beloved Bess, who is under the thrall of the dangerous Crown, and the sinewy drug dealer Sportin' Life.

title: Emlyn Williams as Charles Dickens
description: Acclaimed actor Emlyn Williams impersonates the novelist Charles Dickens on one of his famous lecture tours, reading selections from his celebrated novels.

title: Can-Can
description: The owner of a dance club in 1890s Paris must contend with a judge who wishes to close the club down for its lascivious dancing — but who can't help falling for the owner's charms.

title: Oklahoma!
description: A confident cowboy competes with a surly, mysterious farmhand for the honor of taking a lovely young farm woman to a dance in Rodgers and Hammerstein's 1943 musical adaptation of Green Grow the Lilacs.

title: A Pin to See the Peepshow
Betty Hutton and Her All-Star International Show
The Teahouse of the August Moon
The Trip to Bountiful
description: An aging widow leaves her son and daughter in a small Houston apartment to visit the home where she grew up. There in Bountiful, TX, she hopes to regain her dignity and peace of mind.

title: Cyrano de Bergerac
description: Cyrano is a poet, philosopher and swordsman of incredible wit, but his sizable nose renders him too shy to pursue the beautiful Roxane. Instead, he provides the poetry and eloquence to woo her vicariously through his inarticulate friend Christian.

title: Cyrano de Bergerac
description: Cyrano is a poet, philosopher and swordsman of incredible wit, but his sizable nose renders him too shy to pursue the beautiful Roxane. Instead, he provides the poetry and eloquence to woo her vicariously through his inarticulate friend Christian.

title: Richard III
description: Richard, Duke of York, plots murders, marriages, and other intrigues in order to secure his own place on the throne. This tale of ruthless ambition is part of Shakespeare's cycle of plays about the Wars of the Roses.

title: In the Summer House
description: The lives of two eccentric widowed mothers and their daughters are examined in Jane Bowles' absurdist comedy.

title: Roland Petit's Les Ballets De Paris
description: Roland Petit's dance company Les Ballets de Paris performs four of his ballets, including Carmen, L'Oeuf a la Coque, Pas d'Action and Le Combat.

title: The Caine Mutiny Court-Martial
description: A Marine executive officer who seized command of the destroyer Caine during a typhoon is put on trial in Herman Wouk's adaptation of his novel The Caine Mutiny.

title: The Azuma Kabuki Dancers and Musicians
The Girl on the Via Flaminia
Show Boat
description: Jerome Kern and Oscar Hammerstein II's groundbreaking musical version of Edna Ferber's novel examines the lives of Cap'n Andy and his troupe of traveling show boat performers, including his naïve daughter Magnolia, her gambling husband Gaylord Ravenal, the tragic mixed-race actress Julie, and black stevedore Joe, who marvels at the constancy of the "Ol' Man River" they travel on.

title: The Pajama Game
description: A labor furor over a 7½-cent pay raise at a pajama plant complicates the course of true love for Sid Sorokin, the new factory superintendent, and Babe Williams, the feisty firebrand heading the Union Grievance Committee.

title: Carousel
description: Brash carousel barker Billy Bigelow and Julie Jordan, a quiet girl who works in the mill, fall in love, marry, and have a stormy relationship that leads to tragedy and an attempt at mending old wounds from beyond the grave, in Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical adaptation of Ferenc Molnar's play, Liliom.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
description: William Shakespeare's comedy brings together a group of star-crossed lovers, an inept band of actors led by the pompous Bottom, and the king and queen of the fairies and their impish henchman Puck, who creates romantic and comic havoc for all.

title: The Boy Friend
description: A group of British girls studying at a finishing school in the south of France carry on romances with mistaken identities and other crises, as do the adults in their lives, in Sandy Wilson's affectionate parody of silly 1920s musicals.

title: On Your Toes
description: A former vaudevillian, now working as a music professor, convinces the Russian Ballet director to stage his student's jazz ballet, ultimately performing the lead in the ballet and arousing the jealousy of the prima ballerina's boyfriend — as well as the disappointment of the female music student who loves him.

title: Peter Pan
description: The boy who would not grow up visits the Darling children and takes them on a magical adventure to Never-Never Land in this beloved musical version of the classic J.M. Barrie play.

title: The Rainmaker
description: Plain Lizzie Curry finds herself falling, against her better judgment, for a traveler who promises to bring rain to her family's ever-dry Texas town.

title: The Flowering Peach
description: Clifford Odets comically reimagines the Biblical Noah and his family debating the coming Great Flood — and then struggling to survive it on the ark they have built.

title: The Time of Your Life
description: A group of eccentrics inhabit a dive bar in San Francisco, developing friendships and romances, in William Saroyan's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Plain and Fancy
description: This musical comedy by Arnold B. Horwitt, Joseph Stein, Will Glickman, and Albert Hague depicts New Yorkers Dan King and Ruth Winters as they interact with and grow fond of an Amish community in Bird-in-Hand, Pennsylvania.

title: Bus Stop
description: A bus gets snowed in at a Kansas diner, forcing disillusioned saloon singer Cherie to deal a little longer with Bo Decker, the boisterous but naïve cowboy who insists on marrying her, as the other passengers make connections and confront the disappointments in their own lives.

title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
description: In Tennessee Williams' Pulitzer Prize winner, a wealthy Southern patriarch faces impending death and manipulates his family, as his children squabble and mislead in desperate attempts to secure the family inheritance.

title: Guys and Dolls
description: A fly-by-night gambler attempts to woo a Salvation Army missioner for a $1,000 bet. Meanwhile, a beleaguered showgirl tries to hook her fiancé of 14 years, the founder of "the oldest, established, permanent, floating crap game in New York."

title: Inherit the Wind
description: This courtroom drama is based on the 1925 Scopes "Monkey Trial," in which a Tennessee teacher was charged with teaching that man evolved from apes, instead of state-mandated Creationism. The drama contains a powerful confrontation between a character based on William Jennings Bryan, who believes only what he reads in the Bible, and another based on Clarence Darrow, who defends science and open intellectual inquiry.

title: South Pacific
description: South Pacific follows the lives of U.S. military men, nurses and residents of a Polynesian island during World War II, based on James Michener's Tales of the South Pacific and featuring a score by Rodgers and Hammerstein.

title: Damn Yankees
description: A middle-aged man sells his soul to the devil to become a crackerjack baseball player who can help his beloved Washington Senators beat the Yankees in the World Series. But despite the devil's best attempts — including the sexy Lola — to keep him under his sway, the man wants to return to his wife.

title: Finian's Rainbow
description: A blend of romantic fantasy and social commentary, Finian's Rainbow follows the adventures of an Irishman and his daughter, who hope to strike it rich in America using a pot of gold stolen from a leprechaun.

title: Almost Crazy
description: A cast of 19 spoof contemporary theatre, life and culture in this musical revue.

title: The Skin of Our Teeth
description: The modern-looking Antrobus family and their seductive maid, Sabina, survive many ancient disasters, including the Ice Age, Noah's flood, war and famine, always able to start over and begin anew, in Thornton Wilder's Pulitzer Prize-winning dark comedy.

title: Catch a Star!
description: Carmen Amaya and her dance company perform an evening of Spanish flamenco dance and music.

title: A Day by the Sea
description: The inhabitants of a seaside resort in Dorset, England, struggle against the futility of their lives in N.C. Hunter's Chekhovian drama.

title: Hear! Hear!
description: Fred Waring heads a cast of 20 singers in this musical revue, which he also produces and directs.

title: Maurice Chevalier in an Evening of Songs and Impressions
A View from the Bridge
description: Eddie Carbone, a Brooklyn laborer, holds family and honor above all else. He and his wife have raised a niece as their own. But his possessive love of his niece drives him to actions that betray his family and his ideals.

title: Antonio
description: Antonio De Ronda and his Spanish Ballet Company provide an evening of flamenco music and dance.

title: Tiger at the Gates
description: Ancient Trojan military commander Hector struggles to avoid war with the Greeks over the abducted Helen in Christopher Fry's adaptation of Jean Giraudoux's anti-war play The Trojan War Will Not Take Place.

title: Island of Goats
description: An eccentric stranger becomes dangerously entangled with a widow, her daughter and sister-in-law in Henry Reed's adaptation of Ugo Betti's play.

title: The Diary of Anne Frank
description: Frances Goodrich and Albert Hackett's play is based on the true story of a young Jewish girl who kept a diary of her time hiding from the Nazis in an attic of her father's office during World War II.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: Joyce Grenfell Requests the Pleasure...
description: English actress and mimic Joyce Grenfell headlines an evening of satirical monologues and songs in the guise of various characters.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: A Roomful of Roses
description: A child of divorced parents visits her mother and the man she ran off with and married. The girl remains stubbornly resentful about her family situation despite everyone's best efforts.

title: Comédie Française Program 1
description: The Comedie Francaise performs Moliere's The Would-Be Gentlemen, which depicts a self-made, wealthy merchant who is determined to learn how to be a proper gentleman.

title: Deadfall
description: A man who escapes a murder charge because of a clever lawyer rather than his own innocence is pursued by the widow of his victim.

title: Comédie Française Program 2
description:
The Comedie Francaise performs Marivaux's Harlequin, Reformed By Love and Beaumarchais' The Barber of Seville.
In Harlequin, Reformed By Love, the Harlequin character of commedia dell'arte is pursued by a fairy but falls for a shepherdess.
In The Barber of Seville, a count pursues a well-born young lady with the help of his former servant, who now works as a barber and is able to get the count into the girl's home and past her controlling guardian, who wants her for himself.

title: A Hatful of Rain
description: A war veteran repeatedly falls victim to drugs, nearly destroying his relationships with his wife and brother as he struggles to break the habit, in Michael V. Gazzo's play.

title: Comédie Française Program 3
description:
The Comedie Francaise performs Marivaux's The Game of Love and Chance and Alfred de Musset's A Caprice.
In The Game of Love and Chance, a well-born man and woman are betrothed but don't know each other. Upon meeting, each schemes to switch places with their valet and maid, respectively, to learn the other's true character.
In A Caprice, a woman has been married a year when she discovers her husband's infidelity. She schemes to win him back with the help of a worldlier friend.

title: Katherine Dunham and Her Company
description: Katherine Dunham and her African-influenced modern dance company perform an evening built around her ballet Caribbean Rhapsody.

title: Carmen Amaya and Her Company
description: Carmen Amaya and her dance company perform an evening of Spanish flamenco dance and music.

title: Janus
description: A shipping tycoon's wife and a librarian's husband sneak off to New York every year for two months until they are caught, in Carolyn Green's comedy.

title: Six Characters in Search of an Author
The Azuma Kabuki Dancers and Musicians
King Lear
description:
In William Shakespeare's royal-family tragedy, the aging King Lear divides his estate between
his three daughters, ultimately refusing his youngest and favorite her share because she won't
publicly admit her love for him. The decision leads to chaos and treachery within the kingdom and madness for its monarch.

title: Fallen Angels
description: Two Englishwomen, who are in respectable but dull marriages, reunite with the Frenchman who seduced both of them before they were married.

title: Middle of the Night
description: A well-off, middle-aged widower falls in love with a young girl, in Paddy Chayefsky's play.

title: A Streetcar Named Desire
description: Fragile Southern belle Blanche DuBois moves to New Orleans to live with her sister, Stella, and her brutish brother-in-law, Stanley Kowalski, in a dingy apartment.  Temperaments clash, fireworks fly and secrets are revealed in Tennessee Williams' Pulitzer Prize-winning drama.

title: Miss Julie and The Stronger
description:
An evening of two plays by August Strindberg.
In Miss Julie, the daughter of a powerful count enters into a dangerously flirtatious relationship with a footman on her father's estate.
In The Stronger, two actresses, one married and shopping for Christmas presents for her family, the other single and sitting and reading silently, run into each other in a café.

title: Debut
description: A rebellious Southern belle, who has been betrothed to an eligible local bachelor, falls for a Yankee newspaperman.

title: My Fair Lady
description: An English professor of phonetics makes a bet that he can transform a Cockney flower girl into a lady, in Lerner and Loewe's musical adaptation of George Bernard Shaw's Pygmalion.

title: Little Glass Clock
description: An 18th-century French count is ordered off to war on his wedding day, but he sends a substitute in his place and disguises himself as a priest in order to thwart others' plans to spend the wedding night with his bride.

title: Mister Johnson
description: A childlike West African man yearns to become a "civilized" British man, in Norman Rosten's adaptation of Joyce Cary's novel.

title: A Month in the Country
description: Natalya discovers that she is passionately in love with her son's tutor while spending a month on a country estate in Ivan Turgenev's 1872 play.

title: Affair of Honor
description: A major in a colonial army takes several hostages after blowing up a Vermont bridge but decides to spare their lives if the sister of one, a comely barmaid, will spend the night with him.

title: Waiting for Godot
description: In Samuel Beckett's absurdist masterpiece, two tramps wait perpetually for an enigmatic figure in a blurred universe where time, place and memory defy conventional logic.

title: Goodbye Again
description: A famous writer's now-married old flame revisits him in an attempt to rekindle their affair.

title: The Most Happy Fella
description: A middle-aged Italian vineyard owner falls in love with a pretty waitress from afar, sends her the picture of his handsome foreman, and convinces her to move to his California vineyard and marry him, in Frank Loesser's musical adaptation of Sidney Howard's play They Knew What They Wanted.

title: Shangri-La
description: A group of travelers come upon a land where time does not exist and people live exceedingly long lives in this musical adaptation of the James Hilton novel and film Lost Horizon.

title: New Faces of 1956
description: Twenty of producer Leonard Sillman's discoveries perform songs, dances and sketches in this musical revue.

title: Saint Joan
description: Set in 15th century France, Saint Joan follows a country girl whose mysterious visions propel her into elite circles. When the nation’s rulers become threatened by her popularity and influence, they unite to bring her down and she finds herself on trial for her life.

title: Pictures in the Hallway
description: A Dublin teenager overcomes a childhood haunted by impending blindness to meet girls and get his first job, in this adaptation of one of Sean O'Casey's autobiographical novels.

title: Judy Garland
description: Legendary singer Judy Garland performs in concert on Broadway.

title: The Loud Red Patrick
description: A 1912 Irish-American widower runs his family via a parliamentary council, which vetoes his decision to keep his oldest daughter from quitting college to get married.

title: Sixth Finger in a Five Finger Glove
The Reluctant Debutante
description: A mother is anxious for her daughter to move up in British society by marrying a guardsman, when the daughter would rather marry an apparent rake.

title: Too Late the Phalarope
description: A white South African policeman cheats on his wife with a black girl, infuriating his wife and Afrikaner father and violating the law.

title: Double in Hearts
description: A confused television writer hides out from his estranged wife and the pretty model pursuing him in his lecherous friend's bachelor apartment before deciding whom to come home to.

title: The Apple Cart
description: An English king outwits a prime minister and his cabinet who plan to strip the monarchy of its political influence.

title: King Richard II
description: The thoughtful but weak English King Richard II loses his throne to Henry Bolingbroke in William Shakespeare's play.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: Separate Tables
description:
An evening of two one-acts by Terence Rattigan, Table By the Window and Table Number Seven, both set at an English seaside hotel.
In Table By the Window, a frigid woman attempts to win back her husband who has just come out of prison for attempting to murder her.
Table Number Seven follows a spinsterish young woman who resolutely defends a shy man, despite her domineering mother's objections and even after he turns out to have molested women in darkened movie theatres.

title: The Best House in Naples
description: The mistress of an elderly rich man in Naples demands that he marry her so he can give his name to her grown sons, only one of whom is his. Later produced on Broadway as Filumena, which was adapted by Willis Hall and Keith Waterhouse.

title: The Best House in Naples
description: The mistress of an elderly rich man in Naples demands that he marry her so he can give his name to her grown sons, only one of whom is his. Later produced on Broadway as Filumena, which was adapted by Willis Hall and Keith Waterhouse.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: Major Barbara
description: Wealthy Lady Britomart must reunite with her estranged arms manufacturer husband in order to marry off her daughters, including Salvation Army major Barbara, in George Bernard Shaw's critique of capitalism, war, religion and other political issues.

title: Auntie Mame
description: Roaring Twenties socialite Mame Dennis teaches her orphaned nephew the nature of free living and free thinking, attempting to keep him from the clutches of the uptight world of his late father's estate executor and, later, his fiancée, in Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee's adaptation of the Patrick Dennis novel.

title: The Sleeping Prince
description: An American chorus girl in London has a brief affair with a visiting Prince Regent from the Balkans on the eve of George V's coronation.

title: Diary of a Scoundrel
description: A 19th-century Russian scoundrel must scheme his way out of his meager life in a small apartment through a rich marriage and a prestigious job that requires virtually no work, in Rodney Ackland's adaptation of Alexander Ostrovsky's novel The Russian.

title: Long Day's Journey Into Night
description: The Tyrone family — the miserly actor father, the grasping mother addicted to morphine, the alcoholic older son and the tubercular younger son — come to grips with their twisted love for one another in Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning play.

title: That Girl at the Bijou
description: Iva Kitchell headlines this one-woman revue of entertainment arranged alphabetically.

title: Child of Fortune
description: An ailing English heiress is in love with a man who is engaged to her best friend, until the friend matches the two of them together in the hope that they will eventually live off the sick woman's money, in Guy Bolton's adaptation of the Henry James novel Wings of the Dove.

title: A Very Special Baby
description: A former war hero has never been a hero at home, living off his parents' generosity and gentle mocking without ever holding a steady job.

title: Li'l Abner
description: Dogpatch loafer Li'l Abner is loved by Daisy Mae, but the Yokumberry Tonic his Mammy has given him to make him strong (and which is now desired by a Washington general) has made him uninterested in romance, in this musical adaptation of the characters from the Al Capp comic strip.

title: Girls of Summer
description: A repressed woman's younger sister brings home an uninhibited foreman who unleashes the older woman's inhibitions and fears.

title: The Happiest Millionaire
description: The misadventures of the Biddle family of rich eccentrics in Philadelphia are dramatized by Kyle Crichton from the book My Philadelphia Father, which he co-wrote with daughter Cordelia Biddle.

title: Cranks
description: A cast of four British performers headline a stylized revue that satirizes the Stanislavski-based "Method" popular with aspiring American actors.

title: Bells Are Ringing
description: An answering service operator gets a little too involved in the lives of her clients, particularly a procrastinating playwright whom she falls for.  Mistaken identity and misadventures follow in this Jule Styne-Comden and Green musical comedy.

title: Candide
description: In this musical adaptation of Voltaire's satirical novel, the naïve Candide is separated from his beloved Cunegonde and journeys around the world to find her, retaining his teacher Pangloss's belief that "this is the best of all possible worlds" in the face of ever-increasing catastrophes.

title: Night of the Auk
description: Arch Oboler envisions a future where the first rocket ship to land on the moon is on its way back to an earth in the midst of nuclear war and rife with its own infighting and murdering on the journey.

title: Happy Hunting
description: A nouveau-riche American widow goes to Monaco hoping to be invited to the wedding of Grace Kelly and Prince Rainier. She decides to match her daughter up with an impoverished Spanish duke but finds herself attracted to him, while her daughter falls for a lawyer.

title: The Good Woman of Setzuan
description: Three gods seeking goodness in the city of Setzuan find only evil and corruption, with the exception of a prostitute who gives them shelter, in Bertolt Brecht's morality tale.

title: Speaking of Murder
description: A man remarries after his first wife's mysterious death, unaware of his jealous secretary's role in his first wife's death and her equally horrific plans for his second wife, in William and Audrey Roos' murder mystery.

title: Uncle Willie
description: A do-gooder constantly makes peace in his neighborhood, including bringing together a warring home of two families, one Irish and one Jewish.

title: Troilus and Cressida
description: The Trojans Troilus and Cressida have an affair during the Trojan War but are separated when Cressida is exchanged for a Greek prisoner of war, in William Shakespeare's tragedy.

title: Protective Custody
description: A female American reporter is imprisoned in Eastern Europe on a trumped up charge, only to be released some years later having converted to Communism.

title: Small War on Murray Hill
description: A married American woman offers hospitality to a British general in her home, delaying his army's advances and allowing for a strategic breakthrough for George Washington's army, in Robert E. Sherwood's fanciful account of a historic incident.

title: A Clearing in the Woods
description: A young woman faces both her past and present demons by walking alone in the woods, in Arthur Laurents' play.

title: The Waltz of the Toreadors
description: A retired general is flagrantly unfaithful to his bedridden wife, and reunites with a woman with whom he danced the Waltz of the Toreadors 17 years earlier — and who is now out to prove the wife's infidelity to land her man at last.

title: Waiting for Godot
description: In Samuel Beckett's absurdist masterpiece, two tramps wait perpetually for an enigmatic figure in a blurred universe where time, place and memory defy conventional logic.

title: Measure for Measure
description: A postulant learns that her brother is to be executed for getting his fiancée pregnant. She pleads for his life with the moralistic deputy governing for the absent duke, but is forced to yield her virginity unless she can find a way to outsmart him, in William Shakespeare's study of political and sexual hypocrisy.

title: The Hidden River
description: A French family is haunted by betrayals that led one son to be captured and tortured and another to be imprisoned during World War II.

title: The Potting Shed
description: A young man tries to piece together what has left him estranged from his father and family and alone in the world, in Graham Greene's play.

title: Eugenia
description: A European baroness and her dilettante brother come to America to make good and to marry well in this adaptation of the Henry James novel The Europeans.

title: Christophe Colomb
description: Paul Claudel dramatizes the life of Christopher Columbus, the Italian explorer who discovered America on an expedition from Spain, in an allegorical fashion.

title: Volpone
description: A Venetian gentleman pretends to be dying in order to dupe the friends who hope to be heirs to his great fortune, in Ben Jonson's satire of greed.

title: A Visit to a Small Planet
description: An alien visits Earth hoping to see the Civil War but lands in a 20th-century Virginia family's back yard. He decides to stay even after discovering his mistake and orchestrates a war between the U.S. and the Soviet Union instead.

title: Le Misanthrope
description: In Moliere's 1666 satire of social hypocrisy, a Paris aristocrat detests the shallow artifice of his peers but falls for a flirtatious girl who gleefully exhibits all the social traits he hates.

title: The Misanthrope
description: In Moliere's 1666 satire of social hypocrisy, a Paris aristocrat detests the shallow artifice of his peers but falls for a flirtatious girl who gleefully exhibits all the social traits he hates.

title: Les Nuits De La Colere / Feu La Mere De Madame
description:
An evening of two plays that features Armand Salacrou's Les Nuits de la Colere and Georges Feydeau's Feu la Mere de Madame.
Les Nuits de la Colere examines the betrayal that led to the execution of a French Resistance fighter and the friend who betrayed him.
In Feu la Mere de Madame, a woman's husband awakens her at four in the morning, returning from a party in which a naked girl appeared representing Aphrodite. Comical complications result from the wife's prudery and jealousy.

title: The Tunnel of Love
description: A married suburban couple, unable to conceive, plans to adopt a child, but a disagreement between the wife and the adoption agent leads to not one, but two unexpected pregnancies.

title: Holiday for Lovers
description: An American family makes its first trip to Europe to visit their daughter who is studying in Paris but find that their daughter, and they too, have fallen sway to the romance of the City of Love.

title: Intermezzo
description: A shy schoolteacher's claims that she sees a ghost are rebuffed by her provincial fellow townspeople, until the ghost starts wreaking havoc that only she can calm.

title: Le Chien du Jardinier / Les Adieux
description:
An evening featuring Lope de Vega's Le Chien du Jardinier, as well as Les Adieux, a special "farewell" to the audience by the performers.
Le Chien du Jardinier follows a secretary who loves her boss and is unable to voice objections to his upcoming marriage.
In Les Adieux, the actors who have been performing several classic French plays in repertory provide their own "farewell" to the audience, featuring samplings of other productions.

title: The Taming of the Shrew
description: A wandering braggart out to marry for money ends up with the shrewish daughter of a rich man, whom he must "tame" even as he falls for her, in William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: A Hole in the Head
description: A widower allows his young son to run wild in a Miami Beach hotel, until his brother and sister-in-law come to raise the child themselves in Arnold Schulman's play.

title: Ziegfeld Follies of 1957
description: Beatrice Lillie, Jane Morgan and Billie De Wolfe are among the headliners of this edition of the Ziegfeld Follies revues of songs, dances, sketches and showgirls.

title: Good as Gold
description: A young scientist finds a way to grow an unbelievably large cabbage and appeals to Washington to use it to cure hunger, in John Patrick's adaptation of Alfred Toombs's novel.

title: The Sin of Pat Muldoon
description: A man who abandoned his religion for booze and women after the death of his son is now dying, but he survives the harangues of his wife and older daughter long enough to match his younger daughter up with a Mexican man.

title: The Duchess of Malfi
description: A Duchess secretly marries beneath her station, leading her brothers to take revenge with tragic consequences.

title: Orpheus Descending
description: A Sicilian immigrant's daughter, unhappily running a dry-goods store in the South and tending to her dying husband, is reawakened by a mysterious drifter who appears in town.

title: Brigadoon
description: Two Americans game-hunting in Scotland happen upon a mysterious village in which the people dress and speak as if from another era. One of the Americans is drawn to one of the Scottish lasses and must choose between the magical Brigadoon and his conventional fiancée back in New York.

title: Hotel Paradiso
description: This mad French frolic finds an assortment of refined people skulking through the halls and rooms of a cheap hotel comically intent on assignations.

title: Shinbone Alley
description: A cockroach's misadventures, particularly his love for a self-involved alley cat who has a series of unfortunate romances with other cats, is the subject of George Kleinsinger, Joe Darion and Mel Brooks' adaptation of Don Marquis' stories.

title: The First Gentleman
description: The Prince Regent who will become George IV of England wants to marry his daughter to William of Orange. She chooses Leopold of Saxe-Coburg, setting in motion events that make Queen Victoria's accession to the throne possible.

title: Livin' the Life
description: Mark Twain's Mississippi River-set novels and short stories, including Life on the Mississippi, The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn and The Adventures of Tom Sawyer, are the basis for this musical.

title: A Moon for the Misbegotten
description: Set in a dilapidated Connecticut farmhouse in 1923, this American classic centers on Josie, a towering Irish woman with a quick tongue and a ruined reputation; her conniving father, Phil Hogan; and Jim Tyrone, Hogan's landlord and drinking companion, a cynical alcoholic haunted by the death of his mother.

title: The Greatest Man Alive
description: A 72-year-old man tries to commit suicide but is constantly interrupted, in Tony Webster's comedy.

title: New Girl in Town
description: A weary former prostitute seeks out her estranged sea captain father, hoping to find forgiveness from him and love with a stoker from whom she attempts to conceal her past, in Bob Merrill and George Abbott's musical adaptation of Eugene O'Neill's Anna Christie.

title: Simply Heavenly
description: A black man resolves to be his own man and win his girl when he is worthy of her, after complications involving his incoming divorce and a flirtatious neighbor, in David Martin and Langston Hughes' musical adaptation of some of Hughes' stories.

title: Mask and Gown
description: Female impersonator T.C. Jones headlines this revue, featuring four other performers and showcasing Jones' impersonations of Tallulah Bankhead, Bette Davis and other celebrities as well as his comic observations on current events.

title: Carousel
description: Brash carousel barker Billy Bigelow and Julie Jordan, a quiet girl who works in the mill, fall in love, marry, and have a stormy relationship that leads to tragedy and an attempt at mending old wounds from beyond the grave, in Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical adaptation of Ferenc Molnar's play, Liliom.

title: Four Winds
description: A much-married heiress prefers the party-going life until a poet takes her to the beach for a weekend and tells her to find herself.

title: West Side Story
description: West Side Story transposes Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet to the gang-ridden streets of 1950s Manhattan, dominated by the Sharks and the Jets. Two teens from the bitter-enemy gangs meet and fall in love at a fateful gym dance.

title: I Knock at the Door
description: A Dublin boy grows up faced with the prospect of blindness and his father's death, as his mother struggles with whether to keep him indoors for his health or to send him to school, in this adaptation of one of Sean O'Casey's autobiographical novels.

title: Look Back in Anger
description: A discontented working-class Englishman rails against the upper-middle-class wife he lives with in a cramped flat, and he eventually begins an affair with her equally haughty best friend.

title: Miss Lonelyhearts
description: A man who writes a "Miss Lonelyhearts" advice column in Depression-era New York tries to cure the depression he feels over the letters he receives in Howard Teichmann's adaptation of Nathaniel West's novel.

title: Emlyn Williams as a Boy Growing Up
description: Emlyn Williams performs Dylan Thomas' stories of growing up in Wales.

title: Mary Stuart
description: Schiller's political thriller is a partially fictionalized account of the epic power struggle between England's Elizabeth I and Mary Queen of Scots, as Mary faces her final days imprisoned for her claim to the English throne.

title: The Egghead
description: A doggedly old-fashioned college professor defends a former black student accused of being a Communist, only to find out that the accusation is true.

title: Romanoff and Juliet
description: The son of a Russian ambassador falls for the daughter of an American ambassador in Peter Ustinov's satire.

title: Under Milk Wood
description: The adventures of the inhabitants of a fictional Welsh village are the subject of Dylan Thomas' play.

title: Nature's Way
description: A composer of musicals and his pregnant wife must cope with a variety of intrusions, in Herman Wouk's comedy.

title: Copper and Brass
description: A female cop falls for a jazz musician while investigating a disturbance of the peace.

title: The Cave Dwellers
description: A group of broken-down performers take shelter in an abandoned theatre, grasping for a living by day and enacting their past triumphs and dreams at night.

title: Monique
description: An unhappy wife is persuaded to murder her husband by a lover, only to see the scheme unravel, in an adaptation of the novel by Pierre Boileau and Thomas Narcejac, which also inspired the 1954 film Diabolique.

title: Compulsion
description: Two young men commit what they think is "the perfect murder," until they are caught, in Meyer Levin's adaptation of his novel, based on the Leopold and Loeb trial.

title: The Square Root of Wonderful
description: A Southern mother has made a nervous old maid out of her daughter and an embittered writer out of her son, who has divorced his wife and now seeks to break up her new love affair, in Carson McCullers' play.

title: Jamaica
description: A Jamaican woman dreams of moving to New York City, despite her boyfriend's contentment with the island life, in Harold Arlen, E.Y. Harburg and Fred Saidy's musical.

title: Fair Game
description: A divorced woman who comes to New York to go to college models garments to pay for college and soon attracts the attention of several businessmen.

title: Rumple
description: A comic strip illustrator gives up his work after surviving an airplane crash, leading his two most famous characters to come to life and plead for further adventures.

title: Time Remembered
description: An eccentric duchess hires a milliner to impersonate a dead ballerina, whom her nephew loved, in hopes that he will love again.

title: Nude with Violin
description: The family and friends of a deceased famous French painter meet in his studio hoping to get some of his money, only to discover that all of his paintings were painted by others, in Noel Coward's comedy.

title: The Rope Dancers
description: A cold woman tortures her young daughter, who was born with six fingers on one hand, and her weak husband.

title: The Country Wife
description: The cad Horner pretends to be impotent to seduce the married women of London, and he finds the naïve Margery Pinchwife, visiting from the country, particularly besotted with him in William Wycherley's Restoration comedy.

title: Look Homeward, Angel
description: An overbearing mother forces her husband and children to help her run a North Carolina boardinghouse, nearly crushing the dream of her youngest son to go to college and be a writer, in Ketti Frings' Pulitzer Prize-winning adaptation of Thomas Wolfe's novel.

title: The Makropoulos Secret
description: The daughter of the German emperor, who fled court life with a life-lengthening potion to become a great opera singer, contributes important information to a case between warring families, in Tyrone Guthrie's adaptation of Karel Capek's play.

title: The Dark at the Top of the Stairs
description: An Oklahoma housewife must deal with her discontent salesman husband, shy daughter and overly pampered.

title: The Genius and the Goddess
description: A woman struggles to live with her self-involved physicist husband and is only rallied when she nurses him through pneumonia and has an affair with his assistant.

title: A Shadow of My Enemy
description: The trial of Alger Hiss, a respected U.S. government official who was accused by ex-Communist Party member Whittaker Chambers of being a Soviet spy, is dramatized and slightly fictionalized by Sol Stein.

title: The Music Man
description: Con man Harold Hill comes to River City, Iowa, intending to sell the town and its children on a fake marching-band system and then skip town — until he falls for the local librarian.

title: Miss Isobel
description: An aging woman starts believing that she is a young girl and that her old-maid daughter is her mother.

title: The Chairs and The Lesson
description: An evening of two one-act absurdist plays by Eugene Ionesco.

title: Two for the Seesaw
description: A Nebraska lawyer moves to New York to escape his marriage and has a brief but passionate affair with an eccentric dancer.

title: Summer of the 17th Doll
description: Two Australian field workers come to Melbourne for their 17th summer layoff in a row, planning to enjoy themselves with two barmaids, only to find one of the women is now married and must contemplate the fact that their time has passed.

title: The Body Beautiful
description: A boxing manager must cope with personal problems as well as the problems of his prize boxer, a Dartmouth graduate whose girlfriend disapproves of his fighting.

title: Maybe Tuesday
description: Seven working girls share a New York apartment and scheme to land husbands.

title: Sunrise at Campobello
description: Franklin Delano Roosevelt's struggle to return to political life after he was stricken with polio in 1921, with the help of his wife Eleanor and trusted adviser Louis Howe, is the subject of Dore Schary's play.

title: Present Laughter
description: Noel Coward's totally-irresistible and semi-autobiographical comedy follows a self-obsessed actor in the midst of a mid-life crisis. Freely indulging his considerable appetite for wine, women and sleeping late, the theatre’s favorite leading man suddenly finds himself caught between fawning ingénues, crazed playwrights, secret trysts and unexpected twists.

title: The Infernal Machine
description: The ancient Greek myth of Oedipus, who unknowingly became the king of Thebes only after killing his father and marrying his mother, is reworked and re-dramatized by Jean Cocteau.

title: Oh Captain!
description: An English sea captain sails from Surrey to Paris every week, keeping a wife in England and a mistress in Paris, in the musical adaptation of the 1953 film The Captain's Paradise.

title: Winesburg, Ohio
description: A man grows up in but ultimately abandons a stifling Midwestern town, in this adaptation of a series of short stories by Sherwood Anderson.

title: Interlock
description: A young German refugee introduces her aspiring concert pianist boyfriend to the rich woman she cares for, hoping the woman will help his career, but she gradually realizes the woman wants him for herself.

title: Transposed Heads
description: Two friends are driven to drastic measures over their love for the same woman in Peggy Glanville Hicks' opera, set in India and adapted from Thomas Mann's novel.

title: The Entertainer
description: A seedy London music-hall performer's terrible act is contrasted with scenes from his family life.

title: Cloud 7
description: A suburban husband and father decides to quit his job at a frozen foods business to spend time with his family, horrifying his wife but delighting their friends and her daughter.

title: The Day the Money Stopped
description: The family black sheep and his priggish brother drag out the family's secrets as they battle over a will.

title: Portofino
description: An Italian duke who races cars falls for a rival driver from Texas in a musical that also features a priest, a witch and a henchman of the Devil.

title: Blue Denim
description: A 15-year-old boy avoids his parents by drinking and carousing with friends in his basement — until he gets a girl pregnant and must scramble to figure out what to do.

title: Who Was That Lady I Saw You With?
description: A chemistry professor's wife catches him kissing a female student and is ready to divorce until the professor's friend concocts the idea that the kiss was part of an FBI spy job. When the FBI learns about the ruse, various complications ensue.

title: The Waltz of the Toreadors
description: A retired general is flagrantly unfaithful to his bedridden wife, and reunites with a woman with whom he danced the Waltz of the Toreadors 17 years earlier — and who is now out to prove the wife's infidelity to land her man at last.

title: International Soiree
description: This revue features American comedian Hiram Sherman and French chanteuse Patachou.

title: Two Gentlemen of Verona
description: Bachelor friends Valentine and Proteus compete for the loves of Silvia and then Julia before being paired with their rightful mates, in William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: Back to Methuselah
description: The travails of humankind, from Adam and Eve through those of an old man in 31,000 A.D., are dramatized and satirized by George Bernard Shaw.

title: Martha Graham and Company
description: Martha Graham and her modern dance company perform in concert on Broadway.

title: The Broken Jug
description: A trial over the breaking of a jug, which a girl the judge fancies reveals was committed by the judge himself, is the subject of Heinrich von Kleist's 1808 play.

title: Say, Darling
description: The heady experience of putting on a Broadway musical is dramatized, with some music, from Bissell's novella based on his experience adapting his novel into The Pajama Game.

title: Joyce Grenfell (Monologues and Songs)
description: English actress and mimic Joyce Grenfell headlines an evening of satirical monologues and songs in the guise of various characters.

title: The Next President
description: This revue of songs and comedy highlights the political satirist Mort Sahl.

title: Love Me Little
description: A 17-year-old girl falls for and pursues a shy Princeton undergraduate in John G. Fuller's play.

title: The Firstborn
description: The Biblical story of Moses' turning from the Egyptian royal family who raised him to the enslaved and persecuted Jewish people who were his true ancestors is dramatized by Christopher Fry.

title: Le Malade Imaginaire
description: A hypochondriac plans to marry his daughter to a doctor though she loves another man, in Moliere's 1673 comedy.

title: Jane Eyre
description: An orphaned and mistreated girl finds apparent happiness with the mysterious owner of an English manor house when she comes to serve as his ward's governess, but a dreadful secret nearly destroys their happiness, in Huntington Hartford's adaptation of Charlotte Bronte's novel.

title: The Visit
description: A rich, oft-married widow returns to her poor childhood town in central Europe, offering its citizens a billion marks for the life of the man who seduced and abandoned her years ago and is now the town's most respected citizen.

title: An Evening of 3 Farces
description:
Three farces by Moliere, all performed in French.
In Le Mariage Force, an old man determines to marry a flirtatious young woman despite his friend's protests.
Sganarelle details a man's attempts to kill his wife's supposed lover.
La Jalousie de Barbouille follows a husband and wife who continuously complain about each other, leading to various farcical and romantic complications.

title: Jerome Robbins' Ballet: U.S.A.
description: Jerome Robbins' ballet company Ballets U.S.A. performs four of his dance pieces

title: Howie
description: A jobless man drives his family to distraction by correcting them on everything and always being right, in Phoebe Ephron's play.

title: Handful of Fire
description: A series of unrequited love affairs are destroyed by corruption and vice in a bordello and gambling bar in a Mexican border town.

title: A Touch of the Poet
description: The first and only finished play in Eugene O'Neill's proposed 11-part "American history" cycle addresses the immigrant experience, focusing on the father-daughter conflict of a once-wealthy, still grandly mannered tavern-keeper outside Boston in 1828 and his headstrong offspring who aligns herself with a rich American.

title: Ballet Español
description: The flamenco dance company Ballet Espanol performs a dance concert on Broadway.

title: Drink to Me Only
description: A playboy on trial for shooting his ex-wife claims what seems to be ridiculously excessive drunkenness.

title: Goldilocks
description: A silent filmmaker cons a stage actress preparing to give up her career for marriage into making a film for him, not entirely for professional reasons.

title: The World of Suzie Wong
description: A Canadian painter unknowingly rents a room in a Hong Kong bordello and falls for a kind-hearted prostitute, in Paul Osborn's adaptation of Richard Mason's novel.

title: Lorenzaccio
description: Alfred de Musset's 1832 play depicts Lorenzo de Medici, the 16th-century Florentine nobleman who killed his tyrannical cousin but did not establish a republican government afterwards and was forever disgraced by a debaucherous past.

title: The Girls in 509
description: A staunchly Republican woman and her niece have been hiding in a hotel since Franklin Roosevelt's presidential election, only to reemerge into a world where Dwight Eisenhower is president and they have enormous wealth thanks to a brother's eccentric investments.

title: Le Triomphe de l'Amour
description: A princess falls for the heir to the kingdom her family took over. To win him, she disguises herself as a boy and must deal with the anti-passion thinking of the prince's aunt and uncle in Marivaux's 1732 farce.

title: The Family Reunion
description: The estranged family of a dying English lady convenes, including her eldest son who is haunted by the belief that he is responsible for his wife's death in an accident on a ship, in T.S. Eliot's tense drama.

title: Once More, With Feeling
description: A tyrannical orchestra conductor leaves both musicians and trustees cowering in his wake.

title: Marie Tudor
description: Mary I of England, or Mary Tudor, who struggled with her family to gain and maintain the throne and re-introduced Catholicism to the Protestant country during her brief reign, is the subject of Victor Hugo's play.

title: The Pleasure of His Company
description: A forever-wandering father returns home for his daughter's wedding and turns all plans for it upside down in Samuel Taylor's comedy.

title: Make a Million
description: A Southern girl, pregnant by an unknown soldier, is winning a quiz show and must be married quickly to save face on the program.

title: Don Juan
description: Lothario Don Juan and his frustrated servant Sganarelle must avoid being trapped by Don Juan's latest conquest, and then murdered by her brothers after he abandons her, in Moliere's 1665 comedy.

title: Patate
description: The relationship between a heel who has struck it rich and his patate, or patsy, is the subject of Irwin Shaw's adaptation of Marcel Archard's French play.

title: The Marriage-Go-Round
description: A married academic couple lecture and illustrate what makes a good marriage, even as theirs is threatened by a Swedish sexpot.

title: The Man in the Dog Suit
Le Cid
description: The medieval Spanish son of a former general and the daughter of the current general fall in love despite their fathers' enmity, which leads to tragic tension until the son defends the city from the Moors and earns the title of "the Cid."

title: Epitaph for George Dillon
description: A failed actor and playwright is taken into the home of a lower-middle-class family, causing personal and sexual tensions until he finds success by selling out, in John Osborne and Anthony Creighton's play.

title: Beryozka Russian Dance Company
description: The Beryozka Russian Dance Company performs an evening of Russian music and dance.

title: Maria Golovin
description: The wife of a prisoner of war falls for another soldier who returns from the war blinded, in Gian-Carlo Menotti's opera.

title: Comes a Day
description: An alcoholic Southerner's wife is desperate to find her daughter a husband, willfully looking past the only candidate's violent nature until it is too late.

title: La Plume de Ma Tante
description: A cast of 16 performs a series of skits, many in pantomime, that satirize French culture and customs.

title: The Shadow of a Gunman
description: A poet rooming in a Dublin slum is mistaken for a fugitive member of the I.R.A.

title: Edwin Booth
description: The life of Edwin Booth, the great 19th-century actor whose brother John Wilkes Booth murdered Abraham Lincoln, is the subject of Milton Geiger's play.

title: Cue for Passion
description: A man returns to his California home after time in Asia to discover his father dead, and he becomes convinced that his uncle murdered his father and is sleeping with his mother, in Elmer Rice's update of Hamlet.

title: Britannicus
description: Britannicus, son and heir to the Roman emperor Claudius, sees his throne and fiancée Junia snatched from him by his stepbrother Nero, the corrupt son of his stepmother Agrippina.

title: Flower Drum Song
description: A traditional Chinese bride is brought to San Francisco to marry an assimilating son who exasperates his old-world father by chasing after an Americanized nightclub singer, in Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical adaptation of C.Y. Lee's novel.

title: The Night Circus
description: A woman who is pregnant with her fiancée's child leaves him at the altar for a rough-hewn sailor, with tragic consequences for the couple and the girl's family.

title: The Disenchanted
description: A promising writer succumbs to the whirlwind of Jazz Age liquor and parties. To make money, he finds himself writing a quick Hollywood screenplay, for which he has no talent.

title: The Cold Wind and the Warm
description: A disturbed young college student suffers tragically from unrequited love in a Jewish neighborhood in Massachusetts, in S.N. Berhman's nostalgic comedy-drama.

title: Twelfth Night
description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

title: The Power and the Glory
description: A Catholic priest who lives in Mexico at a time when the Mexican government strove to suppress the Catholic Church is the subject of Denis Cannan's adaptation of Graham Greene's novel.

title: J.B.
description: A successful American industrialist survives unspeakable and unexplainable disasters, ultimately confronting God, in Archibald MacLeish's Pulitzer Prize-winning update of the Book of Job, which is re-told within the framework of a circus sideshow performance.

title: The Gazebo
description: A man counteracts a planned blackmail against him by plotting the blackmailer's murder, in Alec Coppel's comic thriller.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Whoop-Up
description: The complications in the romance between a part-Native American rodeo performer and his girlfriend, who runs a saloon on a Native American reservation in Montana, are the subject of this musical adaptation of Dan Cushman's novel Stay Away, Joe.

title: A Party with Betty Comden & Adolph Green
description: Lyricists Betty Comden and Adolph Green (On the Town, Wonderful Town, Bells Are Ringing, Peter Pan) perform many of their classic songs and discuss their careers in this two-person show.

title: King Henry V
description: William Shakespeare's play portrays the victory of the English King Henry V over the French at the Battle of Agincourt during the Hundred Years' War.

title: Ages of Man
description: Sir John Gielgud performs Shakespearean soliloquies, scenes and sonnets in this one-man show.

title: Third Best Sport
description: A corporate executive's bride joins him on an industrial convention and winds up a fish out of water, eventually insulting a prospective client's wife.

title: Rashomon
description: In this stage adaptation of the 1950 Japanese film, multiple perspectives recount the tale of a bandit who may or may not have murdered a stranger he came upon in the woods and raped the man's wife.

title: Tall Story
description: Two college professors come to terms over a star basketball player who is being kept out of the big game because of his grades.

title: Requiem for a Nun
description: The formerly wantonish Temple Drake, now respectably married, finds her child dead and her black servant on trial for the murder, in William Faulkner's continuation of the story in his novel Sanctuary.

title: Redhead
description: A spinster who models for the wax statues models for a recently murdered young woman and winds up solving the murder's mystery with the deceased woman's brother, with whom she falls in love.

title: The Rivalry
description: Norman Corwin dramatizes the Lincoln-Douglas debates, in which Abraham Lincoln and Stephen Douglas campaigned against each other for a position in the Illinois state senate, chiefly over the subject of slavery.

title: The Legend of Lizzie
description: Lizzie Borden, who became a legendary figure after she was accused of murdering her father and stepmother in a small Massachusetts town in the 1800s, is the subject of Reginald Lawrence's play.

title: The Most Happy Fella
description: A middle-aged Italian vineyard owner falls in love with a pretty waitress from afar, sends her the picture of his handsome foreman, and convinces her to move to his California vineyard and marry him, in Frank Loesser's musical adaptation of Sidney Howard's play They Knew What They Wanted.

title: Les Ballets Africains
description: The national dance company of Guinea performs a dance concert on Broadway.

title: A Majority of One
description: A Jewish widow meets and falls in love with a Japanese business mogul on a cruise to Tokyo in Leonard Spigelgass's play.

title: The Beaux Stratagem
description: Two impoverished young gentlemen plan to travel through small towns romancing and collecting money from rich women, which leads to comic complications, in George Farquhar's 1707 comedy.

title: God and Kate Murphy
description: A domineering Irish mother ruins her two sons' dreams in Kieran Tunne's play.

title: Look After Lulu
description: The romantic misadventures of a much-admired turn-of-the-20th-century French prostitute are the subject of Noel Coward's adaptation of a Georges Feydeau farce.

title: Juno
description: A resolutely unemployed Irishman would rather drink away his days than help his family survive the country's violent rebellion against England, in Marc Blitzstein and Joseph Stein's musical adaptation of Sean O'Casey's Juno and the Paycock.

title: Sweet Bird of Youth
description: An aging actress has an affair with a young drifter, who hopes to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart, the daughter of a powerful politician who is out to destroy him.

title: A Raisin in the Sun
description: Lorraine Hansberry's landmark drama was one of the first on Broadway to examine African-American life on the cusp of the civil rights era.  Walter Younger and his mother, Lena, both yearn to move their family out of Chicago's Southside ghetto.  When Lena's late husband's insurance check arrives, Lena hopes to use it to buy a house in a white neighborhood — while Walter hopes to invest it in a liquor business.

title: Masquerade
description: An emotionally disturbed and sexually frigid woman is the subject of Sigmund Miller's play.

title: First Impressions
description: Strong-willed Elizabeth Bennett plans to defy her mother's blatant attempts to match her up with the wealthy Darcy, but the two fall for each other even as they spar and suffer complications, in this musical adaptation of Jane Austen's novel Pride and Prejudice.

title: A Desert Incident
description: A mysterious research complex is the setting for Pearl S. Buck's allegorical play, which explores the dangers of nuclear research.
