title: Kataki
description: An American GI and a Japanese soldier are stranded on a South Pacific island during World War II and must bond together to survive.

title: Triple Play
description:
An evening of three one-acts and a monologue, including Tennessee Williams' Portrait of a Madonna, Anton Chekhov's Some Comments on the Harmful Effects of Tobacco, and Sean O'Casey's A Pound On Demand and Bedtime Story.
Portrait of a Madonna follows a deranged Southern belle who is convinced that the love of her life, who rejected her for someone else, visits her for sex every night.
Some Comments on the Harmful Effects of Tobacco is a monologue given by a smoker who has been sent by his domineering wife to lecture on tobacco's effects, when he would rather talk about his wife.
A Pound On Demand is a comedy in which a drunk and his sober sidekick must deal with the matter of his account in a Dublin post office.
In Bedtime Story, an Irish prostitute fleeces the Puritanical bachelor whom she has just serviced.

title: The National Theater of the Deaf
Destry Rides Again
description: A sheriff who would prefer not to shoot a gun is compelled to use one by a criminal on the loose in the vice-ridden Western town he's sent to run, in Harold Rome and Leonard Gershe's musical adaptation of the much-filmed story.

title: Once Upon a Mattress
description: In this musical version of The Princess and the Pea, Princess Winnifred is an ungainly, brash girl competing for the hand of Prince Dauntless, whose domineering mother Queen Aggravain has declared he must marry a "true" princess before anyone else in the kingdom can marry.

title: Judy Garland
description: Legendary singer Judy Garland performs in concert on Broadway.

title: The Nervous Set
description: The Greenwich Village beatnik generation is satirized and contrasted with the "squares" in this musical.

title: Gypsy
description: Indomitable stage mother Rose chases vicarious success and stardom as she pushes her daughters through the vaudeville circuit. When Baby June flees the act to elope, Rose vows to make introverted Louise into a star.

title: Billy Barnes Revue
description: A cast of eight performs songs by Billy Barnes and sketches by cast member Bob Rodgers in this musical revue.

title: Much Ado About Nothing
description: The anti-romantic wits Beatrice and Benedick, who profess to hate each other, are forced by their friends' trickery to admit their true feelings as they help to save the wedding of his fellow soldier Claudio and her cousin Hero.

title: An Evening with Yves Montand
description: French singer Yves Montand performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Ballet Español
description: The flamenco dance company Ballet Espanol performs a dance concert on Broadway.

title: Ballet Español
description: The flamenco dance company Ballet Espanol performs a dance concert on Broadway.

title: The Gang's All Here
description: Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee portray U.S. President Warren G. Harding as an unintelligent man entirely dependent on his powerful cronies for support until it is nearly too late to realize the extent of their corruption.

title: The Great God Brown
description: Billy Brown and Dion Anthony, childhood friends and sons of business partners, both fall in love with Margaret and use different masks (physical and metaphorical) to change their personalities and win her at different times. Billy poses as Dion until he is discovered and abandoned, forgetting his true identity.

title: Happy Town
description: A Texas town that doesn't have a single millionaire is the subject of Gordon Duffy, Harry M. Haldane, Max Hampton and Paul Nassau's musical.

title: At the Drop of a Hat
description: Composer Donald Swann and lyricist Michael Flanders perform a series of their songs, with Flanders interjecting comments, in this two-man show.

title: Moonbirds
description: A man learns that he can change his mother into a canary during the full moon, leading his family to deal with the practicalities of the situation, in Marcel Ayme's comic fantasy.

title: Chéri
description: A courtesan's son who has been brought up to marry well has a tortured affair with another older courtesan, in Anita Loos' adaptation of two novels by Colette.

title: Bayanihan
description: Bayanihan, the Philippine dance company, performs an evening of their country's folk dances.

title: Golden Fleecing
description: Navy officers stationed in Venice plot to win roulette with the help of their ship's computer.

title: Heartbreak House
description: On the eve of World War I, unlikely romantic encounters occur during a most unusual country weekend.

title: The Miracle Worker
description: This family drama is based on the true story of a young deaf and blind girl, Helen Keller, and her dedicated teacher Annie Sullivan, who struggles to reach into Helen's isolation and bring her into contact with the outside world.

title: The Warm Peninsula
description: Two women, one a plain spinster and the other a more worldly woman, both describe their unhappy love affairs with unavailable men.

title: Flowering Cherry
description: A household sinks under the weight of its insecure, blustering patriarch in Robert Bolt's play.

title: Take Me Along
description: In Bob Merrill, Joseph Stein and Robert Russell's musical version of Eugene O'Neill's Ah, Wilderness!, Richard Miller comes of age while attempting to woo Muriel Macomber, while his drink-loving Uncle Sid attempts to reform his ways to win Richard's aunt Lilly.

title: The Girls Against the Boys
description: The female cast "battles" the male cast in a series of songs and sketches in this musical revue.

title: The Highest Tree
description: A well-known atomic scientist is diagnosed with leukemia, likely due to his work, and advocates for an end to nuclear bomb tests while dealing with his family's troubles.

title: The Tenth Man
description: An unhappy lawyer is pulled off the street by several old Jewish men to serve as the tenth man needed to start a prayer service at a Long Island synagogue. He meets the granddaughter of one of the regulars, who is believed to be possessed by a dybbuk (wandering spirit) and vows to help cure her of her sickness after his own is relieved.

title: The Sound of Music
description: An Austrian maiden must choose between secular and religious life when her convent sends her to act as nanny to the seven children of a stern navy captain . She falls in love with them, and with him, as Nazi storm clouds gather over her country.

title: Only in America
description: Harry Golden, a real-life Jewish writer, moves to South Carolina and charms his Gentile neighbors until his past stint in prison comes back to haunt him, in Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee's adaptation of Golden's book.

title: Fiorello!
description: Fiorello LaGuardia's life, including his years as an anti-Tammany Hall political crusader, through World War I, and onto his election as mayor of New York City, is the subject of this Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning musical by Jerry Bock, Sheldon Harnick, George Abbott and Jerome Weidman.

title: Lysistrata
description: A Greek woman persuades her fellow female citizens to withhold sex from their husbands so that they may peacefully end the Peloponnesian War, in Aristophanes' comic look at the eternal battle of the sexes.

title: A Loss of Roses
description: An out-of-work dancer comes to stay with the much-too-close mother and son for whom she had once worked as a maid, in William Inge's play.

title: Five Finger Exercise
description: A self-hating young German man takes a job as a tutor for a family in post-war England and tries to make them see how insignificant their personal dramas are, with disastrous results.

title: Silent Night, Lonely Night
description: A woman with an unfaithful husband and distant prep-school son and a man with a wife staying in a sanitarium come together in a New England inn on Christmas Eve, unburden their troubles, and sleep together before returning to their old lives.

title: Jolly's Progress
description: A black maid in Alabama, who has been seduced by her employer and fired by his wife, finds refuge in a teacher-student relationship with a sympathetic writer, whom the town assumes is seducing the girl.

title: Saratoga
description: An illegitimate Creole girl and a Montana cowboy meet in New Orleans while attempting to get revenge on past wrongs. They team up and struggle to avoid their growing attraction to each other in Harold Arlen, Johnny Mercer and Morton Da Costa's musical adaptation of Edna Ferber's novel Saratoga Trunk.

title: The Fighting Cock
description: A retired general disappointed with the lack of honor in the world begins a crusade to rid it of the infidels, a crusade that meets with much opposition from those who accept the world as it is.

title: Belafonte at the Palace
description: Harry Belafonte performs an evening of calypso and pop music on Broadway.

title: Goodbye, Charlie
description: A lecherous Hollywood writer dies and is reincarnated as a woman in George Axelrod's comedy.

title: Pictures in the Hallway
description: A Dublin teenager overcomes a childhood haunted by impending blindness to meet girls and get his first job, in this adaptation of one of Sean O'Casey's autobiographical novels.

title: The Andersonville Trial
description: In this dramatization of a real-life trial, a superintendent of a Civil War prison where Union soldiers were badly treated is put on trial. It is suggested that he was responsible less for authorizing the conditions than for acting upon the orders of authorities.

title: A Mighty Man Is He
description: The wife and mistress of a philandering Broadway producer meet in his apartment after he has been in a car accident, only to discover that a third woman was in the car with him.

title: Peer Gynt
description: The son of a wandering salesman is the focus of his mother's hopes of paying back his father's debts, though he would rather drink and play the field, in Henrik Ibsen's 1867 adaptation of a Norwegian fairy tale.

title: A Distant Bell
description: One of the three repressed daughters of a mentally unbalanced woman falls for a young newspaperman, only to have her young sister win him for herself with tragic consequences.

title: Cut of the Axe
description: Small-town vagabonds are jailed for a murder that was actually committed by the police chief.

title: The Deadly Game
description: An American visiting a Swiss chalet meets a retired judge, defense lawyer and prosecutor who stage "trials" for their own amusement, putting him on "trial" for a murder which, it turns out, he may actually have been responsible for.

title: Roman Candle
description: A girl who has extra-sensory perception falls in love with an army scientist in Sidney Sheldon's comedy.

title: A Lovely Light
description: Dorothy Stickney tells the story of 1920s poet Edna St. Vincent Millay through excerpts from her poetry and letters.

title: Beg, Borrow Or Steal
description: 1950s city beatniks are the subject of Leon Prober and Bud Freeman's musical adaptation of a story by Freeman and Marvin Seiger.

title: Caligula
description: The life of Caligula, the half-mad, dictatorial Roman emperor, is dramatized by Albert Camus.

title: The Long Dream
description: The son of a well-to-do black man who made money by "Uncle Tom"-ing and bargaining with a corrupt police chief discovers his father's past with tragic consequences, in Ketti Frings' adaptation of the Richard Wright novel.

title: The Cool World
description: Warren Miller and Robert Rossen's adaptation of Miller's novel looks at black juvenile delinquents in Harlem.

title: The Tumbler
description: A farmer and young farm woman meet and make love on sight before she learns he is her stepfather and may have killed her father.

title: Toys in the Attic
description: A weak man who has always been dependant on his domineering sisters and wealthy wife mysteriously comes into money on his own, causing the women in his life to dread the sense of independence it gives him, in Lillian Hellman's play.

title: A Thurber Carnival
description: A cast of eight present a series of skits based on the whimsical writings of James Thurber in this comic revue.

title: There Was a Little Girl
description: A well-bred 18-year-old girl is assaulted and raped by hoodlums, in Daniel Taradash's adaptation of Christopher Davis' novel.

title: King Henry IV, Part I
description: Henry IV's son, Prince Hal, must put aside his preference for drunken carousing with Sir John Falstaff and other lowlifes when his father's throne is threatened by the rebel Hotspur.

title: The Good Soup
description: An aging woman recalls her journey from prostitution to respectable wife and mother to disgraced woman, in Garson Kanin's adaptation of Felicien Marceau's French play.

title: Greenwillow
description: A mythical village boasts a family that has been cursed for generations with an eldest son who is determined to wander. The current eldest son vows never to marry in hopes of ending the curse, in Frank Loesser and Lesser Samuels' musical adaptation of the B.J. Chutes novel.

title: Semi-Detached
description: A two-family home is occupied by an English-speaking family and a French-speaking family, who are both kept apart by snobbery and prejudices until tragedy brings them together.

title: Dear Liar
description: The often contentious but fiercely devoted platonic love affair between playwright George Bernard Shaw and the actress known as Mrs. Patrick Campbell is dramatized through a reading of their correspondence.

title: One More River
description: A tyrannical first mate, who has taken over a ship after the captain's death, is put on trial for blinding a deck boy, though the angry crew would prefer a swift death penalty.

title: The Best Man
description: A well-born, womanizing idealist and an ambitious member of the working class compete for the office of President of the United States in Gore Vidal's satire of campaign double-dealings.

title: Viva Madison Avenue!
description: George Panetta's comedy spoofs the changing advertising world of the late 1950s and early 1960s.

title: A Second String
description: A French playwright finds his wife and mistress battling over him, until they decide to unite against him, in Lucienne Hill's adaptation of the Colette novel.

title: Bye Bye Birdie
description: The MacAfee family and the residents of Sweet Apple, Ohio, go topsy-turvy when teen idol Conrad Birdie comes to town to serenade one lucky fan before he enters the Army.

title: King Henry IV, Part II
description: Having defeated Hotspur, Prince Hal becomes King Henry V upon the death of his father, but in order to become a proper king, he must now reject Sir John Falstaff, the drunk and petty criminal with whom he had kept company in younger days.

title: Duel of Angels
description: The righteous wife of a priggish judge, who snubs anyone involved in sexual scandal, is drugged and made to believe she herself was raped, in Jean Giraudoux's play.

title: From A to Z
description: Musical numbers and skits satirizing contemporary life are the subject of this revue.

title: West Side Story
description: West Side Story transposes Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet to the gang-ridden streets of 1950s Manhattan, dominated by the Sharks and the Jets. Two teens from the bitter-enemy gangs meet and fall in love at a fateful gym dance.

title: Christine
description: An Irish woman arrives in India to visit her daughter, but she discovers that she has died and finds herself falling in love with her daughter's Indian doctor husband.

title: Martha Graham and Her Dance Company
description: Martha Graham and her Dance Company perform Graham's ballet Clytemnestra, in which the mythical Myceanean queen recalls arranging the murder of the husband who sacrificed her daughter as she makes her own journey to the Underworld.

title: Finian's Rainbow
description: A blend of romantic fantasy and social commentary, Finian's Rainbow follows the adventures of an Irishman and his daughter, who hope to strike it rich in America using a pot of gold stolen from a leprechaun.

title: H.M.S. Pinafore
description: The daughter of the captain of Her Majesty's Ship Pinafore is in love with a humble sailor, despite her father's hopes that she will marry a better-born suitor, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: Vintage '60
description: Current events, including the 1960 presidential race between John F. Kennedy and Richard Nixon, are lampooned in this musical revue.

title: The World of Carl Sandburg
description: A cast of three performs the best of Carl Sandburg's poetry, prose and folk songs in this dramatic reading.

title: The Hostage
description: An English soldier is held hostage in a Dublin lodging house as a reprisal for the recent British arrest of an Irish radical, in Brendan Behan's play.

title: Les Ballets Africains
description: The national dance company of Guinea performs a dance concert on Broadway.

title: Farewell, Farewell Eugene
description: Two reclusive sisters send greeting cards to the outside world through their cousin, for which they make money that goes into a fund to visit their brother in Africa. Various complications, including a runaway marriage, an abandoned baby's appearance on a doorstep, and a revealing letter follow.

title: Irma La Douce
description: In Paris, a poor student falls for a good-hearted prostitute but resents having to "share" her. He disguises himself as a rich client who insists on seeing her exclusively, leading to many comic complications.

title: A Taste of Honey
description: A sensitive working-class English teenager becomes pregnant by a black man, seeking refuge from her tyrannical, promiscuous mother with a gay art student she befriends.

title: Becket
description: The relationship between Henry II of England and his childhood friend Thomas Becket changes when Becket becomes Archbishop of Canterbury and challenges the King's power over the Church, in Jean Anouilh's dramatization of real events.

title: An Evening with Mike Nichols and Elaine May
description: The improvisational comedy duo of Mike Nichols and Elaine May appear together for the first time on Broadway.

title: The Wall
description: Millard Lampnell adapts John Hersey's novel of the plight of Polish Jews in World War II, from being sent to the Warsaw ghetto to gradually being stripped of their freedoms and sent to concentration camps by the Nazis.

title: Tenderloin
description: A preacher campaigns to rid 1890s New York City of its red-light district, ultimately falling victim to an attempted frame-up by a tabloid journalist, in Jerry Bock, Sheldon Harnick, George Abbott and Jerome Weidman's musical.

title: Face of a Hero
description: A white Southern prosecutor knowingly convicts an innocent suspect and becomes a hero of justice, with only a black secretary knowing about the evidence he suppressed.

title: The 49th Cousin
description: Isaac Lowe, a tyrannical and snobbish German Jewish man, nearly destroys the synagogue he founded and his relationships with his three daughters before seeing the error of his ways, in this comedy co-written by the real Lowe's granddaughter, Florence Lowe.

title: She Stoops to Conquer
description: In Oliver Goldsmith's 1773 comedy, a wealthy English countryman attempts to match his daughter up with a wealthy London resident, but when the daughter learns her suitor prefers lower-class women, she must "stoop to conquer" her man by pretending to be a maid.

title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
description: Spirited but poor tomboy Molly Brown marries a prospector who finds silver in Colorado that makes them rich. She finds social acceptance after surviving the Titanic, despite the problems it causes in her marriage.

title: Rape of the Belt
description: In a twist on a classic Greek myth, Theseus and Heracles come to Themiscyra, the capital of the warrior-women tribe of Amazons, in hopes of claiming their queen's belt. Instead, they must battle two queens and contend with the changing whims of the gods.

title: Period of Adjustment
description: Two couples, one married for five years and the other recent newlyweds, experience ups and downs in their relationships, in Tennessee Williams' comedy.

title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
description: A playboy landlord is eager to seduce his latest pretty young tenant but is thrown by the fact that she is moving in with her boyfriend.

title: Advise and Consent
description: The subcommittee investigation of a candidate for Secretary of State serves as an inside look at politics behind closed doors in Washington, D.C., in Loring Mandel's adaptation of Allen Drury's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel.

title: All the Way Home
description: The sudden death of a Southern husband and father and its effect on his family is the subject of Tad Mosel's Pulitzer Prize-winning adaptation of James Agee's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel A Death in the Family.

title: Little Moon of Alban
description: An Irish woman loves a young revolutionary who is killed in Ireland's struggle for freedom just after World War I. She joins a semi-religious order of nurses and winds up nursing, and falling for, the English soldier who killed her former lover.

title: Camelot
description: King Arthur founds the kingdom of Camelot and the Knights of the Round Table, who fight for justice and right, only to see his ideal crumble when his wife Guenevere falls in love with his favorite knight, Sir Lancelot.

title: Send Me No Flowers
description: A hypochondriac mistakenly comes to believe that he is terminally ill and tries to find a new husband for his wife, in Norman Barasch and Carroll Moore's comedy.

title: The Plough and the Stars
description: Residents of an Irish tenement look forward to Ireland's liberation before and after the Easter Uprising in Dublin in 1916, in Sean O'Casey's drama.

title: Love and Libel
description: Robertson Davies' farce depicts the fallout after a small-town newspaper announces an erroneous engagement between children of warring families.

title: Critic's Choice
description: A successful drama critic's wife decides to write a play that is produced on Broadway, leaving her husband in the awkward position of reviewing it.

title: Wildcat
description: Wildcat Jackson, a 1912 Southwesterner looking for oil, hopes to strike it rich and find her crippled sister a husband in Cy Coleman, Carolyn Leigh and N. Richard Nash's musical.

title: Do Re Mi
description: A wheedling pop music promoter places all his bets on a pretty young singer, his latest in a series of get-rich-quick schemes that exasperate his wife and lead to comically disastrous complications.

title: Rhinoceros
description: Berenger is a simple man with a simple life. He has a regular job, drinks too much, and has a flirtatious relationship with his coworker Daisy. But his day is interrupted by a rhinoceros charging through town – then another and another. Berenger begins to ponder the ramifications of literally following the herd. Written just after World War II, RHINOCEROS is still considered a masterpiece of absurdist theatre, where the world is incomprehensible and anything a writer can imagine can happen

title: Show Girl
description: Carol Channing headlines a revue of songs, production numbers and sketches, featuring comedian Jules Munshin and the French vocal quartet Les Quat'Jeudis.

title: The Conquering Hero
description: A small-town son of a heroic soldier enlists in the marines but is immediately discharged because of hay fever. He does not come home, however, until he has made it look like he deserves a hero's welcome, in this musical adaptation of the film Hail the Conquering Hero.

title: The Octoroon
description: The nephew of a deceased Southern judge finds his uncle's plantation financially strapped. He falls for the daughter of his uncle and a slave, who is also desired by the man who plans to sell the plantation's slaves and buy the daughter himself.

title: Julia, Jake and Uncle Joe
description: This stage adaptation of Oriana Atkinson's novel Over at Uncle Joe's fictionalizes the adventures Atkinson had with her husband, New York Times drama critic Brooks Atkinson, when they went to Russia while he served as Moscow correspondent for the Times.

title: Midgie Purvis
description: A childish 50-year-old woman leaves her dismissive family, disguises herself as an 80-year-old woman, and becomes a babysitter.

title: Once There Was a Russian
description: Samuel Spewack's play traces the political and romantic intrigues surrounding John Paul Jones' enlistment by Catherine the Great to recapture Constantinople for Russia.

title: Come Blow Your Horn
description: An older brother coaches his younger brother in the ways of love, despite the interference of their parents and other complications, in Neil Simon's comedy.

title: 13 Daughters
description: A Hawaiian woman and her Chinese husband attempt to marry off their 13 daughters, who, according to a prophecy cast at the parents' wedding, can only marry when 13 trees blossom.

title: Mary, Mary
description: A woman meets with her ex-husband to tie up their divorce's loose ends and winds up falling in love with him again, despite the presence of his fiancée and a movie star pursuing her.

title: The Devil's Advocate
description: A dying priest is summoned to verify a dead man's claim to saintliness in Dore Schary's play.A dying priest is summoned to verify a dead man's claim to saintliness in Dore Schary's play.

title: The Importance of Being Oscar
description: Excerpts from Oscar Wilde's writings are interspersed with biographical details about his life in Micheal MacLiammoir's one-man play.

title: Big Fish, Little Fish
description: A disgraced college professor who now works as a small-time publisher plans to leave his equally dissolute friends, in Hugh Wheeler's play.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: The Happiest Girl in the World
description: The women of Athens band together in refusing their husbands sex until they stop fighting wars, in this musical adaptation of Aristophanes' Lysistrata.

title: A Far Country
description: Sigmund Freud, preparing to leave Nazi-occupied Vienna in 1937, recalls a landmark case in which he used psychoanalysis to cure a woman of her inability to walk by locating the fear and longing that caused her paralysis.

title: Carnival!
description: A naïve, orphaned girl is taken in as an apprentice to a traveling French circus and develops an astonishing ability to relate to the puppets designed and performed by an embittered, crippled man who loves her, in Bob Merrill and Michael Stewart's musical adaptation of the 1953 film Lilli.

title: The Young Abe Lincoln
description: Abraham Lincoln's years in New Salem, Illinois, in which he was introduced to politics and romance, are musicalized by Victor Ziskin, Joan Javits, Richard N. Bernstein, John Allen and Arnold Sundgaard.

title: Becket
description: The relationship between Henry II of England and his childhood friend Thomas Becket changes when Becket becomes Archbishop of Canterbury and challenges the King's power over the Church, in Jean Anouilh's dramatization of real events.

title: Donnybrook!
description: An Irish prizefighter, who has become a pacifist after killing a man in a fight, returns home and falls for a fiery lass whose father finds the fighter's new worldview cowardly, in Johnny Burke and Robert E. McEnroe's musical adaptation of the film The Quiet Man.

title: Mandingo
description: An African slave is trained to fight other slaves on an antebellum Southern plantation, and is ultimately seduced by his mistress after her husband rejects her for a female slave on their wedding night, in Jack Kirkland's adaptation of Kyle Onstott's novel.

title: A Call on Kuprin
description: An American science journalist goes to Russia to meet with the Russian nuclear expert who was forced out of America and back to his homeland by USSR authorities.

title: Pal Joey
description: Joey, a second-rate Chicago entertainer, two-times a married society dame and a naïve chorus girl. Based on the novel by John O'Hara and scored by Rodgers & Hart.

title: The Billy Barnes People
description: A cast of nine performs songs by Billy Barnes and sketches by cast member Bob Rodgers in this musical revue.

title: From the Second City
description: The Second City, the legendary Chicago sketch comedy and improvisation troupe, comes to Broadway with an evening of songs and sketches.

title: Purlie Victorious
description: A black man dreams of being a preacher and works to take control of the church in his small Georgia community despite the community's difficult relationships with neighboring whites, in Ossie Davis's comedy.

title: Sail Away
description: A hostess working on a cruise ship en route to Capri falls in love with a younger passenger, in Nöel Coward's musical comedy.

title: The Caretaker
description: A vagabond enters and changes the lives of two brothers who live together in a cluttered London apartment, in this early work from Harold Pinter.

title: Blood, Sweat and Stanley Poole
description: A career sergeant who never finished high school has been sent to work as a supply officer in a Midwestern army post during peacetime. He bribes his education officer to help him pass tests that he could never pass on his own.

title: Jerome Robbins' Ballet: U.S.A.
description: Jerome Robbins' ballet company Ballets U.S.A. performs four of his dance pieces

title: Milk and Honey
description: A married Jewish-American man meets a Jewish-American widow traveling in Israel, and though he has long been separated from his wife, he is reluctant to deal with their growing attraction, in Jerry Herman and Don Appell's musical.

title: Everybody Loves Opal
description: A cheerful, wealthy reclusive is besieged by three con artists out to murder her and collect the money from her estate, in John Patrick's comedy.

title: Let It Ride
description: An unassuming man who writes greeting cards turns out to be a whiz at picking winning horses, which endears him to several gamblers desperate to make a killing, in this musical adaptation of John Cecil Holm and George Abbott's Three Men on a Horse.

title: How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
description: Window-washer J. Pierrepont Finch schemes his way to the top of the World Wide Wicket Corporation in Frank Loesser, Abe Burrows, Jack Weinstock and Willie Gilbert's musical satire of big business.

title: Do You Know the Milky Way?
description: A childlike German veteran of World War II goes on a long quest for his identity, ultimately ending up with a psychiatrist because he believes he has come from the Milky Way.

title: A Shot in the Dark
description: A maid is suspected of killing a chauffeur, and only a romantic magistrate believes her innocence.

title: A Cook for Mr. General
description: The adventures of an inept group of soldiers in a Pacific rehabilitation center are the subject of Steven Gethers' play.

title: Kwamina
description: The son of an African tribal chief returns home after attending medical school in London and finds his modern methods conflict with his village's traditions. He also butts heads with the village's white female doctor, but he ultimately falls in love with her.

title: An Evening with Yves Montand
description: French singer Yves Montand performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Look, We've Come Through
description: In Hugh Wheeler's play, an unattractive young woman is stood up by her date but encounters a closeted gay man with whom she develops a close friendship.

title: Write Me a Murder
description: Two brothers who inherit their father's fortune encounter a young couple. One brother sells the family estate to the husband and the other writes a mystery story — in which he concocts the perfect murder — with the wife, with whom he has fallen in love and plans to kill her husband.

title: The Garden of Sweets
description: The three children who abandoned their driven, single mother in adulthood return for her funeral but are haunted by her spirit.

title: The Complaisant Lover
description: A patient dentist ends up trying to persuade his wife's lover to continue seeing her and not cause problems, an arrangement the lover refuses to keep.

title: Gideon
description: A humble ancient farmer is visited by an angel who must convince him that he is Jehovah before exhorting and leading him to fight the Midianites that are threatening the Israelites. Gideon, the farmer, wins the war but ultimately takes credit for the victory himself, refusing to share it with God.

title: The Gay Life
description: A notorious Viennese ladies' man ultimately abandons his wild love for the innocent girl who has loved him for years, in the musical adaptation of Arthur Schnitzler's The Affairs of Anatol.

title: A Man for All Seasons
description: Robert Bolt's historical drama follows Sir Thomas More, the 16th-century Chancellor of England, as he clashes with Henry VIII for refusing to support his divorce and faces persecution for honoring his conscience.

title: Sunday in New York
description: A resolutely virginal young woman falls for a young newspaper reporter, but complications involving her fiancé and brother ensue in Norman Krasna's comedy.

title: Daughter of Silence
description: An Italian attorney defends a young woman accused of killing the man who raped and helped murder her mother during World War II. The married attorney and defendant fall in love, but their future is threatened by her sentence.

title: Take Her, She's Mine
description: A father must accept losing his daughter to the college life and boys, in Phoebe and Henry Ephron's play.

title: First Love
description: A successful writer recalls his childhood and young adulthood, in which his driving mother set out great plans for him, many of which he only achieved after her death.

title: Ross
description: In his last years, the famed Lawrence of Arabia enlists in the RAF under the assumed name Ross after leading the Arabians to independence from the British and his capture and torture by the Turkish government.

title: Subways Are for Sleeping
description: A magazine writer goes undercover for a story about well-dressed men who lead happy homeless lives in New York City, eventually falling for their leader, in Jule Styne, Betty Comden and Adolph Green's musical comedy.

title: The Night of the Iguana
description: A defrocked priest accused of having sexual relations with a teenage girl seeks shelter at a Mexican inn run by his blowsy, widowed old friend, who finds herself competing for his attentions with a kindly spinster who is caring for her grandfather, an aging poet.

title: The Captains and the Kings
description: A Naval captain struggles to introduce nuclear-powered submarines, despite complications involving his son, in Leo Lieberman's play, said to be based on Admiral Hyman G. Rickover.

title: Something About a Soldier
description: A misfit army private is sent to a mental hospital and is then discharged by a sympathetic captain who wants to help him avoid the war he himself must ultimately face.

title: Giants, Sons of Giants
description: A respected French scientist is driven mad by decades-old feelings of being unable to live up to his demanding father.

title: The Egg
description: A young drifter is unfaithful in his marriage, but he reacts violently when he learns his wife has taken a lover herself.

title: Romulus
description: In Gore Vidal's adaptation of Frederich Durenmatt's play, Romulus is portrayed as a decadent, silly man who marries the Roman empress because of his eagerness to preside over the country as it falls to the Goths. His attitude is changed when he meets the Gothic general who, it turns out, admires much about Rome.

title: A Family Affair
description: The mad preparations for a wedding ceremony come to a boil as the bride's guardian and the groom's parents clash over the plans.

title: A Passage to India
description: A young Indian doctor attempts to make friends with a group of British visitors but ultimately becomes disillusioned by his efforts, in Santha Rama Rau's adaptation of E.M. Forster's novel.

title: New Faces of 1962
description: Producer Leonard Sillman presents 18 of his discoveries, who perform songs, dances and sketches in this musical revue.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: Saint Joan
description: Set in 15th century France, Saint Joan follows a country girl whose mysterious visions propel her into elite circles. When the nation’s rulers become threatened by her popularity and influence, they unite to bring her down and she finds herself on trial for her life.

title: A Gift of Time
description: A man who has been diagnosed with cancer decides to live his remaining days as fully as he can rather than protract his illness in bed.

title: General Seeger
description: A U.S. Army General plans to honor his son, who supposedly died honorably in war, until the son's widow appears and claims the son killed himself, unable to live up to his father's unstinting demands for heroism. The General ultimately decides to investigate his own son's death.

title: No Strings
description: An African-American fashion model in Paris falls for a white American novelist who is enjoying the high life at the expense of his work. She convinces him to return home for inspiration, and he does — without her.

title: Isle of Children
description: A dying young girl and her father imagine a utopian society to escape the reality of the girl's impending death and her hysterical mother.

title: All American
description: A European professor tries to adjust to the American college life in Charles Strouse, Lee Adams and Mel Brooks' musical adaptation of Robert Lewis Taylor's novel Professor Fodorski.

title: I Can Get It for You Wholesale
description: A ruthlessly ambitious owner of a dress-making business finds himself in conflict with his mother, girlfriend, friends and associates during his rise to the top, in Harold Rome and Jerome Weidman's musical adaptation of Weidman's novel.

title: Great Day in the Morning
description: A resolutely liberal, irreligious woman fights with her family and friends for years but relents long enough to attend her niece's confirmation.

title: A Thousand Clowns
description: A nonconformist television writer's custody of his young nephew is threatened when the Child Welfare Bureau comes calling.

title: Venus at Large
description: A movie star joins a Stanislavski-influenced acting school to improve her skills, in Henry Denker's comedy.

title: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
description: Ancient Roman slave Pseudolus schemes to win his freedom by helping his young master Hero win the beautiful courtesan Philia, who is betrothed to the egotistical soldier Miles Gloriosus, in this musical farce based on the plays of Plautus.

title: The Father
description: A captain and his wife disagree over how to raise their daughter, with the wife going so far as to insinuate the daughter is not her husband's in order to drive him insane and get her way, in August Strindberg's 1887 indictment of marriage and religion.

title: Long Day's Journey Into Night
description: The Tyrone family — the miserly actor father, the grasping mother addicted to morphine, the alcoholic older son and the tubercular younger son — come to grips with their twisted love for one another in Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning play.

title: Bravo Giovanni
description: An Italian restaurant owner faces competition from a neighboring chain outlet, which leads him and his cohorts to dig an underground tunnel between the restaurants and steal food from his competitor.

title: The Affair
description: A group of Cambridge University fellows reluctantly think it morally right to rehire a disliked colleague who was unjustly dismissed.

title: Eddie Fisher at the Winter Garden
description: Eddie Fisher performs in concert with Dick Gregory and Juliet Prowse at the Winter Garden Theatre.

title: Stop the World - I Want to Get Off
description: The much-put-upon Littlechap attempts to improve himself by marrying his boss's daughter, ultimately having affairs with three other women, all played by the same actress who plays his wife.  The Leslie Bricusse-Anthony Newley musical uses a circus setting.

title: Come on Strong
description: A struggling actor-photographer and an aspiring actress fall in love and decide to devote more time to each other than to their careers.

title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
description: Edward Albee won the Tony Award for his first major play, in which a college professor and his wife invite a younger academic and his wife over for drinks after a late-night party, leading to an evening of sadistic games, attempted seductions and shattering revelations.

title: Seidman and Son
description: A wealthy dress manufacturer maintains his business integrity and strength as a family man despite his cutthroat business in Elick Moll's adaptation of his novel.

title: Step on a Crack
description: A philandering doctor, his alcoholic wife and their worry-prone son converge at their New Jersey home on the Fourth of July.

title: Mr. President
description: A fictional U.S. President, his wife and family spend their last days in the White House before retiring in Irving Berlin, Howard Lindsay and Russell Crouse's musical.

title: Night Life
description: A New York club brings together a variety of people from all walks of life.

title: The Perfect Setup
description: A businessman tries to keep a wife in the country and a mistress in the city, in Jack Sher's comedy.

title: Tchin-Tchin
description: An English woman and an Italian-American man discover that their spouses are having an affair with each other and ultimately find a special connection of their own, in Sidney Michaels' adaptation of Francois Billetdoux's play.

title: The Fun Couple
description: A newly married couple abandon their romantic dreams of life to face the realities of the world.

title: Beyond the Fringe
description: Alan Bennett, Peter Cook, Jonathan Miller and Dudley Moore satirize classic and contemporary social mores and practices in this comedic revue, which they wrote themselves.

title: Calculated Risk
description: The owners of a textile farm discover their company has been sold out and seek to discover which one of them did it.

title: Nowhere to Go But Up
description: The lives and misadventures of Prohibition agents Izzy Einstein and Moe Smith are musicalized by Sol Berkowitz and James Lipton.

title: The Beautiful Bait
description: A prime minister scheming to overthrow a royal dynasty gets a girl dangled before him and his general as bait, until the general disavows and defeats him and wins the girl. This ancient Chinese play is presented in an acrobatic production by the Foo Hsing Theatre, performed by actors under the age of 17.

title: Little Me
description: In Cy Coleman, Carolyn Leigh and Neil Simon's musical version of Patrick Dennis' satirical novel, a well-endowed but poor girl rises to the top ranks of movie stardom thanks to all the men she encounters, but remains ever in love (as much as she is capable) with the hometown rich kid from the other side of the tracks.

title: Lord Pengo
description: The art dealer Joseph Duveen is the subject of S.N. Behrman's reworking of his play, The Days of Duveen.

title: Never Too Late
description: A middle-aged couple whose children have left the nest discover that they are to be parents once more.

title: Moby Dick
description: A company of actors is seen rehearsing a dramatic adaptation of Herman Melville's novel Moby Dick, in Orson Welles' play.

title: Harold
description: A twentysomething young man falls in love for the first time in Herman Raucher's play.

title: The Moon Besieged
description: Seyril Schocken dramatizes John Brown's raid on Harpers Ferry and the effects of his abolitionist crusade on his family.

title: In the Counting House
description: A strong-willed father and his weak-willed son own a lingerie firm together on Madison Avenue.

title: Tiger Tiger Burning Bright
description: A woman builds a dream world around herself and her children to escape from her guilt over accidentally causing the death of one of her sons.

title: The Beauty Part
description: S.J. Perelman satirizes the drive for artistic self-expression in a series of comedic sketches.

title: The White Snake
description: A young man falls in love with a woman, unaware that she is a thousand-year-old white snake who has taken human form. This ancient Chinese tale is given an acrobatic production by the Foo Hsing Theatre, performed by actors under the age of 17.

title: Oliver!
description: Orphaned Oliver Twist goes from mistreatment in the London workhouses to falling in with a gang of pickpockets led by the roguish Fagin, the kindhearted Nancy, and the menacing Bill Sykes, before finally finding a home, in Lionel Bart's musical adaptation of the Charles Dickens novel.

title: Hidden Stranger
description: A plastic surgeon restores an Italian count's disfigured face at his villa outside Florence.

title: The Milk Train Doesn't Stop Here Anymore
description: An eccentric, much-married widow settles down to write her memoirs but is rejuvenated when a young poet enters her life.

title: The School for Scandal
description: The gossip, backbiting and romantic scheming of London society are satirized in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1777 comedy.

title: On an Open Roof
description: A Puerto Rican lawyer and his American wife have trouble adjusting to a cold-water flat in New York.

title: An Evening with Maurice Chevalier
description: Maurice Chevalier headlines this evening of songs and sketches.

title: The Hollow Crown
description: A cast of eight performs songs and excerpts from various writings by and about British royalty.

title: Brigadoon
description: Two Americans game-hunting in Scotland happen upon a mysterious village in which the people dress and speak as if from another era. One of the Americans is drawn to one of the Scottish lasses and must choose between the magical Brigadoon and his conventional fiancée back in New York.

title: Natural Affection
description: A boy returns home from reform school to live with his mother and her new lover, ultimately driving them apart and careening toward his own tragic fate, in William Inge's family drama.

title: Andorra
description: A young man has grown up believing he is Jewish but was adopted by a teacher who saved him from neighboring anti-Semitic forces.  It turns out he is not Jewish and is the illegitimate son of the teacher and one of the forces' women, but by the time the truth is revealed, no one believes it and the forces close in.

title: Photo Finish
description: An 80-year-old novelist looks back over his life at the ages of 20, 40 and 60.

title: Lorenzo
description: An acting troupe touring Italy gets caught in a war between two cities.

title: The Heroine
description: A Hollywood wife tries to stop her husband from cheating on her, but her plans backfire.

title: The Jack Benny Show
description: Jack Benny headlines an evening of comedy and music featuring singers Jane Morgan; Clara Ward and the Ward Singers; Buck Benny, the Waukegan Hillbillies and Toni Marcus; and The Half-Brothers.

title: Dear Me, the Sky Is Falling
description: An interfering mother drives her family to distraction before learning how to let them be independent from a psychiatrist.

title: The Riot Act
description: A disapproving mother of three New York policemen tries to prevent their marriages.

title: Strange Interlude
description: A professor's daughter, haunted by the loss of her fiancé in World War I, embarks on a series of affairs and a placid marriage, becoming a mother under murky circumstances and ignoring the novelist who truly loves her. She and other characters in Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize-winning play communicate their private thoughts to the audience.

title: Too True to Be Good
description: An idle rich young woman tries hedonism and then religion in an attempt to find purpose, in George Bernard Shaw's indictment of modern wealth and morality.

title: Enter Laughing
description: Set in the Bronx during the Depression, Enter Laughing chronicles the over-protective parents, the two too many girlfriends, and paycheck commensurate with his acting talent, of a young man who grew up to become comedy legend Carl Reiner.  Adapted by Joe Stein, book writer of Fiddler on the Roof, from Reiner's memoir.

title: Tovarich
description: Two refugees from the Russian aristocracy become a maid and butler for an American family living in Paris, charming the children as they dodge a Soviet Commissar on their trail, in this musical adaptation of Robert E. Sherwood and Jacques Deval's play.

title: The Lady of the Camellias
description: A courtesan's young lover struggles to help her as she dies of tuberculosis in Giles Cooper and Terrence McNally's adaptation of the Alexandre Dumas novel.

title: My Mother, My Father and Me
description: A middle-class family's ridiculous reactions to every crisis are satirized by Lillian Hellman, in her adaptation of Burt Blechman's novel How Much?

title: Mother Courage and Her Children
description: A crafty canteen woman working with the Swedish army is determined to profit by the Thirty Years' War, but ultimately uses all three of her children to do it.

title: Danny Kaye
description: Danny Kaye performs in a revue also featuring The Dunhills, The Marquis Family, Senor Wences and The Johnny Mann Singers.

title: Children from Their Games
description: A modern-day misanthrope collects mounting evidence of the pain that exists in the modern world and asks his friend to help him leave it.

title: Man in the Moon
description: Bil and Cora Baird and their marionettes perform a musical story, as well as characters from around the world, in this musical puppet show.

title: Ages of Man
description: Sir John Gielgud performs Shakespearean soliloquies, scenes and sonnets in this one-man show.

title: Sophie
description: Sophie Tucker's rise to fame in vaudeville and nightclubs is musicalized by Steve Allen and Phillip Pruneau.

title: Rattle of a Simple Man
description: A reluctant prostitute and a reluctant customer spend a night together in Charles Dyer's comedy.

title: Hot Spot
description: A female member of the Peace Corps works hard in the obscure country to which she has been sent in Mary Rodgers, Martin Charnin, Jack Weinstock and Willie Gilbert's musical.

title: She Loves Me
description: A store clerk and a salesgirl in a Hungarian parfumerie cannot stand each other, but are unaware that they are conducting an anonymous romantic correspondence.

title: The Beast in Me
description: Eleven of the modernized fables included in James Thurber's Fables for Our Time are staged in this musical revue.

title: Karmon Israeli Dancers
description: The Karmon Israeli Dancers perform an evening of Israeli folk dances and songs.

title: Pal Joey
description: Joey, a second-rate Chicago entertainer, two-times a married society dame and a naïve chorus girl. Based on the novel by John O'Hara and scored by Rodgers & Hart.

title: Pajama Tops
description: A man attempts assignations with various women in Mawby Green and Ed Feilbert's adaptation of Jean De Le Traz's farce Moumou.

title: Oh Dad, Poor Dad, Mamma's Hung You in the Closet and I'm Feelin' So Sad
description: An overbearing mother brings her son and the body of her dead husband, carried in his coffin, to the Caribbean for a vacation in Arthur Kopit's black farce.

title: The Irregular Verb to Love
description: An eccentric British family, including a mother who blows up a fur store to protest cruelty to animals and children who make unusual career choices, is held together by a patient father.

title: The Rehearsal
description: A countess persuades her husband's best friend to join her in her disapproval of his latest mistress as they all retreat to a chateau to stage Marivaux's The Double Inconstancy.

title: Bicycle Ride to Nevada
description: A formerly famous novelist has become embittered and tries to destroy his nearest and dearest.

title: Luther
description: The life of Martin Luther, who started the Protestant Reformation in 1517, is dramatized by John Osborne.

title: Spoon River Anthology
description: The poems of Edgar Lee Masters, as adapted by Charles Aidman, paint a picture of the lives of the residents of the fictional town of Spoon River. Many of the dead residents are eulogized.

title: The Student Gypsy
description: A shy young maiden runs away from home, falls in love with a prince and becomes an apprentice to a gypsy queen, who had earlier kidnapped the rightful prince and put her son in his place, in Rick Besoyan's spoof of operettas.

title: Chips with Everything
description: An upper-class man leads a group of lower-class men to defy the Establishment.

title: Obratsov Russian Puppet Theatre
description: Russian puppeteer Sergei Obratsov and his company present an evening of puppetry.

title: Here's Love
description: A man convinces the cynical daughter of a Macy's department store employee, and eventually everyone else, that he is really Santa Claus, in Meredith Willson's musical adaptation of the 1947 film Miracle on 34th Street.

title: Semi-Detached
description: A greedy and aggressive middle-class family is portrayed as behaving in the only way possible to reach self-improvement in David Turner's satire.

title: The Private Ear and the Public Eye
description: An evening of two one-acts by Peter Shaffer. In The Private Ear, a shy young man invites a girl to dinner at his apartment with his best friend, whom the girl winds up falling for. In The Public Eye, a stuffy husband hires a private detective to find out if his young, fun-loving wife is unfaithful.

title: A Case of Libel
description: A prominent ex-war correspondent pushes forward with a painful libel suit against a ruthless columnist.

title: Martha Graham
description: Martha Graham's dance company performs an evening of modern dance on Broadway.

title: The Advocate
description: The trial of Saco and Vanzetti, two Italian immigrant anarchists convicted of murder in Massachusetts in 1923, is dramatized by Robert Noah.

title: Jennie
description: A turn-of-the-20th-century actress tours the company in melodramatic spectaculars with her husband, then falls for an English playwright, in Arthur Schwartz, Howard Dietz and Arnold Schulman's musical, said to be partly based on the life of actress Laurette Taylor.

title: Phèdre
description: Theseus's wife is destroyed by her love for her stepson in Racine's dramatization of the Greek myth.

title: A Rainy Day in Newark
description: A labor boss finds himself the owner of a clock factory, which has to run under the same labor conditions for which he's been agitating.

title: Barefoot in the Park
description: A free-spirited bride and her buttoned-down groom settle down to some rocky happily-ever-aftering in a Greenwich Village walk-up, occasionally invaded by the bride's easily winded mother and the quirky bohemian who lives in the attic.

title: 110 in the Shade
description: An unmarried woman in the Old West must choose between the attentions of the local sheriff and a charismatic con man who promises to bring rain. Based on Nash's play The Rainmaker.

title: Bérénice
description: Berenice, the Queen of Palestine, is in love with the Roman emperor Titus but is also loved by Antiochus, the King of Commagene.

title: The Ballad of the Sad Cafe
description: The Southern love triangle between an Amazon, a dwarf and a reformed scoundrel is the subject of Edward Albee's adaptation of Carson McCullers' novel.

title: Tambourines to Glory
description: Two black women establish a gospel church in Harlem for different reasons. One kills a man but ultimately repents, in Langston Hughes' adaptation of his novel.

title: Arturo Ui
description: A Chicago mobster's rise to power eerily parallels that of Adolf Hitler in Bertolt Brecht's parable.

title: Man and Boy
description: A famous tycoon will let nothing stand in the way of his quest for wealth, including his son, in Terence Rattigan's play.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
description: Mental hospital patient Randle McMurphy leads a revolt against cold Nurse Ratched in this stage adaptation of the Ken Kesey novel.

title: Once for the Asking
description: A group of people get their most cherished wish granted for a four-hour period in Owen G. Arno's farce.

title: Have I Got a Girl for You!
description: A nosy mother interferes with her son, who wants to live an independent life as a high school athletics coach.

title: The Girl Who Came to Supper
description: An American chorus girl in London has a brief affair with a visiting Prince Regent from the Balkans on the eve of George V's coronation, in Noel Coward and Harry Kurnitz's musical adaptation of Terrence Rattigan's play The Sleeping Prince.

title: Love and Kisses
description: Two teenagers get married in suburban Detroit, upsetting the groom's parents and older sister, who is engaged herself.

title: Marathon '33
description: The participants of a dance marathon suffer through its grueling requirements, in June Havoc's dramatization of her own experiences and her novel Early Havoc.

title: The Beautiful Bait
description: A prime minister scheming to overthrow a royal dynasty gets a girl dangled before him and his general as bait, until the general disavows and defeats him and wins the girl. This ancient Chinese play is presented in an acrobatic production by the Foo Hsing Theatre, performed by actors under the age of 17.

title: Double Dublin
description: A cast of four present material dealing with Irish life in this revue.

title: The Milk Train Doesn't Stop Here Anymore
description: An eccentric, much-married widow settles down to write her memoirs but is rejuvenated when a young poet enters her life.

title: The Chinese Prime Minister
description: An aging actress examines both the truths and the myths of her occupation and her past, leaving them behind to better enjoy old age.

title: Hello, Dolly!
description: A meddlesome matchmaker brings together the young clerk of a wealthy Yonkers merchant and his assistant with a widowed milliner and her assistant, while making sure she herself gets to marry the merchant, in Jerry Herman and Michael Stewart's musical adaptation of Thornton Wilder's The Matchmaker.

title: Dylan
description: The Welsh poet Dylan Thomas makes what turns out to be his final tour of America, in Sidney Michaels' play.

title: After the Fall
description: A man examines his life and failed marriage to determine whether he should marry again. Arthur Miller's non-linear, autobiographical play is said to be partly based on his marriage to Marilyn Monroe.

title: The Dybbuk
description: S. Ansky dramatizes the old Jewish belief that the spirit of a dead man who has suffered injustice in life can inhabit the body of a living person as a means of crying out for the justice to be righted.

title: Josephine Baker
description: Legendary entertainer Josephine Baker performs a special concert on Broadway.

title: Rugantino
description: An Italian cad makes a bet that he can seduce the wife of one of Rome's most prominent citizens.

title: Fair Game for Lovers
description: A sophisticated writer has trouble raising his 18-year-old daughter.

title: The Passion of Josef D.
description: Joseph Stalin's relationship to Lenin and his involvement in the Russian Revolution are the subject of Paddy Chayefsky's play.

title: Foxy
description: A prospector looking for gold in the Yukon in 1896 pretends to be both rich and ill so his friends will look after him instead of for gold, in this musical adaptation of Ben Johnson's Volpone.

title: Abraham Cochrane
description: A couple's unhappy marriage is ruined by a visit from the husband's wartime friend.

title: Any Wednesday
description: A married business tycoon visits his kooky mistress in an office-paid-for apartment every Wednesday. Complications ensue when an out-of-town manufacturer and the tycoon's wife mistakenly get sent to the apartment.

title: Marco Millions
description: Eugene O'Neill's story of a Westerner's culture shock and adjustment upon encountering the Eastern world for the first time, based on the history of Marco Polo's expeditions.

title: Children of the Shadows
description: A young boy brought to Israel after World War II has difficulty adjusting to his new surroundings.

title: The Deputy
description: A Catholic priest ultimately defies Pope Pius XII, who chooses to ignore the Nazis' treatment of Jews during World War II.

title: What Makes Sammy Run?
description: A ruthlessly ambitious young man schemes his way to the top of the Hollywood-studio food chain, betraying friends and lovers in his wake, in Ervin Drake, Budd and Stuart Schulberg's musical adaptation of Budd Schulberg's novel.

title: Each Had Six Wings
description: Hanoch Bartov dramatizes the Jewish people's migration to and settlement in the State of Israel after its establishment.

title: But For Whom Charlie
description: A man escapes his domineering father and cheating college friend turned colleague.

title: A Murderer Among Us
description: A man who is sent to prison for a murder he didn't commit feels entitled to kill someone when he is released.

title: Funny Girl
description: Jule Styne, Bob Merrill and Isobel Lennart musicalize the life of Fanny Brice, who rose from the ranks of Brooklyn vaudeville to headline the Ziegfeld Follies, but found unhappiness in her marriage to gambler Nick Arnstein.

title: Never Live Over a Pretzel Factory
description: Three young men trying to make an art film in New York have difficulties with the alcoholic movie star they have hired.

title: Sponono
description: The white principal of a South African reform school attempts to help a young black inmate during the apartheid era.

title: Anyone Can Whistle
description: A corrupt mayoress fakes a miracle to save her failing town — a miracle that brings a nurse with her charges from the local asylum, as well as a mysterious man who is supposed to sort things out when the inmates run amok.

title: The Seagull
description: Famous actress Irina Arkadina is obsessed with a callous lover, dismissive of her frustrated son and suspicious of an admiring young woman. Anton Chekhov's 1895 play explores the tensions between mothers, sons, lovers, friends and servants.

title: The Crucible
description: Arthur Miller's tale of the Salem witch trials, in which a group of girls accuse upstanding women in the town of witchcraft to divert suspicion from their own activities, has been seen as an allegory for Senator Joseph McCarthy's anti-Communist crusades of the 1950s.

title: High Spirits
description: A British writer and his second wife invite an eccentric medium to hold a séance for research purposes, with the ghost of the man's first wife unexpectedly conjured and wreaking havoc, in this musical adaptation of Noel Coward's play Blithe Spirit.

title: West Side Story
description: West Side Story transposes Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet to the gang-ridden streets of 1950s Manhattan, dominated by the Sharks and the Jets. Two teens from the bitter-enemy gangs meet and fall in love at a fateful gym dance.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Cafe Crown
description: The stagestruck busboy of a Second Avenue theatrical restaurant becomes an investor in Broadway plays, in this musical adaptation of Hy Kraft's play.

title: Baby Want a Kiss
description: A Hollywood couple visits an old friend in James Costigan's comedy.

title: Blues for Mister Charlie
description: A black man returns home to the South after having spent some time in the North and is brutally murdered by a white store-owner, in James Baldwin's examination of ongoing racial tensions.

title: The Sunday Man
description: A food store chain's manager keeps a mistress but will only visit her on Sundays.

title: The White House
description: The lives of the presidents and first ladies are dramatized from their own letters and diaries and correspondence about them, by A.E. Hotchner.

title: Roar Like a Dove
description: A Scottish nobleman's American wife refuses to try to conceive a son with him after they have had six daughters.

title: The Subject Was Roses
description: A mother and father struggle for the love of their son, who has recently returned home after serving overseas, in Frank D. Gilroy's Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning drama.

title: Fade Out - Fade In
description: A movie-theatre usherette becomes a film star in Depression-era Hollywood, despite being cast in roles that don't suit her, in the Jule Styne-Betty Comden-Adolph Green musical comedy.

title: Folies Bergère [1964]
description: The ensemble of the French revue Folies Bergère performs songs and dances, with numbers featuring showgirls interspersed throughout.

title: The Three Sisters
description: Sisters Olga, Masha and Irina long to leave their provincial military town for Moscow and grapple with frustrated love and disappointment, in Anton Chekhov's 1901 drama.

title: Wiener Blut
description: A count serving as an ambassador at the Conference of Vienna struggles to keep his extramarital affairs in order in Johann Strauss' operetta.

title: The Committee
description: A cast of eight performs improvisational, comedic material about everyday life in this revue, in which the material changes nightly.

title: Traveller Without Luggage
description: A soldier who suffered amnesia in World War I finally discovers his past, full of adolescent cruelty, and rejects it for a false, happier past.

title: A Girl Could Get Lucky
description: A middle-aged couple, consisting of a fun-loving secretary and an uptight taxi driver, find relief from loneliness by courting and marrying each other.

title: Absence of a Cello
description: A laid-back scientist decides to make himself and his family appear fancier to get a corporate job, which he ultimately wins by just being himself.

title: Fiddler on the Roof
description: Tevye, a Jewish milkman in early 1900s Russia, sees his three eldest daughters married, each one moving further from traditional ways, and must cope with the growing anti-Jewish sentiment in his country.

title: Oh What a Lovely War
description: Director Joan Littlewood and her Theatre Workshop company present an collection of songs from the World War I era to reflect ironically on the dehumanization of all war.

title: The Last Analysis
description: A retired comedian reenacts the key moments of his life in an episode of self-psychoanalysis.

title: Cambridge Circus
description: A group of seven Cambridge graduates perform comedy sketches and musical numbers in this revue, which they wrote themselves.

title: Beekman Place
description: A retired violinist's old flame comes back into his life, prompting him to become active again and restart his career.

title: The Physicists
description: Three well-known scientists pretend to be patients in an asylum for various reasons and are ultimately unable to leave when the doctor takes over.

title: The Sign in Sidney Brustein's Window
description: A Jewish newspaper publisher and political activist remains optimistic in the face of struggle.

title: Golden Boy
description: A black boxer falls for his manager's white girlfriend in this musical adaptation of the Clifford Odets' play.

title: Ben Franklin in Paris
description: Benjamin Franklin journeys to Paris with his two young grandsons to enlist France's aid in the American Revolution and finds that the best way to King Louis XIV is through a seductive countess who is the king's trusted adviser at court.

title: A Severed Head
description: A group of friends couple and re-couple in various relationships, in Iris Murdoch and J.B. Priestley's satire on modern sexual practices and attitudes.

title: The Changeling
description: A woman enlists an admirer to murder her fiancé so she can be with her lover, which ends tragically. A more comic love story involves two men who pretend to be crazy in order to see the married woman they love, in Thomas Middleton and William Rowley's 1622 play.

title: I Was Dancing
description: An overbearing vaudeville comedian decides to move in with the son he abandoned for 21 years.

title: Comedy in Music Opus 2
description: Danish classical pianist and comedian Victor Borge performs an evening of comedic piano routines and anecdotes.

title: Something More!
description: An American novelist takes his family to Italy in the hope of finding new inspiration in life, and he and his wife find extramarital temptation on their journeys.

title: Luv
description: A neurotic who has failed at committing suicide ultimately comes between a husband and wife in Murray Schisgal's dark comedy.

title: Conversation at Midnight
description: In Edna St. Vincent Millay's play, a group of men meet for dinner and discuss politics, culture and other topics after they have eaten.

title: Poor Bitos
description: Guests at a party dress up as French Revolution figures in order to humiliate a local prosecutor who comes dressed as Robespierre, in Jean Anouilh's play.

title: The Owl and the Pussycat
description: A would-be actress working part-time as a prostitute shares an apartment with a more educated aspiring writer. They come to like each other despite their differences, in Bill Manhoff's comedy.

title: P.S. I Love You
description: An American diplomat's wife develops a pen pal romance with a Frenchman while living in Paris.

title: Zizi
description: Zizi Jeanmaire headlines a revue of French music hall dances, choreographed by Roland Petit.

title: Bajour
description: An anthropologist studies a Romany Gypsy tribe of thieves roaming through modern-day New York, in this musical adaptation of stories Joseph Mitchell published in The New Yorker.

title: Slow Dance on the Killing Ground
description: A black fugitive, an older German refugee, and a white teenager on her way to an abortion converge in a Brooklyn neighborhood on the night of Adolph Eichmann's hanging.

title: One by One
description: Two paraplegics find love and fulfilling lives in spite of their handicaps.

title: Poor Richard
description: A British poet wins over his publisher's secretary on a visit to New York.

title: Incident at Vichy
description: A World War II drama taking place in Vichy, France, during the Nazi occupation. The townspeople of Vichy are called into an interrogation room in an effort to ferret out the Jews among them.

title: Ready When You Are, C.B.!
description: A young actress who doubles as her apartment's landlady falls for a Hollywood star living in her building.

title: Beyond the Fringe '65
description: Robert Cessna, Donald Cullen, Joel Fabiani and James Valentine satirize ancient and modern mores and practices in this return engagement of the comedy revue Beyond the Fringe.

title: I Had a Ball
description: Garside, a psychologist turned fortune teller, suddenly begins seeing the future in his crystal ball and goes to work bringing two pairs of star-crossed lovers together against the backdrop of the Coney Island boardwalk.

title: Alfie!
description: A British lothario decides to examine his life after a series of personal and relationship crises, in Bill Naughton's play.

title: Hughie
description: A small-time gambler reminisces about a hotel clerk to the clerk's successor, in Eugene O'Neill's two-actor drama.

title: Tiny Alice
description: A powerful widow and her lawyer offer a generous grant to the Church on the condition that the Cardinal's naïve secretary be used as a liaison, in Edward Albee's look at the corruption involved in mixing religion and money.

title: Peterpat
description: The marriage of an egocentric writer of paperback novels suffers but ends happily.

title: The Family Way
description: An actress seeks to keep the memory of her late husband alive, while her young son searches for a father figure.

title: Tartuffe
description: A religious conman infiltrates the household of a gullible man and his exasperated family in Moliere's 1664 comedy.

title: Boeing-Boeing
description: Playboy Bernard juggles three fiancées, all flight attendants, with careful planning and the reluctant assistance of his housekeeper. But weather delays and the invention of a faster Boeing jet send his elaborate love life into chaos.

title: Kelly
description: In 1880s New York, a lonely busboy's efforts to jump off the Brooklyn Bridge repeatedly fail, rousing the attention of gamblers who plan to substitute a dummy in his place for the next try.

title: Diamond Orchid
description: An ambitious Latin-American woman helps her colonel lover take over his country and then devotes herself fanatically to charitable causes as first lady, in Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee's play, which may have been based on Eva Peron.

title: Baker Street
description: The great detective Sherlock Holmes must stop the dastardly Moriarty from setting a bomb off during Queen Victoria's Jubilee celebration and rescue the love letters of a charming actress from Moriarty's hands, in this musical adaptation of Arthur Conan Doyle's classic stories.

title: All in Good Time
description: A young married couple struggles to find time to consummate their marriage while living with the groom's family.

title: Catch Me If You Can
description: A man's wife mysteriously disappears from their weekend getaway cottage in the Catskills, in Jack Weinstock and Willie Gilbert's comedy-mystery.

title: The Odd Couple
description: Two suddenly single pals — a sloppy sportswriter and a fastidious news writer — strain their friendship by turning roommates and unconsciously repeating the same mistakes they made in the marriages they just left.

title: This Was Burlesque
description: Former striptease artist Ann Corio oversees an evening of "girls and gags" in the tradition of old burlesque — plus a male addition to the traditionally female group of exotic dancers.

title: Do I Hear a Waltz?
description: A lonely American spinster touring Italy finds bittersweet romance with a married shopkeeper in Venice, in this musical adaptation of Laurents' play The Time of the Cuckoo.

title: Maurice Chevalier at 77
description: Maurice Chevalier headlines this evening of songs and sketches.

title: The Amen Corner
description: A Harlem pastor must deal with a rebellious congregation, a son who has lost his faith, and the return of her long-estranged husband who is ready to die, in James Baldwin's play.

title: Half a Sixpence
description: Arthur Kipps, an orphan and over-worked draper's assistant at the turn of the last century, unexpectedly inherits a fortune that propels him into high society. His childhood companion, Ann Pornick, watches with dismay as Arthur is made over in a new image by the beautiful and classy Helen Walsingham. Both young women undoubtedly love Arthur - but which of them should he listen to? With the help of his friends, Arthur learns that if you want to have the chance of living the right life, you need to make the right choices.

title: And Things That Go Bump in the Night
description: A family hiding in a bomb shelter as the end of the world approaches brings in visitors to torture with acts of cruelty.

title: Guys and Dolls
description: A fly-by-night gambler attempts to woo a Salvation Army missioner for a $1,000 bet. Meanwhile, a beleaguered showgirl tries to hook her fiancé of 14 years, the founder of "the oldest, established, permanent, floating crap game in New York."

title: A Race of Hairy Men!
description: Two couples plan a dirty weekend together in a New York apartment but have second thoughts when they get there.

title: The Glass Menagerie
description: Tennessee Williams’s autobiographical “memory play” looks at the WIngfield family—frustrated writer Tom, his nagging mother, Amanda, who is often lost in memories of her Southern-belle past, and his painfully shy sister, Laura—and the effect a visit from a “gentleman caller” for Laura has on all their lives.

title: Ken Murray's Hollywood
description: Ken Murray presents home movies featuring movie stars and other Hollywood figures, including life at William Randolph Hearst's estate, San Simeon. He also discusses the making of his own film, Bill and Coo.

title: Flora, the Red Menace
description: An aspiring fashion illustrator becomes caught up in the Communist Party during the Great Depression.

title: The Roar of the Greasepaint - The Smell of the Crowd
description: The scrappy but poor Cocky routinely survives the abuse of the well-born and powerful Sir as they play the Game of Life, in Leslie Bricusse and Anthony Newley's allegorical musical.

title: Oliver!
description: Orphaned Oliver Twist goes from mistreatment in the London workhouses to falling in with a gang of pickpockets led by the roguish Fagin, the kindhearted Nancy, and the menacing Bill Sykes, before finally finding a home, in Lionel Bart's musical adaptation of the Charles Dickens novel.

title: Mrs. Dally
description: A middle-aged woman, disappointed in her weak husband's guilt over their son's death, finds love with a man she discovers to be immature.

title: A Very Rich Woman
description: A rich Boston widow fights her daughters' efforts to declare her incompetent in order to gain access to her money.

title: Pickwick
description: A wealthy Victorian Englishman and his valet have been sent to debtors' prison and recall the adventures that got them there, in this musical adaptation of the Charles Dickens novel The Pickwick Papers.

title: Generation
description: A successful advertising executive visits his young married daughter who lives the bohemian life in Greenwich Village with her husband and wants to have her baby without a doctor present.

title: Minor Miracle
description: A young boy claims to have seen a vision of the Virgin Mary, which causes consternation in his neighborhood parish.

title: Drat! The Cat!
description: A well-born young woman who would rather have a career than a husband turns to a life as a cat burglar amidst 1890s society, in Milton Schafer and Ira Levin's musical.

title: Entertaining Mr. Sloane
description: A mysterious young man boards with a woman who seduces him, which complicates their relationship and the man's relationships with her father and brother.

title: The Impossible Years
description: The teenaged daughters of a psychiatry professor begin to get into romantic misadventures, in Robert Fisher and Arthur Marx's comedy.

title: The World of Charles Aznavour
