description: Legendary French singer-songwriter Charles Aznavour performs many of his classic songs, including "Yesterday When I Was Young," in concert.

title: On a Clear Day You Can See Forever
description: A kooky young woman goes to a psychiatrist to cure her smoking. The psychiatrist discovers through hypnosis that she is the reincarnation of a well-born English lady — with whom he finds himself falling in love — in Burton Lane and Alan Jay Lerner's musical.

title: The Right Honourable Gentleman
description: A real-life scandal in Victorian England, in which a Parliament official's career was ruined by an accusation of adultery, is dramatized.

title: Danton's Tod
description: Georg Buchner dramatizes the conflict between French Revolution leader Danton and left-wing bourgeois politician Robespierre.

title: The Royal Hunt of the Sun
description: The Peruvian conquistador Pizarro is disillusioned with life and sacrifices the Incan man-God Atahuallpa in hopes that he will rise from the dead and prove that a greater power than death exists.

title: Postmark Zero
description: The letters of unnamed German soldiers who fought in the Battle of Stalingrad are dramatized, along with scenes from the home front.

title: Mating Dance
description: A television personality is married to a female senator but is having an affair that must be concealed until the campaign is over.

title: Xmas in Las Vegas
description: A compulsive gambler tries his luck at blackjack in his annual trip to Las Vegas, while his family gets involved in various sexual fantasies and hijinks.

title: The Zulu and the Zayda
description: The family of a feisty Jewish grandfather, or zayda, hire a Zulu to be his companion; they become friends despite age and racial differences, but must contend with the prejudice of their neighbors.

title: Skyscraper
description: An antiques dealer with a rich fantasy life fights to save her Manhattan brownstone from being torn down, in Jimmy Van Heusen, Sammy Cahn and Peter Stone's musical adaptation of Elmer Rice's play Dream Girl.

title: The Devils
description: A hard-living priest is accused by a nun of possessing her with erotic visions, leading the priest to personal revelations as he is tortured and executed in 1600s France.

title: Man of La Mancha
description: An imprisoned Miguel de Cervantes gets his fellow inmates to enact the story of his novel, Don Quixote, about an aged nobleman who declares himself a "knight errant" out to do battle for good and the love of a fair maiden, in Mitch Leigh, Joe Darion and Dale Wasserman's musical adaptation of the classic Cervantes novel.

title: You Can't Take It With You
description: An eccentric family allows each member to pursue his own ambition in the home, but their routine is disrupted when a daughter with a regular job wants to bring her fiancé and his Wall Street family to dinner in George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy.

title: Inadmissible Evidence
description: A self-hating English solicitor who handles divorce cases rails against his life, wife and family, and ultimately finds himself abandoned and alone.

title: Anya
description: A former Russian Cossack general discovers a young woman in a Berlin psychiatric ward who claims to be the Grand Duchess Anastasia, the princess thought to have been killed with her family during the Russian Revolution. The general plans to reunite the woman with Anastasia's grandmother, the Dowager Empress, in hope of profit, in this musical adaptation of the play and film Anastasia.

title: The Playroom
description: A teenager adores her father and resents her stepmother so much that she decides to kidnap her stepsister, with the help of four friends who decide to kill the girl to avoid being caught.

title: Me and Thee
description: A couple is urged to stop conforming and throws caution to the wind, with comically awful results.

title: Cactus Flower
description: A man's young girlfriend demands to meet the wife who is keeping them from getting married — a wife that the man invented to keep the girlfriend from getting too close. He asks his spinsterish assistant to pretend to be the wife, which leads to complications, in Abe Burrows' comedy.

title: The Country Wife
description: The cad Horner pretends to be impotent to seduce the married women of London, and he finds the naïve Margery Pinchwife, visiting from the country, particularly besotted with him in William Wycherley's Restoration comedy.

title: The Yearling
description: A lonely farm boy learns to deal with his life through a friendship with a young fawn, in this musical adaptation of the Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings novel.

title: La Grosse Valise
description: A clown attempts to get his huge suitcase through customs, then opens it to reveal a zany revue of sketches, songs and dances.

title: The Persecution and Assassination of Jean-Paul Marat as Performed by the Inmates of the Asylum of Charenton Under the Direction of the Marquis de Sade
description: The inmates of France's Charenton Asylum are instructed to perform a play detailing the events that led to the assassination of radical journalist Jean-Paul Marat during the French Revolution. The performance is directed by their fellow inmate, the Marquis de Sade, and has a revolutionary character of its own, intended to defy the hospital director and staff.

title: UTBU
description: The play's title stands for Unhealthy to Be Unpleasant, a group that kills undesirable people, in James Kirkwood's comedy.

title: Malcolm
description: A 15-year-old innocent is sent into the world and gradually corrupted by the people he meets, in Edward Albee's adaptation of James Purdy's novel.

title: The Wayward Stork
description: A sterile husband plans to have his wife artificially inseminated, but his sister-in-law receives the treatment by mistake.

title: Sweet Charity
description: A New York taxi dancer is open-hearted but unlucky in love, until she meets a strait-laced claustrophobe and nurses him through an elevator jam, in this musical adaptation of the Federico Fellini film The Nights of Cabiria.

title: The Great Indoors
description: A Jewish man who made munitions in Germany during World War II meets his two children, one mothered by a black servant and the other by a German dancer who was tortured by the Nazis.

title: Wait Until Dark
description: A doll filled with heroin ends up in the apartment of a blind woman, who is terrorized by criminals looking for the doll until she figures out how to fight back.

title: The Condemned of Altona
description: A German family feels guilt over appeasing the Nazis, particularly the son, who imprisons himself in his room for killing two prisoners while serving in Russia and imagines all of Germany is still as guilt-ridden as he.

title: Philadelphia, Here I Come!
description: Gareth O'Donnell leaves his life in Ireland behind for fame and fortune in America, expressing his feelings through his two sides — the shy and dutiful public side and the angry, defiant private side — in Brian Friel's comedy.

title: Hostile Witness
description: A prominent British barrister is charged with murdering the man who killed his daughter in a hit-and-run accident.

title: Slapstick Tragedy
description: An evening of two one-act plays by Tennessee Williams. Two broken-down prostitutes, one scarred by a breast removal and the other by emotional problems, console each other in friendship in The Mutilated. The Gnadiges Fraulein follows the vagabond residents of a Florida bunkhouse.

title: Nathan Weinstein, Mystic, Connecticut
description: A retired Jewish postal worker tries to find the cause of his neurotic daughter's problems.

title: First One Asleep, Whistle
description: A troubled young mother has a tragic romance with an emotionally immature man.

title: Where's Daddy?
description: A young and fearful expectant father persuades his wife to give up their baby and end the marriage, to the shock of family and friends, until the baby's birth changes everything.

title: 3 Bags Full
description: A wealthy sporting goods mogul tries to keep his family's adventures in life and love straight along with three similar-looking bags, one holding diamonds, one cast and one ladies' underwear.

title: Wait a Minim!
description: A cast of eight performs a variety of folk songs from around the world interspersed with dances and satirical sketches, often parodying the apartheid regime in South Africa, in this revue.

title: Happily Never After
description: A couple's weekend getaway on Long Island is interrupted by family problems and friends' marital troubles.

title: Pousse-Café
description: A German professor becomes obsessed with a cabaret singer in this musical adaptation of the film The Blue Angel.

title: Mark Twain Tonight!
description: Hal Holbrook brings the personality and writings of Mark Twain to life in this one-man show.

title: The Caucasian Chalk Circle
description: A peasant girl steals a baby to raise and ultimately becomes a better parent than the child's birth parents, in Bertolt Brecht's parable.

title: The Best Laid Plans
description: A businesswoman who shares a psychoanalyst with a famous playwright pretends to be a beatnik to attract him.

title: "It's a Bird...It's a Plane...It's Superman"
description: The one and only Superman is nearly destroyed by an evil scientist angered over losing the Nobel Prize 10 times, who works with a reporter colleague of Clark Kent's on The Daily Planet to find the superhero's weak spot.

title: Ivanov
description: In Anton Chekhov's 1887 drama, a man attempts to escape his dying wife by playing cards with an attractive young woman on a nearby estate, ultimately becoming disgusted at his own conduct.

title: A Time for Singing
description: A Welsh mining family endures struggles and tragedy in this musical adaptation of Richard Llewellyn's novel How Green Was My Valley.

title: Mame
description: Roaring Twenties socialite Mame Dennis teaches her orphaned nephew the nature of free living and free thinking, attempting to keep him from the clutches of the uptight world of his late father's estate executor and, later, his fiancée.

title: A Hand Is on the Gate
description: A cast of eight reads writings by African-American authors and performs traditional African-American songs.

title: Annie Get Your Gun
description: Sharp-shooting country girl Annie Oakley is such a natural with a gun that she ultimately becomes the star of Buffalo Bill's Wild West show — to the consternation of the man she loves but can out-shoot, Frank Butler.

title: A Delicate Balance
description: Suburban couple Agnes and Tobias, who live with Agnes's alcoholic sister Claire, must cope with the unexpected arrivals of their friends Harry and Edna and their daughter Julia, in Edward Albee's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Manuela Vargas
description: Manuela Vargas and her company perform an evening of flamenco music and dance.

title: Dinner at Eight
description: A couple in financial trouble invite a variety of socially prominent, social-climbing and socially fading characters to a dinner party at their home.

title: Help Stamp Out Marriage!
description: Two couples, one married and one having a secret affair, are in the same apartment, in this Keith Waterhouse and Willis Hall comedy.

title: The Investigation
description: The court record of a 1964-65 German court trial for 21 people implicated in the deaths at the Auschwitz concentration camp is enacted onstage, with actors portraying the accused individuals and various witnesses.

title: The Killing of Sister George
description: A radio actress clings to her role as Sister George, a nurse who is ultimately killed off a BBC soap opera, while dealing with her needy roommate in real life.

title: The Loves of Cass McGuire
description: A strong-willed but boozy woman returns to her Irish homeland after years in America, only to find herself being sent by her family to a nursing home.

title: The Alchemist
description: A London gentleman must flee temporarily to the country to escape the plague. He leaves his townhouse in the care of his butler, who uses it to carry out illicit acts with a con-man and prostitute, in Ben Jonson's 1610 comedy.

title: The Apple Tree
description: Three one-act musicals about men, women and temptation, based on stories by Mark Twain, Frank R. Stockton and Jules Feiffer.

title: We Have Always Lived in the Castle
description: A teenage girl, her older sister and their aging uncle are the only survivors of a family's tragic death from poisoning. They have isolated themselves in the family home until the outside world intrudes and reveals their family's killer.

title: How's the World Treating You?
description: A young man fails as a soldier, a lover and a husband, ultimately attempting suicide.

title: Threepenny Opera
description:
The outlaw Macheath is repeatedly betrayed and sent to prison, only to receive a last-minute reprieve from Queen Victoria, in Kurt Weill and Bertolt Brecht's darkly satirical adaptation of
John Gay's The Beggar's Opera.

title: Under the Weather
description: An evening of three one-act comedies. In the first, a widower tries to avoid remarrying. The second follows a Nobel Prize-winning scientist who travels to Florida to persuade a childhood friend to show him an intimately located wen she once let him see. The final play sees a prostitute unsuccessfully trying for a deeper relationship with her 87-year-old friend.

title: Gilbert Becaud on Broadway
description: French singer Gilbert Becaud performs in concert on Broadway.

title: The Rose Tattoo
description: A Sicilian seamstress mourning her husband's death finds love again with a passionate truck driver.

title: Let's Sing Yiddish
description: This Yiddish-language musical deals with daily life in a Central European village and then with the struggles and assimilation of American immigrants.

title: The Apparition Theatre of Prague
description: The Apparition Theatre of Prague performs in black clothes against black backgrounds to highlight "animated," brightly painted objects.

title: Les Ballets Africains
description: The national dance company of Guinea performs a dance concert on Broadway.

title: Don't Drink the Water
description: In Woody Allen's comedy, a caterer from Newark, New Jersey, travels behind the Iron Curtain with his wife and daughter; all become suspected of being spies and must hide out in the American Embassy.

title: Cabaret
description: Cabaret singer Sally Bowles performs at the decadent Kit Kat Klub as the Nazi Party quietly takes hold of 1930s Berlin.

title: The School for Scandal
description: The gossip, backbiting and romantic scheming of London society are satirized in Richard Brinsley Sheridan's 1777 comedy.

title: Right You Are If You Think You Are
description: A woman's identity is kept a secret, with two distinctly different possibilites, in Luigi Pirandello's play.

title: Those That Play the Clowns
description: The circumstances surrounding the acting troupe that puts on the fateful play-within-the-play in Hamlet are the subject of Michael Stewart's play.

title: Walking Happy
description: A shoemaker's daughter sets out to marry and build the business prospects of her father's seemingly ordinary apprentice in this musical adaptation of Harold Brighouse's play Hobson's Choice.

title: Hail Scrawdyke!
description: A young art student organizes his friends into a fantasy rebellion that ultimately proves ineffective.

title: I Do! I Do!
description: A married couple survives ups and downs through the years, in Tom Jones and Harvey Schmidt's musical adaptation of Jan de Hartog's play The Fourposter.

title: My Sweet Charlie
description: A black lawyer on the run after killing a white man in self-defense meets a poor, pregnant white girl hiding in an abandoned summer home on the Gulf Coast.

title: Yerma
description: A peasant wife is driven mad by her infertility, even after learning that her husband never wanted a child.

title: Agatha Sue, I Love You
description: Two broke horse gamblers try to raise another stake with the help of a pretty folk singer in the hotel room next to theirs.

title: A Joyful Noise
description: A country singer who wanders the American South is run out of a Tennessee town by the father of the girl he loves, later returning as a singing idol who has chosen to return to the simple singing life.

title: We, Comrades Three
description: The life, times and work of the 19th-century poet Walt Whitman are the subject of Richard Baldridge's play.

title: The Star-Spangled Girl
description: Two roommates and co-editors of an intellectual magazine are distracted by the pretty blonde in the neighboring apartment in Neil Simon's comedy.

title: At the Drop of Another Hat
description: Lyricist Michael Flanders and composer Donald Swann perform a series of their comic songs, with Flanders interjecting commentary and performing a monologue.

title: The Persecution and Assassination of Jean-Paul Marat as Performed by the Inmates of the Asylum of Charenton Under the Direction of the Marquis de Sade
description: The inmates of France's Charenton Asylum are instructed to perform a play detailing the events that led to the assassination of radical journalist Jean-Paul Marat during the French Revolution. The performance is directed by their fellow inmate, the Marquis de Sade, and has a revolutionary character of its own, intended to defy the hospital director and staff.

title: The Homecoming
description: An expat professor brings his wife home to North London to meet his working-class family. Fraught with jealousy, tension and rivalry, the homecoming threatens their marriage and intensifies a lifetime of aggression among brothers and sons.

title: The Wild Duck
description: A wealthy merchant's son returns home after a time to discover that his old schoolmate has married and has a daughter with the family servant, whom the merchant's wife believed had an affair with her husband, in Henrik Ibsen's 1884 play.

title: The Astrakhan Coat
description: A thieving killer and his twin accomplices leave a naïve young waiter to take the blame for their crimes.

title: Come Live With Me
description: A writer lives in a London flat with a beautiful young nanny, but he is dogged by many visitors, including his wife.

title: The East Wind
description: Two Central European refugees survive war and hardship to open a delicatessen in London, and the men react to their circumstances in very different ways.

title: You Can't Take It With You
description: An eccentric family allows each member to pursue his own ambition in the home, but their routine is disrupted when a daughter with a regular job wants to bring her fiancé and his Wall Street family to dinner in George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy.

title: The Paisley Convertible
description: Newlyweds cope with their former fiancés and the bride's mother in Harry Cauley's romantic comedy.

title: Love in E Flat
description: A medical intern and a schoolteacher carry on a romance while keeping listening devices in each other's apartments.

title: Of Love Remembered
description: A Norwegian family immigrates to St. Paul, MN, and deals with life and love over 50 years.

title: The Natural Look
description: A working wife struggles to hold down her job and hold onto her husband.

title: You Know I Can't Hear You When the Water's Running
description: An evening of four one-acts about sex and relationships. In The Shock of Recognition, a respected playwright decides to add a new scene to his latest play. The Footsteps of Doves deals with a couple arguing over ditching their double bed for two singles. In I'll Be Home for Christmas, two suburban parents struggle over how to communicate the facts of life to their children. In I'm Herbert, two old people get confused about their past marital lives.

title: That Summer - That Fall
description: The Greek-French tragedy of Phaedra, in which a wife falls tragically in love with her stepson, is updated to take place within a modern Italian family.

title: War and Peace
description: Five Russian aristocratic families go through personal changes as their country is invaded by Napoleon in the early 19th century, in this adaptation of the classic Leo Tolstoy novel.

title: Sherry!
description: An imperious drama critic breaks his leg while staying at a suburban Ohio home on a lecture tour, turning the house upside down with his demands and visiting theatrical friends, in Laurence Rosenthal and James Lipton's musical adaptation of Kaufman and Hart's play The Man Who Came to Dinner.

title: Hello, Solly!
description: A cast of five performs a collection of acts in the Yiddish vaudeville tradition.

title: Illya Darling
description: An American schoolteacher vacationing in Greece falls for a local prostitute and tries to take her away from a life that makes her happy, in this musical adaptation of the 1960 film Never on Sunday.

title: Galileo
description: The astronomer Galileo battles the Catholic Church for his right to express his theory of how the planets move around the sun.

title: A Warm Body
description: A worldly archaeologist finds himself in the apartment of a more skeptical newspaperwoman.

title: Little Murders
description: Carol Newquist sees the world going to hell and taking his children with it, until the family is forced to shoot back at bullets coming through their home, in Jules Feiffer's absurdist comedy.

title: Hallelujah, Baby!
description: A black maid struggles toward success in show business over a 60-year period of changing race relations. Times change, but she always remains the same age.

title: The Imaginary Invalid
description: A hypochondriac plans to marry his daughter to a doctor although she loves another man, in Moliere's 1673 comedy.

title: A Touch of the Poet
description: The first and only finished play in Eugene O'Neill's proposed 11-part "American history" cycle addresses the immigrant experience, focusing on the father-daughter conflict of a once-wealthy, still grandly mannered tavern-keeper outside Boston in 1828 and his headstrong offspring who aligns herself with a rich American.

title: Tonight at 8:30
description:
An evening of one-act plays by Noel Coward.  In Ways and Means, a debt-plagued gambler and his wife are saved from final disgrace when a chauffeur who had planned to rob them saves them instead.  Still Life depicts the frustrated secret affair between two married middle-class people.  Fumed Oak follows a middle-aged salesman who has earned enough money to tell off his wife, mother-in-law and daughter and to leave them.
Note: The original 1936 production of Tonight at 8:30 contained nine one-act plays performed over three evenings, including We Were Dancing, The Astonished Heart, Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Shadow Play, Ways and Means and Still Life. Six one-acts (Red Peppers, Hands Across the Sea, Fumed Oak, Family Album, Shadow Play, and Ways and Means) were performed in a 1948 revival.  Only three of the one-acts were performed in the 1967 revival.

title: Sing Israel, Sing
description: A kibbutz in Israel provides the setting for performances of Yiddish and Israeli folklore, jokes and songs.

title: The Girl in the Freudian Slip
description: A psychiatrist deals with sex problems at home and in the office in this comedy.

title: The Unknown Soldier and His Wife
description: The Unknown Soldier goes off to die in 2,000 years worth of battles, before finally deciding not to go to war again.

title: Judy Garland "At Home at the Palace"
description: Judy Garland returns to the Palace Theatre to perform in concert with her children, Lorna and Joey Luft, and with dancer John Bubbles, comedian Jackie Vernon and juggler Francis Brunn.

title: Eddie Fisher and Buddy Hackett at the Palace
description: Eddie Fisher sings, Buddy Hackett performs a comedy monologue, and the two team up for a finale.

title: Dr. Cook's Garden
description: A young doctor discovers that a kindly older doctor has actually been poisoning undesirable human beings to improve his community.

title: Keep It in the Family
description: A domineering father believes his actions in his family are for their own good, but they lead his wife and children to revolt against him.

title: Song of the Grasshopper
description: An amiable, unambitious man comes into conflict with the ideals of middle-class hard work and snobbery over achievement.

title: The Birthday Party
description: A young boarder is visited by two sinister strangers on his birthday. They organize an unusually violent party for him, then dress him up in his best clothes the next day and take him away to places unknown.

title: A Minor Adjustment
description: A father asks his firm's press agent's mistress to seduce his rebellious young son.

title: Johnny No-Trump
description: An aspiring teenage poet is torn between his father and his uncle, finally reconciling both influences before tragedy befalls his family.

title: Marlene Dietrich
description: Legendary singer Marlene Dietrich performs a concert of German songs and other standards.

title: After the Rain
description: The second Great Flood, which supposedly happened in 1969, is described by a lecturer and acted out. A leader of a group of survivors becomes a tyrant who must be killed and leaves behind an authoritarian form of government that continues after his death.

title: By George
description: Max Adrian impersonates George Bernard Shaw in an evening taken from the great playwright's non-theatrical writings, including his letters, reviews and critical essays, which he wrote between the ages 38 to 93.

title: Daphne in Cottage D
description: Two lonely, neurotic people meet at a resort hotel, get drunk, lash out and confess their fears and dreams to each other.

title: Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead
description: The events of William Shakespeare's Hamlet are treated in dark comedic fashion by Tom Stoppard as seen from the points of view of Rosencrantz and Guildenstern, Hamlet's friends at court who are being sent to their deaths by forces they are unable to comprehend.

title: There's a Girl in My Soup
description: A middle-aged gourmet chef becomes entangled with a mod-ish young lady in this British sex farce.

title: Mirele Efros
description: A family matriarch is victimized by her uncaring children.

title: What Did We Do Wrong?
description: A businessman turns himself into a hippie in order to match his drop-out son in wild behavior.

title: Henry, Sweet Henry
description: A lonely and neglected teenager idolizes and follows the exploits of a famous concert pianist and ladykiller, in Bob Merrill and Nunnally Johnson's musical adaptation of the Nora Johnson novel and film The World of Henry Orient.

title: The Little Foxes
description: Southern belle Regina Giddens and her brothers scheme to outwit Regina's husband Horace, who opposes their attempts to profit from a cotton factory in partnership with a Chicago businessman, in Lillian Hellman's look at the power of money to destroy lives.

title: More Stately Mansions
description: In Eugene O'Neill's continuation of the early-American story he began in A Touch of the Poet, innkeeper's daughter Sara Melody marries the well-to-do Simon Harford but must contend with Simon's domineering mother for his true love and loyalty.

title: The Trial of Lee Harvey Oswald
description: The imagined trial of Lee Harvey Oswald, in which he testifies that his murder of President Kennedy was part of a conspiracy, is dramatized by Amram Ducovny and Leon Friedman.

title: The Ninety Day Mistress
description: A 25-year-old girl has been warned against forming lasting romantic attachments, so she makes sure that her many love affairs each last only 90 days.

title: Halfway Up the Tree
description: A retired British general turns himself into a bearded hippie, playing guitar in a tree, in order to understand his children in Peter Ustinov's comedy.

title: The Promise
description: Two young men and a young woman meet during the bombing of Leningrad and form lasting attachments.

title: Mother Courage and Her Children
description: A crafty canteen woman working with the Swedish army is determined to profit by the Thirty Years' War, but ultimately uses all three of her children to do it.

title: Something Different
description: A playwright tries to repeat a past success by recreating the conditions under which he wrote the first play, when he was unmarried and still living with his mother.

title: Everything in the Garden
description: A group of upper-middle-class wives discovers they can earn money at a city brothel to support their spending habits.

title: Pantagleize
description: An innocent man unwittingly gives the signal for a bloody revolution, which ultimately destroys him.

title: The Show Off
description: A clerk at New York's Penn Station is given to exaggerating his own role at the station in George Kelly's satire.

title: How Now, Dow Jones
description: The woman charged with reporting the Dow Jones average reports falsely that it has hit 1,000, because her fiancé has promised to marry her when that happens.

title: Spofford
description: A retired chicken farmer sees his country town invaded by big-city commuters and sets out to study their ways, in Herman Shumlin's comedy.

title: Brief Lives
description: Patrick Garland's one-man play is told from the perspective of John Aubrey, a 17th-century Englishman who met and kept accounts of many of the famous men of his day, including Rene Descartes, Thomas Hobbes and Christopher Wren.

title: Paul Taylor Dancers
description: Paul Taylor's modern dance company perform his latest ballets, including Taylor's Lento and Agathe's Tale.

title: How to Be a Jewish Mother
description: The typical Jewish mother is presented in a series of comic sketches and songs.

title: Saint Joan
description: Set in 15th century France, Saint Joan follows a country girl whose mysterious visions propel her into elite circles. When the nation’s rulers become threatened by her popularity and influence, they unite to bring her down and she finds herself on trial for her life.

title: Exit the King
description: Ionesco's absurdist drama follows King Berenger I in the final day of his life, surrounded by a decaying kingdom, as he refuses to acknowledge death and slowly acquiesces to its reality.

title: Staircase
description: Two lonely, aging gay men attempt to form a lasting affectionate friendship despite their differences.

title: Before You Go
description: An aspiring actress and her dog take refuge from a thunderstorm in a Greenwich Village apartment belonging to a failed sculptor who is set on seducing the actress.

title: The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
description: A romantic Scottish schoolteacher instills the value of passion in her female students but is undone by her admiration of fascism, in Jay Allen's adaptation of the Muriel Spark novel.

title: The Happy Time
description: A magazine photographer remembers visiting his French-Canadian home and family, including an aging father and impressionable nephew, after years of travel, in this musical adaptation of the Robert L. Fontaine novel and Samuel Taylor play.

title: I Never Sang for My Father
description: A middle-aged son attempts to connect with his difficult, aging father.

title: Darling of the Day
description: A famous painter takes on the identity of his late valet, even marrying the man's wife, in Jule Styne and E.Y. Harburg's musical adaptation of Arnold Bennett's novel Buried Alive.

title: Avanti!
description: In Samuel Taylor's comedy, an American businessman and a British girl are brought together in a Rome hotel suite by an Italian fixer eager to get them together.

title: A Day in the Death of Joe Egg
description: A married couple struggle to deal with their disabled daughter, inventing conversations, characteristics and a full imaginary life for her as their own marriage falls apart.

title: Golden Rainbow
description: A widower allows his young son to run wild in a Las Vegas hotel until his brother and sister-in-law come to raise the child themselves, in Walter Marks and Ernest Kinoy's musical adaptation of Arnold Schulman's play A Hole in the Head.

title: The New Music Hall of Israel
description: A young troupe of Israeli performers puts on a vaudeville act of songs, dances and novelty acts.

title: The Price
description: When the Great Depression cost his family their fortune, Victor Franz gave up his dream of an education to support his father. Three decades later, Victor has returned to his childhood home to sell the remainder of his parents’ estate. His wife, his estranged brother, and the wily furniture dealer hired to appraise their possessions all arrive with their own agendas, forcing Victor to confront a question, long-stifled, about the value of his sacrifice.

title: Plaza Suite
description: An evening of three one-acts set in the Plaza Hotel.  In Visitor from Mamaroneck, a middle-aged married couple tries to rekindle their dying spark. In Visitor from Hollywood, a film producer invites his childhood sweetheart to a hotel for sex. In Visitor from Forest Hills, a bride has locked herself in the bathroom on her wedding day, with her parents desperate to get her out.

title: Les Ballets Africains
description: The national dance company of Guinea performs a dance concert on Broadway.

title: Carry Me Back to Morningside Heights
description: A young Jewish man insists on becoming a slave to an African-American law student as a personal penance for the years of wrongs whites have done to blacks.

title: Portrait of a Queen
description: Queen Victoria's life is dramatized from her own letters and diaries, as well as commentary from her contemporaries.

title: Tiger at the Gates
description: Ancient Trojan military commander Hector struggles to avoid war with the Greeks over the abducted Helen in Christopher Fry's adaptation of Jean Giraudoux's anti-war play The Trojan War Will Not Take Place.

title: Here's Where I Belong
description: The relationship between two brothers sours as they compete for their California farmer father's love, in this musical adaptation of John Steinbeck's novel East of Eden.

title: The Guide
description: A tour director pretends to be a holy man in an Indian village, in this adaptation of R.K. Narayan's novel.

title: Weekend
description: A Presidential candidate turns his son's black girlfriend into a political asset in Gore Vidal's comedy.

title: Loot
description: In this British farce, a teenager and his friend rob a bank and hide the loot in the teen's mother's coffin, but the arrival of an inspector sends their hapless plans into chaos.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: The Seven Descents of Myrtle
description: An ineffectual and dying mother's-boy marries a fading actress and brings her home to the family's Southern farm to spite his swarthy half-brother.

title: The Education of H*Y*M*A*N K*A*P*L*A*N
description: A tailor with big dreams is part of a group of immigrants training to become American citizens, in this musical adaptation of stories by Leo Rosten.

title: George M!
description: The life and career of the early 20th-century musical comedy man and impresario George M. Cohan is musicalized using his classic song catalog.

title: Mike Downstairs
description: A Little Italy resident does what he can to help his neighbors amid the chaos of modern Manhattan and the world.

title: I'm Solomon
description: A cobbler who resembles King Solomon takes the king's place while the king pretends to be a commoner for a day, in this musical adaptation of the play King Solomon and the Cobbler.

title: The Exercise
description: An actor and actress improvise personal expressions of their own emotional problems as part of their rehearsal process.

title: Cyrano de Bergerac
description: Cyrano is a poet, philosopher and swordsman of incredible wit, but his sizable nose renders him too shy to pursue the beautiful Roxane. Instead, he provides the poetry and eloquence to woo her vicariously through his inarticulate friend Christian.

title: Hair
description: The musical that introduced rock 'n' roll to the theatrical stage, Hair examines a group of 60s-era youth struggling for generational and personal identity, dealing with the Vietnam War, and exploring drugs and the sexual revolution.

title: Soldiers
description: A play being rehearsed in Coventry, England, for the 100th anniversary of the Geneva Convention asserts that Winston Churchill backed the mass bombing of German cities in 1943 and condoned Polish General Sikorski's murder to appease Josef Stalin.

title: Leonard Sillman's New Faces of 1968
description: In this musical revue, sixteen of producer Leonard Sillman's discoveries perform songs, dances and sketches.

title: Happiness Is Just a Little Thing Called a Rolls Royce
description: A shy lawyer is pushed to succeed by his ambitious wife.

title: The Only Game in Town
description: A Las Vegas dancer and pianist start a casual affair, but become caught up in "the only game in town": love and marriage.

title: Martha Graham and Dance Company
description: Martha Graham's company of modern dancers perform her ballets Dancing-Ground, Cortege of Eagles, Acrobats of God, Appalachian Spring and A Time of Snow.

title: The Venetian Twins
description: A set of twins, one intelligent and brave and the other dim-witted and cowardly, are repeatedly mixed up in Carlo Goldoni's 1747 comedy.

title: George Dandin
description: A man who marries a higher-born wife must endure her extravagant whims — and affairs — in Moliere's 1668 comedy.

title: Tartuffe
description: A religious conman infiltrates the household of a gullible man and his exasperated family in Moliere's 1664 comedy.

title: Martha Graham and Dance Company
description: Martha Graham's company of modern dancers perform her ballets Dancing-Ground, Cortege of Eagles, Acrobats of God, Appalachian Spring and A Time of Snow.

title: Lovers
description: An evening of two Brian Friel one-acts.  In Winners, a young couple happily prepare for their wedding day, unaware of the tragic accident about to befall them.  A Commentator describes the accident to the audience, and both narrates and appears in Losers, in which he plays a middle-aged husband locking horns with a domineering mother-in-law.

title: Pantagleize
description: An innocent man unwittingly gives the signal for a bloody revolution, which ultimately destroys him.

title: The Show Off
description: A clerk at New York's Penn Station is given to exaggerating his own role at the station in George Kelly's satire.

title: Lovers and Other Strangers
description: An evening of four untitled comedic one-acts.  The first deals with the lead-up to a seduction, the second with a married couple's quarrel, the third with a groom getting cold feet the night before his wedding and the fourth with a father and mother struggling to help their son be confident about his marriage.

title: The Cuban Thing
description: A Cuban family that had lived comfortably under Fulgencio Batista's regime comes to accept Fidel Castro gradually after the revolution that brings him to power.

title: Woman Is My Idea
description: This romantic comedy looks at romances developing among the Mormons of the Brigham Young era in Salt Lake City.

title: The Man in the Glass Booth
description: A Jewish multimillionaire poses as a Nazi war criminal so that he may be put on trial in Israel and give the Jewish people a face on which to project their fantasies of the most vicious, unrepentant Nazi imaginable.

title: Noël Coward's Sweet Potato
description: In this revue a cast of nine performs songs, sketches and scenes from plays written by Noël Coward.

title: Box / Quotations from Chairman Mao Tse-Tung
description: Box is a recorded commentary on life which is later replayed in Quotations, in which Chairman Mao's recitation of his quotes overlaps with the Box commentary, a recitation of a Will Carlton poem and a confession to a priest.

title: The Death of Bessie Smith / The American Dream
description: Two one-act plays by Edward Albee. The Death of Bessie Smith follows conversations between the staff at a "Whites-Only" hospital on the day black blues singer Bessie Smith died in a car crash. In The American Dream, an elderly grandmother exposes a squabbling couple's secret to their neighbor.

title: The Great White Hope
description: African-American boxing champion Jack Jefferson, who is loosely modeled on his real-life counterpart, Jack Johnson, suffers racism due to his success and his relationship with a white woman, in Howard Sackler's Pulitzer Prize-winning drama.

title: Marlene Dietrich
description: Legendary singer Marlene Dietrich performs a concert of German songs and other standards.

title: Gilbert Becaud Sings Love
description: French singer Gilbert Becaud performs in concert on Broadway.

title: The Cocktail Party
description: The guests at a fashionable cocktail party discover that the hostess is missing and a strange guest has taken over her flat, in T.S. Eliot's dissection of London society.

title: Krapp's Last Tape / The Zoo Story
description: An evening of two one-act plays.  In Samuel Beckett's Krapp's Last Tape, an aging man reviews his collection of tapes and records a new one.  Edward Albee's The Zoo Story depicts a disturbing encounter between a complacent middle-class man and a troubled young vagabond on a Central Park bench.

title: The Misanthrope
description: In Moliere's 1666 satire of social hypocrisy, a Paris aristocrat detests the shallow artifice of his peers but falls for a flirtatious girl who gleefully exhibits all the social traits he hates.

title: The Megilla of Itzik Manger
description: The Old Testament's Book of Esther, in which Esther marries a Persian king and ends his persecution of the Jews, is re-set in a modern shtetl as a Yiddish-language musical.

title: The Flip Side
description: Hugh and Margaret Williams' comedy takes a look at the then-current phenomenon of wife-swapping.

title: Happy Days
description: A woman chatters away to her barely responsive husband and merrily goes about her daily routine — despite being nearly buried in a mound of sand outside in broad daylight, with a mysterious bell ringing whenever she would sleep.

title: We Bombed in New Haven
description: Actors rehearse a play about an Air Force bombing squadron sent to ridiculous targets in Joseph Heller's satire. The actor playing the squadron commander frequently steps out of character to reassure the audience that they are only watching a play.

title: Her First Roman
description: The romance between Julius Caesar and Cleopatra is depicted in a comedic manner, with Caesar as an elderly philosopher-warrior educating the kittenish Cleopatra, in this musical adaptation of George Bernard Shaw's Caesar and Cleopatra.

title: Maggie Flynn
description: An Irish-American woman running a New York orphanage keeps her charges together during the tensions leading to the Civil War draft riots.

title: Rockefeller and the Red Indians
description: This British comedy spoofs Westerns as they are depicted in movies and on television.

title: King Lear
description:
In William Shakespeare's royal-family tragedy, the aging King Lear divides his estate between
his three daughters, ultimately refusing his youngest and favorite her share because she won't
publicly admit her love for him. The decision leads to chaos and treachery within the kingdom and madness for its monarch.

title: A Cry of Players
description: Will, a young Englishman, rebels against the constraints of his marriage and his society until he runs away to join a troupe of actors — and presumably to write plays for them under the name William Shakespeare.

title: Zorba
description: Zorba the Greek teaches his life-embracing philosophy to a more uptight young student who has inherited a mine in Crete. Zorba maintains his joy in living despite several tragedies, in John Kander, Fred Ebb and Joseph Stein's musical adaptation of Nikos Kazantzakis' novel Zorba the Greek and its 1964 film.

title: Morning, Noon and Night
description: An evening of three one-act plays.  In Morning, a black family takes medicine that turns them white.  Noon follows a group of sexual deviants who are brought together as a practical joke.  In Night, four mourners honor a dead friend at a cemetery, while a fifth comes to bury a dog.

title: Promises, Promises
description: To gain favor at work, a junior executive allows bigwigs to use his apartment for trysts. His plan works swimmingly until he discovers his own office crush is one of the late-night visitors. Based on the movie The Apartment by Billy Wilder.

title: The Goodbye People
description: A Coney Island hot dog salesman comes out of retirement to risk everything on reopening his stand.

title: Jimmy Shine
description: A struggling abstract painter reenacts romantic and other adventures from his past, occasionally in song, in Murray Schisgal's play.

title: The House of Atreus
description: Agamemnon, the king of Argos, returns home from fighting the Trojan War to find his adulterous wife, Clytemnestra, ready to murder him for sacrificing their daughter, Iphigenia, in Aeschylus' tragedy, the first in his Oresteia trilogy.

title: The Sudden & Accidental Re-Education of Horse Johnson
description: A warehouse worker takes some time off to study, planning to learn how to change the world.

title: Arturo Ui
description: A Chicago mobster's rise to power eerily parallels that of Adolf Hitler in Bertolt Brecht's parable.

title: Forty Carats
description: A 40-year-old divorcee has a rejuvenating affair with a younger man in Jay Allen's adaptation of the Pierre Barillet and Jean-Pierre Gredy comedy.

title: The Fig Leaves Are Falling
description: A middle-aged man leaves his wife and suburban family for a fling with a sexually liberated younger woman.

title: Hadrian VII
description: The rejected priest Frederick William Rolfe lives in disgraced exile and escapes into a fantasy that he has been elected Pope.

title: Harkness Ballet
description: The Harkness Ballet performs a program of 17 ballets on Broadway.

title: Merce Cunningham Dance Company
description: The Merce Cunningham Dance Company performs innovative modern dances choreographed by Merce Cunningham.

title: Cock-a-Doodle Dandy
description: A magical rooster appears in an Irish parish and forces its congregants to make choices about their lives, in Sean O'Casey's darkly comic parable about mid-century Irish life.

title: Celebration
description: A young boy seeks to plant a garden in the yard of a recently demolished church, and competes with an older playboy for the attentions of a selfish dancer in this Harvey Schmidt-Tom Jones musical.

title: Red, White and Maddox
description: Don Tucker and Jay Broad's musical satirizes Georgia Governor Lester Maddox, eventually predicting he will become a destructive President of the United States.

title: Fire!
description: At an unexplained meeting, a bully forces the participants to confess their sins and yell, "Fire!" as a form of cleansing themselves.

title: The Mother Lover
description: An emotionally estranged mother and son are joined on one of their dutiful visits with each other by a call girl.

title: Canterbury Tales
description: A group of pilgrims entertain each other with stories of love, deception and bawdy humor en route to the tomb of St. Thomas-Becket in Canterbury.  A musical adaptation of the "tales" written by Geoffrey Chaucer in the late 1300s.

title: Dear World
description: A deranged countess and her associates scheme to stop businessmen from drilling for oil under the streets of their Parisian neighborhood, in Jerry Herman, Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee's musical adaptation of Jean Giraudoux's play The Madwoman of Chaillot.

title: Play It Again, Sam
description: A film critic depressed over his wife's abandonment places himself in a film fantasy life where he is coached by his hero, Humphrey Bogart.

title: The National Theater of the Deaf
description: A rotating program of one-acts, performed in sign-language and pantomime.  The plays include The Tale of Kasane, Tyger! Tyger! and other burnings, Poems by Children, On the Harmfulness of Tobacco, Blueprints, Gianni Schicchi, and The Critic

title: Does a Tiger Wear a Necktie?
description: Juvenile drug addicts react to various attempts to rehabilitate them in detention, particularly those of a dedicated English teacher.

title: But, Seriously...
description: A Hollywood screenwriter experiences marital and other personal problems in Julius Epstein's rueful comedy.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: The Wrong Way Light Bulb
description: A liberal writer inherits an apartment house in a neighborhood experiencing many social changes and tensions, and he finds his old ways of coping to be inadequate.

title: Zelda
description: A modern-day Noah and his family prepare to survive the end of the world, which comes in the form of a hurricane named Zelda.

title: In the Matter of J. Robert Oppenheimer
description: The Atomic Energy Commission hearing on the security clearance of the atomic bomb's "father," J. Robert Oppenheimer, has been fancifully dramatized by Heinar Kipphardt.

title: The Watering Place
description: A veteran of the Vietnam War moves in with and disrupts the lives of his dead friend's family.

title: The Dozens
description: A nightclub singer and her weak husband meet and spend a night in hiding with a fugitive leader of an African country.

title: Come Summer
description: An aging peddler and his young companion find adventure while working the Connecticut River Valley in 1840.

title: Billy
description: An innocent young sailor is accused of mutiny, and then tried for murder, in this musical adaptation of Herman Melville's novella Billy Budd.

title: Cop-out
description: An evening of two one-act plays by John Guare.  In Home Fires, a family of German immigrants suffers tension in the wake of the Armistice ending World War I.  Cop-Out depicts the relationship between several policemen and their wives, with one man and one woman playing all the parts.

title: The Megilla of Itzik Manger
description: The Old Testament's Book of Esther, in which Esther marries a Persian king and ends his persecution of the Jews, is re-set in a modern shtetl as a Yiddish-language musical.

title: The Gingham Dog
description: A liberal white Southern man and a black woman from Harlem suffer the breakup of their marriage.

title: Trumpets of the Lord
description: Vinnette Carroll's musical, adapted from James Weldon Johnson's verse sermons "God's Trombone" and various gospel hymns, transports the audience to a religious revival meeting.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: The Jimmy Roselli Show
description: Singer Jimmy Roselli performs a concert on Broadway, with a guest appearance by comedian Pat Cooper.

title: The Miser
description: A rich miser wants to marry off his daughter to a rich older man and his son to a rich widow, having his own designs on his son's beloved, in Moliere's 1668 comedy.

title: The Front Page
description: A managing editor of a Chicago newspaper fights to keep his star reporter on the story of a condemned anarchist's jailbreak, when the reporter is ready to quit and get married.

title: The World's a Stage
description: Sam Vine performs a one-man, theatrically designed program of hypnotism that includes audience participation.

title: My Daughter, Your Son
description: Two families prepare for the wedding of their children, who have been living together for a while.

title: A Teaspoon Every Four Hours
description: A Jewish family deals with its daughter's upcoming nuptials in a comedic manner.

title: Oh! Calcutta!
description: Kenneth Tynan devised this musical revue, to which Samuel Beckett, John Lennon, Sam Shepard and others contributed sketches and songs of a cheekily erotic nature. The cast performs in the nude.

title: Tiny Alice
description: A powerful widow and her lawyer offer a generous grant to the Church on the condition that the Cardinal's naïve secretary be used as a liaison, in Edward Albee's look at the corruption involved in mixing religion and money.

title: The New Music Hall of Israel
description: A young troupe of Israeli performers puts on a vaudeville act of songs, dances and novelty acts.

title: The New Music Hall of Israel
description: A young troupe of Israeli performers puts on a vaudeville act of songs, dances and novelty acts.

title: A Flea in Her Ear
description: A handful of French married couples determined to have affairs convene at a notorious hotel in Georges Feydeau's 1907 sex farce.

title: A Patriot for Me
description: An Austrian intelligence officer becomes involved in an espionage scandal with homosexual elements.

title: The Three Sisters
description: Sisters Olga, Masha and Irina long to leave their provincial military town for Moscow and grapple with frustrated love and disappointment, in Anton Chekhov's 1901 drama.

title: Indians
description: Buffalo Bill is portrayed as conflicted about the treatment of Native Americans and buffalo during the opening of the American West in Arthur Kopit's play.

title: The Penny Wars
description: A family struggling through the Depression loses a father to death and a stepfather to suicide, in Elliott Baker's dramatization of his novel.

title: Three Men on a Horse
description: A meek writer of greeting cards has a knack for picking the winning horse at the race track, which brings him to the attention of some gamblers down on their luck, in this Depression-era farce.

title: Butterflies Are Free
description: A blind young man leaves his over-protective mother to live in Greenwich Village, and falls in love with the girl in the neighboring apartment.

title: Jimmy
description: The glamorous life of James J. "Jimmy" Walker, mayor of New York City from 1926 to 1932, is musicalized.

title: Angela
description: A middle-aged wife begins an affair with a young TV repairman.

title: The Time of Your Life
description: A group of eccentrics inhabit a dive bar in San Francisco, developing friendships and romances, in William Saroyan's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: King Henry V
description: William Shakespeare's play portrays the victory of the English King Henry V over the French at the Battle of Agincourt during the Hundred Years' War.

title: Our Town
description: The Stage Manager guides audiences through a small New England town in the early 1900s, as its inhabitants grow up, get married and discover the beauty of life, in Thornton Wilder's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Buck White
description: A militant black lecturer addresses a meeting organized by a black political group in this musical adaptation of Joseph Dolan Tuotti's play Big Time Buck White.

title: Private Lives
description: Divorcees Elyot and Amanda unexpectedly meet while honeymooning with their respective new spouses and discover that their passion for — and irritation with — each other is just as strong as ever.

title: The Mundy Scheme
description: A political scheme to use Ireland as a burial ground for the dead of the other crowded cities of the world causes controversy in Brian Friel's comedy.

title: La Strada
description: A naive young woman becomes the assistant to an abusive circus strongman, later befriending a clown who arouses the strongman's jealousy, in this musical adaptation of Federico Fellini's 1954 film.

title: Coco
description: The Parisian dress designer Coco Chanel makes a comeback after years of retirement while reminiscing about her childhood in Andre Previn and Alan Jay Lerner's musical.

title: Love Is a Time of Day
description: Two college students engage in a love affair in John Patrick's comedy.

title: Last of the Red Hot Lovers
description: A middle-aged, overweight and married restaurant owner tries to join the sexual revolution in three separate affairs that fall flat in Neil Simon's comedy.

title: No Place to Be Somebody
description: A black bartender attempts to outwit a white mobster syndicate in Charles Gordone's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: The National Theater of the Deaf
description: An evening of two plays performed in pantomime and sign language with spoken narration. Sganarelle, Moliere's 1660s comedy, details a man's attempts to kill his wife's supposed lover. Songs from Milk Wood is adapted from Under Milk Wood, Dylan Thomas' dramatic collection of stories of life in a Welsh village.

title: Watercolor & Criss-crossing
description: An evening of two one-act plays.  In Watercolor, various couples discuss sex and philosophy on the beach.  Criss-Crossing depicts modern violence in a cartoonish fashion.

title: Brightower
description: A biographer looks into the life of a famous writer who committed suicide, bringing up questions of the right to privacy.

title: Paris Is Out!
description: An elderly Jewish couple's plans for their first trip to Europe create mayhem within their family.

title: Charles Aznavour
description: Legendary French singer-songwriter Charles Aznavour performs many of his classic songs, including "Yesterday When I Was Young," in concert.

title: Gloria and Esperanza
description: An artist matures through a series of experiences involving a psychiatrist, a hospital, a TV show and other adventures.

title: Gantry
description: A preacher who works from revival tents in the 1920s gets mixed up with a female evangelist in this musical adaptation of Sinclair Lewis' novel Elmer Gantry.

title: Child's Play
description: A mysterious evil takes over a boys' school and leads to seemingly random, unexplained acts of violence.

title: Norman, Is That You?
description: A father visiting from Ohio discovers that his son in New York is living as a gay man.

title: Harvey
description: A harmless, alcoholic middle-aged man drives his sister crazy by insisting that his friendship with an invisible white rabbit is real, in Mary Chase's comic fantasy.

title: Georgy
description: An unattractive but appealing young girl has many romantic misadventures in swinging 1960s London, in this musical adaptation of the film Georgy Girl.

title: The Chinese and Dr. Fish
description: An evening of two one-acts by Murray Schisgal.  Dr. Fish follows a wife discussing her sex problems with an expert, who only increases them.  In The Chinese, a young man with Chinese parents disappoints his family by pretending to be Jewish.

title: Operation Sidewinder
description: In Sam Shepard's play racial and cultural tensions come to a boil just as a military computer built to resemble a rattlesnake mysteriously ends up in the desert.

title: Purlie
description: A black preacher returns to his hometown to open a church, outwitting a segregationist plantation owner to make it happen, in this musical adaptation of Ossie Davis' play Purlie Victorious.

title: Grin and Bare It! / Postcards
description: An evening of two one-act comedies. In Grin and Bare It!, the daughter of a nudist family brings her fiancé home to meet the family, who are practicing what they preach.  In Postcards, a man and woman compete for the best-written postcards to send to famous people.

title: Blood Red Roses
description: Britain's Crimean War of 1854-55 is used as the backdrop for this anti-war musical.

title: Minnie's Boys
description: Minnie Marx pushes her sons to succeed in vaudeville, with the sons eventually growing up to be the Marx Brothers.

title: Look to the Lilies
description: A group of German nuns ask a wandering black man to build them a church in New Mexico, in this musical adaptation of the William E. Barrett novel and the film Lilies of the Field.

title: Applause
description: Legendary actress Margo Channing becomes close to stage-struck young hopeful Eve Harrington, who turns out not to be as sweet as she seems, in Charles Strouse, Lee Adams, Betty Comden and Adolph Green's musical adaptation of the Mary Orr story that inspired the 1950 film All About Eve.

title: Borstal Boy
description: Frank McMahon adapts episodes from Irish writer and activist Brendan Behan's teenage years, during which he was caught with a suitcase of dynamite in England during the I.R.A. troubles and sentenced to serve in a boys' reformatory.

title: Candida
description: A minister's wife becomes an object of infatuation for an idealistic young poet, in George Bernard Shaw's comedic look at the changing views on gender and social equality.

title: Cry for Us All
description: In 1890s Brooklyn, an up-and-coming Irish politician's dreams and marriage are destroyed when a previous love affair is revealed, in Mitch Leigh, William Alfred, Phyllis Robinson and Alfred Marre's musical adaptation of Alfred's play Hogan's Goat.

title: The Boy Friend
description: A group of British girls studying at a finishing school in the south of France carry on romances with mistaken identities and other crises, as do the adults in their lives, in Sandy Wilson's affectionate parody of silly 1920s musicals.

title: A Place for Polly
description: An ambitious publisher is confronted with a stolen manuscript in Lonnie Coleman's play.

title: Park
description: Four members of a family meet in a park, as if they were strangers, and discover common bonds.

title: Inquest
description: The trial of accused atomic spies Ethel and Julius Rosenberg is reconstructed from authentic courtroom data, letters, tapes and other information.

title: Company
description: In a series of vignettes, New York bachelor Bobby learns about the perils and pleasures of love, marriage, dating and divorce from his married friends.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: Beggar on Horseback
description: An aspiring classical composer is bogged down by odd jobs and nagging in-laws in George S. Kaufman and Marc Connelly's comic dissection of the eternal art vs. commerce dilemma.

title: The Engagement Baby
description: A Jewish advertising man going through marriage problems discovers that he has a love child with his childhood sweetheart, a black woman.

title: Wilson in the Promise Land
description: President Woodrow Wilson, dealing with the fallout from World War I at the end of his administration, is haunted by the historical effects of the war as represented by figures from the past and present.

title: Othello
description: Othello, a Moor who has become a general in the Venetian army, sees his happy marriage to the beautiful Desdemona destroyed when his seemingly trustworthy ensign, Iago, suggests to him that she may be unfaithful, in William Shakespeare's tragedy of revenge, jealousy and intrigue.

title: Bob and Ray -- the Two and Only
description: Comedic impersonators Bob Elliott and Ray Goulding headline an evening of tongue-in-cheek interviews featuring their eccentric cast of characters.

title: Opium
description: This one-man play is adapted from Jean Cocteau's journals detailing his experience with opium addiction and withdrawal.  The drug ultimately becomes the second character in the play.

title: Conduct Unbecoming
description: An upstanding regiment of the British army in 1800s India is threatened by a secret, violent incident whose perpetrator they attempt to uncover.

title: The Rothschilds
description: The famous banking family rises from the Jewish ghetto to the royal courts of Europe in Jerry Bock, Sheldon Harnick and Sherman Yellen's musical.

title: Gandhi
description: Mahatma Gandhi's life and struggle for India's independence from Britain are dramatized by Gurney Campbell.

title: Paul Sills' Story Theatre
description: Second City founding director and improvisation legend Paul Sills created and directs this evening of theatre pieces adapted from Grimm Brothers fairy tales.

title: Light, Lively and Yiddish
description: Jewish life in a small Eastern European village is contrasted with life in the bustling cities of New York and Tel Aviv.

title: Not Now, Darling
description: Two mischievous furriers wreak sexual havoc in the lives of several married couples in this British sex farce.

title: The President's Daughter
description: A Yiddish-American family deals with life and love in a comedic manner in this episodic musical.

title: The Good Woman of Setzuan
description: Three gods seeking goodness in the city of Setzuan find only evil and corruption, with the exception of a prostitute who gives them shelter, in Bertolt Brecht's morality tale.

title: Hay Fever
description: Members of a theatrical family each invite a guest for a weekend on their country estate, leading to many complications and clashes between the culture of the theatre and the culture of the rest of the world.

title: Two by Two
description: The story of Noah and the ark is retold with Noah and his family characterized in a modern Jewish manner, in Richard Rodgers, Martin Charnin and Peter Stone's musical adaptation of Clifford Odets' play The Flowering Peach.

title: Sleuth
description: A detective story writer plays a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with his wife's lover in Anthony Shaffer's thriller.

title: Les Blancs
description: An African man who has been schooled in Europe returns home for his father's funeral and finds himself torn between two cultures in an atmosphere of racial violence.

title: The Castro Complex
description: An American woman besotted with Fidel Castro meets a real-life Cuban revolutionary seeking refuge from the CIA, who sets her straight about her hero.

title: The Candyapple
description: A priest who has given up his faith arrives at his brother's wedding with a motorcycle and a mistress, and everyone wonders how his father will take the change.

title: Foreplay
description: A formerly closeted and married man takes his first steps into  gay life.

title: The Gingerbread Lady
description: An alcoholic singer returns from rehab to a teenaged daughter, a self-absorbed ex-lover and friends, and must continue to struggle to keep her life together.

title: The Me Nobody Knows
description: The writings detailing the hopes and dreams of underprivileged children in New York City are musicalized by Gary William Friedman and Will Holt.

title: A Place Without Doors
description: A husband and his wife are questioned in the murder of their housekeeper, whom the wife killed.

title: Happy Birthday, Wanda June
description: Kurt Vonnegut updates the story of Ulysses' homecoming from the Trojan War.

title: Lovely Ladies, Kind Gentlemen
description: Captain Fisby is sent to American-occupied Okinawa, Japan for purposes of business and educating the natives, but falls in love with Japanese culture in this musical adaptation of John Patrick's play The Teahouse of the August Moon.

title: The Playboy of the Western World
description: A mysterious man stumbles into an Irish pub, claiming he is fleeing his farm after killing his father. The locals, including a barmaid who is attracted to the man, are more interested in enjoying the man's story than in condemning him, in John Millington Synge's play.

title: Soon
description: A group of rock musicians come to New York and discover the joys and pains of success.

title: A Doll's House
description: Nora Helmer, a childlike wife and mother accustomed to an existence built around her husband Torvald, comes to confront the truth of her marriage, in Henrik Ibsen's groundbreaking 1879 play.

title: Ari
description: Jewish refugees confront British authorities on the way toward their new homeland of Israel in 1947, in Walt Smith and Leon Uris' musical adaptation of Uris' novel Exodus.

title: No, No, Nanette
description: A Bible salesman, his wife, their lawyer friend and his wife, and the salesman's young ward, Nanette, get into various romantic entanglements and misunderstandings in 1920s Atlantic City.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
description: William Shakespeare's comedy brings together a group of star-crossed lovers, an inept band of actors led by the pompous Bottom, and the king and queen of the fairies and their impish henchman Puck, who creates romantic and comic havoc for all.

title: Four on a Garden
description: An evening of four comedic one-acts by Abe Burrows.  In House of Dunkelmayer, the widow of a delicatessen owner lusts after young waiters. Betty recalls a long-ago wild summer on Fire Island. Toreador follows an encounter between a buttoned-up woman and a friendly painter, and The Swingers is about an elderly couple who meet at a dance hall and attempt one more romantic evening.

title: The School for Wives
description: An aging man who is afraid of women makes clumsy advances toward the young ward he wants to marry in Moliere's 1662 comedy.

title: Hedda Gabler
description: Ibsen's Hedda Gabler presents a psychological study of a cultivated woman, recently returned from her honeymoon, whose boredom and dissatisfaction in a stifling environment lead her to destroy others — and herself.

title: And Miss Reardon Drinks a Little
description: Three schoolteacher sisters attempt to retreat from the world until it confronts them with their lives' disappointments in Paul Zindel's dark comedy.

title: Abelard and Heloise
description: The love story of Peter Abelard, a churchman who had taken a vow of celibacy, and Heloise, the girl he tutored in the 12th century in France, is dramatized by Ronald Millar.

title: An Enemy of the People
description: When Dr. Thomas Stockmann discovers toxic contamination in the water used at the local baths, he expects to be hailed as a hero. But since the baths are the town's main source of revenue, the community fights to silence him — and Dr. Stockmann learns there are forces more powerful than truth.

title: The Philanthropist
description: A disengaged university professor cheerfully ponders anagrams, academia and the meaning of life. Meanwhile, in the outside world, the Prime Minister and his cabinet have been assassinated, and England's finest writers are being killed.

title: Father's Day
description: Three divorcees bond over their situation and invite their husbands to a cocktail party.

title: All Over
description: The wife, children and mistress of a dying man quarrel as they wait at his bedside.

title: How the Other Half Loves
description: Two neighbors discover their spouses are having an affair with each other in Alan Ayckbourn's farce, in which one living room set serves as a living room for two houses, with the action occurring simultaneously and the inhabitants unaware of each other.

title: Follies
description: The Weismann Follies showgirls reunite before their old theatre is torn down, singing and dancing their old numbers and confronting past regrets and misplaced hopes, in Stephen Sondheim and James Goldman's look at the decay of American show business and the dangers of living in the past.

title: Johnny Johnson
description: A peaceful American stonecutter retains his idealism in the face of World War I horrors in Kurt Weill and Paul Green's anti-war musical.

title: 70, Girls, 70
description: A group of elderly residents in a New York nursing home organize themselves into a gang of fur thieves, stealing from the rich and giving to the poor, in John Kander, Fred Ebb and Norman L. Martin's musical adaptation of the film Make Mine Mink.

title: Ovid's Metamorphoses
description: Second City founding director and improvisation legend Paul Sills created and directs this evening of theatre pieces based on romantic stories from Ovid's Metamorphoses.

title: Frank Merriwell
description: The adventures of a heroic college student in approximately 1896 are musically adapted from a series of novels by Burt L. Standish.

title: Dance of Death
description: A captain and his wife draw her visiting cousin into their dangerous marital games in August Strindberg's 1901 play.

title: Earl of Ruston
description: Earl Woods, an eccentric Southerner who spent some time in mental institutions before an early death, is the subject of this musical by Peter Link and Woods' cousins, C.C. and Ragan Courtney.

title: Scratch
description: The Devil and Daniel Webster struggle for the soul of a New Hampshire farmer in a mock trial in 1850.

title: Antigone
description: Oedipus' daughter defies her uncle in insisting on a proper burial for her brothers, whom he killed in order to take the throne, in Sophocles' tragedy.

title: Lenny
description: The life and many of the standup routines of the outrageous, provocative comedian Lenny Bruce are detailed in Julian Barry's play.

title: The Trial of the Catonsville Nine
description: Father Daniel Berrigan, one of nine Jesuit priests who burned Vietnam War draft cards on site at the District Court of Maryland in 1968 and were sent to prison, dramatizes the experience in this play.

title: No Place to Be Somebody
description: A black bartender attempts to outwit a white mobster syndicate in Charles Gordone's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Solitaire / Double Solitaire
description: An evening of two one-act plays.  In Solitaire, a man is almost dehumanized by the regimented computerization of the future.  In Double Solitaire, a contemporary married couple examines their emotional lies.

title: Jesus Christ Superstar
description: The final days of Jesus Christ leading up to his crucifixion are seen through the eyes of his betrayer, Judas, in Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice's rock opera.

title: The Incomparable Max
description: The Devil shows a vainglorious poet a future in which he will not be remembered, but the poet is then able to predict a train wreck, in Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee's adaptation of stories by Max Beerbohm.

title: Ain't Supposed to Die a Natural Death
description: Melvin Van Peebles series of vignettes of life in the black ghetto of the 1970s is presented as spoken-word poetry with musical accompaniment.

title: To Live Another Summer, to Pass Another Winter
description: This musical revue features songs and stories relating both to the Bible and to Israel's formation into a nation.

title: Unlikely Heroes
description: An evening of three one-act plays adapted from Philip Roth stories.  Defender of the Faith follows an army sergeant who reluctantly gets involved with recruits who are fellow Jews.  In Epstein, a married father develops a strange rash after an affair with a widow.  Eli, the Fanatic follows a lawyer assigned to evict a Hebrew school after new zoning regulations come into place, until he ends up championing the school he is being asked to crusade against.

title: On the Town
description: Three sailors on shore leave in New York City during World War II find romance and adventure while helping one of them track down the elusive Miss Turnstiles poster girl, in the first Broadway musical written by Leonard Bernstein, Betty Comden and Adolph Green.

title: The Grass Harp
description: Eccentric Southerner Dolly Talbo, her maid Catherine and her nephew Collin guard Dolly's recipe for her secret elixir from her sister Verena and Verena's opportunistic boyfriend, even deciding to leave the house and live in a tree, in this musical adaptation of Truman Capote's novel and play.

title: The Prisoner of Second Avenue
description: A well-to-do man loses his job, succumbs to the pressures of big-city life and suffers a nervous breakdown in Neil Simon's dark comedy.

title: Mary Stuart
description: Schiller's political thriller is a partially fictionalized account of the epic power struggle between England's Elizabeth I and Mary Queen of Scots, as Mary faces her final days imprisoned for her claim to the English throne.

title: Twigs
description: An evening of four one-act plays. In Emily, a divorcee connects with a moving man as they fix her kitchen.  In Celia, a former Hollywood bit player has become a taken-for-granted housewife.  In Dorothy, a housewife and her husband's rendezvous is interrupted by his elderly father.  Ma turns out to be the previous three ladies' grouchy mother, finally willing to marry their father before she dies.

title: Old Times
description: A married couple are visited by the wife's former roommate, whose presence raises questions about the nature of the three's past and present relationships with each other.

title: Only Fools Are Sad
description: A cast of six sings songs and tells stories of the Hasidic movement, founded in 18th-century Europe and advocating a simple, devotional Jewish life.

title: Two Gentlemen of Verona
description: Bachelor friends Valentine and Proteus compete for the loves of Silvia and then Julia before being paired with their rightful mates in Galt MacDermot, John Guare and Mel Shapiro's musical adaptation of William Shakespeare's comedy.

title: Wild and Wonderful
description: A former West Point cadet is sent by the CIA to infiltrate a youth movement in an unnamed city.

title: Inner City
description: A series of nursery-rhyme parodies highlighting the diminishing quality of life in the center of America's cities are presented in song.

title: Murderous Angels
description: The events surrounding the deaths of the Congo's independence leader Patrice Lumumba and UN Secretary General Dag Hammarskjold are dramatized by Conor Cruise O'Brien, Hammarskjold's general representative in Katanga.

title: Fun City
description: Joan Rivers co-wrote this comedy, which imagines what life may be like in New York in the immediate future and how romance may be conducted there.

title: There's One in Every Marriage
description: A group of male friends pursue women, including each other's wives, in this adaptation of Georges Feydeau's 1896 farce.

title: Narrow Road to the Deep North
description: Edward Bond's play symbolically dramatizes life in Japan in the 17th, 18th and 19th centuries, leading up to the time the country was aggressively visited by the British Empire.

title: Vivat! Vivat Regina!
description: Queen Elizabeth I and her cousin, Mary, Queen of Scots, must choose whether to commit themselves to love or country, with each forever envying the other's decision.

title: The Sign in Sidney Brustein's Window
description: A Jewish newspaper publisher and political activist remains optimistic in the face of struggle.

title: Wise Child
description: A criminal on the run is forced to disguise himself in women's clothes in Simon Gray's comedy.

title: The Love Suicide at Schofield Barracks
description: The ritual suicide of a commanding general and his wife, which was staged as a protest against war, is investigated by the military in Romulus Linney's courtroom drama.

title: Grease
