description: Danny and Sandy fall for each other during a carefree summer fling. But when the school year begins, Danny is torn between his feelings for good-girl Sandy and his image with the T-Birds and the Pink Ladies.

title: Moonchildren
description: A group of students comes of age in the 1960s in Michael Weller's comedy-drama.

title: Night Watch
description: A dominating husband and his long-suffering wife play a murderous game in Lucille Fletcher's thriller.

title: Sticks and Bones
description: An all-American, "Nelsons"-like family continues living its 1950s ideal of life even after a son traumatized by the Vietnam War returns home, in David Rabe's dark comedy.

title: Twelfth Night
description: Mistaken identity, wild characters and unusual courtships are all combined in one of Shakespeare's most popular comedies.

title: Children! Children!
description: A babysitter is terrorized by three evil children in this thriller.

title: The Country Girl
description: Washed-up actor Frank Elgin receives a final chance for a comeback from a young director who remembers Elgin at his best. Elgin's career, future and relationship with his beleaguered wife lay at the mercy of his struggles with alcohol.

title: The Selling of the President
description: In 1968, Presidential candidate Richard Nixon's staff increases his popularity through a series of carefully orchestrated TV advertising campaigns, in this musical based on the book by Joe McGinniss.

title: A Celebration of Richard Rodgers
description: The music of Richard Rodgers, from the 1920s through the 1970s, is performed in this benefit concert.

title: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
description: Ancient Roman slave Pseudolus schemes to win his freedom by helping his young master Hero win the beautiful courtesan Philia, who is betrothed to the egotistical soldier Miles Gloriosus, in this musical farce based on the plays of Plautus.

title: Voices
description: A couple takes refuge from a storm in a deserted Maine house which turns out to be haunted.

title: Elizabeth I
description: The events of Elizabeth I's reign over England are presented in a cartoonish, sketch-like fashion by a 16th-century troupe of street performers.

title: Sugar
description: Two musicians who witness the St. Valentine's Day Massacre in 1929 disguise themselves as women who play in an all-girl band to avoid gangsters.  One falls for the band's sexy lead singer, while the other is pursued by an eccentric millionaire, in Jule Styne, Bob Merrill and Peter Stone's musical adaptation of the 1959 film comedy Some Like It Hot.

title: That's Entertainment
description: A cast of nine performs the songs of composer Arthur Schwartz and lyricist Howard Dietz in this musical revue.

title: Promenade, All!
description: From 1895 to the early 1970s, six generations of an American family resolve their issues.

title: Captain Brassbound's Conversion
description: A bloodthirsty pirate meets his match in a British lady adventurer.

title: Lost in the Stars
description: Two South African families, one black and one white, are brought together by a tragic murder charge in the age of apartheid, in Kurt Weill and Maxwell Anderson's musical adaptation of Alan Paton's novel Cry the Beloved Country.

title: Don't Bother Me, I Can't Cope
description: This collection of songs with music from the African-American culture, including gospel, blues and calypso, paints an optimistic portrait of contemporary black life.

title: All the Girls Came Out to Play
description: A writer and his agent live together in a suburban community for work but are assumed to be a gay couple by their neighbors.

title: The Little Black Book
description: An attractive young woman invades a bachelor's apartment and refuses to leave in this French comedy.

title: The Crucible
description: Arthur Miller's tale of the Salem witch trials, in which a group of girls accuse upstanding women in the town of witchcraft to divert suspicion from their own activities, has been seen as an allegory for Senator Joseph McCarthy's anti-Communist crusades of the 1950s.

title: Ring Around the Bathtub
description: An Irish-American family struggles through the Depression in Chicago.

title: An Evening with Richard Nixon and...
description: Gore Vidal's political satire is based on President Richard Nixon's actual statements, presenting him as the latest in a line of imperialist American politicians.

title: Different Times
description: Several generations of an American family survive from 1905 through World War II and on to the present.

title: Tough to Get Help
description: A liberal advertising man and his relationship to the black couple who work for him is treated comedically by playwright Steve Gordon.

title: Hard Job Being God
description: The book of Genesis and other books of the Old Testament are treated in rock musical form.

title: Don't Play Us Cheap!
description: A pair of mischievous spirits attempt to intrude on a Harlem family party in Melvin Van Peebles' musical fantasy.

title: Heathen!
description: The beliefs and needs of two eras in Hawaii — 1819 and 1972 — are compared, with strong similarities emerging.

title: Man of La Mancha
description: An imprisoned Miguel de Cervantes gets his fellow inmates to enact the story of his novel, Don Quixote, about an aged nobleman who declares himself a "knight errant" out to do battle for good and the love of a fair maiden, in Mitch Leigh, Joe Darion and Dale Wasserman's musical adaptation of the classic Cervantes novel.

title: That Championship Season
description: Four former basketball stars and their coach gather for a reunion and begin to realize the price of their win-at-all-costs mentality.

title: Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris
description: The lovely and lusty songs of Belgian-born, French-dwelling composer Jacques Brel are performed by a cast of five in this musical revue.

title: From Israel with Love
description: An Israeli Army Entertainment Groups unit performs a selection of Hebrew-language songs and dances.

title: Neil Diamond: One Man Show
description: Pop singer-songwriter Neil Diamond performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Dude
description: This freely structured rock musical asks the big questions about life and death across age and earthly boundaries.

title: Hurry, Harry
description: A wealthy young man travels the world in search of himself and his purpose.

title: Pacific Paradise
description: A company of performers from the Maori people of New Zealand perform ceremonies, songs, dances, legends and other forms of entertainment from their tradition

title: 6 Rms Riv Vu
description: Two strangers married to other people meet by chance while searching for an apartment and begin an affair.

title: Mother Earth
description: This rock musical features songs and sketches dealing with man's treatment of the environment.

title: Pippin
description: The young son of the medieval French ruler Charlemange is encouraged by a flashy troupe of strolling players to try his hand at war, love, and other joys before settling down.

title: The Lincoln Mask
description: Scenes from Abraham Lincoln's life, focusing on his stance against slavery, are interspersed with scenes from Our American Cousin, the play Lincoln was watching the night he was assassinated at Ford's Theater.

title: Butley
description: Butley, a university professor, shares his office and his flat with his former star pupil. He must face the ultimate breakdown of his marriage and his intense friendship with his roommate, all while entangled in petty university politics and student dissent.

title: Enemies
description: Maxim Gorky's play depicts a society coming apart on the eve of revolution.

title: Much Ado About Nothing
description: The anti-romantic wits Beatrice and Benedick, who profess to hate each other, are forced by their friends' trickery to admit their true feelings as they help to save the wedding of his fellow soldier Claudio and her cousin Hero.

title: Lysistrata
description: A Greek woman persuades her fellow female citizens to withhold sex from their husbands so that they may peacefully end the Peloponnesian War, in Aristophanes' comic look at the eternal battle of the sexes.

title: The Secret Affairs of Mildred Wild
description: A contemporary housewife living above a candy store escapes her dreary life by imagining herself as a 1930s movie star.

title: Mourning Becomes Electra
description: Eugene O'Neill retells the Greek trilogy The Oresteia as the tale of the Mannon family, who lives in New England just after the Civil War and must cope with incestuous and murderous feelings among their various members.

title: Dear Oscar
description: This musical looks at the life of the renowned author, playwright and wit Oscar Wilde.

title: Ambassador
description: An uptight lawyer from Massachusetts is sent to Paris and falls in love with Europe in this musical adaptation of the Henry James novel.

title: Via Galactica
description: In the year 2972, everyone will live life in such a similarly processed fashion that a group of individualists will plan an escape to a new solar system to live their own lives, in Galt MacDermot, Christopher Gore and Judith Ross's rock opera.

title: The Creation of the World and Other Business
description: The story of Adam, Eve and their family is treated as a metaphor for the universal battle between good and evil in Arthur Miller's play.

title: The Great God Brown
description: Billy Brown and Dion Anthony, childhood friends and sons of business partners, both fall in love with Margaret and use different masks (physical and metaphorical) to change their personalities and win her at different times. Billy poses as Dion until he is discovered and abandoned, forgetting his true identity.

title: Don Juan
description: Lothario Don Juan and his frustrated servant Sganarelle must avoid being trapped by Don Juan's latest conquest, and then murdered by her brothers after he abandons her, in Moliere's 1665 comedy.

title: The Last of Mrs. Lincoln
description: Mary Todd Lincoln's widowed years, in which she experienced financial problems and was at one point committed to a mental institution by her one surviving son, are dramatized by James Prideaux.

title: The Sunshine Boys
description: Ex-vaudevillians Willie Clark and Al Lewis reunite for a television special — in spite of the fact that they can't stand each other.

title: Purlie
description: A black preacher returns to his hometown to open a church, outwitting a segregationist plantation owner to make it happen, in this musical adaptation of Ossie Davis' play Purlie Victorious.

title: The Plough and the Stars
description: Residents of an Irish tenement look forward to Ireland's liberation before and after the Easter Uprising in Dublin in 1916, in Sean O'Casey's drama.

title: Look Away
description: Mary Todd Lincoln and her black dressmaker and confidante prepare to leave the asylum to which the President's widow was confined in the 1870s, while reminiscing about the past.

title: The Enemy Is Dead
description: A man who fantasizes about being a war hero experiences a change of heart that saves his marriage when he encounters a powerful example of true bigotry.

title: Don Juan in Hell
description: The third act of George Bernard Shaw's play Man and Superman, featuring a debate between a puritanical Don Juan and the Devil.

title: Let Me Hear You Smile
description: A wife looks at her life and marriage from ages 10, 48 and 69.

title: Medea
description: A barbarian sorceress is abandoned by her war-hero husband for a Greek princess, turning to the ultimate murder for revenge in Euripedes' tragedy.

title: The Jockey Club Stakes
description: A group of British aristocrats are forced to contend with accusations of cheating in their jockey club and with the investigation that follows.

title: Shelter
description: A television commercial writer lives in a television studio with a talking computer named Arthur, fantasizing about the women in his life.

title: Finishing Touches
description: A middle-aged professor, his wife and their three sons get through personal crises in Jean Kerr's comedy.

title: Warp
description: A young man projects himself into a comic-book fantasy, where he becomes a hero sent to outer space to destroy the Prince of Chaos.

title: Status Quo Vadis
description: In a world in which everyone wears a status-marking number from 1 to 5 at all times, a Number 5 poet dares to pursue a Number 1 heiress.

title: No Sex Please, We're British
description: An unassuming couple's home is suddenly filled with pornographic literature in a farcical misunderstanding.

title: A Little Night Music
description: Sondheim's 1973 musical, based on the Ingmar Bergman film Smiles of a Summer Night, follows aging actress Desiree Armfeldt, her mother Madame Armfeldt, and a series of interwoven love affairs during one eventful weekend in the country.

title: Out Cry
description: A brother and sister who are both actors are stranded by their colleagues in a strange theatre and act a two-character play that may have particular resonance in their own lives.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: The Changing Room
description: A rugby team's locker room adventures, before, during and after the game, are detailed in David Storey's play.

title: Sondheim: A Musical Tribute
description: A star-studded tribute concert to the music and lyrics of Stephen Sondheim, with many of the songs performed by their shows' original cast members.

title: 42 Seconds from Broadway
description: A young couple living in New York deal with career, family and sexual problems in Louis Del Grande's comedy.

title: Irene
description: A young Irish-American lass gets to model for a famous dress designer and finds love in Harry Tierney and Joseph McCarthy's 1919 musical comedy.

title: Seesaw
description: A straight-laced lawyer has a love affair with an uninhibited dancer in New York, in Cy Coleman, Dorothy Fields and Michael Bennett's musical adaptation of William Gibson's play Two for the Seesaw.

title: The River Niger
description: A black poet is forced to paint houses to provide for his family in Harlem.  That family's history, including his son's decision to leave the Air Force and the street life for law school, is the subject of Joseph A. Walker's play.

title: The Living Mask
description: In Luigi Pirandello's play, a nobleman shaken by an accident believes himself to be the German Emperor Henry IV, and he continues pretending to be even after the delusional episode ends so that he may consciously avoid reality.

title: Here Are Ladies
description: Siobhan McKenna performs a one-woman selection of Irish writings dealing with women.

title: No Hard Feelings
description: A middle-aged married couple breaks up but ultimately reconciles in Sam Bobrick and Ron Clark's comedy.

title: The Women
description: Park Avenue society can't stop gossiping about Mary Haines' husband's affair with shop girl Crystal Allen in Clare Boothe Luce's biting look at the cattier side of the fairer sex.

title: A Streetcar Named Desire
description: Fragile Southern belle Blanche DuBois moves to New Orleans to live with her sister, Stella, and her brutish brother-in-law, Stanley Kowalski, in a dingy apartment.  Temperaments clash, fireworks fly and secrets are revealed in Tennessee Williams' Pulitzer Prize-winning drama.

title: The Play's the Thing
description: In Ferenc Molnar's farce, a young playwright is distraught when he overhears the actress he loves having an affair with another man. His mentor must convince him that she is only rehearsing a play — and that he must write her a better one.

title: Cyrano
description: A large-nosed but eloquent poet gives a dashing young soldier the words to court the poet's cousin, who is also his unrequited love, in this musical adaptation of Edmond Rostand's Cyrano de Bergerac.

title: Nash at Nine
description: A cast of five performs poems and songs featuring the lyrics of Ogden Nash in this revue.

title: Smith
description: A botanist finds himself transformed into the hero of a musical comedy from which he cannot escape.

title: Uncle Vanya
description: Longtime academic Vanya comes to question his devotion to an aging professor, whose wife Vanya loves even as she is drawn to the enigmatic doctor Astrov, in Anton Chekhov's 1897 play.

title: The Desert Song
description: Pierre, the seemingly mild-mannered son of a French general, masquerades as the "Red Shadow," the leader of a group of Arab bandits in the Middle East, in order to have adventures and seduce his beloved Margot.

title: The Waltz of the Toreadors
description: A retired general is flagrantly unfaithful to his bedridden wife, and reunites with a woman with whom he danced the Waltz of the Toreadors 17 years earlier — and who is now out to prove the wife's infidelity to land her man at last.

title: A Streetcar Named Desire
description: Fragile Southern belle Blanche DuBois moves to New Orleans to live with her sister, Stella, and her brutish brother-in-law, Stanley Kowalski, in a dingy apartment.  Temperaments clash, fireworks fly and secrets are revealed in Tennessee Williams' Pulitzer Prize-winning drama.

title: Crown Matrimonial
description: The events surrounding the abdication of King Edward VIII of England in 1936 are seen through the eyes of his mother, Queen Mary.

title: Raisin
description: Walter Younger and his mother struggle over how best to use his late father's insurance money in this musical adaptation of Lorraine Hansberry's play, A Raisin in the Sun. Walter hopes to use it to open a liquor store and mother Lena is eager to move her family out of Chicago's black ghetto.

title: Children of the Wind
description: An actor struggles with alcoholism while attempting to cope with career and family problems.

title: Veronica's Room
description: Veronica visits a mysterious house owned by an older couple who are not as sweet and harmless as they appear to be in Ira Levin's thriller.

title: Molly
description: Molly Goldberg, the beloved character from 1940s and 1950s radio and television, gets the musical treatment, dealing with husband Jake's unemployment, children Sam and Rosalie's growing pains, and all of her neighbors' problems — and gossip.

title: Full Circle
description: The fall of Berlin is dramatized, with ironic parallels drawn between the Nazis and their defeaters, the Communists.

title: Boom Boom Room
description: David Rabe's dark drama examines how go-go girl Chrissy found herself in tragic circumstances.

title: Gigi
description: A young French girl being groomed for the life of a courtesan attracts the attention of an older playboy whom she had always considered a friend, in Lerner and Loewe's stage adaptation of their 1958 film musical, based on Colette's novel.

title: Good Evening
description: Peter Cook and Dudley Moore provide satirical commentary on contemporary society, as well as musical interludes, in this sequel to their popular revue, Beyond the Fringe.

title: The Visit
description: A rich, oft-married widow returns to her poor childhood town in central Europe, offering its citizens a billion marks for the life of the man who seduced and abandoned her years ago and is now the town's most respected citizen.

title: Chemin de Fer
description: Various romantic and sexual entanglements, of the married and unmarried kind, occur in this adaptation of Georges Feydeau's farce.

title: The Good Doctor
description: A writer suggesting Anton Chekhov creates several stories of human eccentricities and frailties, preceded by a music concert, in Neil Simon's adaptation of several actual Chekhov stories.

title: Bette Midler
description: Bette Midler performs an evening of pop standards, rock and other music on Broadway.

title: The Pajama Game
description: A labor furor over a 7½-cent pay raise at a pajama plant complicates the course of true love for Sid Sorokin, the new factory superintendent, and Babe Williams, the feisty firebrand heading the Union Grievance Committee.

title: The Iceman Cometh
description: Set in the summer of 1912 at Harry Hope's saloon on New York's lower west side, this is O'Neill's classic story of a freespending, boisterous salesman who compels his fellow barflies to confront their pipe dreams.

title: Find Your Way Home
description: A gay man whose married lover leaves him to return to his wife drowns his sorrows by working as a hustler — until his former lover decides to leave his wife and return to him.

title: The Three Sisters
description: Sisters Olga, Masha and Irina long to leave their provincial military town for Moscow and grapple with frustrated love and disappointment, in Anton Chekhov's 1901 drama.

title: The Beggar's Opera
description: The outlaw Macheath is repeatedly betrayed and sent to prison, only to avoid hanging in a satirically happy ending, in John Gay's 1728 opera, which served as the inspiration for Kurt Weill and Bertolt Brecht's The Threepenny Opera.

title: Measure for Measure
description: A postulant learns that her brother is to be executed for getting his fiancée pregnant. She pleads for his life with the moralistic deputy governing for the absent duke, but is forced to yield her virginity unless she can find a way to outsmart him, in William Shakespeare's study of political and sexual hypocrisy.

title: Holiday
description: An up-and-coming Wall Street lawyer plans to enjoy life once he's made enough money, a prospect that doesn't thrill his well-born fiancée but excites her more unconventional sister.

title: The Au Pair Man
description: An elegant woman living in faded grandeur takes in a rough-hewn handyman, forcing him to do her chores and bend to her will, in Hugh Leonard's allegory of English-Irish relationships.

title: A Moon for the Misbegotten
description: Set in a dilapidated Connecticut farmhouse in 1923, this American classic centers on Josie, a towering Irish woman with a quick tongue and a ruined reputation; her conniving father, Phil Hogan; and Jim Tyrone, Hogan's landlord and drinking companion, a cynical alcoholic haunted by the death of his mother.

title: An Evening with Josephine Baker
description: Legendary entertainer Josephine Baker performs a special concert on Broadway.

title: Next Time I'll Sing to You
description: A playwright and three actors determine to figure out the key to a legendary hermit's existence.  James Saunders' play is based on an actual hermit, Alexander James Cameron, who lived in England for 42 years.

title: Liza
description: Liza Minnelli performs a concert of show tunes and popular music, directed and choreographed by Bob Fosse.

title: Lorelei
description: Lorelei Lee, the gold-digging showgirl from Gentlemen Prefer Blondes, is now a widow looking back on her 1920s adventures from the earlier musical. Four new songs for this production were written by Jule Styne, Betty Comden and Adolph Green, in addition to the classic songs retained from the Gentlemen score by Styne and Leo Robin.

title: Rainbow Jones
description: A lonely young woman creates an imaginary world of animal friends while waiting for the right human male to appear.

title: What the Wine-Sellers Buy
description: A young man is tempted by the riches awaiting a pimp and drug dealer as a means to escape the black ghetto of his childhood.

title: The Freedom of the City
description: Three non-violent Irish protestors seek refuge in the Lord Mayor's office in 1970 Londonderry, but are killed by British troops brought in to keep order, in Brian Friel's drama, said to be based on real events.

title: Noël Coward in Two Keys
description: An evening of two one-act plays by Noël Coward.  Into the Garden Maud details a henpecked American millionaire's liberation from his controlling wife.  In A Song at Twilight, a famous writer comes out of the closet in old age.

title: Sextet
description: A group of six friends go through various hetero and homosexual couplings.

title: Over Here!
description: Two sisters who entertain by singing at the Stage Door Canteen during World War II find a third singer, which allows them to form a trio.  However, the third singer turns out to be a Nazi spy.

title: Mott the Hoople
description: English glam rock band Mott the Hoople performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Ulysses in Nighttown
description: The fantasies, sexual and otherwise, of many of the characters in James Joyce's novel, Ulysses, are acted out in Marjorie Barkentin's play.

title: Candide
description: In this musical adaptation of Voltaire's satirical novel, the naïve Candide is separated from his beloved Cunegonde and journeys around the world to find her, retaining his teacher Pangloss's belief that "this is the best of all possible worlds" in the face of ever-increasing catastrophes.

title: Clarence Darrow
description: Legendary American lawyer Clarence Darrow reviews his life and career, including his roles in the Scopes "Monkey" Trial and the Leopold and Loeb murder case, in David W. Rintels' one-man play.

title: My Fat Friend
description: A fat woman's two friends encourage her to lose weight to attract a man, who turns out not to like thin women.

title: Dance of Death
description: A captain and his wife draw her visiting cousin into their dangerous marital games in August Strindberg's 1901 play.

title: Thieves
description: Herb Gardner's New York-set comedy looks at panhandling in the streets and troubled marriages and affairs in the luxury apartments of the Upper East Side.

title: Martha Graham and Company
description: Martha Graham and her modern dance company perform in concert on Broadway.

title: Words & Music
description: Lyricist Sammy Cahn performs his songs with a cast of three singers and tells stories from his life in this autobiographical revue.

title: An American Millionaire
description: A millionaire is hounded by a variety of eccentric characters in Murray Schisgal's dark comedy.

title: Jumpers
description:
An aging professor of moral philosophy attempts to create a lecture while ignoring a nearby
corpse, his wife entertaining his university boss nearby, and a chorus of academic gymnasts
called Jumpers. Politics, space travel and religion also appear in Tom Stoppard's fantastical
comedy.

title: Sammy
description: Legendary entertainer Sammy Davis, Jr. performs in concert with the Nicholas Brothers and Freda Payne.

title: My Sister, My Sister
description: Ray Aranha's play looks at an African-American childhood in the 1950s South.

title: Bad Habits
description: An evening of two one-act plays, both set in a nursing home. In Ravenswood, a doctor seeks to cure several elderly patients of their ills by encouraging complete freedom. In Dunelawn, drugs are offered as the solution.

title: Will Rogers' USA
description: The comic philosopher and performer Will Rogers performs selections from his own material, adapted by Paul Shyre as a one-man play.

title: Ride the Winds
description: The story of an 11th-century Japanese samurai is musicalized by John Driver.

title: Scapino
description: Frank Dunlop and Jim Dale adapt Moliere's comic tale of Scapin, the deceitful valet who contrives to bring his master's children and their respective loves together through all kinds of trickery and despite his master's differing plans.

title: Short Eyes
description: The inmates of a prison band together sexually, personally and in their shared hatred of an incarcerated child molester.

title: The Magic Show
description: A young magician replaces a fading one, performing several amazing feats along with his assistants, in Stephen Schwartz's musical.

title: Gypsy
description: Indomitable stage mother Rose chases vicarious success and stardom as she pushes her daughters through the vaudeville circuit. When Baby June flees the act to elope, Rose vows to make introverted Louise into a star.

title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
description: In Tennessee Williams' Pulitzer Prize winner, a wealthy Southern patriarch faces impending death and manipulates his family, as his children squabble and mislead in desperate attempts to secure the family inheritance.

title: Scapino
description: Frank Dunlop and Jim Dale adapt Moliere's comic tale of Scapin, the deceitful valet who contrives to bring his master's children and their respective loves together through all kinds of trickery and despite his master's differing plans.

title: Enrico Macias and His La Fete Orientale Co.
description: Algerian musician Enrico Macias performs in concert with his La Fete Orientale Co

title: Medea and Jason
description: Eugenie Leontovich freely adapts the Robinson Jeffers version of Medea, the Euripedes tragedy about a vengeful sorceress who is scorned by the handsome young warrior she loves and has helped succeed.

title: Mack & Mabel
description: Silent film director Mack Sennett pioneers the art of film comedy, and falls in love with his major discovery and star, Mabel Normand.  Their ill-fated love affair is musicalized by Jerry Herman and Michael Stewart.

title: Flowers
description: Unusual sexual practices and transvestism are theatricalized in mime performance in this piece, which is said to be suggested by Jean Genet's novel Notre Dame des Fleurs.ï¿½

title: Absurd Person Singular
description: The radically shifting fortunes of three married couples are examined as they come together for some dubious merriment on three consecutive Christmas Eves.

title: The National Health
description: The experiences of the inhabitants of a British hospital are treated satirically by Peter Nichols.

title: Hosanna
description: A Montreal transvestite and his lover reveal their politically metaphorical hopes and fears to each other.

title: Charles Aznavour on Broadway
description: Legendary French singer-songwriter Charles Aznavour performs many of his classic songs, including "Yesterday When I Was Young," in concert.

title: Brief Lives
description: Patrick Garland's one-man play is told from the perspective of John Aubrey, a 17th-century Englishman who met and kept accounts of many of the famous men of his day, including Rene Descartes, Thomas Hobbes and Christopher Wren.

title: Andy Williams with Michel Legrand
description: Pop crooner Andy Williams performs in concert with French singer-songwriter Michel Legrand.

title: Dreyfus in Rehearsal
description: A Jewish playwright and actors rehearse a play about the infamous Dreyfus case, as another threat of anti-Semitism appears outside their own theatre.

title: Equus
description: Psychiatrist Martin Dysart attempts to understand why young stableboy Alan Strang has blinded six horses. In his exploration of the troubled boy and his dysfunctional parents, Dysart must confront the shortcomings of his own life.

title: Tony & Lena Sing
description: Tony Bennett and Lena Horne perform together in concert on Broadway.

title: Mert & Phil
description: A middle-aged woman who has been married 20 years undergoes a mastectomy.

title: Anthony Newley / Henry Mancini
description: British composer-lyricist-singer Anthony Newley performs in concert with American composer Henry Mancini.

title: Tubstrip
description: A.J. Kronengold's comedy is set in a gay bathhouse.

title: Mourning Pictures
description: A young poet watches her mother die from cancer.

title: Love for Love
description: The playboy Valentine prepares, at least nominally, to give up his inheritance in order to continue an irresponsible life and to court the beautiful Angelica, in William Congreve's Restoration comedy and social satire.

title: Sherlock Holmes
description: Sharp-witted detective Sherlock Holmes and his trusted companion Doctor Watson prepare to rescue Miss Faulkner from the clutches of the dastardly Moriarty, in Arthur Conan Doyle and William Gillette's play based on Conan Doyle's legendary literary character.

title: Johnny Mathis and the Miracles
description: Pop singer Johnny Mathis performs in concert with the legendary Motown group The Miracles.

title: Sizwe Banzi Is Dead
description: A South African Bantu has the opportunity to exchange passports with a dead man but is conflicted about giving up his own identity.

title: Fame
description: Anthony J. Ingrassia's play tells the life story of an actress based on Marilyn Monroe.

title: Saturday, Sunday, Monday
description: Keith Waterhouse and Willis Hall adapt Eduardo de Filippo's Italian comedy, which looks at the trial and tribulations of a well-off family in Naples.

title: The Island
description: Two cellmates in a maximum-security political prison in South Africa present their own version of Antigone at the annual prison show.

title: Eddie Arnold
description: Country singer Eddie Arnold performs in concert on Broadway.

title: The Fifth Dimension with Jo Jo's Dance Factory
description: The pop vocal group The Fifth Dimension performs a concert with Jo Jo's Dance Factory.

title: As You Like It
description: Rosalind, banished from her father's kingdom by her usurping uncle, disguises herself as a boy while falling for one, the similarly exiled duke Orlando.

title: London Assurance
description: London widower Sir Harcourt Courtly falls for a Gloucestershire heiress — the same heiress his son is pursuing — in Dion Boucicault's 1841 comedy.

title: Who's Who in Hell
description: The President of the United States and the Chairman of the U.S.S.R. have just been murdered by a young assassin, who is killed by police.  All three meet in an anteroom that will lead them to heaven or hell.

title: In Praise of Love
description: A crusty Marxist critic in London builds an emotional wall around himself, abusing his terminally ill wife, American friend and Liberal-party son.

title: God's Favorite
description: Neil Simon's comedy casts the Biblical story of Job in a contemporary setting.

title: The Rules of the Game
description: A man attempts to avenge a perceived insult to his wife in this play, which is the show the actors rehearse in Pirandello's Six Characters in Search of an Author.

title: Of Mice and Men
description: Two migrant field hands, the average-looking but smart George and the strong but mentally challenged Lennie, find work on a farm in California during the Great Depression, seeing their dreams lead to tragedy when Lennie gets too close to the wife of the boss's son, in John Steinbeck's adaptation of his novel.

title: Where's Charley?
description: An Oxford student is forced to dress in drag as his own aunt, visiting from Brazil, when she does not appear in time to chaperone him, his friends, and their beloveds.  Romantic, farcical complications ensue in Frank Loesser and George Abbott's musical adaptation of Brandon Thomas's play Charley's Aunt.

title: Raphael in Concert with the Voices of New York
Good News
description: Romance, passing exams, winning the football game and doing the "Varsity Drag" are the main focuses of a group of students at Tait College in the 1920s.  Note: The 1974 revival re-set the action to the 1930s.

title: Nureyev and Friends
description: Rudolf Nureyev and his troupe of ballet dancers perform four ballets: Apollo, Flower Festival in Genzano, Aureole and The Moor's Pavane.

title: All Over Town
description: In this absurdist comedy, a psychiatrist mistakenly assumes a black man fathered nine welfare-supported children with five different mothers; in reality, the father is an unassuming but sexually adept white man.

title: The Member of the Wedding
description: A lonely young Southern girl escapes into fantasy with her black cook and young cousin, hoping to join her brother and his fiancée on their honeymoon for more fantastic adventures.

title: The Hashish Club
description: A failed drug trip leads to violent consequences.

title: The Wiz
description: Kansas farm girl Dorothy is transported in a tornado to the magical land of Oz in this musical retelling of The Wizard of Oz that features an all-black cast, a score by Charlie Smalls and a book with an updated urban sensibility by William F. Brown.

title: Black Picture Show
description: A black poet and playwright has ended up in a Bronx psychiatric unit, looking over his life on its last day

title: Shenandoah
description: A pacifist who refuses to participate in the Civil War is drawn into it when one of his sons is abducted and another is killed, in this musical adaptation of the 1965 film.

title: The Ritz
description: A conservative Cleveland businessman is on the run to escape his murderous mafioso brother-in-law. In his desperation, he seeks refuge in an uproarious gay bathhouse packed with kooky characters and a chain of mistaken identities.

title: Dance With Me
description: The La Mama Plexus Company performs an experimental comedy with music, in which an unfortunate tries to recapture the past through memory.

title: Seascape
description: Edward Albee, in his second Pulitzer Prize-winning play, has a day at the beach, investigating the communication between couples — one, a pair of middle-aged American humans contemplating retirement; the other, a male and female lizard tiring of the sea and considering a landlocked life.

title: Man on the Moon
description: This musical fantasy of the space age was written by John Phillips of the 1960s rock group The Mamas and the Papas.

title: Private Lives
description: Divorcees Elyot and Amanda unexpectedly meet while honeymooning with their respective new spouses and discover that their passion for — and irritation with — each other is just as strong as ever.

title: Hughie / Duet
description: An evening of two one-act plays: Eugene O'Neill's Hughie and David Scott Milton's Duet.

title: The Night That Made America Famous
description: Harry Chapin's socially conscious rock and country songs are performed by Chapin and a cast of 11 in this revue.

title: Clarence Darrow
description: Legendary American lawyer Clarence Darrow reviews his life and career, including his roles in the Scopes "Monkey" Trial and the Leopold and Loeb murder case, in David W. Rintels' one-man play.

title: Goodtime Charley
description: The relationship between Charles, the Dauphin of France, and Joan of Arc is musicalized by Larry Grossman, Hal Hackaday and Sidney Michaels.

title: A Doll's House
description: Nora Helmer, a childlike wife and mother accustomed to an existence built around her husband Torvald, comes to confront the truth of her marriage, in Henrik Ibsen's groundbreaking 1879 play.

title: A Gala Tribute to Joshua Logan
description: Songs and scenes from the plays and musicals directed by Joshua Logan are performed and he is saluted in this special benefit performance.

title: The Lieutenant
description: This rock opera is based on the My Lai incident in Vietnam, covering action in Vietnam and the United States over a three-year period.

title: The Rocky Horror Show
description: Innocent Brad and Janet find themselves seeking shelter at a mysterious old castle on a dark and stormy night, where they encounter transvestite Dr. Frank N Furter, his "perfect" creation Rocky, and an assortment of other crazy creatures.

title: Seals and Crofts, with Walter Heath
description: The soft-rock band Seals and Crofts perform in concert with special guest Walter Heath.

title: The Misanthrope
description: In Moliere's 1666 satire of social hypocrisy, a Paris aristocrat detests the shallow artifice of his peers but falls for a flirtatious girl who gleefully exhibits all the social traits he hates.

title: Same Time, Next Year
description: A man and woman, both married to others, meet each other annually for sex through several decades and personal changes.

title: Don't Call Back
description: An actress is terrorized in her own home by her son and his friends in Russell O'Neil's thriller.

title: Doctor Jazz
description: The story of a young jazz musician serves as the backdrop for the birth of jazz in America.

title: All God's Chillun Got Wings
description: The interracial marriage of childhood sweethearts ends tragically in New York in Eugene O'Neill's 1924 drama.

title: A Letter for Queen Victoria
description: Director Robert Wilson and his company present a self-described opera, featuring dramatic scenes, music and dance, but presented with no continuity in stream-of-consciousness, two-act form.

title: We Interrupt This Program...
description: This play's audience is held hostage by a group of criminals seeking the release of an imprisoned friend.

title: P. S. Your Cat Is Dead!
description: A frustrated actor finds his apartment robbed and the gay burglar interested in seducing him.

title: Bette Midler's Clams on the Half Shell Revue
description: Bette Midler performs a concert of Broadway, rock, gospel and other musical numbers in her unique, outrageous style.

title: The Constant Wife
description: W. Somerset Maugham's 1926 comedy of marital manners focuses on a cuckolded Constance Middleton, who pretends not to know her doctor husband is playing doctor with her best friend — until that friend's jealous husband confronts her.

title: Dance Theatre of Harlem
description: The racially diverse ballet company Dance Theatre of Harlem performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Little Black Sheep
description: A group of Jesuit priests cannot keep the tensions from Robert F. Kennedy's recent assassination out of their New Haven cloister.

title: Rodgers & Hart
description: A cast of 12 performs the romantic and comic numbers of the Broadway and Hollywood songwriting team of Richard Rodgers and Lorenz Hart.

title: Chicago
description: Set amidst the razzle-dazzle decadence of the 1920s, Chicago is the story of Roxie Hart, a housewife and nightclub dancer who murders her on-the-side lover after he threatens to walk out on her. Desperate to avoid conviction, she dupes the public, the media and her rival cellmate, Velma Kelly, by hiring Chicago’s slickest criminal lawyer to transform her malicious crime into a barrage of sensational headlines, the likes of which might just as easily be ripped from today's tabloids.

title: The First Breeze of Summer
description: The matriarch of an upwardly mobile black family remembers her struggles in Leslie Lee's family drama.

title: Death of a Salesman
description: Salesman Willy Loman finds his career crumbling and his relationships with his wife and sons severely tested in Arthur Miller's dream-like meditation on the cost of the American dream.

title: A Chorus Line
description: Broadway gypsies bare their souls and put their lives "on the line" as they audition for an unnamed Broadway musical. The 1975 show won the Pulitzer Prize and the Tony Award for Best Musical.

title: The Concert: Frank Sinatra, Ella Fitzgerald, and Count Basie
description: Legendary singers Frank Sinatra and Ella Fitzgerald play Broadway with the iconic jazz musician Count Basie and his band.

title: The Skin of Our Teeth
description: The modern-looking Antrobus family and their seductive maid, Sabina, survive many ancient disasters, including the Ice Age, Noah's flood, war and famine, always able to start over and begin anew, in Thornton Wilder's Pulitzer Prize-winning dark comedy.

title: Ah, Wilderness!
description: In a small New England town at the turn of the 20th century, an intense, poetic and sensitive young man falls in love, drives his mother crazy, and sparks his parents to recall their own romance and youth.

title: The Robber Bridegroom
description: A robber in disguise falls for a pretty farmer's daughter in Robert Waldman and Alfred Uhry's musical adaptation of the Eudora Welty novel.

title: The Fifth Season
description: Two partners in the dress-making business struggle to make ends meet and engage in love affairs in this Yiddish-English musical adaptation of Sylvia Regan's play.

title: Trelawny of the "Wells"
description: A popular British star of melodramas gives up the stage for marriage, only to flee her husband's traditional family for the footlights again.

title: Lamppost Reunion
description: A famous singer returns to his old Hoboken neighborhood and meets old friends, many of whom he double-crossed to become famous.

title: The Leaf People
description: A singer looking for a missionary who has gone missing in the Amazon rainforest discovers a new breed of intelligent species.

title: Treemonisha
description: A black orphan girl found under a tree is educated and works to improve her community in Scott Joplin's opera.

title: Edward II
description: Christopher Marlowe dramatizes the reign of Edward II of England, marked by his extravagant favoritism towards commoner Piers Gaveston, which angers the court nobles and leads to his downfall.

title: Me and Bessie
description: The life of legendary blues singer Bessie Smith is recalled, and her songs are sung, in a tribute put together by Will Holt and Linda Hopkins.  The latter actress acts as narrator of Smith's life and sings her songs.

title: Yentl
description: A Jewish girl disguises herself as a boy in order to study the Torah in this adaptation of Isaac Bashevis Singer's story "Yentl the Yeshiva Boy."

title: Summer Brave
description: William Inge's reworking of his Pulitzer Prize-winning play, Picnic, which dramatizes the effect a young drifter has on the women of a small Midwestern town, including a stifled beauty queen, her mother and sister, and an old-maid schoolteacher.

title: The Time of Your Life
description: A group of eccentrics inhabit a dive bar in San Francisco, developing friendships and romances, in William Saroyan's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Travesties
description: In 1917 Zurich, an artist—Tristan Tzara, a writer—James Joyce, and a revolutionary—Lenin, collide in a kaleidoscopic thrill-ride that's performed in the style of Oscar Wilde's The Importance of Being Earnest.

title: Kennedy's Children
description: A group of grown-up children of the 1960s commiserate in a Lower East Side bar about how their Kennedy-era dreams have dissolved in the 1970s.

title: The Three Sisters
description: Sisters Olga, Masha and Irina long to leave their provincial military town for Moscow and grapple with frustrated love and disappointment, in Anton Chekhov's 1901 drama.

title: Hello, Dolly!
description: A meddlesome matchmaker brings together the young clerk of a wealthy Yonkers merchant and his assistant with a widowed milliner and her assistant, while making sure she herself gets to marry the merchant, in Jerry Herman and Michael Stewart's musical adaptation of Thornton Wilder's The Matchmaker.

title: A Musical Jubilee
description: A cast of seven performs songs expressing the development of the Broadway musical through the years.

title: Fonteyn & Nureyev on Broadway
description: The ballet dancers Margot Fonteyn and Rudolf Nureyev make their farewell appearance as a duo, dancing Frederick Ashton's ballet Marguerite and Armand, which is based on the Alexandre Dumas novel La dame aux Camelias.

title: Boccaccio
description: Citizens of Florence, Italy in 1348 flee to the country to escape the plague and tell frequently bawdy stories to entertain each other in this musical adaptation of stories from Giovanni Boccaccio's The Decameron.

title: Habeas Corpus
description: An aging doctor and his family, friends and patients lust after each other in various combinations while staying at an English seaside resort.

title: The Norman Conquests
description: The self-contained comedies in Ayckbourn's trilogy depict Norman in ardent pursuit of his sister-in-law, shown from three different perspectives in the family's country home: In Living Together, the action is seen from the sitting room. In Round and Round the Garden, the action is seen from the garden. In Table Manners, the action is seen from the dining room.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: The Glass Menagerie
description: Tennessee Williams’s autobiographical “memory play” looks at the WIngfield family—frustrated writer Tom, his nagging mother, Amanda, who is often lost in memories of her Southern-belle past, and his painfully shy sister, Laura—and the effect a visit from a “gentleman caller” for Laura has on all their lives.

title: Very Good Eddie
description: Two couples of differing heights cross paths on a boat headed to a honeymoon inn in Poughkeepsie, accidentally trading partners in a farcical manner, in this intimate musical comedy that was one of a noted series Jerome Kern composed for the Princess Theatre.

title: Angel Street
description: A prosperous couple in Victorian London is driven apart when the husband starts to convince his wife she is going mad, in Patrick Hamilton's thriller, which was filmed using its British title, Gaslight.

title: Murder Among Friends
description: A successful Broadway stage actor and his friends play a series of devious games that lead to murder.

title: Sweet Bird of Youth
description: An aging actress has an affair with a young drifter, who hopes to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart, the daughter of a powerful politician who is out to destroy him.

title: The Royal Family
description: In this thinly veiled parody of the Barrymore family circa 1927, a flamboyant theatrical family must cope with the dumbfounding fact that one of them wishes to marry someone outside of show business.

title: Awakening
description: Mikhail Baryshnikov and Gelsey Kirkland dance a pas de deux choreographed by Robert Weiss for the American Ballet Theater, with a new score commissioned for the ballet by Craig Steven Shuler.

title: Home Sweet Homer
description: The Greek warrior Odysseus makes a ten-year journey home to his faithful wife, Penelope, and son, Telemachus, in this musical adaptation of Homer's epic poem "The Odyssey."

title: The Poison Tree
description: The dehumanizing effects of time spent in contemporary prisons are examined in this play by Ronald Ribman.

title: Push Comes to Shove
description: Mikhail Baryshnikov and dancers from the American Ballet Theater perform a ballet choreographed by Twyla Tharp to music by Franz Joseph Haydn and Joseph Lamb.

title: Pacific Overtures
description: Stephen Sondheim and John Weidman's musical examines Japan's forced opening to the West in 1853 after 200 years of isolation from the Western world.  The staging incorporates techniques used in the traditional Noh and Kabuki theatrical styles.

title: A Memory of Two Mondays / 27 Wagons Full of Cotton
description: A double bill of one-act plays. In Arthur Miller's A Memory of Two Mondays, a young man working in a Brooklyn auto-parts warehouse during the Depression dreams of a college education.  In Tennessee Williams' 27 Wagons Full of Cotton, a Southern cotton gin owner seeks revenge against a rival who burned down his factory by seducing that rival's childlike bride.

title: They Knew What They Wanted
description: An aging Italian vineyard owner in California proposes to a waitress via letter, sending her a picture of his handsome hired hand.  Romantic and emotional complications ensue when she agrees to marry and live with the Italian in Sidney Howard's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Paul Anka
description: Pop singer-songwriter and former teen idol Paul Anka performs in concert.

title: A Matter of Gravity
description: An aging woman who has retreated from contemporary society struggles to cope with her free-wheeling grandson, his friends, and a mysterious new cook.

title: Rockabye Hamlet
description: William Shakespeare's tragic tale of the prince of Denmark is re-told as a rock musical.

title: Mrs. Warren's Profession
description: A young lady discovers that the mother who gave her such a high-toned upbringing is, in fact, the madam of a brothel. Far from being ashamed of her profession, Mrs. Warren defends it as the epitome of capitalism.

title: Knock Knock
description: Joan of Arc finds herself living with two men in a messy, isolated cottage in Jules Feiffer's comedy-fantasy.

title: Bubbling Brown Sugar
description: The musical vitality of Harlem in the 1920s, '30s and '40s is reexamined in this revue featuring classic and new songs.

title: Geraldine Fitzgerald in Songs of the Street
description: Geraldine Fitzgerald performs a one-woman evening of personally selected music and stories.

title: Dance Theatre of Harlem
description: The racially diverse ballet company Dance Theatre of Harlem performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Zalmen, or The Madness of God
description: Russian authorities investigate rumors of a protest by a rabbi that was inspired by his brilliant, or crazy, beadle Zalmen in the 1950s.

title: The Lady from the Sea
description: The wife of a doctor moves to a small Norwegian town in the mountains, away from the seaside fjord where she grew up.  When her former fiancé, a sailor, returns after a long absence, she is forced to choose between her former and her present life, in Henrik Ibsen's 1889 play.

title: My Fair Lady
description: An English professor of phonetics makes a bet that he can transform a Cockney flower girl into a lady, in Lerner and Loewe's musical adaptation of George Bernard Shaw's Pygmalion.

title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
description: Edward Albee won the Tony Award for his first major play, in which a college professor and his wife invite a younger academic and his wife over for drinks after a late-night party, leading to an evening of sadistic games, attempted seductions and shattering revelations.

title: Secret Service
description: A spy for the Union Army during the Civil War falls in love with a daughter of the Confederacy, and then is caught.

title: Boy Meets Girl
description: Two Hollywood screenwriters scheme to cast the unborn child of a studio waitress in a new film, then scramble to cook up a scandal when they are bought out by the studio, in Sam and Bella Spewack's satire on the wiles of the film industry.

title: Shirley MacLaine
description: Shirley MacLaine performs an evening of song, dance and monologue, backed throughout the evening by five "gypsy" dancers.

title: The Heiress
description: Plain Catherine Sloper, who lives a spinster's life with her unloving father and eccentric aunt, is courted by the dashing Morris Townsend, seemingly for love and not for money, in this adaptation of the Henry James novel Washington Square.

title: Streamers
description: A group of soldiers in a Virginia army barracks struggle to cope with their racial, homophobic and other personal torments and insensitivities as they wonder if they will ever see combat in Vietnam.

title: Rex
description: The story of Henry VIII, the volatile English king who married multiple times in the hope of securing a male heir to the throne, is musicalized by Richard Rodgers, Sheldon Harnick and Sherman Yellen.

title: So Long, 174th Street
description: A high school student in the 1930s Bronx struggles to escape the family pharmaceutical business and become an actor in this musical version of Joseph Stein's play Enter Laughing, based on the Carl Reiner novel.

title: The Belle of Amherst
description: William Luce's one-woman play tells the story of Emily Dickinson, the legendary poet who lived a reclusive existence at her family home in Amherst, MA in the Victorian era.

title: Threepenny Opera
description:
The outlaw Macheath is repeatedly betrayed and sent to prison, only to receive a last-minute reprieve from Queen Victoria, in Kurt Weill and Bertolt Brecht's darkly satirical adaptation of
John Gay's The Beggar's Opera.

title: 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue
description: The trials and tribulations of the White House's occupants from George Washington to Theodore Roosevelt, and those of their wives and servants, are musicalized by Leonard Bernstein and Alan Jay Lerner.  The Presidents and First Ladies are all played by one man and one woman, and the servants are played by the same couple, Lud and Seena, through the years.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Des Journees Entieres Dans Le Arbres
description: An old woman nearing the end of her life visits her ne'er-do-well son in this revision of Marguerite Duras' French play.  The English translation of the title is Days in the Trees.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: Legend
description: A female bank robber in the Old West is forced to choose between the sheriff who captures her and the outlaw she loves.

title: H.M.S. Pinafore
description: The daughter of the captain of Her Majesty's Ship Pinafore is in love with a humble sailor, despite her father's hopes that she will marry a better-born suitor, in W.S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan's operetta.

title: The Runner Stumbles
description: A priest on trial for a nun's murder remembers their meeting in 1911 Michigan in Milan Stitt's play, which is based on a true incident.

title: Something's Afoot
description: A group of ten house guests at an isolated island estate appear to be set up to be murdered, one by one, in this musical comedy spin on Agatha Christie's Ten Little Indians and similar murder mysteries.

title: Al Green / Ashford & Simpson
description: Soul singer Al Green and the Motown singer/songwriter duo Ashford & Simpson perform together in concert on Broadway.

title: The Paul Taylor Dance Company
description: The Paul Taylor Dance Company performs three modern dance pieces choreographed by Taylor: "Public Domain," "Big Bertha" and "Esplanade."

title: California Suite
description: An evening of four short plays by Neil Simon that feature various visitors to two suites in the Beverly Hills Hotel.

title: An Evening with Diana Ross
description: Motown legend Diana Ross performs highlights from her music and film careers in concert on Broadway.

title: Godspell
description: The Gospel According to St. Matthew is presented in a series of skits and songs, with Jesus and his disciples presented as loving clowns, in this musical featuring songs by Stephen Schwartz, conceived and originally directed by John-Michael Tebelak.

title: Pal Joey
description: Joey, a second-rate Chicago entertainer, two-times a married society dame and a naïve chorus girl. Based on the novel by John O'Hara and scored by Rodgers & Hart.

title: Shirley MacLaine
description: Shirley MacLaine performs an evening of song, dance and monologue, backed throughout the evening by five "gypsy" dancers.

title: Guys and Dolls
description: A fly-by-night gambler attempts to woo a Salvation Army missioner for a $1,000 bet. Meanwhile, a beleaguered showgirl tries to hook her fiancé of 14 years, the founder of "the oldest, established, permanent, floating crap game in New York."

title: Checking Out
description: An aging actor in the Yiddish theatre decides to stage-manage his own death.

title: For Colored Girls Who Have Considered Suicide / When the Rainbow Is Enuf
description: A black woman explores seven facets of herself and emerges a stronger person in Ntzoke Shange's "choreo-poem."

title: Debbie
description: Debbie Reynolds headlines a nightclub-style revue of musical highlights from her career.

title: Going Up
description: A young man pretends to be an airplane pilot to impress a girl in this revised revival of a Louis A. Hirsch-Otto Harbach musical from 1917, based on James Montgomery's play The Aviator.

title: I Have a Dream
description: The words of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. are brought to life and augmented by performances of gospel songs.

title: Oh! Calcutta!
description: Kenneth Tynan devised this musical revue, to which Samuel Beckett, John Lennon, Sam Shepard and others contributed sketches and songs of a cheekily erotic nature. The cast performs in the nude.

title: Porgy and Bess
description: George Gershwin, Ira Gershwin and DuBose Heyward's operatic adaptation of Heyward's play Porgy follows the lives of the inhabitants of Catfish Row, an African-American section of Charleston, South Carolina, including the crippled Porgy, his beloved Bess, who is under the thrall of the dangerous Crown, and the sinewy drug dealer Sportin' Life.

title: Days in the Trees
description: An aging woman visits her only son, a ne'er-do-well who is nevertheless all she has, in this translation of Marguerite Duras's French play Des Journées Entières dans les Arbres.

title: Des Journees Entieres Dans Le Arbres
description: An old woman nearing the end of her life visits her ne'er-do-well son in this revision of Marguerite Duras' French play.  The English translation of the title is Days in the Trees.

title: Kings
description: This evening featured dramatic and dance adaptations of several Greek tragedies, including Oedipus, Medea and Theseus and Hippolyta, the last taken from Mary Renault's novel Bull from the Sea.

title: Siamsa
description: An Irish village festival is staged by The National Folk Theatre of Ireland, with traditional rituals, dancing and folk music performed.

title: The Robber Bridegroom
description: A robber in disguise falls for a pretty farmer's daughter in Robert Waldman and Alfred Uhry's musical adaptation of the Eudora Welty novel.

title: Wheelbarrow Closers
description: An energetic salesman is forced to face his retirement in Louis LaRusso II's play.

title: Best Friend
description: A disturbed woman claims to have had a lesbian relationship with her friend in order to break up the friend's romance.

title: Poor Murderer
description: An actor is interrogated in an insane asylum and led to believe that he actually killed the actor who played Polonius opposite his Hamlet during a performance of that scene from Shakespeare's play, in Czechoslovakian playwright Pavel Kohout's political thriller.

title: The Innocents
description: A repressed woman becomes a governess for two children in a mysterious country house, becoming convinced that they are possessed by the spirits of deceased former staff members, in Wiliam Archibald's adaptation of Henry James' short novel The Turn of the Screw.

title: Don't Step on My Olive Branch
description: This Israeli musical revue presents numbers, sung in English, that comment on current affairs, usually in a satirical manner.

title: No Man's Land
description: Two aged poets have a conversation in a strange home environment filled with hostile servants in Harold Pinter's enigmatic play.

title: Dutch National Ballet
description: The Dutch National Ballet performs on Broadway.

title: The Eccentricities of a Nightingale
description: A lonely minister's daughter falls for the neighborhood mother's boy, a young doctor, in Tennessee Williams' revision of  his 1948 play Summer and Smoke.

title: Chinese Acrobats of Taiwan
description: The Chinese Acrobats of Taiwan perform an evening of acrobatics, folk dances and martial arts.

title: Natalie Cole
description: Jazz singer Natalie Cole performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Comedians
description: A group of aspiring comedians tries out in a club, before a regular audience and an agent, with varying degrees of success.

title: Herzl
description: The life of Theodor Herzl, the founder of Zionism, is dramatized by Dore Schary and Amos Elon.

title: Bing Crosby on Broadway
description: Legendary singer Bing Crosby performs in concert with his family, the Joe Bushkin Quartet, Ted Rogers and the Billy Byers Orchestra.

title: Sly Fox
description: An elderly man who has gotten rich off the gold rush in 1800s San Francisco schemes to bilk his greedy associates out of money by pretending to be an invalid, in Larry Gelbart's adaptation of Ben Jonson's satirical farce Volpone.

title: The Night of the Iguana
description: A defrocked priest accused of having sexual relations with a teenage girl seeks shelter at a Mexican inn run by his blowsy, widowed old friend, who finds herself competing for his attentions with a kindly spinster who is caring for her grandfather, an aging poet.

title: Music Is
description: In this musical adaptation of William Shakespeare's Twelfth Night, Viola, shipwrecked on the strange island of Illyria and separated from her twin brother, Sebastian, disguises herself as a boy to serve the duke Orsino, who is in love with the fair Olivia, leading to all manner of comic and romantic complications.

title: Barry Manilow on Broadway
description: Pop singer-songwriter Barry Manilow headlines a concert on Broadway.

title: Your Arms Too Short to Box with God
description: The Gospel of St. Matthew is retold as a gospel musical, conceived and written by Vinette Carroll.

title: Fiddler on the Roof
description: Tevye, a Jewish milkman in early 1900s Russia, sees his three eldest daughters married, each one moving further from traditional ways, and must cope with the growing anti-Jewish sentiment in his country.

title: Something Old, Something New
description: An elderly widow and widower decide to live together unmarried, to the chagrin of their families.

title: The Trip Back Down
description: An unremarkable race car driver must confront his career's inevitable downslide while visiting family and friends in his old home town.

title: Dirty Linen & New-Found-Land
description: An evening of two one-act plays by Tom Stoppard.  In Dirty Linen, a Parliamentary committee meets to deal with a sex scandal.  In New-Found-Land, two men take over the meeting room during the lunch break, and one satirizes a tourist's description of a trip across America.

title: Ipi-tombi
description: This musical brings South African village folk dances, song and rituals to the stage.

title: Merce Cunningham Dance Company
description: The Merce Cunningham Dance Company performs innovative modern dances choreographed by Merce Cunningham.

title: Otherwise Engaged
description: An intellectual refuses to become emotionally involved with his increasingly frustrated family and friends in Simon Gray's study of alienation.

title: A Party with Betty Comden & Adolph Green
description: Lyricists Betty Comden and Adolph Green (On the Town, Wonderful Town, Bells Are Ringing, Peter Pan) perform many of their classic songs and discuss their careers in this two-person show.

title: American Buffalo
description: After underselling a valuable nickel to a customer, junk shop owner Don and a team of third-rate crooks plot to seek revenge by stealing the customer's coin collection.

title: The Cherry Orchard
description: Russian aristocrat Lyubov returns from Paris to her childhood estate, which is due to be sold. Anton Chekhov's 1903 play highlights the growing irrelevancy of the Russian upper classes as the former peasant class begins to gain power.

title: Caesar and Cleopatra
description: Roman emperor Julius Caesar meets the young Egyptian queen Cleopatra, courts her and tutors her in the ways of the politics of his land in George Bernard Shaw's 1898 play.

title: Nureyev
description: Rudolf Nureyev performs three ballets: Pierrot Lunaire, Song of a Wayfarer and The Lesson.

title: Unexpected Guests
description: A Southern California couple's marriage is slowly disintegrating.

title: Mark Twain Tonight!
description: Hal Holbrook brings the personality and writings of Mark Twain to life in this one-man show.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: Appearing Nitely
description: Lily Tomlin performs an evening of character comedy, which she devised with Jane Wagner.

title: Mummenschanz
description: This evening features mime performers who use masks, flexible body wrappings, props and costumes to create their affects.

title: The Shadow Box
description: Three terminally ill patients and their family members prepare to face the inevitable in the same hospital, in Michael Cristofer's Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning play.

title: Ladies at the Alamo
description: The chairman of a Texas theatre complex attempts to oust the theatre's artistic director.

title: Anna Christie
description: A weary former prostitute seeks out her estranged sea captain father, hoping to find forgiveness from him, while hiding her past from a stoker she loves in Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: I Love My Wife
description: Two couples in Trenton, N.J. contemplate wife-swapping in this Cy Coleman-Michael Stewart musical.

title: Side by Side by Sondheim
description: Three singers and a narrator perform the songs of Stephen Sondheim in this musical revue.

title: Annie
description: A spunky orphan girl finds a home with a New York millionaire during the Depression, but must dodge the clutches of her evil orphanage mistress, in Charles Strouse, Martin Charnin and Thomas Meehan's musical based on the popular Harold Gray comic strip.

title: The Basic Training of Pavlo Hummel
description: Awkward young soldier Pavlo Hummel is seen training for combat in Vietnam and achieving some distinction in battle before meeting a tragic end in David Rabe's play.

title: Nana Mouskouri on Broadway
description: Greek singer Nana Mouskouri performs in concert on Broadway.

title: The King and I
description: Welsh schoolteacher Anna Leonowens travels from England to Siam to serve as governess to the king's many children. Their clash of wills and the lessons they learn from each other are examined in this Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, based on Leonowens's account of her experiences.

title: Happy End
description: Representatives of the Salvation Army and gangsters collide in Roaring Twenties Chicago in this Kurt Weill-Bertolt Brecht musical.

title: Vieux Carré
description: Two one-act plays by Tennessee Williams are set in the same rooms of a 1930s New Orleans boarding house, with overlapping characters.  The first, The Angel in the Alcove, is about a homosexual relationship between a young writer and an aging painter.  The second, I Never Get Dressed Until After Dark on Sundays, follows a young stud and his easily aroused mistress.

title: Together on Broadway (Mary Martin & Ethel Merman)
description: Mary Martin and Ethel Merman perform their greatest hits in this benefit concert, hosted by Cyril Ritchard.

title: The House of Atreus
description: Agamemnon, the king of Argos, returns home from fighting the Trojan War to find his adulterous wife, Clytemnestra, ready to murder him for sacrificing their daughter, Iphigenia, in Aeschylus' tragedy, the first in his Oresteia trilogy.

title: Toller Cranston's "The Ice Show"
description: Canadian ice skating champion Toller Cranston headlines an ice show.

title: Gemini
description: A brother and sister are both attracted to the same man in the summer of 1973 in Philadelphia.

title: Beatlemania
description: The lads from Liverpool are brought back to life in this concert of the Beatles' greatest hits.

title: The Importance of Being Earnest
description: Two wealthy London bachelors each pretend to be a fictitious man called Earnest in order to win over two eligible young ladies, despite the ladies' avowed preference for that name alone — and the interference of the intimidatingly proper Lady Bracknell — in Oscar Wilde's "trivial comedy for serious people."

title: Man of La Mancha
description: An imprisoned Miguel de Cervantes gets his fellow inmates to enact the story of his novel, Don Quixote, about an aged nobleman who declares himself a "knight errant" out to do battle for good and the love of a fair maiden, in Mitch Leigh, Joe Darion and Dale Wasserman's musical adaptation of the classic Cervantes novel.

title: Estrada
description: This Russian variety show features circus acts and musical numbers.

title: Tartuffe
description: A religious conman infiltrates the household of a gullible man and his exasperated family in Moliere's 1664 comedy.

title: Miss Margarida's Way
description: A tyrannical eighth-grade teacher addresses the audience as her class, railing against religion, education and democracy.

title: Comedy with Music
description: Danish classical pianist and comedian Victor Borge performs an evening of comedic piano routines and anecdotes.

title: Cleo on Broadway
description: Acclaimed British jazz singer Cleo Laine performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Hair
description: The musical that introduced rock 'n' roll to the theatrical stage, Hair examines a group of 60s-era youth struggling for generational and personal identity, dealing with the Vietnam War, and exploring drugs and the sexual revolution.

title: The Gin Game
description: An elderly man and woman play repeated games of gin in their retirement home, slowly coming to grips with what is left of their lives in their old age, in Donald L. Coburn's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: The Night of the Tribades
description: The emotional life of the playwright August Strindberg is examined in Per Olov Enquist's play.

title: Dracula
description: Bram Stoker's classic novel about a charming Transylvanian count who is really a vampire out to seduce women for their blood is adapted for the stage by Hamilton Deane and John L. Balderston.

title: Some of My Best Friends
description: A middle-aged business executive seeks shelter from a competitive world by talking to his house pets and plants.

title: An Almost Perfect Person
description: Judith Ross's comedy follows the romantic adventures of a female Congressional candidate.

title: The Act
description: A washed-up Hollywood film star performs an autobiographical nightclub act in Las Vegas.

title: Bully
description: Jerome Alden's one-man play follows the real and imagined adventures of President Theodore Roosevelt, as well as the President's imagined "conversations" with members of his family and his contemporaries.

title: A Condition of Shadows
description: Jerry Rockwood portrays the author Edgar Allan Poe in this one-man show, which he also wrote.

title: Golda
description: Israeli prime minister Golda Meir is depicted at the crucial point in the Yom Kippur War, with flashbacks to her earlier life.

title: The Merchant
description: Arnold Wesker reimagines William Shakespeare's The Merchant of Venice with a shift in the relationships and more strongly from the point of view of the Jewish moneylender Shylock, taking his inspiration from the three stories Shakespeare used as his source.

title: Lou Rawls on Broadway
description: Jazz-soul singer Lou Rawls performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Jesus Christ Superstar
description: The final days of Jesus Christ leading up to his crucifixion are seen through the eyes of his betrayer, Judas, in Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice's rock opera.

title: Chapter Two
description: A recently widowed spy novelist and divorced actress unexpectedly fall in love in Neil Simon's autobiographical comedy.

title: Saint Joan
description: Set in 15th century France, Saint Joan follows a country girl whose mysterious visions propel her into elite circles. When the nation’s rulers become threatened by her popularity and influence, they unite to bring her down and she finds herself on trial for her life.

title: A Touch of the Poet
description: The first and only finished play in Eugene O'Neill's proposed 11-part "American history" cycle addresses the immigrant experience, focusing on the father-daughter conflict of a once-wealthy, still grandly mannered tavern-keeper outside Boston in 1828 and his headstrong offspring who aligns herself with a rich American.

title: Cold Storage
description: Two hospital patients discuss life and death in Ronald Ribman's play.

title: Do You Turn Somersaults?
description: A doctor forms a romance with his patient on the Riga coast in 1968.

title: The November People
description: A Watergate criminal returns home after serving time in prison.

title: Cheaters
description: Michael Jacobs' comedy looks at the fad of wife-swapping that was a hot topic in the 1970s.

title: Paul Robeson
description: In Phillip Hayes Dean's biographical two-man play, the legendary actor, singer and political activist Paul Robeson sings songs and tells stories of his multi-faceted career, from triumphs in Show Boat and The Emperor Jones, to his fight for racial equality to accusations of Communist involvement.

title: Elvis: The Legend Lives!
description: The life and music of Elvis Presley are celebrated in this concert of the rock'n'roll singer's greatest hits.

title: On the Twentieth Century
description: A down-and-out Broadway producer struggles to convince his former muse and lover, now a successful film actress, to return to Broadway in a play about Mary Magdelene, while dealing with her jealous new lover and a religious fanatic aboard a luxury train, in Cy Coleman, Betty Comden and Adolph Green's musical adaptation of the play Twentieth Century.

title: Deathtrap
description: A down-on-his-luck playwright's student tells him he has written the perfect suspense play and will bring it to the playwright's Connecticut home tonight.  The suspense over whether the playwright will kill the student and take credit for his play forms the crux of Ira Levin's thriller.

title: The Water Engine / Mr. Happiness
description: In The Water Engine, presented in the style of a radio drama, the inventor of an engine that runs purely on water is seen as a threat to big business.  In Mr. Happiness, a radio advice-giver responds to letters.

title: Timbuktu!
description: This revision of Kismet, the musical tale of a wily poet who helps his daughter marry a prince while enjoying a dalliance of his own, is set in the half-mythical Timbuktu region of Mali in West Africa, and features an all-black cast and five new songs by Robert Wright and George Forrest taken from African folk music.

title: Hello, Dolly!
description: A meddlesome matchmaker brings together the young clerk of a wealthy Yonkers merchant and his assistant with a widowed milliner and her assistant, while making sure she herself gets to marry the merchant, in Jerry Herman and Michael Stewart's musical adaptation of Thornton Wilder's The Matchmaker.

title: The Effect of Gamma Rays on Man-in-the-Moon Marigolds
description: A domineering mother subverts the dreams of her daughters, one bookish and the other promiscuous, in Paul Zindel's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: 13 Rue de L'Amour
description: Georges Feydeau's 1892 farce follows a variety of couples, some of whom are unfaithful, some of whom wish to be unfaithful, and some of whom merely suspect their spouses of infidelity.

title: Stages
description: Five short plays are presented dealing with a middle-aged man confronting failure. Stage II is based on two separate testimonies given before the House Un-American Activities Committee in the 1950s.

title: Dancin'
description: This anthology of dance vignettes, using a wide variety of styles, existing songs and no book, is directed and choreographed by Bob Fosse.

title: A History of the American Film
