description: An evening of musical vignettes parodying films and film stars from the silent era to the present features book and lyrics by Christopher Durang and music by Mel Marvin.

title: Eliot Feld Ballet
description: Modern ballet choreographer Eliot Feld's dance company performs on Broadway.

title: Murray Louis Dance Company
description: Rudolf Nureyev performs "Vivace" and "The Canarsie Venus," two pieces choreographed by modern dance specialist Murray Louis, with Louis' dance company

title: Diversions and Delights
description: An exiled and ill Oscar Wilde gives a public performance, under the pseudonym of "Sebastian Melmoth," shortly before his death in John Gay's one-man play.

title: Patio / Porch
description: Two one-acts portray conversations between women.  In Patio, the women are disappointed sisters.  In Porch, they are a domineering mother and her daughter.

title: The Mighty Gents
description: Several black men who are former members of a gang in Newark, N.J. struggle to survive as adults.

title: Da
description: An Irish man recalls his troubled relationship with his late father, a poor gardener constantly taken advantage of by his employers.

title: Ain't Misbehavin'
description: A cast of five singers perform the music and celebrate the freewheeling spirit of Harlem musician Thomas "Fats" Waller.

title: Angel
description: Ketti Frings co-authors this musical adaptation of her play Look Homeward, Angel, based on Thomas Wolfe's novel about a domineering mother who insists her sons help her run a boardinghouse, keeping their own dreams in check.

title: Runaways
description: This musical revue of songs and monologues delivered by children who have run away from home is written by Elizabeth Swados.

title: Working
description: This musical revue based on Studs Terkel's oral history of the working class features songs by a variety of writers, from Stephen Schwartz, who conceived and directs the project, to Mary Rodgers to Micki Grant to James Taylor.

title: The American Dance Machine
description: Memorable dances from 13 classic and contemporary Broadway musicals are performed by the American Dance Machine.

title: Once in a Lifetime
description: A down-on-their-luck vaudeville trio goes to Hollywood shortly after the talking-pictures revolution to make their fortunes, and end up posing as vocal coaches for a major producer.

title: The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas
description: Miss Mona, the madam of a beloved Texas whorehouse, finds her business suddenly under attack from a television evangelist and local politicians, with even the local sheriff unable to do much to stop the sudden switch in public opinion.

title: Stop the World - I Want to Get Off
description: The much-put-upon Littlechap attempts to improve himself by marrying his boss's daughter, ultimately having affairs with three other women, all played by the same actress who plays his wife.  The Leslie Bricusse-Anthony Newley musical uses a circus setting.

title: Players
description: The battle for control of a soccer team takes place in a boardroom.

title: Eubie!
description: Songs by the African-American composer Eubie Blake, best-known for the 1921 all-black revue Shuffle Along, are performed in this revue.

title: The Crucifer of Blood
description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson are seen as young detectives taking on an early case rooted in past violence in India.

title: First Monday in October
description: Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee's play imagines the first woman appointed as a Supreme Court judge as a conservative who attracts the most liberal member of the Court despite her politics.

title: King of Hearts
description: An American soldier in World War I stays in a deserted French town which proves to be occupied by carefree, escaped inmates from the local asylum.

title: St. Mark's Gospel
description: Alec McCowen gives a one-man performance of the Gospel According to St. Mark.

title: Gorey Stories
description: The spooky tales and characters from Edward Gorey's Amphigorey and Amphigorey Too form the backbone of this "entertainment with music."

title: Platinum
description: An aging movie queen attempts a comeback by making a record and falls for a young rock star.

title: The Playboy of the Weekend World
description: Emlyn Williams devised and performs this one-man show based on the works of British writer Saki.

title: The Neighborhood Playhouse at 50
description: The 50th anniversary of the legendary acting school The Neighborhood Playhouse is celebrated in an evening of scenes, music and dance.

title: The Kingfisher
description: An aging romantic seeks to rekindle an old flame, despite the disapproval of his manservant.

title: Man and Superman
description: A confirmed bachelor is pursued by a woman in George Bernard Shaw's play depicting the eternal battle of the sexes.  The play's controversial third act, Don Juan in Hell, features a debate between a Puritanical Don Juan (played by the same actor who plays the bachelor) and the Devil.

title: Ballroom
description: A lonely widow finds herself again through dancing at a local ballroom — and through entering a relationship with a man who turns out to be married.

title: Icedancing
description: Ice skaters John Curry and JoJo Starbuck perform an evening of choreographed ice skating routines.

title: A Broadway Musical
description: The trials and tribulations of putting on a Broadway musical become the subject of a Broadway musical.

title: Taxi Tales
description: A series of vignettes of urban life relating to taxicabs and their drivers.

title: Monteith & Rand
description: John Monteith and Suzanne Rand perform an evening of comedy, some of which is improvised.

title: The Grand Tour
description: A Polish Jewish man and his colonel friend escape from the Nazis during the fall of France in Jerry Herman, Michael Stewart and Mark Bramble's musical adaptation of S.N. Behrman's play Jacobowsky and the Colonel.

title: Wings
description: A woman who in her youth performed stunts on biplanes struggles to regain control of her mobility and her life after suffering a stroke.

title: Trick
description: The murder of a BBC news anchor's wife is investigated in Larry Cohen's comic thriller.

title: Are You Now, or Have You Ever Been
description: Transcripts from testimony at the House Un-American Activities Committee hearings make up this drama, with the words of Ring Lardner, Jr., Arthur Miller, Elia Kazan, Paul Robeson and Lillian Hellman among those excerpted.

title: They're Playing Our Song
description: A neurotic composer and a wacky lyricist form a partnership and a tempestuous romance, expressing their thoughts in song both in their own solos and in songs where each is backed by three "alter egos."

title: Saravá
description: The widowed Dona Flor marries again but is haunted by the ghost of her first husband in N. Richard Nash's and Mitch Leigh's musical adaptation of Jorge Amado's novel Dona Flor and Her Two Husbands and its film version.

title: Whoopee!
description: A hypochondriac seeking a cure for his health in California inadvertently elopes with a rancher's daughter who is avoiding marriage to a sheriff but in love with an American Indian, causing plenty of comic complications in this musical farce.

title: Coquelico
description: This multimedia circus show from the National Theatre of Prague tells the story of two clowns who hatch from eggs and live in pursuit of Venus.

title: On Golden Pond
description: An elderly couple enjoy their latest summer in a cottage on a Maine lake, as they come to terms with the husband's advancing age and his ongoing estrangement from his newly engaged daughter.

title: Sweeney Todd
description: A barber who was unjustly imprisoned for years by a corrupt judge returns to England bent on revenge — a revenge that turns indiscriminately murderous, leading his resourceful accomplice, Mrs. Lovett, to bake the victims into meat pies.

title: Strangers
description: The tempestuous relationship and marriage of author Sinclair Lewis and political journalist Dorothy Thompson is the subject of Sherman Yellen's play.

title: Béjart: Ballet of the Twentieth Century
description: The 70-member Ballet of the Twentieth Century performs an evening of dance choreographed by Maurice Béjart.

title: Spokesong
description: An Irish bike shop owner sees "the common wheel" as a cure for the strife his country is suffering.

title: Zoot Suit
description: The Sleepy Lagoon murder case of 1942 and the Zoot Suit riots of 1943, both of which centered around anti-Chicano racism in Los Angeles, are dramatized in Luis Valdez's play.

title: A Meeting by the River
description: A British family becomes influenced by the mysticism of the Far East.

title: Bedroom Farce
description: A self-absorbed young couple disrupts the lives of three other couples on the night a party is being given, with the onstage action taking place in three separate bedrooms.

title: Faith Healer
description: "Rashomon"-like questions of reality and truth are raised here by four contradictory monologues, divided among three characters — an itinerant Irish healer of the sick, working the rural British Isles with his wife (or mistress), and his Cockney manager.

title: Carmelina
description: An Italian woman collects child support checks from three American soldiers, each of whom thinks he is the father of her daughter, and each of whom returns to her village for a nostalgic tour in Burton Lane, Alan Jay Lerner and Joseph Stein's musical suggested by the film Buona Sera, Mrs. Campbell.

title: My Old Friends
description: A group of elderly retirement home residents resolutely enjoy life and each other.

title: G.R. Point
description: A group of soldiers in Vietnam are charged with shipping the dead bodies of their comrades back to the United States, dealing with the task in different ways.

title: Whose Life Is It Anyway?
description: A car-crash victim who has been paralyzed fights for his right to die rather than live in an incapacitated state.

title: Manny
description: The life of the film actor and art collector Edward G. Robinson is dramatized in Raymond Serra's play.

title: The Elephant Man
description: The life of John Merrick, intensely disfigured by a rare disease, who was rescued from a life as a carnival freak by a kindly doctor and patronized by actresses and royalty, is dramatized by Bernard Pomerance.

title: V.I.P. Night on Broadway
description: Veteran actress Phyllis Newman conceived this benefit performance, featuring many Broadway stars of the day as well as a performance from the American Dance Machine.

title: Break a Leg
description: The lives of middle European theatre folk, particularly a feuding producer and critic, are examined in Ira Levin's play.

title: The Goodbye People
description: A Coney Island hot dog salesman comes out of retirement to risk everything on reopening his stand.

title: Bosoms and Neglect
description: A couple is in for a night of revelation when they discover that their psychiatrist is leaving and that the man's mother is dying of cancer.

title: Knockout
description: A bullying boxer competes against a gentle ex-boxer-turned-trainer in a prizefight.

title: The Utter Glory of Morrissey Hall
description: The students at a girls' boarding school play endless pranks on its staff, including staging a mutiny against the long-suffering headmistress.

title: Lerner and Loewe: A Very Special Evening
Murder at the Howard Johnson's
description: Three people with murderous intent occupy three rooms in a Howard Johnson's motel.

title: Up in One
description: Veteran Australian entertainer Peter Allen headlines a concert of pop music.

title: I Remember Mama
description: A Norwegian immigrant family settling into San Francisco in the early 1900s is held together by its indomitable Mama, in Richard Rodgers and Martin Charnin's musical adaptation of John van Druten's play.

title: Loose Ends
description: A married couple is undone by the woman's selfishness and inability to commit.

title: Lone Star & Pvt. Wars
description: In two one-act plays, three wounded Vietnam veterans pass the time by trading jokes and philosophies.

title: Richard III
description: Richard, Duke of York, plots murders, marriages, and other intrigues in order to secure his own place on the throne. This tale of ruthless ambition is part of Shakespeare's cycle of plays about the Wars of the Roses.

title: Bruce Forsyth on Broadway!
description: British vaudevillian Bruce Forsyth performs an evening of comedy.

title: The Madwoman of Central Park West
description: In this semi-autobiographical musical, Phyllis Newman plays a version of herself, a successful actress seeking to balance her career with her life as a wife and mother.  The songs in this show were mostly cut or unused from other projects.

title: The Price
description: When the Great Depression cost his family their fortune, Victor Franz gave up his dream of an education to support his father. Three decades later, Victor has returned to his childhood home to sell the remainder of his parents’ estate. His wife, his estranged brother, and the wily furniture dealer hired to appraise their possessions all arrive with their own agendas, forcing Victor to confront a question, long-stifled, about the value of his sacrifice.

title: Got Tu Go Disco
description: A woman who sells disco clothes in a store hates disco music, until her boyfriend convinces her to go to the local dance club, where she becomes its queen.

title: Broadway Opry '79
description: Rotating country music acts perform in concert, bringing "a little country to the big city."

title: But Never Jam Today
description: An all-black musical adaptation of Lewis Carroll's "Alice in Wonderland," about a girl's trip into a magical dreamland with an eccentric cast of characters.

title: Gilda Radner - Live from New York
description: Gilda Radner headlines a musical revue showcasing many of her comic characters from Saturday Night Live, including Roseanne Roseannadanna, Baba Wawa, Lisa Loopner and others.

title: Peter Pan
description: The boy who would not grow up visits the Darling children and takes them on a magical adventure to Never-Never Land in this beloved musical version of the classic J.M. Barrie play.

title: Shirley Bassey
description: Shirley Bassey performs in concert.

title: On Golden Pond
description: An elderly couple enjoy their latest summer in a cottage on a Maine lake, as they come to terms with the husband's advancing age and his ongoing estrangement from his newly engaged daughter.

title: Evita
description: An obscure and ambitious actress becomes the powerful and controversial first lady of Argentina.

title: Dogg's Hamlet, Cahoot's Macbeth
description: An evening of two one-acts by Tom Stoppard.  In the first, English schoolboys present two short versions of Hamlet in their own language, Dogg.  In the second, a real-life production of Macbeth, staged in a Czech living room by playwright Pavel Kahout when the government banned public performances, is recreated and juxtaposed with the police inquiry.

title: The 1940's Radio Hour
description: A struggling radio show puts on its 1942 radio broadcast, which features many hit songs from the era.

title: Sugar Babies
description: The comics, variety acts and showgirls of the burlesque era are recalled in this musical revue.

title: Once a Catholic
description: Comic adventures in a Catholic girls' school.

title: The Most Happy Fella
description: A middle-aged Italian vineyard owner falls in love with a pretty waitress from afar, sends her the picture of his handsome foreman, and convinces her to move to his California vineyard and marry him, in Frank Loesser's musical adaptation of Sidney Howard's play They Knew What They Wanted.

title: A Kurt Weill Cabaret
description: Alvin Epstein and Martha Schlamme perform a cabaret of songs with music by Kurt Weill.

title: Devour the Snow
description: The survivors of the Donner Party, a group of pioneers who traveled across America and were trapped in the Sierra Nevada during the winter of 1847, are the subjects of Abe Polsky's play.

title: Romantic Comedy
description: A married playwright attempts to continue his marriage while maintaining a mistress.

title: Engelbert (Humperdinck) on Broadway
description: Pop singer Engelbert Humperdinck performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Strider
description: The life story of a piebald horse, from birth to tragic, unwanted end.

title: Last Licks
description: A son tries to get his widowed father's situation in order, and to settle some old grievances with him, in Frank D. Gilroy's family drama.

title: Night and Day
description: A journalist and British diplomat confront an African leader over a local uprising that has attracted much media coverage.  The diplomat's wife observes everyone else's behavior throughout.

title: King of Schnorrers
description: A Sephardic beggar's pretty daughter is wooed by an artisan in this musical version of Israel Zangwill's novel.

title: Bent
description: Two homosexual lovers are thrown into a Nazi concentration camp in the 1930s, with one denying being gay until his experiences in the camp teach him the importance of pride in himself.

title: Bette! Divine Madness
description: Bette Midler headlines a concert of songs and comedy, featuring her backup singers The Harlettes.

title: Oklahoma!
description: A confident cowboy competes with a surly, mysterious farmhand for the honor of taking a lovely young farm woman to a dance in Rodgers and Hammerstein's 1943 musical adaptation of Green Grow the Lilacs.

title: Teibele and Her Demon
description: A woman who was deserted by her husband and is forbidden by law to remarry is courted by a suitor who poses as a demon.

title: Chinese Acrobats & Magicians of Taiwan
description: The Chinese Acrobats of Taiwan perform a holiday act featuring magicians, dance and martial arts.

title: Comin' Uptown
description: This musical update of Charles Dickens' A Christmas Carol recasts Scrooge as a contemporary Harlem slumlord.

title: Watch on the Rhine
description: A peace activist exiled from pre-World War II Nazi Germany and a conservative Romanian unsure of how real a threat the Nazis pose meet in the Washington, D.C. home of the German's mother-in-law, in Lillian Hellman's tense drama.

title: Betrayal
description: An extramarital affair between Emma and Jerry, who is the best friend of Emma's husband Robert, is examined in backwards chronology.

title: The Lady from Dubuque
description: Three couples meet in a living room and play dangerous games, avoiding the topic of one woman's imminent death, until they are interrupted by the arrival of a black man and a woman calling herself "the lady from Dubuque" and saying she is the dying woman's mother.

title: Harold and Maude
description: A discontented, perpetually suicidal young man meets and becomes deeply attached to a free-spirited elderly woman in this adaptation of the 1971 film.

title: The Best House in Naples
description: The mistress of an elderly rich man in Naples demands that he marry her so he can give his name to her grown sons, only one of whom is his. Later produced on Broadway as Filumena, which was adapted by Willis Hall and Keith Waterhouse.

title: Canterbury Tales
description: A group of pilgrims entertain each other with stories of love, deception and bawdy humor en route to the tomb of St. Thomas-Becket in Canterbury.  A musical adaptation of the "tales" written by Geoffrey Chaucer in the late 1300s.

title: West Side Story
description: West Side Story transposes Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet to the gang-ridden streets of 1950s Manhattan, dominated by the Sharks and the Jets. Two teens from the bitter-enemy gangs meet and fall in love at a fateful gym dance.

title: Talley's Folly
description: This segment of Lanford Wilson's trilogy about the Talley family looks at the courtship of Aunt Sally and her beloved husband, Matt.

title: Whose Life Is It Anyway?
description: A car-crash victim who has been paralyzed fights for his right to die rather than live in an incapacitated state.

title: Mister Lincoln
description: Abraham Lincoln recalls his life and philosophy in this one-man play, which uses many of the real President's written words and speeches.

title: Dance Theatre of Harlem
description: The racially diverse ballet company Dance Theatre of Harlem performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Major Barbara
description: Wealthy Lady Britomart must reunite with her estranged arms manufacturer husband in order to marry off her daughters, including Salvation Army major Barbara, in George Bernard Shaw's critique of capitalism, war, religion and other political issues.

title: Charlotte
description: Charlotte von Stein, a lady-in-waiting in the 16th-century court at Weimar, recounts her long affair with Johann von Goethe.

title: Censored Scenes From King Kong
description: This comedy imagines that scenes cut from the film "King Kong" actually contained information for secret agents.

title: Heartaches of a Pussycat
description: The amorous and other adventures of a white pussycat and her animal friends are dramatized in this stylized Argentinian production of Genevieve Serreau and James Lord's French script from a story by Honore de Balzac.

title: Clothes for a Summer Hotel
description: F. Scott Fitzgerald visits his wife, Zelda, in a mental hospital in Asheville, N.C.  They look back over their lives and relationship in Tennessee Williams' final play to play Broadway in his lifetime.

title: Reggae
description: This musical examines reggae music and Rastafarianism, a popular religious movement advocating that Jamaicans return to Ethiopia.  In this tale a pop singer returns to Jamaica after achieving success in the United States and reunites with an old lover who gets in trouble with gangs over his marijuana growing.

title: Children of a Lesser God
description: A unconventional speech therapist who works at a school for the deaf attempts to teach the school's deaf cleaning woman to speak and read lips. As their relationship heats up, so does their need for control, igniting a thrilling exploration of passion, intimacy, and connection.

title: Horowitz and Mrs. Washington
description: A man who is the victim of violence by a black street gang finds himself cared for by a black nurse.

title: I Ought to Be in Pictures
description: A struggling Hollywood screenwriter is visited by the 19-year-old daughter from New York whom he abandoned years ago.

title: Morning's at Seven
description: Four sisters who live near each other in a Midwestern suburb find their existence disrupted when one's son wants to leave home to get married and another tells her husband she wants to live apart from the sister who shares a house with them.

title: Goodbye Fidel
description: After the Castro revolution, a group of upper-class Cubans attempt to adjust to life in America.

title: Past Tense
description: A husband and wife examine their broken marriage.

title: Happy New Year
description: A young banker who has worked his way up from poverty plans to retire as soon as he's made enough money to enjoy life, which scandalizes his rich fiancée but pleases her free-spirited sister. A musical adaptation of Philip Barry's play Holiday, featuring songs by Cole Porter.

title: Nuts
description: A woman must defend her sanity in court.  But if she is proven to be of sound mind, she will have to stand trial for murder.

title: Barnum
description: Circus impresario Phineas T. Barnum builds "The Greatest Show on Earth," despite his wife's disapproval and a brief affair with "Swedish Nightingale" Jenny Lind.

title: A Day in Hollywood / A Night in the Ukraine
description: The first act of this musical revue celebrates the movies with a mixture of classic and original songs, including a number in which the "famous feet" of movie stars are the only parts of them seen in a dance routine.  The second act presents a fictitious Marx Brothers movie loosely based on Anton Chekhov's The Bear.

title: Hide and Seek
description: A woman left alone in a mysterious house is terrorized in Lezley Havad's thriller.

title: Home
description: A black Southern farmer is thrown in jail for opposing the Vietnam draft and later moves up North only to experience further difficulties, before finally returning to the comforts of home and family.

title: The Roast
description: A group of successful comedians who viciously backbite to maintain their success, destroying their personal lives and relationships in the process, come together to "roast," mock and honor one of their own.

title: Musical Chairs
description: This musical depicts members of an audience at an Off-Broadway play.

title: Blackstone!
description: Veteran magician Harry Blackstone headlines an evening of music and magic.

title: Of the Fields, Lately
description: A son's homecoming reopens family wounds.

title: Billy Bishop Goes to War
description: A hapless military school student becomes a hero of World War I in John Gray and Eric Peterson's two-man play with music.

title: Your Arms Too Short to Box with God
description: The Gospel of St. Matthew is retold as a gospel musical, conceived and written by Vinette Carroll.

title: It's So Nice to Be Civilized
description: The lives and loves of the people who live in a city neighborhood.

title: The Music Man
description: Con man Harold Hill comes to River City, Iowa, intending to sell the town and its children on a fake marching-band system and then skip town — until he falls for the local librarian.

title: Fearless Frank
description: The life of Welsh author Frank Harris, who chronicled his many affairs in his memoir My Life and Loves.

title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
description: An acerbic theatre critic breaks his leg while on a lecture tour in the Midwest and is forced to stay a bit longer at the home of his host family, ultimately taking over the house with his demands and visiting Broadway luminary friends.

title: Camelot
description: King Arthur founds the kingdom of Camelot and the Knights of the Round Table, who fight for justice and right, only to see his ideal crumble when his wife Guenevere falls in love with his favorite knight, Sir Lancelot.

title: Coppelia
description: A sinister inventor creates a lifelike doll that steals the heart of a man who thinks she is real.

title: The Bat
description: This ballet, adapted from the Johann Strauss operetta Die Fledermaus, is performed by the Ballet National de Marseille and choreographed by Roland Petit.

title: Marcel Proust Remembered
description: Marcel Proust's seven-volume novel, Remembrance of Things Past, is turned into a ballet performed by the Ballet National de Marseille and choreographed by Roland Petit.

title: 42nd Street
description: A chorus girl from Allentown, PA, steps into the starring role to save the show when its star breaks her leg, in this stage adaptation of the classic 1933 film musical.

title: Charlie and Algernon
description: A medical experiment attempts to turn a brain-damaged man into a genius in this musical adaptation of Daniel Keyes' novel Flowers for Algernon and the film based on it.

title: Passione
description: A wife who abandoned her Italian-American family in Philadelphia returns.

title: Insideoutsideandallaround with Shelley Berman
description: Shelley Berman presents a one-man evening of comedy routines.

title: The Bacchae
description: The Greek god Dionysus punishes his cousin, Pentheus, the king of Thebes, and his aunt, Agave, who refuse to worship him because his mother was a mortal member of their family, in Euripedes' tragedy.

title: Makarova and Company
description: Prima ballerina Natalia Makarova performs with her own company of dancers in the Russian-Soviet style of ballet.

title: Makarova and Company
description: Prima ballerina Natalia Makarova performs with her own company of dancers in the Russian-Soviet style of ballet.

title: Division Street
description: Former 1960s radicals examine their lives from an adult perspective.

title: The Suicide
description: In Nikolai Erdman's 1928 play, an unemployed man who fails to learn to play the tuba properly considers suicide, with his neighbor exploiting that suicide to several bidders who want to further their own agendas.

title: Brigadoon
description: Two Americans game-hunting in Scotland happen upon a mysterious village in which the people dress and speak as if from another era. One of the Americans is drawn to one of the Scottish lasses and must choose between the magical Brigadoon and his conventional fiancée back in New York.

title: Banjo Dancing
description: A joyful celebration of Americana, this solo piece showcases the virtuoso musical talents and endearing storytelling of writer/performer Stephen Wade.

title: Tintypes
description: Songs from the early twentieth century are used to illustrate the immigrant experience in America during those years.

title: Quick Change
description: Michael McGiveney pays tribute to his father, Owen McGiveney, who was known for his "quick change" artistry in distinguishing between characters when he would perform, most notably in Charles Dickens' Oliver Twist.

title: A Life
description: The life story of Drumm, a disillusioned Irish civil servant who appeared in Hugh Leonard's previous play, Da.

title: Fifth of July
description: A paraplegic Vietnam War veteran prepares to sell his family's Missouri homestead to fellow college radicals of the 1960.  This is one of Lanford Wilson's three plays about the Talley family.

title: Tricks of the Trade
description: In this Cold War-spy thriller a New York psychiatrist and his patient play cat and mouse.

title: Boston Ballet Company
description: The Boston Ballet Company, the first professional dance company in New England, performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Boston Ballet Company
description: The Boston Ballet Company, the first professional dance company in New England, performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Boston Ballet Company
description: The Boston Ballet Company, the first professional dance company in New England, performs in concert on Broadway.

title: Les Colon Baioni
description: An Italian duo of clowns makes its North American debut in this evening of comedy.

title: Lunch Hour
description: A group of married couples toy with wife-swapping in the Hamptons.

title: The Philadelphia Story
description: A wealthy socialite sees her second wedding disrupted by her ex-husband and a nosy reporter and photographer.

title: A Lesson From Aloes
description: Two friends in South Africa, one white and one black, find their relationship tested when the black man and his family decide to leave his apartheid-torn country for England.

title: The American Clock
description: A businessman and his family, including his son who dreams of being a writer, are hit hard by the Great Depression in Arthur Miller's semi-autobiographical play.

title: Perfectly Frank
description: Songs of Frank Loesser, who wrote for many Hollywood films as well as Broadway's Where's Charley, Guys and Dolls, How to Succeed... and The Most Happy Fella.

title: Onward Victoria
description: A musical biography of the 19th-century feminist icon Victoria Woodhull, who became a millionaire stockbroker and ran for President of the United States on a platform of free love and sexual equality.

title: Amadeus
description: The composer Antonio Salieri must come to terms with the greater genius of the bratty but God-gifted younger composer, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart — but not before setting out to destroy him.

title: John Gabriel Borkman
description: A banker who was imprisoned for embezzling money from clients returns to find his wife and sister-in-law warring over his affections and those of his son, in Henrik Ibsen's 1896 play.

title: Mixed Couples
description: Two couples who swapped partners 25 years ago reunite at an airport hanger in New Jersey in 1927.

title: Frankenstein
description: A Swiss scientist in the mid-1800s creates a living, but horrible-looking, creature who terrorizes the town in his quest for love in Victor Gialanella's adaptation of Mary Shelley's classic novel.

title: The Pirates of Penzance
description: Young Frederic has turned 21 and thus completed his apprenticeship to a band of kindhearted pirates.  He falls for Mabel, the lovely daughter of law-enforcer Major-General Stanley, only to learn that his birthday falls on Feb. 29, which means he is technically still a pirate.

title: Emlyn Williams as Charles Dickens
description: Acclaimed actor Emlyn Williams impersonates the novelist Charles Dickens on one of his famous lecture tours, reading selections from his celebrated novels.

title: To Grandmother's House We Go
description: A family matriarch's daughter and three grandchildren come to her Connecticut home for a contentious Thanksgiving.

title: Shakespeare's Cabaret
description: A cast of six performs excerpts from William Shakespeare's poetry, set to music by Lance Mulcahy.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: The Five O'Clock Girl
description: A poor shop girl wins the heart of a wealthy playboy through a series of anonymous phone conversations at 5 o'clock.

title: Piaf
description: In this biographical play Edith Piaf recalls her difficult rise from the gutters of Paris to worldwide fame as a singer, along with her many personal tragedies.

title: Heartland
description: In this thriller, a homicidal maniac stalks a Midwestern town.

title: Sophisticated Ladies
description: This lavish revue pays tribute to the big-band music of legendary composer Duke Ellington, including "In a Sentimental Mood," "It Don't Mean a Thing (If It Ain't Got That Swing)" and the title tune.

title: The Survivor
description: A group of teenagers smuggles food to the Jewish people living in the Warsaw ghetto of World War II, in Susan Nanus' adaptation of Jack Eisner's memoir about the experience.

title: Bring Back Birdie
description: In this musical sequel to Bye Bye Birdie, it's 20 years after Conrad Birdie left for the Army, and Rose and Albert, now married, have to find him again for an appearance on the Grammy Awards broadcast, while also contending with rebellious children and other calamities.

title: Broadway Follies
description: An international cast recreates acts from the vaudeville era.

title: Lolita
description: A European college professor becomes obsessed with a vulgar American woman's 12-year-old daughter, leading to a cross-country odyssey involving marriage, murder and intrigue in Edward Albee's adaptation of Vladimir Nabokov's novel.

title: Rose
description: A middle-aged British schoolteacher worries over her commitment to her job, her marriage and her political outlook.

title: Woman of the Year
description: A television interviewer and a newspaper cartoonist get in a public battle over their respective professions, fall in love, marry and experience career conflicts.  A musical adaptation of the 1942 film starring Katharine Hepburn and Spencer Tracy.

title: The Father
description: A captain and his wife disagree over how to raise their daughter, with the wife going so far as to insinuate the daughter is not her husband's in order to drive him insane and get her way, in August Strindberg's 1887 indictment of marriage and religion.

title: Fools
description: A schoolteacher struggles to lift the curse of stupidity placed on the citizens of a long-ago Russian village.

title: Aaah Oui Genty!
description: The French marionette company Compaigne Phillipe Genty presents an evening of marionettes, hand puppets and similar figures and effects.

title: Copperfield
description: This musical adaptation of the Charles Dickens novel follows a young boy's growth to manhood in Victorian England, through orphan-hood, stints as a factory worker, and encounters with many eccentric and inspiring characters.

title: Animals
description: An evening of three one-act comedies.  In the first, a Spanish matador seeks to kill a bull in each of the 50 United States.  In the second, an elephant longs to be human.  In the third, a freakish-looking creature becomes a woman.

title: The Floating Light Bulb
description: In Woody Allen's parody of The Glass Menagerie, an unhappy mother nags her shy son to audition his magic tricks for a talent agent.

title: Can-Can
description: The owner of a dance club in 1890s Paris must contend with a judge who wishes to close the club down for its lascivious dancing — but who can't help falling for the owner's charms.

title: The Moony Shapiro Songbook
description: The songs of a fictitious, successful composer-lyricist are performed by a cast of five in this parody of a songwriter revue.

title: Passionate Ladies
description: Barbara Perry wrote and performs an evening of five monologues performed by women related to the performing arts

title: Inacent Black
description: An angel helps with the problems of an upper-middle-class black family in Long Island.

title: The Little Foxes
description: Southern belle Regina Giddens and her brothers scheme to outwit Regina's husband Horace, who opposes their attempts to profit from a cotton factory in partnership with a Chicago businessman, in Lillian Hellman's look at the power of money to destroy lives.

title: I Won't Dance
description: A paraplegic confined to a wheelchair celebrates the recent mysterious murder of his brother and sister-in-law in a diabolic manner.

title: It Had to Be You
description: An aspiring actress and a producer of television commercials have an unusual romance in this comedy, written by and starring real-life married couple Renee Taylor and Joseph Bologna.

title: Lena Horne: The Lady and Her Music
description: Lena Horne sings many of the classic songs of her career and tells stories about her experiences performing in the Cotton Club, in Hollywood and on Broadway.

title: St. Mark's Gospel
description: Alec McCowen gives a one-man performance of the Gospel According to St. Mark.

title: Wally's Cafe
description: A New Jersey married couple opens a café in the California desert and takes on an aspiring actress as their waitress.

title: This Was Burlesque
description: Former striptease artist Ann Corio oversees an evening of "girls and gags" in the tradition of old burlesque — plus a male addition to the traditionally female group of exotic dancers.

title: A Taste of Honey
description: A sensitive working-class English teenager becomes pregnant by a black man, seeking refuge from her tyrannical, promiscuous mother with a gay art student she befriends.

title: Scenes and Revelations
description: Four sisters squabble over what to do with their Lancaster homestead after their parents' deaths.

title: Fiddler on the Roof
description: Tevye, a Jewish milkman in early 1900s Russia, sees his three eldest daughters married, each one moving further from traditional ways, and must cope with the growing anti-Jewish sentiment in his country.

title: The Supporting Cast
description: A famous author's wife invites her friends, who are all related to accomplished celebrities, to honor the release of her tell-all book, which is based on all of them.

title: My Fair Lady
description: An English professor of phonetics makes a bet that he can transform a Cockney flower girl into a lady, in Lerner and Loewe's musical adaptation of George Bernard Shaw's Pygmalion.

title: An Evening with Dave Allen
description: Irish comedian Dave Allen makes his Broadway debut with a provocative evening of comedy dealing with sex, politics, religion and other topics.

title: The Catherine Wheel
description: Twyla Tharp choreographs an evening of dance about the frequent failure of people to communicate, set to music by David Byrne of the Talking Heads.

title: The Life and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby
description: David Edgar dramatizes Charles Dickens' novel as a two-part, eight-and-a-half-hour play, detailing the efforts of young, fatherless Nicholas to provide for his mother and sister, despite the obstacles provided by his distrusting uncle Ralph and Wackford Squeers, the odious schoolmaster who is his initial employer.

title: Marlowe
description: The life of controversial playwright and Shakespeare contemporary Christopher Marlowe is treated as a rock musical, in which Marlowe and Shakespeare are seen competing for the love of the same actress.

title: Candida
description: A minister's wife becomes an object of infatuation for an idealistic young poet, in George Bernard Shaw's comedic look at the changing views on gender and social equality.

title: Einstein and the Polar Bear
description: An advertising artist's car breaks down during a blizzard outside the secluded New England home of a retired novelist. She seeks shelter with him and finds unexpected romance.

title: Crimes of the Heart
description: Three eccentric, disaster-prone Southern sisters come together after one shoots her husband, in Beth Henley's Pulitzer Prize-winning dark comedy.

title: Ned & Jack
description: On the night of his triumphant opening as Hamlet, John Barrymore visits his equally successful friend, playwright Ned Sheldon, to celebrate their friendship and success before their careers begin an inevitable decline.

title: The Dresser
description: A theatrical dresser struggles to prepare his celebrated actor employer to go on for another performance as King Lear in the English provinces.

title: Oh, Brother!
description: A father of two sets of twins — one biological and one adopted from the Middle East — sets out to find one of each pair after they go missing from a hijacked plane in Iraq, in a farcical, musical adaptation of William Shakespeare's The Comedy of Errors.

title: Mass Appeal
description: A beloved Catholic priest who deftly avoids controversial issues encounters a passionate young seminarian who is determined to make such issues part of his preaching.

title: Camelot
description: King Arthur founds the kingdom of Camelot and the Knights of the Round Table, who fight for justice and right, only to see his ideal crumble when his wife Guenevere falls in love with his favorite knight, Sir Lancelot.

title: Merrily We Roll Along
description: The story of how a composer's idealism and friendships were corrupted by success is told backwards, starting with the disillusioned present and ending with their optimistic college years, in Stephen Sondheim and George Furth's musical, which is suggested by the George S. Kaufman-Moss Hart play.

title: The First
description: The story of Jackie Robinson, who became the first African-American to play baseball in the major leagues when he was drafted by the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947, is musicalized by Bob Brush, Martin Charnin and Joel Siegel.

title: The West Side Waltz
description: An aging pianist is rejuvenated by a young aspiring actress who comes to stay at her Upper West Side apartment.

title: Grown Ups
description: Nagging Jewish parents ignore their daughter Marilyn in favor of their successful journalist son Jack — only to see his business and marriage fall apart in the course of a year.

title: Kingdoms
description: Edward Sheehan dramatizes the historical incident in which Napoleon kidnapped Pope Pius VII and held him hostage in France.

title: Duet for One
description: A virtuoso cellist goes to therapy to learn how to face the multiple sclerosis that is derailing her career, in Tom Kempinski's fictionalized dramatization of the real-life story of Jacqueline du Pre.

title: Dreamgirls
description: An opportunistic show business promoter sets the career of a female trio of black singers soaring as 1960s Motown music becomes popular with both white and black audiences, necessitating the overweight lead singer's demotion in favor of a more glamorous singer who had previously sung backup.

title: Little Me
description: In Cy Coleman, Carolyn Leigh and Neil Simon's musical version of Patrick Dennis' satirical novel, a well-endowed but poor girl rises to the top ranks of movie stardom thanks to all the men she encounters, but remains ever in love (as much as she is capable) with the hometown rich kid from the other side of the tracks.

title: The Curse of an Aching Heart
description: A daughter of Irish immigrants in 1920s and 1930s Brooklyn loses her parents, is raised by an uncle who lusts for her, and waits patiently for the neighborhood lothario who turns out to be an alcoholic disappointment, but she still keeps her optimism.

title: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat
description: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice musicalize the Biblical story of a young man whose brothers are jealous of their father's favoritism toward him and the beautiful coat he receives as a gift. They sell him into slavery in Egypt, telling their father he has been murdered, but he ultimately becomes important to the Pharaoh through his ability to interpret dreams.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: Othello
description: Othello, a Moor who has become a general in the Venetian army, sees his happy marriage to the beautiful Desdemona destroyed when his seemingly trustworthy ensign, Iago, suggests to him that she may be unfaithful, in William Shakespeare's tragedy of revenge, jealousy and intrigue.

title: Pump Boys and Dinettes
description: Four gas station attendants trade jokes and songs with two waitresses at a diner off North Carolina Highway 57.

title: Special Occasions
description: A divorced couple frequently runs into each other at special occasions, through new marriages, divorces, and family births and deaths, in Bernard Slade's comedy.

title: The World of Sholom Aleichem
description: An evening inspired by the stories of Sholom Aleichem, whose work was the basis for Fiddler on the Roof, as well as other Russian Jewish folk tales of Aleichem's era.

title: Come Back to the 5 & Dime Jimmy Dean, Jimmy Dean
description: A group of women reunite for a meeting of their James Dean fan club, trading memories and memorabilia of the famous screen star to compensate for their own unhappy lives.

title: Little Johnny Jones
description: An American jockey rides his horse in a London race but is accused of throwing it, until he finds out he was framed by a gambler and clears his name.

title: Eminent Domain
description: A college professor on a Midwestern campus is always demanding in his quest for discovering talent, even as his personal life suffers.

title: Agnes of God
description: A court psychiatrist attempts to unravel the case of a dead baby found in the wastebasket of a young nun who has no memory of the incident. The psychiatrist does battle with a strong-willed Mother Superior who insists the child was immaculately conceived.

title: Solomon's Child
description: A research scientist hires a mysterious man to kidnap his son and rescue him from the cult he has joined.

title: Medea
description: A barbarian sorceress is abandoned by her war-hero husband for a Greek princess, turning to the ultimate murder for revenge in Euripedes' tragedy.

title: "Master Harold"...and the Boys
description: In South Africa during the apartheid era a young white man's relationship with his two older black servants changes as he matures.

title: The Hothouse
description: A paranoid superintendent at a government-run rest home must cope with an annoying aide and a disastrous holiday auction, in Harold Pinter's 1958 absurdist dark comedy.

title: Is There Life After High School?
description: A group of former high school students remember the joy and angst of those years at a reunion.

title: Nine
description: A famous film director is suffering from a creative block — and personal difficulties with his wife, mistress, the actress who serves as his muse, and his female producer — in Maury Yeston, Arthur Kopit and Mario Fratti's musical adaptation of the Federico Fellini film 8 1/2.

title: Beyond Therapy
description: A bisexual lawyer falls for a female writer for People magazine, and they both complain about their situation to their outrageously incompetent therapists.

title: Do Black Patent Leather Shoes Really Reflect Up?
description: This musical centers on a boy's frustrated romance with an overweight girl as they survive Catholic school in 1950s Chicago.

title: The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas
description: Miss Mona, the madam of a beloved Texas whorehouse, finds her business suddenly under attack from a television evangelist and local politicians, with even the local sheriff unable to do much to stop the sudden switch in public opinion.

title: Blues in the Night
description: In this musical revue, a variety of classic and obscure jazz and blues tunes tell the story of three women in love with the same no-good man.

title: Torch Song Trilogy
description: A gay drag performer has a tempestuous relationship with his bisexual, closeted lover. Both attempt other relationships before forming a family with an adopted son — and after the drag queen confronts his disapproving mother — in an evening composed of three one-act plays, with a blues singer singing torch songs as commentary.

title: Cleavage
description: In this musical, a variety of couples, both young and old, pursue love.

title: Play Me a Country Song
description: Twelve friends gather to celebrate Woody's, their favorite road-stop bar in the Rocky Mountains, before it is torn down, in this country and western-flavored musical.

title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
description: When a pioneer farmer meets and marries a townswoman to keep house for himself and his six unruly brothers, the brothers decide to take brides of their own — by kidnapping them — in this stage adaptation of the 1954 film musical.

title: Present Laughter
description: Noel Coward's totally-irresistible and semi-autobiographical comedy follows a self-obsessed actor in the midst of a mid-life crisis. Freely indulging his considerable appetite for wine, women and sleeping late, the theatre’s favorite leading man suddenly finds himself caught between fawning ingénues, crazed playwrights, secret trysts and unexpected twists.

title: Ghosts
description: In Henrik Ibsen's 1881 play, Mrs. Alving plans to dedicate an orphanage to the memory of her late husband, but confesses to Pastor Manders that her supposedly upstanding husband was actually a philanderer. The effects of his indiscretions are still apparent in their disease-afflicted son and the maid he has fallen for.

title: Your Arms Too Short to Box with God
description: The Gospel of St. Matthew is retold as a gospel musical, conceived and written by Vinette Carroll.

title: A Doll's Life
description: In this musical sequel to Henrik Ibsen's play A Doll's House, Nora strikes out on her own after slamming the door on husband Torvald, becoming a successful businesswoman and meeting several men who see her in different ways, before returning home to see if her husband can view her as an equal partner.

title: Edith Stein
description: The life of Edith Stein, a Jewish woman who converted to Roman Catholicism and became a Carmelite nun in Nazi Germany before her death at Auschwitz, is dramatized by Arthur Giron, who adds several meetings between Stein and an SS officer who is infatuated with her.

title: The Queen and the Rebels
description: A group of travelers in an unnamed country are held hostage by revolutionaries looking to capture the country's elusive queen.

title: Cats
description: Based on T.S. Eliot’s book of poems, “Old Possum’s Book of Practical Cats,” Cats immerses the audience in the world of nocturnal “Jellicle Cats.” Eliot’s poems are brought to life as the felines dance and sing about their unique characteristics before gathering for the Jellicle Ball at which one among them is chosen to ascend to the supernatural “Heaviside Layer.”

title: Good
description: A German novelist and university professor must rationalize his decision to join the Nazi Party and participate in its destructive practices and face the effects these choices have on his friendship with a Jewish physician.

title: The Wake of Jamey Foster
description: A Southern family gathers for the wake of a deceased relative with a shady reputation, as unrequited love and class tensions within the extended family bubble anew.

title: Georgia Brown and Friends
description: Georgia Brown traces her career from the cabarets of London to stardom in the West End and on Broadway, most notably as Nancy in Oliver!

title: Rock 'n Roll! The First 5,000 Years
description: The revolutionary songs of rock 'n' roll are sung against multimedia projections, giving a historical context to the tunes and the various eras from which they sprang.

title: Twice Around the Park
description: An evening of two one-acts. In the first, a female cop berates her downstairs actor neighbor for disturbing the peace with his rehearsing, only to find herself caught in his charms. In the second, a middle-aged married couple decides to spice up their sex life.

title: Foxfire
description: An Appalachian widow's country-songwriter son wants her to leave the family homestead, which is also being looked at as development property, and move with him to Florida.

title: 84 Charing Cross Road
description: A television writer with dreams of being a playwright strikes up a correspondence with an English book dealer from whom she orders classic literature secondhand, in James Roose-Evans' adaptation of Helene Hanff's memoir.

title: Herman Van Veen: All of Him
description: Dutch musical theatre performer Herman Van Veen sings, dances, tells jokes, and mimes in this one-man show.

title: Steaming
description: Six women discuss a variety of topics, sex most notable among them, in a Turkish bath.

title: Monday After the Miracle
description: In William Gibson's sequel to The Miracle Worker, Helen Keller has started a successful writing career with the help of her teacher, Anne Sullivan, but she must struggle to adjust to Sullivan's marriage to John Macy and her own emerging sexuality.

title: A Little Family Business
description: A Boston wife takes over her husband's carpet-manufacturing business when he suffers a heart seizure, leading to farcical complications with the business and the couple's murky history of extramarital affairs.

title: Almost an Eagle
description: A Boy Scout troop meets in a dingy church basement in Iowa to prepare for their curmudgeonly scoutmaster's Memorial Day flag-bearing ritual.

title: Alice in Wonderland
description: Eva Le Gallienne's production, from a script she co-adapted, contains elements of Lewis Carroll's novel Alice in Wonderland, in which a young English girl travels down the rabbit hole into a magical dreamland, as well as the book's sequel, Through the Looking Glass.

title: Whodunnit
description: Six strangers gather for a black-tie dinner at an English estate on a stormy night, with all of them having a reason to kill a particularly unctuous member of the party, in Anthony Shaffer's spoof of Agatha Christie mystery novels.

title: Plenty
description: An English woman who served as a spy for the French Resistance during World War II sees her youthful ideals about the war's effect on Britain destroyed in the decades after, as her marriage and sanity also deteriorate.

title: Angels Fall
description: Two couples — a disillusioned former college professor and the student who married him and takes care of him, and a wealthy widow and her tennis-player lover — come to a New Mexico mission to seek spiritual counseling from a priest and his Native American assistant.

title: The Misanthrope
description: In Moliere's 1666 satire of social hypocrisy, a Paris aristocrat detests the shallow artifice of his peers but falls for a flirtatious girl who gleefully exhibits all the social traits he hates.

title: A View from the Bridge
description: Eddie Carbone, a Brooklyn laborer, holds family and honor above all else. He and his wife have raised a niece as their own. But his possessive love of his niece drives him to actions that betray his family and his ideals.

title: Merlin
description: Merlin, the magician and protector of royal heir Arthur, must battle an evil queen who wants to put her own son on the English throne.

title: Moose Murders
description: The owners and a group of guests at a hunting lodge in the Adirondacks discover that a murderer is among them.

title: On Your Toes
description: A former vaudevillian, now working as a music professor, convinces the Russian Ballet director to stage his student's jazz ballet, ultimately performing the lead in the ballet and arousing the jealousy of the prima ballerina's boyfriend — as well as the disappointment of the female music student who loves him.

title: Slab Boys
description: A group of boys who mix paints at a Scottish carpet factory pull secret pranks to escape the reality of their drab existence and to express defiance against their superiors.

title: Marcel Marceau on Broadway
description: Renowned French mime Marcel Marceau performs new and classic sketches on Broadway.

title: Aznavour
description: Legendary French singer-songwriter Charles Aznavour performs many of his classic songs, including "Yesterday When I Was Young," in concert.

title: Brighton Beach Memoirs
description: Neil Simon's semi-autobiographical comedy follows Depression-era teenager Eugene Jerome as he pursues his dreams of becoming a successful comedy writer and deals with the conflicts of his squabbling family.

title: K2
description: Two Americans, a district attorney and a nuclear physicist, face a broken leg, avalanches, and other catastrophes while attempting to climb the second highest mountain in the world in Pakistan.

title: 'night, Mother
description: In Marsha Norman's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, a daughter announces to her mother that she will kill herself at the end of the evening, leading to an uneasy completion of routine tasks and a series of hopelessly ineffectual pleadings and confrontations.

title: You Can't Take It With You
description: An eccentric family allows each member to pursue his own ambition in the home, but their routine is disrupted when a daughter with a regular job wants to bring her fiancé and his Wall Street family to dinner in George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart's Pulitzer Prize-winning comedy.

title: The Man Who Had Three Arms
description: A man known as Himself relays how a sudden growth of an extra arm made him famous — and how that fame disappeared as soon as the arm did.

title: Teaneck Tanzi: The Venus Flytrap
description: A woman settles disputes in her family through wrestling matches, ultimately challenging her pro-wrestler husband to some time on the mat as she demands that he take her more seriously.

title: Show Boat
description: Jerome Kern and Oscar Hammerstein II's groundbreaking musical version of Edna Ferber's novel examines the lives of Cap'n Andy and his troupe of traveling show boat performers, including his naïve daughter Magnolia, her gambling husband Gaylord Ravenal, the tragic mixed-race actress Julie, and black stevedore Joe, who marvels at the constancy of the "Ol' Man River" they travel on.

title: Total Abandon
description: A father distraught over the failure of his marriage becomes violently abusive to his two-year-old son.

title: My One and Only
description: In 1927, aviator Billy Buck Chandler falls for English swimmer Edythe Herbert, yearns to become the first American to make a nonstop trans-Atlantic flight to Paris, and sings and dances to classic George and Ira Gershwin tunes.

title: Parade of Stars Playing the Palace
description: Stars of today pay tribute to the stars of yesteryear who played the Palace Theatre in its days as a vaudeville house in the early 20th century, in this benefit concert that celebrated the theatre's 70th anniversary.

title: The Ritz
description: A conservative Cleveland businessman is on the run to escape his murderous mafioso brother-in-law. In his desperation, he seeks refuge in an uproarious gay bathhouse packed with kooky characters and a chain of mistaken identities.

title: The Caine Mutiny Court-Martial
description: A Marine executive officer who seized command of the destroyer Caine during a typhoon is put on trial in Herman Wouk's adaptation of his novel The Caine Mutiny.

title: Private Lives
description: Divorcees Elyot and Amanda unexpectedly meet while honeymooning with their respective new spouses and discover that their passion for — and irritation with — each other is just as strong as ever.

title: The Flying Karamazov Brothers
description: The popular juggling act presents an evening of juggling, comedy and music.

title: Dance a Little Closer
description: An American entertainer performing at a luxury hotel in the Austrian Alps encounters an old American flame, now posing as a British lady and in a relationship with a foreign diplomat, as the NATO-Soviet conflict moves toward World War III, in Charles Strouse and Alan Jay Lerner's musical adaptation of Robert E. Sherwood's play Idiot's Delight.

title: Passion
description: When adultery threatens the carefully structured stability of a marriage, the husband and wife each begin to talk with an alter ego about their dilemmas.

title: The Guys in the Truck
description: A director of live football games for television is unmatched in his command of his crew during the game, but must contend with their rambunctiousness — and his own personal disappointments and dilemmas — when the cameras aren't rolling.

title: Mame
description: Roaring Twenties socialite Mame Dennis teaches her orphaned nephew the nature of free living and free thinking, attempting to keep him from the clutches of the uptight world of his late father's estate executor and, later, his fiancée.

title: La Cage aux Folles
description: Jerry Herman's musical, based on the French play of the same name, is the story of a flamboyant gay couple who must pretend to be straight for one night — with one of the men in drag — to dupe the conservative political family of their son's fiancee.

title: The Corn Is Green
description: A Welsh schoolteacher fights to nurture the writing talent in a local miner.

title: Edmund Kean
description: Edmund Kean, the great Shakespearean actor of Victorian England, recalls his arduous rise to glory, his megalomaniacal hold on that glory, and his personal tragedies, while performing some of the great Shakespeare soliloquies on which he made his name.

title: Zorba
description: Zorba the Greek teaches his life-embracing philosophy to a more uptight young student who has inherited a mine in Crete. Zorba maintains his joy in living despite several tragedies, in John Kander, Fred Ebb and Joseph Stein's musical adaptation of Nikos Kazantzakis' novel Zorba the Greek and its 1964 film.

title: American Buffalo
description: After underselling a valuable nickel to a customer, junk shop owner Don and a team of third-rate crooks plot to seek revenge by stealing the customer's coin collection.

title: Brothers
description: A widowed shipyard owner must oversee his four squabbling sons, particularly one who is reluctant to donate his kidney to the brother who desperately needs it.

title: Amen Corner
description: A Harlem pastor must deal with a rebellious congregation, a son who has lost his faith, and the return of her long-estranged husband who is ready to die, in this musical adaptation of James Baldwin's play.

title: La Tragedie de Carmen
description: Georges Bizet's opera Carmen, in which the soldier Don Jose is destroyed by his love for the beautiful gypsy temptress Carmen, is presented in an 80-minute, theatricalized adaptation that contains additional elements from the Prosper Merimee novella that inspired the opera.

title: Marilyn
description: The life of silver-screen sex symbol Marilyn Monroe is examined in this musical, which features running commentary by a trio called Destiny.

title: Doonesbury
description: Garry Trudeau wrote the book and lyrics for this adaptation of his political-satire comic strip, with Elizabeth Swados composing the music. A group of college seniors live together on a college commune in New England, dealing with romance and looking forward to getting rich in 1980s America.

title: The Glass Menagerie
description: Tennessee Williams’s autobiographical “memory play” looks at the WIngfield family—frustrated writer Tom, his nagging mother, Amanda, who is often lost in memories of her Southern-belle past, and his painfully shy sister, Laura—and the effect a visit from a “gentleman caller” for Laura has on all their lives.

title: Baby
description: Three couples of varying ages deal with impending parenthood in David Shire, Richard Maltby, Jr. and Sybille Pearson's musical.

title: Heartbreak House
description: On the eve of World War I, unlikely romantic encounters occur during a most unusual country weekend.

title: Noises Off
description: In Act I of Michael Frayn's farce, a second-rate company of British actors is rehearsing a touring company of a terrible sex farce. Act II reveals the backstage chaos that takes place during a performance, and Act III follows the onstage performance in which everything goes wrong.

title: Peg
description: Peggy Lee sings many of her classic songs, including "Is That All There Is?" and "Fever," as well as several new tunes that tell the story of her life.

title: The Tap Dance Kid
description: A young boy from an upper-middle-class black family nurses a dream to become a tap dancer, with the encouragement of his uncle and despite the disapproval of his father.

title: The Real Thing
description: Playwright Henry and actress Annie fall in love while cheating on their spouses, then marry and cheat on each other, unable to let his intense intellect and her intense emotions keep them from appreciating their love.

title: Ian McKellen: Acting Shakespeare
description: Ian McKellen explores his personal connection to the works of Shakespeare and demonstrates how actors in general relate to the Bard's characters by performing soliloquies from the classic plays.

title: Open Admissions
description: A black college student challenges the system that is allowing him admittance but not doing much beyond that to better his prospects — and the white teacher who is sympathetic but unwilling to help begins to question the system's effect on her.

title: The Rink
description: An Italian housewife who runs a roller-skating rink on the Eastern seaboard prepares to abandon it until her estranged daughter returns after a long absence, hoping to save the rink and patch things up with her mother.

title: Awake and Sing!
description: The battle lines for a lower-middle-class Jewish family in the Depression-era Bronx are drawn between the string-pulling parents who think they know best and their resistant offspring who have hatched their own dreams of the future.

title: Glengarry Glen Ross
description: A group of Chicago real-estate salesman battle ruthlessly for the big deal in David Mamet's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Death of a Salesman
description: Salesman Willy Loman finds his career crumbling and his relationships with his wife and sons severely tested in Arthur Miller's dream-like meditation on the cost of the American dream.

title: The Human Comedy
description: A small-town American family struggles to survive World War II in this musical adaptation of William Saroyan's novel, as young Homer comes of age and his brother, Marcus, fights in the war and inspires his orphaned fellow soldiers with tales of his girlfriend and family.

title: The Golden Age
description: A young writer and college professor contacts an Upper West Side matron about her connections to great figures of the past. The woman moves him into her apartment, hoping he will fall for her shy granddaughter.

title: Shirley MacLaine on Broadway
description: Shirley MacLaine recounts her show business life and journey, from the Broadway chorus of The Pajama Game to Academy Award-winning film stardom, while singing, dancing, and performing monologues from several of her films.

title: Beethoven's Tenth
description: The ghost of legendary composer Ludwig von Beethoven is summoned to counsel a contemporary London music critic who is holding back the singing career of his wife and the composing career of his son.

title: Play Memory
description: Jean recalls her Canadian salesman father's years of success, the years of failure accompanied by alcoholism and abuse, and the scars they left behind, in Joanna M. Glass's memory play.

title: Oliver!
description: Orphaned Oliver Twist goes from mistreatment in the London workhouses to falling in with a gang of pickpockets led by the roguish Fagin, the kindhearted Nancy, and the menacing Bill Sykes, before finally finding a home, in Lionel Bart's musical adaptation of the Charles Dickens novel.

title: A Moon for the Misbegotten
description: Set in a dilapidated Connecticut farmhouse in 1923, this American classic centers on Josie, a towering Irish woman with a quick tongue and a ruined reputation; her conniving father, Phil Hogan; and Jim Tyrone, Hogan's landlord and drinking companion, a cynical alcoholic haunted by the death of his mother.

title: Sunday in the Park with George
description: This Pulitzer Prize-winning musical follows painter Georges Seurat in the months leading up to the completion of his most famous painting, A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte. Consumed by his need to “finish the hat,” Seurat alienates the French bourgeoisie, spurns his fellow artists, and neglects his lover Dot, not realizing that his actions will reverberate over the next 100 years.

title: A Woman of Independent Means
description: A wealthy Texas matron reads letters from a life spanning much of the 20th century that includes two marriages, children, and acquiring (and almost losing) a sizable fortune against an ever-changing background of world events.

title: End of the World
description: A mysterious man offers a playwright unlimited wealth if he will write a play about the nuclear crisis.

title: The Babe
description: George Herman "Babe" Ruth is seen at the height of his baseball career, at his retirement and at a reunion game shortly before his death in 1948, in Bob Acosta and Ann Acosta's one-person play.

title: The Wiz
description: Kansas farm girl Dorothy is transported in a tornado to the magical land of Oz in this musical retelling of The Wizard of Oz that features an all-black cast, a score by Charlie Smalls and a book with an updated urban sensibility by William F. Brown.

title: Design for Living
description: Artists Gilda, Otto and Leo rotate partners while on an excursion through Europe in Noel Coward's scandalous "ménage à trois" dark comedy.

title: Oedipus Rex
description: The people of Thebes ask their king, Oedipus, for help in saving their kingdom from plague, leading Oedipus to discover a shocking secret from his past, in Sophocles' Greek tragedy.

title: Hurlyburly
description: Two Hollywood casting directors, their actor and screenwriter friends, and their various girlfriends and hangers-on engage in cocaine-fueled, misogynistic mind games in David Rabe's black satire of Tinseltown corruption.

title: Patti LaBelle on Broadway
description: Patti LaBelle, with backup vocalists The Sweeties, performs in concert on Broadway as part of her "Look to the Rainbow" tour.

title: Quilters
description: A pioneer woman and her daughters record the family's hardships and joys in the exquisite quilts they make by hand, each quilt "block" commemorating an event in their lives.

title: Kipling
description: Rudyard Kipling, the author of The Jungle Book, the "Just So" stories, the poem "If," and other classics, recalls his life and reads from his work in Brian Clark's one-man play.

title: Ma Rainey's Black Bottom
description: Legendary blues musician "Ma" Rainey, an ambitious trumpeter who hopes she will perform his arrangement of her signature tune, and the rest of her band and hangers-on make their music and deal with the harsh reality of their business and lives in 1927 Chicago.

title: Much Ado About Nothing
description: The anti-romantic wits Beatrice and Benedick, who profess to hate each other, are forced by their friends' trickery to admit their true feelings as they help to save the wedding of his fellow soldier Claudio and her cousin Hero.

title: Cyrano de Bergerac
description: Cyrano is a poet, philosopher and swordsman of incredible wit, but his sizable nose renders him too shy to pursue the beautiful Roxane. Instead, he provides the poetry and eloquence to woo her vicariously through his inarticulate friend Christian.

title: Alone Together
description: A middle-aged couple happily welcomes the prospect of an empty nest — until their grown children, disappointed with their lives so far, return home.

title: Whoopi Goldberg
description: Whoopi Goldberg presents an evening of comic monologues spoken by various characters, from a nine-year-old girl to an elderly man, from a "dope fiend" to a valley girl.

title: The Three Musketeers
description: The young d'Artagnan becomes a Musketeer of the Guard of Louis XIII, joining Athos, Porthos and Aramis. They fight to recover Queen Anne's brooch, which has been stolen by Cardinal Richelieu as a form of blackmail, in the Rudolf Friml operetta based on the Alexandre Dumas novel.

title: Accidental Death of an Anarchist
description: In Dario Fo's political farce, inspired by a true incident, an imposter labeled the Fool impersonates a judge who has multiple guilty defendants on his hands, causing constant chaos in a police station.

title: André De Shields' Haarlem Nocturne
description: This musical revue pays homage to the nightclubs of Harlem's golden age. Conceived, cowritten and codirected by star André De Shields.

title: Doug Henning & His World of Magic
description: Veteran magician Doug Henning performs a new act with many assistants, both human and animal, including children from the audience.

title: Home Front
description: A disillusioned Vietnam veteran returns to his Texas home after the war, unable to forgive his parents for not letting him dodge the draft and unwilling to forget what he suffered in combat.

title: Dancing in the End Zone
description: A Midwestern college student and football hero is forced to question the value of his chosen sport by his radical tutor.

title: The King and I
description: Welsh schoolteacher Anna Leonowens travels from England to Siam to serve as governess to the king's many children. Their clash of wills and the lessons they learn from each other are examined in this Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, based on Leonowens's account of her experiences.

title: Harrigan 'n Hart
description: The musicalized story of Edward Harrigan and Tony Hart, who made a memorable and pioneering musical-comedy team in the 1800s but were torn apart by Harrigan's hateful wife and her distrust of Hart's possible homosexual feelings for her husband.

title: Pack of Lies
description: A suburban housewife in 1960 England discovers that her best friends and neighbors are Soviet spies, and her home has become a secret surveillance post for the British government officials out to trap them.

title: Strange Interlude
description: A professor's daughter, haunted by the loss of her fiancé in World War I, embarks on a series of affairs and a placid marriage, becoming a mother under murky circumstances and ignoring the novelist who truly loves her. She and other characters in Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize-winning play communicate their private thoughts to the audience.

title: The Octette Bridge Club
description: Eight sisters are photographed at their annual twice-monthly meal and bridge club, although the idyllic scene is soon replaced with deeper troubles, petty betrayals and illnesses.

title: The Loves of Anatol
description: The Viennese lothario Anatol sees himself as a merry seducer of women whom he then calculatedly abandons, little realizing that the women are getting the better of him by ending their relationships with him first.

title: Requiem for a Heavyweight
description: An aging boxer heads tragically toward decline, in this stage adaptation of the Rod Serling television film and motion picture.

title: A Day in the Death of Joe Egg
description: A married couple struggle to deal with their disabled daughter, inventing conversations, characteristics and a full imaginary life for her as their own marriage falls apart.

title: Biloxi Blues
description: In the second installment of Neil Simon's autobiographical Brighton Beach trilogy, Eugene Jerome (a fictionalized version of Simon) goes into basic training to serve in World War II, finding romance and developing his writing talents by observing the diverse group of men he serves with — and the strange sergeant he serves under.

title: Leader of the Pack
description: Ellie Greenwich and her husband Jeff Barry collaborate on several hit pop tunes in the 1960s, including "Chapel of Love," "Da Doo Ron Ron," and the title tune of this musical biography that features an appearance by the real-life Greenwich.

title: Take Me Along
description: In Bob Merrill, Joseph Stein and Robert Russell's musical version of Eugene O'Neill's Ah, Wilderness!, Richard Miller comes of age while attempting to woo Muriel Macomber, while his drink-loving Uncle Sid attempts to reform his ways to win Richard's aunt Lilly.

title: Grind
description: In a Depression-era burlesque theatre, a black comic attempts to build a relationship with a stripper, an Irish ex-terrorist haunted by his past takes a job as a stooge for a blind comic, and everyone must confront their own hardships and the racism that divides the company.

title: Big River
description: In Roger Miller and William Hauptman's musical adaptation of Mark Twain's The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, rebellious teenager Huck takes off on a raft with runaway slave Jim, encountering conmen, an orphaned family and bigotry along the way.

title: Aren't We All?
description: English nobility seek out marriage proposals — and proof of extramarital philandering — at a stately country club.

title: As Is
description: A gay man finds comfort and support in an old lover when he contracts the AIDS virus, in William M. Hoffman's play, one of the first that dealt directly with the AIDS crisis.

title: Doubles
description: Four middle-aged men, three Jewish and one Gentile, meet regularly for a game of doubles tennis and to discuss their failing marriages, personal crises and growing older.

title: Arms and the Man
description: During the Serbio-Bulgarian War of 1885, a Bulgarian woman who is engaged to a hero of the war encounters a Serbian captain who is retreating from the war because he despises it. He teaches her to see beyond the romantic ideals of war, in George Bernard Shaw's 1894 play.

title: The Odd Couple
description: Two suddenly single pals — a sloppy sportswriter and a fastidious news writer — strain their friendship by turning roommates and unconsciously repeating the same mistakes they made in the marriages they just left.

title: Singin' in the Rain
