description: A 1920s silent-screen romantic duo prepares for the arrival of motion-picture sound, and the leading man falls for the girl called in to dub over the screechy voice of his onscreen partner, in this adaptation of the 1952 film musical.

title: Song and Dance
description: In the first act of this Andrew Lloyd Webber-Don Black-Richard Maltby, Jr. musical, Emma, an aspiring English hat designer, moves to New York and experiences four affairs in a one-woman song cycle. In the second act, one of her boyfriends, a Nebraskan computer salesman named Joe, experiences New York through dance.

title: The Search for Signs of Intelligent Life in the Universe
description: Lily Tomlin plays multiple roles in Jane Wagner's one-woman play, a comedic look at and critique of contemporary American society.

title: The Iceman Cometh
description: Set in the summer of 1912 at Harry Hope's saloon on New York's lower west side, this is O'Neill's classic story of a freespending, boisterous salesman who compels his fellow barflies to confront their pipe dreams.

title: Tango Argentino
description: A century of the tango is celebrated in an evening of music and dance performed by 30 of Argentina's finest.

title: The Marriage of Figaro
description: A Count's valet prepares to marry the Countess's chambermaid — until it becomes clear the Count wishes to revive an old law that will allow him to take advantage of the bride before the wedding. The valet's schemes to thwart the Count show the growing French endorsement of an aristocracy of merit and wits rather than birth, in Pierre Beaumarchais's 1784 play.

title: Mayor
description: The story of New York mayor Ed Koch, including his dilemma over the proposed redevelopment of Times Square in the 1980s, is musicalized from his own memoirs, with songs by Charles Strouse and a book by Warren Leight.

title: The News
description: The editor of a big-city tabloid newspaper doggedly pursues the story of a serial killer on the loose, unaware that his daughter is arranging a date with the murderer through the paper's personals column.

title: I'm Not Rappaport
description: A lifelong radical and world-class kibitzer, retiree Nat Moyer spends his afternoons spinning outrageous yarns that both intrigue and infuriate fellow octogenarian Midge Carter, the half-blind building superintendent with whom Nat shares his Central Park bench.

title: The Boys of Winter
description: Seven marines preparing for a mission in Vietnam debate the causes and justifications of the war.

title: The Mystery of Edwin Drood
description: In the musical adaptation of Charles Dickens's last, unfinished novel, the audience gets to decide who murdered the mysterious orphan Edwin Drood, with the musical presented in the style of a Victorian music hall, with a master of ceremonies, a woman playing Drood and other conventions of the period.

title: Blood Knot
description: Two half-brothers, one of whom appears black and one of whom appears white, live together in a shack outside South Africa's Port Elizabeth, enacting daily routines and games that reveal their dangerous codependence.

title: Hay Fever
description: Members of a theatrical family each invite a guest for a weekend on their country estate, leading to many complications and clashes between the culture of the theatre and the culture of the rest of the world.

title: Jerry's Girls
description: A group of female performers pay tribute to the song catalogue of Jerry Herman, with tunes from Hello, Dolly!, Mame, La Cage aux Folles, Mack and Mabel and more.

title: Wind in the Willows
description: The adventures of the animals in the classic Kenneth Grahame children's book, including the reckless Toad, the egotistical Rat and the shy, bookish Mole, are musicalized by Jane Iredale, William Perry and Roger McGough.

title: The Robert Klein Show!
description: Comedian Robert Klein satirizes American culture, advertising and his perceptions of anti-Semitism.

title: Benefactors
description: An architect's decision to build a development in a slum in South London is mocked by his journalist friend, as both men and their wives look at the state of their ideals and their marriages.

title: Corpse!
description: A struggling actor schemes to murder his wealthy twin brother in Gerald Moon's comedy thriller.

title: Lillian
description: The celebrated playwright Lillian Hellman recalls her tempestuous and controversial life in the waiting room of the hospital where her longtime lover, the writer Dashiell Hammett, is dying.

title: Jerome Kern Goes to Hollywood
description: Four performers sing a selection of Jerome Kern songs that appeared in Hollywood films.

title: Uptown...It's Hot!
description: The history of 20th-century African-American pop music, from jazz to Motown to rap, is showcased in this musical revue.

title: The Caretaker
description: A vagabond enters and changes the lives of two brothers who live together in a cluttered London apartment, in this early work from Harold Pinter.

title: Patti LaBelle
description: Patti LaBelle returns to Broadway for a concert of pop, gospel and Philadelphia soul.

title: Execution of Justice
description: Emily Mann's play examines the 1978 trial of Dan White, a member of the San Francisco Board of Supervisors who murdered Harvey Milk, a fellow supervisor who was openly gay, and the city's mayor, George Moscone.

title: Peter, Paul & Mary "From Bleecker to Broadway"
description: The folk trio Peter, Paul and Mary celebrate 25 years in show business with a benefit concert.

title: Precious Sons
description: A young, budding actor is offered a part in a touring company of A Streetcar Named Desire — and the chance to escape the crumbling marriage of his overworked father and nagging mother — in George Furth's family drama.

title: The Temptations / The Four Tops
description: The legendary Motown singing groups The Temptations and The Four Tops perform a concert of their greatest hits.

title: The Flying Karamazov Brothers "Juggling and Cheap Theatrics"
description: The popular performers juggle objects of all kinds, many of which are brought onstage from volunteers in the audience.

title: Loot
description: In this British farce, a teenager and his friend rob a bank and hide the loot in the teen's mother's coffin, but the arrival of an inspector sends their hapless plans into chaos.

title: So Long on Lonely Street
description: Family members gather at the fading family home in Atlanta for the funeral of Aunt Pearl and the reading of her will.

title: Big Deal
description: A failed boxer joins a group of small-time criminals who plan to rob a Chicago apartment, in this Depression-era musical featuring a score of the era's standards with book, direction and choreography by Bob Fosse.

title: Social Security
description: An art gallery owner and her husband are thrown into a panic when her mother intimates that she may be living with them for an extended period.

title: The Petition
description: A retired British general's wife joins a public protest against nuclear armaments, prompting them to examine the divisions in their politics and in their married life.

title: Sweet Charity
description: A New York taxi dancer is open-hearted but unlucky in love, until she meets a strait-laced claustrophobe and nurses him through an elevator jam, in this musical adaptation of the Federico Fellini film The Nights of Cabiria.

title: Long Day's Journey Into Night
description: The Tyrone family — the miserly actor father, the grasping mother addicted to morphine, the alcoholic older son and the tubercular younger son — come to grips with their twisted love for one another in Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning play.

title: The House of Blue Leaves
description: On the day in 1965 that the Pope visits New York and masses of people line the streets in adulation, Artie, a zookeeper living in Sunnyside, Queens, thinks its time for his life to be blessed, too. He desperately wants to escape his lower middle-class existence and become a popular singer and songwriter, but his life is complicated by an ambitious mistress, a crazy wife and a bomb-making son.

title: The Boys in Autumn
description: Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn reunite in 1920s Hannibal, years after their boyish adventures, hashing over the good old days and revealing surprising secrets.

title: Mummenschanz: "The New Show"
description: The Swiss mime trio Mummenschanz performs a show dealing with light, darkness and objects attempting to replace a person's "missing" head.

title: Robert Klein on Broadway
description: Robert Klein performs an evening of standup comedy on Broadway, including autobiographical material, observations on American culture, and his signature song-and-dance routine, "I Can't Stop My Leg."

title: Arsenic and Old Lace
description: A drama critic must deal with his eccentric family, including two sweet aunts who cheerfully poison elderly men with elderberry wine.

title: Shirley Bassey
description: Shirley Bassey performs in concert.

title: Cuba and His Teddy Bear
description: A good-hearted Cuban drug dealer on the Lower East Side must deal with his rebellious teenage son.

title: Honky Tonk Nights
description: A black vaudeville troupe moves from Hell's Kitchen to Harlem, with its star duo getting some additional opportunities from white show business that require personal compromise and threaten to tear them apart.

title: Me and My Girl
description: Unsophisticated Cockney Bill Snibson finds out he is the long-lost Earl of Hereford, and must choose between fitting in with proper society or losing his girl, fishmonger's assistant Sally Smith.

title: Rags
description: In this musical by Charles Strouse, Stephen Schwartz and Joseph Stein, Jewish immigrants in 1910 discover that America does not deliver what they thought it promised even as they find romance, fight for labor equality, and experience disappointment and tragedy.

title: The Life and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby
description: David Edgar dramatizes Charles Dickens' novel as a two-part, eight-and-a-half-hour play, detailing the efforts of young, fatherless Nicholas to provide for his mother and sister, despite the obstacles provided by his distrusting uncle Ralph and Wackford Squeers, the odious schoolmaster who is his initial employer.

title: You Never Can Tell
description: The children of a suffragette, who don't know their father, scheme to find and invite him to lunch, while the modern-thinking daughter is courted by a 19th-century-style ladies' man.

title: Rowan Atkinson at the Atkinson
description: British comedian Rowan Atkinson performs an evening of sketch comedy with a focus on scatological humor.

title: Raggedy Ann
description: A sick child's doll comes to life and brings her through a nightmarish fantasy world to the Doll Doctor to help her get well.

title: Flamenco Puro
description: A group of Spanish gypsies perform the flamenco songs and dances of their heritage.

title: Costello Sings Again
description: Elvis Costello plays five concerts on Broadway, three with his British band The Attractions and two with the British band The Confederates, along with special guests.

title: Into the Light
description: An American physicist becomes obsessed with an expedition to determine whether the Shroud of Turin, said to contain an imprint of Christ's face, is real or fake.

title: A Little Like Magic
description: The Canadian puppeteer troupe Famous People Players manipulate puppet versions of well-known figures, using disembodied human limbs and special effects.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: As You Like It
description: Rosalind, banished from her father's kingdom by her usurping uncle, disguises herself as a boy while falling for one, the similarly exiled duke Orlando.

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Teenagers Romeo and Juliet fall for each other despite their warring families in Verona. Their passionate romance leads to tragedy in William Shakespeare's tale of forbidden love.

title: Oh Coward!
description: Roderick Cook conceives, directs and stars in this revue of songs, dramatic scenes and other excerpts from the writings of Noël Coward.

title: The Front Page
description: A managing editor of a Chicago newspaper fights to keep his star reporter on the story of a condemned anarchist's jailbreak, when the reporter is ready to quit and get married.

title: Smile
description: An innocent beauty contestant and her savvy roommate witness the treachery and favoritism that goes on behind the scenes at the average American beauty pageant, in the musical adaptation of the 1975 film by Marvin Hamlisch and Howard Ashman.

title: Broadway Bound
description: In the third and last play of Neil Simon's Brighton Beach trilogy, Eugene Jerome (based on Simon) and his brother deal with their parents' crumbling marriage as they start careers as comedy writers.

title: Wild Honey
description: A provincial Russian schoolteacher struggles to remain faithful to his wife, despite the attentions of three other women, in Michael Frayn's adaptation of Anton Chekhov's first known play.

title: Jackie Mason's The World According to Me!
description: Jackie Mason brings an evening of Jewish-themed, politically barbed standup to Broadway.

title: Smokey Robinson Plus Jean Carne
description: Motown legend Smokey Robinson performs in concert with jazz-pop singer Jean Carne.

title: Sweet Sue
description: A WASP-y married woman debates with her alter ego over her attraction to her son's college roommate.

title: Stepping Out
description: A group of amateur dancers meet once a week and squabble through rehearsals for their big performance at a charity pageant.

title: Stardust
description: Six performers sing songs with lyrics by Mitchell Parrish, including "Sweet Lorraine," "Sophisticated Lady," "Stardust" and many other classic standards.

title: Death and the King's Horseman
description: A Nigerian chief prepares to commit suicide as a ritual means of joining his predecessor in the next world — until a British commanding officer intervenes with the argument that this act violates his country's code of conduct.

title: Coastal Disturbances
description: A photographer romancing a lifeguard, two former college roommates and an older married couple vacation on a private New England beach and confront the possibilities of their lives ahead.

title: Les Misérables
description: Relentless policeman Javert pursues escaped convict Jean Valjean over decades through the tumult of revolutionary France. Valjean becomes a mayor, agrees to raise the daughter of dying prostitute and joins the fight for freedom. Based on Victor Hugo's epic novel.

title: Starlight Express
description: Little steam engine Rusty enters a cross-country race against the flashier trains Greaseball and Electra, hoping to impress pretty sidecar Pearl, in this musical look at a fantasy train world from Andrew Lloyd Webber and Richard Stilgoe.

title: The Nerd
description: Willum’s birthday party is about to get a jolt of excitement. Rick Steadman, a fellow ex-soldier who had saved Willum’s life in Vietnam, but who he actually never met, has decided to pop by for a visit. Delighted at first, Willum’s enthusiasm wanes when he finds out that Rick is not only socially inept, but also never plans to leave! Desperate to get him out of the house, Willum must hatch an outrageous plan to rid his life of this wacky GI who came to dinner!

title: Fences
description: Troy Maxson, a former baseball player in the Negro Leagues now reduced to collecting trash, must deal with his headstrong football-player son and his wife, who reevaluates their marriage when Troy comes home with the baby he fathered with another woman.

title: Blithe Spirit
description: Researching material for a new novel, Charles engages Madame Arcati, a spiritual medium of uncertain talent, to conduct a séance in his home. Quite by accident, she summons the spirit of Charles's first wife and cannot make the disruptive spirit go away.

title: The Mikado
description: The son of the Mikado of Japan disguises himself as a wandering minstrel to woo the fair Yum-Yum, who is scheduled to marry the Lord High Executioner, in Gilbert and Sullivan's satirical operetta.

title: Safe Sex
description: A gay man nurses his lover through AIDS and must meet the lover's wife and son after he dies.

title: The Musical Comedy Murders of 1940
description: A backers' audition for a new musical on a suburban estate turns deadly, with plenty of confusing murders and knotty plots to unravel, in John Bishop's comedic thriller.

title: The Regard of Flight
description: Creator Bill Irwin stars in an evening of physical comedy in the vaudeville tradition, featuring costars M.C. O'Connor and Doug Skinner.

title: Barbara Cook: A Concert for the Theatre
description: Barbara Cook returns to Broadway for an evening of classic and contemporary songs from the musical theatre and the Great American Songbook, along with some backstage anecdotes.

title: A Month of Sundays
description: A crotchety senior citizen faces his old age and lingering family problems in a Westchester retirement home.

title: All My Sons
description: In the years following World War II, the Keller family continues to hope for their MIA son Larry to turn up alive. Amidst accusations of war crimes and the impending reality that Larry will never return, the Kellers confront a host of family secrets.

title: Asinamali!
description: Five prisoners in a South African jail recount the circumstances that led to their imprisonment through dialogue, song and dance.

title: Pygmalion
description: In George Bernard Shaw's play, based on a classical myth, a blustering phonetics professor bets that he can turn a Cockney flower girl into a passable society lady in three months.

title: Les Liaisons Dangereuses
description: Former lovers, La Marquise de Merteuil and Le Vicomte de Valmont compete in games of seduction and revenge. These merciless aristocrats toy with the hearts and reputations of innocents. Merteuil incites Valmont to corrupt the convent-educated Cecile de Volanges before her wedding night but Valmont has other designs. His target is the peerlessly virtuous and happily married Madame de Tourvel.

title: Sleight of Hand
description: A magician develops a new trick that proves dangerous in Jon Pielmeier's suspense thriller.

title: The Comedy of Errors
description: A well-born man from ancient Syracuse and his slave search for their long-lost brothers in Ephesus, causing confusion with their various spouses and love interests along the way, in William Shakespeare's farce.

title: Broadway
description: The main hoofer at the Paradise Club competes with a gangster for the hand of a pretty new dancer.

title: Dreamgirls
description: An opportunistic show business promoter sets the career of a female trio of black singers soaring as 1960s Motown music becomes popular with both white and black audiences, necessitating the overweight lead singer's demotion in favor of a more glamorous singer who had previously sung backup.

title: Sherlock's Last Case
description: Dr. Watson gives us the truth about Arthur Conan Doyle's legendary detective Sherlock Holmes — he is a self-absorbed, egotistical tyrant in private, even as he is tested once again to solve the case of "the perfect murder."

title: Roza
description: A former prostitute and concentration-camp survivor takes care of the children of prostitutes in Paris, including one boy who is searching for his real parents.

title: La Serva Padrona
description: An elderly bachelor's maid would like to be the mistress of the house. When her master asks his male servant to find a husband for her, they scheme to trick him in Giovanni Battista Pergolesi's opera buffa.

title: Pulcinella
description: A leader of a company of performers refuses to take his mask off even when the company performs for royalty, in this take on the classic masked Pulcinella character based on an unfinished film by Roberto Rosselini.

title: Mort Sahl on Broadway!
description: Mort Sahl brings an evening of comedy and political commentary to Broadway.

title: Tom Waits in Concert on Broadway
description: Singer-songwriter Tom Waits performs a concert of his classic songs as well as songs from his latest album Frank's Wild Years shortly after starring in a musical version of the latter at Chicago's Steppenwolf Theatre.

title: Il Berretto a Songali
description: A bank clerk prefers to think of himself as a voice of reason in a town crackling with sexual jealousy and hysteria. His views are challenged when his boss's wife insists her husband is having an affair with his wife, despite having no proof.

title: Burn This
description: A dangerously sensual restaurant owner, whose gay brother recently died with his lover in a boating accident, falls into a tempestuous relationship with the female modern dancer who roomed with his brother.

title: Jerry Garcia Acoustic and Electric
description: Grateful Dead guitarist Jerry Garcia brings his own acoustic and electric bands to Broadway for a concert of Dead favorites and other regulars of the folk and rock genres.

title: Late Nite Comic
description: A standup comic and an aspiring dancer have an on-again, off-again romance through their careers' ups and downs.

title: La Serva Amorosa
description: The clever and loyal Coraline outwits her elderly master's new wife, who has exiled the master's son from the house in hopes of gaining it for herself, in Carlo Goldoni's 1752 comedy.

title: Anything Goes
description: An evangelist-turned-nightclub singer, a lovelorn stockbroker wooing a lovely debutante, the debutante's British lord fiancé, and a gangster disguised as a minister all turn up on a luxury cruise liner to sing, dance and romance.

title: Cabaret
description: Cabaret singer Sally Bowles performs at the decadent Kit Kat Klub as the Nazi Party quietly takes hold of 1930s Berlin.

title: Podrecca Puppet Theatre Company
description: Vittorio Podrecca's traveling theatre of marionette performers appears on Broadway.

title: Don't Get God Started
description: A series of African-American-themed skits depict problems that are cured by religion in this gospel musical.

title: Into the Woods
description: A childless baker and his wife endeavor to lift their family curse by journeying into the woods, where they encounter Rapunzel (and her witchly "mother"), Cinderella, Jack (of Beanstalk fame), Little Red Riding Hood and other classic fairy tale characters, and they all must learn the responsibility that comes with getting what you want.

title: Teddy & Alice
description: President Theodore "Teddy" Roosevelt's relationship with his rebellious daughter, Alice, is examined in this musical, featuring the classic music of John Philip Sousa set to lyrics by Hal Hackady and a book by Jerome Alden.

title: Breaking the Code
description: Hugh Whitmore's play depicts Alan Turing, the British mathematician who cracked the Nazis' Enigma code but was branded a criminal for being openly gay.

title: Penn & Teller
description: The popular magicians Penn & Teller perform an evening of comical illusions.

title: Virsky's Ukrainian State Dance Company
description: The Ukrainian dance company founded by Pavel Virsky performs an evening of the folk dances of their country.

title: The Phantom of the Opera
description: For over 25 years, The Phantom of the Opera has been the Broadway musical all others are measured against. The timeless story, the unforgettable score, the undeniable obsession that could never die… Winner of seven 1988 Tony Awards, including Best Musical, Andrew Lloyd Webber’s stunning masterwork is more than the longest-running musical in Broadway history—it’s an international phenomenon that unmasks emotions, leaving audiences everywhere breathless.

title: Sarafina!
description: A South African student who has survived arrest and torture in the apartheid culture is inspired by her teacher to lead her classmates in a musical celebration of the life of Nelson Mandela.

title: Rodney Dangerfield on Broadway!
description: Comic Rodney Dangerfield brings his everyman act to Broadway, demanding respect from a world that never gives it to him.

title: Serious Money
description: The greed and ruthlessness of the 1980s London stock market is theatricalized and satirized by Caryl Churchill.

title: A Walk in the Woods
description: A Russian and an American, both advocating nuclear disarmament from different positions at a Geneva summit, debate the pros and cons of the issue and come to understand and learn from each other.

title: A Streetcar Named Desire
description: Fragile Southern belle Blanche DuBois moves to New Orleans to live with her sister, Stella, and her brutish brother-in-law, Stanley Kowalski, in a dingy apartment.  Temperaments clash, fireworks fly and secrets are revealed in Tennessee Williams' Pulitzer Prize-winning drama.

title: M. Butterfly
description: A French diplomat falls in love with a Chinese opera singer, who turns out to be a spy—and a man—in David Henry Hwang's Tony Award-winning play, which is based on a real-life incident.

title: The Gospel at Colonus
description: Sophocles' Oedipus at Colonus, in which the exiled king Oedipus seeks a place where he may be properly buried, is retold as a gospel musical within the framework of a Pentecostal church service.

title: Joe Turner's Come and Gone
description: August Wilson depicts the great migration of African-Americans, from the farms of the South to the cities of the North, in this drama of folks passing through a Pittsburgh boardinghouse in 1911 in search of identity and stability.

title: Mail
description: A struggling writer who has disappeared for four months returns to read his mail, which comes to life singing and dancing.

title: Michael Feinstein in Concert
description: Singer and music archivist Michael Feinstein performs a concert of songs from the Great American Songbook.

title: Macbeth
description: When three witches deliver some surprising prophecies, Macbeth hatches a plan to murder the king and claim the throne for himself. Provoked by his wife and preoccupied with greed, Macbeth begins his tragic descent into madness.

title: Chess
description: American and Russian chess champions play a match against each other — and compete for the same woman — at the height of the Cold War.

title: Romance / Romance
description: In the first act of Barry Harman and Keith Herrmann's musical, two 19th-century aristocrats meet in disguise, fall in love and worry over how to confess their true identities. In the second act, two married best friends fantasize about sleeping with each other while vacationing in the Hamptons.

title: Jackie Mason's The World According to Me!
description: Jackie Mason brings an evening of Jewish-themed, politically barbed standup to Broadway.

title: Speed-the-Plow
description: David Mamet satirizes Hollywood's chasm between business and art as two powerful producers debate whether to produce a spiritual novel or a surefire blockbuster.

title: Carrie
description: A small-town high school girl discovers she has telekinetic powers and uses them to get back at her bullying high school classmates and her tyrannical mother, in this musical adaptation of Stephen King's horror novel and the film based on it.

title: Long Day's Journey Into Night
description: The Tyrone family — the miserly actor father, the grasping mother addicted to morphine, the alcoholic older son and the tubercular younger son — come to grips with their twisted love for one another in Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning play.

title: Juno and the Paycock
description: Unemployed Captain Boyle would rather drink his days away with his friend Joxer than get a job to provide for his wife Juno and their children. Sean O'Casey's tale traces the effects of the 1920s Irish civil war on its working-class people.

title: Ah, Wilderness!
description: In a small New England town at the turn of the 20th century, an intense, poetic and sensitive young man falls in love, drives his mother crazy, and sparks his parents to recall their own romance and youth.

title: The Night of the Iguana
description: A defrocked priest accused of having sexual relations with a teenage girl seeks shelter at a Mexican inn run by his blowsy, widowed old friend, who finds herself competing for his attentions with a kindly spinster who is caring for her grandfather, an aging poet.

title: Canciones De Mi Padre
description: Linda Ronstadt performs the Mexican folk songs her father sang to her when she was a child.

title: Checkmates
description: Two African-American couples, one older and more traditional, the other younger and upwardly mobile, share a two-family home in Detroit in Ron Milner's comedy.

title: Ain't Misbehavin'
description: A cast of five singers perform the music and celebrate the freewheeling spirit of Harlem musician Thomas "Fats" Waller.

title: The Georgian State Dance Company
description: The Georgian State Dance Company brings to life the acrobatic dances and folk songs of the Russian state of Georgia.

title: Paul Robeson
description: In Phillip Hayes Dean's biographical two-man play, the legendary actor, singer and political activist Paul Robeson sings songs and tells stories of his multi-faceted career, from triumphs in Show Boat and The Emperor Jones, to his fight for racial equality to accusations of Communist involvement.

title: Michael Feinstein in Concert: "Isn't It Romantic"
description: Cabaret singer Michael Feinstein performs an evening of tunes from the Great American Songbook in conjunction with the release of his album Isn't It Romantic.

title: Kenny Loggins on Broadway
description: Singer-songwriter Kenny Loggins, best known for writing songs for the film musical Footloose, performs an evening of pop and rock songs.

title: Spoils of War
description: A Brooklyn boy who desperately wants to reunite his divorced parents finds an unexpected friend in his father's new mistress.

title: The Devil's Disciple
description: A town drunkard substitutes himself for the minister British soldiers are attempting to capture and hang, in George Bernard Shaw's 1897 satire of New England Puritanism and political self-importance during the Revolutionary War.

title: Rumors
description: In Neil Simon's murderous farce, four couples arrive at the 10th anniversary celebration party for New York's deputy mayor and his wife, only to find the mayor wounded in bed and the wife missing.

title: Our Town
description: The Stage Manager guides audiences through a small New England town in the early 1900s, as its inhabitants grow up, get married and discover the beauty of life, in Thornton Wilder's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: Legs Diamond
description: The Prohibition-era gangster Legs Diamond reveals a show-business yen in this musical adaptation of the biographical film The Rise of Legs Diamond.

title: Eastern Standard
description: A group of four upwardly mobile New Yorkers invite a homeless woman to spend the summer with them at a Hamptons beach house as they come to terms with their relationships and situations.

title: Black and Blue
description: This revue celebrates the blues and jazz music and dance made popular by black performers in the 1920s and 1930s.

title: Born Yesterday
description: A millionaire junk dealer with designs on Washington politics hires a sophisticated writer to educate his dumb-blonde girlfriend, Billie Dawn, who ends up falling for the writer and turning the tables on her boyfriend's shady business deals.

title: Shirley Valentine
description: A Liverpool housewife who feels unappreciated rediscovers herself on a trip to Greece where she has an affair with a local tavern-keeper, in Willy Russell's one-woman play.

title: Cafe Crown
description: A variety of Yiddish theatrical types, most notably an impresario who plans to "improve" King Lear, gather regularly at a Second Avenue café.

title: Hizzoner!
description: Legendary New York mayor Fiorello H. LaGuardia recounts his triumphs and setbacks in Paul Shyre's one-man play.

title: Jerome Robbins' Broadway
description: Jerome Robbins recreates the direction and choreography of many of his classic set pieces from Broadway musicals, including scenes and numbers from Fiddler on the Roof, West Side Story, On the Town and more.

title: Joan Jett and the Black Hearts on Broadway
description: Joan Jett and the Black Hearts bring punk rock to Broadway for this concert in conjunction with the release of their album Up Your Alley.

title: Lend Me a Tenor
description: On a historic night at the Cleveland Opera Company, world-famous tenor Tito Morelli is to perform in Otello. Through a series of mishaps, Tito receives a double dose of tranquilizers, causing the house manager to believe he is dead and setting off a chain reaction of slapstick and mistaken identity.

title: Metamorphosis
description: A commercial traveler with a domineering father awakens one morning to find himself transformed into a dung beetle, in Stephen Berkoff's adaptation of the Franz Kafka short story.

title: Run for Your Wife
description: In Ray Cooney's sex farce, a seemingly ordinary taxi driver has two wives who live minutes from each other in the London suburbs, and he must try desperately to keep them from learning about each other.

title: The Heidi Chronicles
description: A feminist art historian and her friends, male and female, gay and straight, mature from the 1960s to the 1980s as they search for political, professional and personal fulfillment, in Wendy Wasserstein's Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning play.

title: Chu Chem
description: A scholar and his daughter journey to Kaifeng Fu, China, for traces of the Jewish immigrants who settled there 800 years earlier. While they are there, a prince falls for the daughter, but she refuses to become part of his traditional harem.

title: Welcome to the Club
description: Four divorced men commiserate over their marriages while locked up in alimony jail.

title: Barry Manilow at the Gershwin
description: Barry Manilow performs a concert of his greatest hits at the Gershwin Theatre.

title: Starmites
description: A lonely teenage girl magically finds herself in the comic-book world she adores, where she must lead the Starmites in their efforts to save the earth and battle the evil Shak Graa.

title: Ghetto
description: A theatre troupe proves unexpectedly popular in a Jewish ghetto in Vilna, Lithuania, shortly after many of its residents have been murdered by the Nazis.

title: Largely New York
description: Clown and actor Bill Irwin brings New York to life through mime, dance and multimedia in a series of vignettes.

title: Mandy Patinkin in Concert: "Dress Casual"
description: Tony Award winner Mandy Patinkin performs a concert in conjunction with the release of his album Dress Casual, featuring pop standards and theatre music by Harold Arlen, Rodgers and Hammerstein, Stephen Sondheim, and more.

title: Shenandoah
description: A pacifist who refuses to participate in the Civil War is drawn into it when one of his sons is abducted and another is killed, in this musical adaptation of the 1965 film.

title: Freddie Jackson: Up Close & Personal
description: Freddie Jackson presents a concert of gospel-influenced pop music, featuring singer Regina Belle.

title: Sweeney Todd
description: A barber who was unjustly imprisoned for years by a corrupt judge returns to England bent on revenge — a revenge that turns indiscriminately murderous, leading his resourceful accomplice, Mrs. Lovett, to bake the victims into meat pies.

title: Orpheus Descending
description: A Sicilian immigrant's daughter, unhappily running a dry-goods store in the South and tending to her dying husband, is reawakened by a mysterious drifter who appears in town.

title: Mastergate
description: A Hollywood studio and the White House plot together to stage a Central American guerilla raid, in Larry Gelbart's political satire, inspired by the Iran-Contra scandal.

title: Dangerous Games
description: This Argentina-inspired musical sets its first act in a 1930s brothel, where two brothers dance a violent tango with a new virgin. The second act re-sets the Orpheus myth during the country's brutal junta political regime in the 1970s, where Orpheus is a rock singer who follows his beloved to a hell guarded by fascists.

title: The Secret Rapture
description: A kind owner of a small graphic art business must care for her alcoholic stepmother after her father's death. The tragedy that follows leaves her hard-driving politician sister to pick up the pieces.

title: Love Letters
description: A.R. Gurney's two-character play follows the relationship between a stuffy W.A.S.P. and a free-spirited woman, throughout their lives from childhood to death, as chronicled in the letters they write to each other. The play is very simply presented, generally with the two actors seated at a table, reading from the script, as if from letters.

title: Sid Caesar & Company
description: Sid Caesar headlines an evening of comedy, song and dance, with many of the sketches taken from his classic TV series, Your Show of Shows.

title: Meet Me in St. Louis
description: This stage adaptation of the classic 1944 film musical examines one year in the life of the Smith family, who live in St. Louis just as the 1904 World's Fair is preparing to take place there — until the father's New York job offer threatens to take them away.

title: Threepenny Opera
description:
The outlaw Macheath is repeatedly betrayed and sent to prison, only to receive a last-minute reprieve from Queen Victoria, in Kurt Weill and Bertolt Brecht's darkly satirical adaptation of
John Gay's The Beggar's Opera.

title: Prince of Central Park
description: A 12-year-old hides from an abusive foster mother in a Central Park treehouse, where he meets an eccentric but lovable cast of characters.

title: Grand Hotel
description: An aging ballerina, a baron who must steal jewels to make a living, a dying bookkeeper, and a typist with dreams of screen stardom are just a few of the guests who pass through the Grand Hotel in Berlin in the early 1930s, where life goes on even as many of the guests' lives change suddenly and permanently.

title: A Few Good Men
description: A group of military defense lawyers tackle a case of murder in Guantanamo Bay, in which the defendant may have been covering up for their superior officers.

title: Gypsy
description: Indomitable stage mother Rose chases vicarious success and stardom as she pushes her daughters through the vaudeville circuit. When Baby June flees the act to elope, Rose vows to make introverted Louise into a star.

title: The Circle
description: A titled English lady, who eloped with a former Parliament official, returns with her new husband to the estate — and the husband and son — she abandoned, only to find that the son's wife may soon run off with her own lover.

title: Artist Descending a Staircase
description: Dadaist artists Martello and Beauchamp accuse each other of pushing their elderly (and now traditionalist) colleague Donner down a staircase, in this satirical thriller by Tom Stoppard that follows the men's friendships from 1914 to 1972.

title: The Victor Borge Holiday Show on Broadway
description: Classical pianist and comedian Victor Borge performs a concert of holiday music and entertainment.

title: The Tenth Man
description: An unhappy lawyer is pulled off the street by several old Jewish men to serve as the tenth man needed to start a prayer service at a Long Island synagogue. He meets the granddaughter of one of the regulars, who is believed to be possessed by a dybbuk (wandering spirit) and vows to help cure her of her sickness after his own is relieved.

title: City of Angels
description: A disillusioned crime novelist adapts his latest novel into a screenplay as his marriage falls apart. At the same time, we see the adventures of his detective, presented as if in a black-and-white film. The detective has a way with women but is forever haunted by the one who got away, in this musical spoof of film noir crime movies and Hollywood's treatment of writers.

title: Peter, Paul & Mary "A Holiday Celebration"
description: The folk trio Peter, Paul and Mary perform a concert of holiday favorites with the New York Choral Society.

title: Tru
description: The legendary writer Truman Capote is seen spending Christmas alone in his New York apartment in 1975, recalling his past after his rich and famous friends deserted him following the publication of a scandalous roman à clef about their exploits.

title: The Merchant of Venice
description: Moneylender Shylock forces the Christian merchant Antonio to offer him a "pound of flesh" in exchange for money to allow Antonio's friend to marry the beautiful and wealthy Portia, in William Shakespeare's tale of revenge, greed and religion.

title: Stephanie Mills Comes "Home" to Broadway
description: Stephanie Mills, who became a star in The Wiz and later started a pop career, returns to the Broadway stage for a concert of pop and soul music, including her signature song from The Wiz, "Home."

title: Don Cossacks
description: The Don Cossacks Song and Dance Company of Rostov performs the songs, dances, and folklore of the Cossack people of Russia.

title: Miss Margarida's Way
description: A tyrannical eighth-grade teacher addresses the audience as her class, railing against religion, education and democracy.

title: Oba Oba '90
description: A group of dancers perform to the pop and classical music of Brazil in this musical revue.

title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
description: In Tennessee Williams' Pulitzer Prize winner, a wealthy Southern patriarch faces impending death and manipulates his family, as his children squabble and mislead in desperate attempts to secure the family inheritance.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
description: The Joads, a family of sharecroppers in Oklahoma, are driven west by the Depression and the drought of the Dust Bowl, in Frank Galati's adaptation of the John Steinbeck novel.

title: Lettice and Lovage
description: A flamboyant tour guide who loves to embellish the history behind an English country house butts heads with a fact-conscious official at the house.

title: Aspects of Love
description: A young man has an affair with an older actress who later marries his uncle, with whom she has a daughter who eventually falls for the young man years later.

title: The Piano Lesson
description: In 1936 Pittsburgh, Berniece Charles wants to sell the family piano to her daughter, while her brother, Boy Willie, wants to sell it to get money to buy the land their family once worked as slaves.

title: Truly Blessed
description: The gospel singer Mahalia Jackson's life story, from humble beginnings in New Orleans to national success at the height of the civil rights movement, is told using her signature music and some original songs.

title: Accomplice
description: Two English couples plot the murders of various spouses at a country estate and then debate theatrical matters, in this spoof-thriller by Rupert Holmes.

title: A Change in the Heir
description: Two branches of the same royal family bring up their children as the opposite sex in hopes of gaining the crown. Mistaken identity and romance result, in this musical farce.

title: Prelude to a Kiss
description: An old man and a young bride accidentally switch bodies, creating chaos and humor in their relationships and teaching them about the true meaning of love.

title: Some Americans Abroad
description: A group of American college professors and students rush to take in as much of English culture and theatre as they can, in Richard Nelson's satire of middle-class tourist culture.

title: Zoya's Apartment
description: A Russian brothel operating under the guise of a dress-making shop is run by a madam who dreams of escaping to Paris as her ex-aristocrat husband retreats into oblivion, in Mikhael Bulgakov's 1926 play.

title: The Cemetery Club
description: The monthly gathering of four Jewish women at their husbands' graves is interrupted by a would-be suitor for one of the women.

title: Michael Feinstein in Concert: Piano and Voice
description: Singer and music archivist Michael Feinstein performs a concert of songs from the Great American Songbook.

title: Stand-Up Tragedy
description: A new Catholic school teacher seeks to rescue a Hispanic student, who shows promise as an artist, from a horrifying family life and an educational system with little sympathy.

title: Bugs Bunny on Broadway
description: Screenings of several of the classic Looney Tunes cartoon shorts, featuring the wily Bugs Bunny, are accompanied live by the Warner Brothers Symphony Orchestra.

title: The Miser
description: A rich miser wants to marry off his daughter to a rich older man and his son to a rich widow, having his own designs on his son's beloved, in Moliere's 1668 comedy.

title: Jackie Mason: Brand New
description: Jackie Mason skewers politics, Jewish-Gentile differences, and more in this evening of comedy, staged on a set resembling a TV news show with Mason as anchor.

title: Once On This Island
description: Ti Moune is a fearless peasant girl who falls in love with a wealthy boy from the other side of the island. When their divided cultures keep them apart, Ti Moune is guided by the powerful island gods, Erzulie, Asaka, Papa Ge, and Agwe, on a remarkable quest to reunite with the man who has captured her heart.

title: Oh, Kay!
description: This classic Gershwin musical depicts the adventures of two bootleggers — Lady Kay and her brother, the Duke of Durham — in Prohibition-era Long Island.

title: Buddy
description: The songs of Buddy Holly, the story of his meteoric rise in the rock 'n' roll world, and his sudden tragic death in a 1959 plane crash form the backbone of this jukebox musical.

title: Bobby McFerrin's Voicestra on Broadway
description: Jazz musician Bobby McFerrin and his Voicestra, a group of 12 singers who can sing a wide variety of musical styles, perform a concert with an innovative take on group singing.

title: Those Were the Days
description: A revue of Yiddish songs, dances and sketches, conceived by Zalmen Mlotek and Moishe Rosenfeld and directed and choreographed by Eleanor Reissa.

title: Six Degrees of Separation
description: Inspired by a true story, a group of wealthy New Yorkers are taken in by a conman who claims to be the son of actor-director Sidney Poitier. His victims turn detective and try to piece together the connections that gave him access to their lives. Meanwhile, the conman's lies are beginning to catch up with him, leading unexpectedly into darker territory.

title: Shadowlands
description: The renowned English author C.S. Lewis strikes up a correspondence with the divorced American poet Joy Davidman, which leads to an unexpected romance and marriage and a love that must surmount a tragic obstacle.

title: Fiddler on the Roof
description: Tevye, a Jewish milkman in early 1900s Russia, sees his three eldest daughters married, each one moving further from traditional ways, and must cope with the growing anti-Jewish sentiment in his country.

title: Shogun, the Musical
description: An English sea captain, shipwrecked in 17th-century Japan, becomes caught in a political power struggle and falls in love with a married noblewoman, in this musical adaptation of James Clavell's novel.

title: An Evening with Harry Connick Jr. and His Orchestra
description: Harry Connick, Jr. performs a concert of jazz standards and his own compositions, singing, playing piano, bass and drums, and trading jokes with his onstage band.

title: Peter Pan
description: The boy who would not grow up visits the Darling children and takes them on a magical adventure to Never-Never Land in this beloved musical version of the classic J.M. Barrie play.

title: Monster in a Box
description: Spalding Gray recounts his attempts to write a novel about a man who doesn't enjoy vacations, in his latest comedic monologue.

title: La Bête
description: A vulgar street performer and a high-minded playwright compete for favors in the royal court in this 17th-century-set satire.

title: Mule Bone
description: Two African-American male friends come to blows over a woman, and one goes to trial for knocking the other out with a mule bone, in this adaptation of an unfinished play by Langston Hughes and Zora Neale Hurston, based on one of Hurston's short stories.

title: Taking Steps
description: A bucket manufacturer and his family are shown a mysterious old house, a former brothel said to be haunted by the ghost of one of its residents, in Alan Ayckbourn's farce.

title: Lost in Yonkers
description: Two brothers are sent to live with their formidable German grandmother, their childlike aunt and their gangster uncle in Neil Simon's Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning semi-autobiographical play.

title: The Speed of Darkness
description: Two Vietnam War buddies reunite in South Dakota, one a successful all-American husband and father, the other a homeless philosopher who needs a place to stay.

title: The Big Love
description: Florence Aadland, the mother of a 15-year-old aspiring actress whose relationship with actor Errol Flynn later led to a scandalous trial, is the subject of this one-woman play.

title: Penn & Teller: The Refrigerator Tour
description: The popular magicians Penn & Teller perform an evening of comical illusions, including a trick in which a refrigerator appears to fall on them from above.

title: Lucifer's Child
description: Karen Blixen, the Danish woman who achieved fame as Out of Africa author Isak Dinesen, recalls her life and loves in this one-person play.

title: I Hate Hamlet
description: An actor retreating from a canceled TV series to play Hamlet in Central Park has a crippling fear of the role, and he gets counseled by the ghost of one of its most celebrated interpreters, John Barrymore.

title: Miss Saigon
description: Set in 1975 during the final days of the of the Vietnam War, Miss Saigon is an epic love story about the relationship between Chris, an American GI and Kim, a young Vietnamese woman. They are separated when the country falls, until she returns to his life years later, in this musical inspired by the opera Madame Butterfly.

title: The Secret Garden
description: A spoiled orphan girl is sent to live with her uncle on the Yorkshire moors and discovers renewed life, for herself and her sickly cousin, in bringing her dead aunt's secret garden back to life.

title: Our Country's Good
description: In Timberlake Wertenbaker's dramatization of a real-life incident and Thomas Keneally's novel The Playmaker, it is 1788, and a Royal Marine lieutenant directs several of the criminals and misfits banished to the new British colony of Australia in the first play the country has produced, gradually winning the skeptical fledgling actors over to the magic of the theatre.

title: The Will Rogers Follies
description: The life of Will Rogers, the comedian and headliner of the Ziegfeld Follies, is told through a series of Follies-like variety acts and lavish production numbers, directed and choreographed by Tommy Tune.

title: The Odd Couple
description: Two suddenly single pals — a sloppy sportswriter and a fastidious news writer — strain their friendship by turning roommates and unconsciously repeating the same mistakes they made in the marriages they just left.

title: Getting Married
description: The family of a bishop whose youngest daughter is getting married debate their views on matrimony on the morning of her wedding.

title: On Borrowed Time
description: An old man chases Death (called Mr. Brink) up a tree so he can spend more time with his grandson, in Paul Osborn's fantasy based on L.E. Watkin's novel.

title: André Heller's Wonderhouse
description: A group of illusionists and novelty performers present acts from the days of vaudeville at a birthday party for an elderly woman.

title: Dancing at Lughnasa
description: Five unmarried Irish sisters, who escape their drab lives by dancing to music on their new radio, are recalled by the adult son of one of the women.

title: The Homecoming
description: An expat professor brings his wife home to North London to meet his working-class family. Fraught with jealousy, tension and rivalry, the homecoming threatens their marriage and intensifies a lifetime of aggression among brothers and sons.

title: Moscow Circus - Cirk Valentin
description: The Moscow Circus brings an evening of acrobatics and clown routines to Broadway following a successful engagement at Radio City Music Hall.

title: Park Your Car in Harvard Yard
description: A dying high school teacher and his young housekeeper, who is also one of his former students, form an unexpected friendship in spite of generational divides and past resentments.

title: Peter Pan
description: The boy who would not grow up visits the Darling children and takes them on a magical adventure to Never-Never Land in this beloved musical version of the classic J.M. Barrie play.

title: Catskills on Broadway
description: Freddie Roman, Marilyn Michaels, Mal Z. Lawrence and Dick Capri each perform a 30-minute standup set designed to recall the kind of comedy often performed at the resorts in the Catskills Mountains in New York.

title: Nick & Nora
description: Nick and Nora Charles, the married amateur sleuths from The Thin Man novel and film series, compete to figure out who murdered a bookkeeper with a mysterious past.

title: The Crucible
description: Arthur Miller's tale of the Salem witch trials, in which a group of girls accuse upstanding women in the town of witchcraft to divert suspicion from their own activities, has been seen as an allegory for Senator Joseph McCarthy's anti-Communist crusades of the 1950s.

title: A Christmas Carol
description: Charles Dickens' classic story about the miserly Ebenezer Scrooge, who reconsiders his ways after a series of ghostly visits on Christmas Eve. A celebration of kindness, generosity, and compassion that will fill your overflowing heart with the desire to spread the glow of holiday good cheer when you leave the theater.

title: Two Shakespearean Actors
description: Richard Nelson's play dramatizes the 1849 incident in which legendary British actor William Charles Macready brought his interpretation of Macbeth to America, only to discover a young American actor, Edwin Forrest, was performing it at the same time, and audiences were willing to riot to show their preferences.

title: The Visit
description: A rich, oft-married widow returns to her poor childhood town in central Europe, offering its citizens a billion marks for the life of the man who seduced and abandoned her years ago and is now the town's most respected citizen.

title: A Little Hotel on the Side
description: Georges Feydeau and Maurice Desvallieres' 1894 farce brings together a group of guests and staff at a Parisian hotel for bed-hopping, mistaken identity, and other shenanigans.

title: Crazy He Calls Me
description: A naïve young Brooklyn lawyer courts and marries an eccentric woman and ends up taking her to court.

title: The Most Happy Fella
description: A middle-aged Italian vineyard owner falls in love with a pretty waitress from afar, sends her the picture of his handsome foreman, and convinces her to move to his California vineyard and marry him, in Frank Loesser's musical adaptation of Sidney Howard's play They Knew What They Wanted.

title: Crazy for You
description: A banker with a yen for show business is sent to foreclose on a property that turns out to be a theatre. After falling in love with the local postmistress, he decides to put on a show to save the theatre, in this musical featuring classic Gershwin songs and a Ken Ludwig libretto inspired by the 1930 musical Girl Crazy.

title: Private Lives
description: Divorcees Elyot and Amanda unexpectedly meet while honeymooning with their respective new spouses and discover that their passion for — and irritation with — each other is just as strong as ever.

title: Search and Destroy
description: An inept businessman plans to lie and cheat his way to the top of the movie business.

title: Death and the Maiden
description: A Latin American woman meets a man that she believes raped and tortured her when her country was controlled by a dictatorship 15 years earlier. She turns the tables on the man, despite her husband's counseling otherwise, in Ariel Dorfman's political thriller.

title: Four Baboons Adoring the Sun
description: A suburban housewife leaves her husband for an old college boyfriend, joining him and their children on an archeological dig in Sicily where life turns out to be not quite as idyllic as she had hoped.

title: The Master Builder
description: An aging architect is haunted by memories and fears until a figure from his past returns.

title: Conversations with My Father
description: Novelist Charlie remembers his relationship with his father, Eddie, a Jewish man who aggressively tried to assimilate into America as a bartender but remained haunted by his past.

title: Jake's Women
description: A novelist whose second marriage is on the verge of collapse examines his relationships with all of the women in his life to understand how he might be a better husband.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, a Danish prince, discovers that his uncle Claudius murdered his father and took the throne; Hamlet's mother has married the usurper. Shakespeare's tragedy of betrayal and revenge is considered among the greatest plays in the English language.

title: Five Guys Named Moe
description: Five guys named Moe leap out of a jukebox and sing the songs of Louis Jordan to teach Nomax how to fix his relationship with his girlfriend.

title: A Streetcar Named Desire
description: Fragile Southern belle Blanche DuBois moves to New Orleans to live with her sister, Stella, and her brutish brother-in-law, Stanley Kowalski, in a dingy apartment.  Temperaments clash, fireworks fly and secrets are revealed in Tennessee Williams' Pulitzer Prize-winning drama.

title: Two Trains Running
description: In 1969 in Pittsburgh's Hill District, the owner of a local diner fights to stay open as a municipal project encroaches on his establishment. His regulars must deal with racial inequality and the turbulent, changing times.

title: Guys and Dolls
description: A fly-by-night gambler attempts to woo a Salvation Army missioner for a $1,000 bet. Meanwhile, a beleaguered showgirl tries to hook her fiancé of 14 years, the founder of "the oldest, established, permanent, floating crap game in New York."

title: Metro
description: Polish street performers put on an unexpectedly successful musical in the subway and must decide whether to remain true to their art or sell out to commercial interests.

title: The High Rollers Social and Pleasure Club
description: New Orleans musician Allen Toussaint headlines a revue of the music of his hometown, much of which he wrote himself.

title: Man of La Mancha
description: An imprisoned Miguel de Cervantes gets his fellow inmates to enact the story of his novel, Don Quixote, about an aged nobleman who declares himself a "knight errant" out to do battle for good and the love of a fair maiden, in Mitch Leigh, Joe Darion and Dale Wasserman's musical adaptation of the classic Cervantes novel.

title: Jelly's Last Jam
description: The troubled legacy of Jelly Roll Morton, a Creole man who claimed to have invented jazz but always shunned the black side of his heritage, is examined in musical terms as Morton faces death.

title: A Small Family Business
description: A middle-aged manager of a frozen foods business takes over the larger company founded by his father-in-law and is ultimately sucked into the family's scheming and errant bookkeeping against his better judgment, in Alan Ayckbourn's indictment of British greed in the Margaret Thatcher years.

title: Falsettos
description: William Finn and James Lapine's musical combines their Off-Broadway works The March of the Falsettos and Falsettoland, which tell the story of a gay man named Marvin, his lover Whizzer, Marvin’s wife Trina and their extended family from the early ‘80s through the early days of the AIDS crisis.

title: The Price
description: When the Great Depression cost his family their fortune, Victor Franz gave up his dream of an education to support his father. Three decades later, Victor has returned to his childhood home to sell the remainder of his parents’ estate. His wife, his estranged brother, and the wily furniture dealer hired to appraise their possessions all arrive with their own agendas, forcing Victor to confront a question, long-stifled, about the value of his sacrifice.

title: Chinese Coffee
description: A failed writer complains about the mess he's made of his life to an almost equally disappointed photographer friend, whom the writer has used as inspiration for his latest novel.

title: Salome
description: King Herod lusts for his stepdaughter, Salome, who asks him to bring her the head of John the Baptist in exchange for her favors, in Oscar Wilde's take on the Biblical legend.

title: The Real Inspector Hound and the Fifteen Minute Hamlet
description: An evening of two one-act plays by Tom Stoppard. In The Real Inspector Hound, two self-satisfied critics become part of the murder-mystery play they are reviewing. The Fifteen Minute Hamlet offers a breathless condensation of the entire plot of William Shakespeare's play.

title: Anna Karenina
description: This musical adaptation of the classic Leo Tolstoy novel dramatizes the married Anna Karenina's passionate romance with Count Vronsky, for whom she sacrifices her marriage and compromises her ideals.

title: Oba Oba '93
description: A group of dancers perform to the pop and classical music of Brazil in this musical revue.

title: The Show Off
description: A clerk at New York's Penn Station is given to exaggerating his own role at the station in George Kelly's satire.

title: Solitary Confinement
description: An isolated millionaire who only communicates with his staff through closed-circuit televisions is suddenly menaced by a killer, in Rupert Holmes' thriller.

title: Gypsy Passion
description: Andalusian singers and dancers perform the passionate flamenco routines associated with Spanish Gypsies.

title: 3 from Brooklyn
description: Comedian Sal Richards, singer Roslyn Kind, and other performers extol the joys of Brooklyn in this musical revue.

title: Someone Who'll Watch Over Me
description: An Irish journalist, a British professor and an African-American doctor are forced to entertain themselves, and each other, to pass the time when they are imprisoned in Beirut.

title: The Seagull
description: Famous actress Irina Arkadina is obsessed with a callous lover, dismissive of her frustrated son and suspicious of an admiring young woman. Anton Chekhov's 1895 play explores the tensions between mothers, sons, lovers, friends and servants.

title: My Favorite Year
description: Lynn Ahrens and Stephen Flaherty's musical is based on the 1982 film, which fictionalizes a real-life incident in which a drunken, faded, Errol Flynn-like movie idol guest stars on a live 1950s television comedy show, à la Sid Caesar's Your Show of Shows.

title: A Christmas Carol
description: Charles Dickens' classic story about the miserly Ebenezer Scrooge, who reconsiders his ways after a series of ghostly visits on Christmas Eve. A celebration of kindness, generosity, and compassion that will fill your overflowing heart with the desire to spread the glow of holiday good cheer when you leave the theater.

title: Tommy Tune Tonite!
description: Tommy Tune pays tribute to his song-and-dance idols, performing routines associated with Fred Astaire, Ray Bolger and others, in this autobiographical concert.

title: Anna Christie
description: A weary former prostitute seeks out her estranged sea captain father, hoping to find forgiveness from him, while hiding her past from a stoker she loves in Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: The Boys Choir of Harlem and Friends
description: The Boys Choir of Harlem performs a concert with a variety of special guests from the worlds of music, dance and spoken-word poetry.

title: Saint Joan
description: Set in 15th century France, Saint Joan follows a country girl whose mysterious visions propel her into elite circles. When the nation’s rulers become threatened by her popularity and influence, they unite to bring her down and she finds herself on trial for her life.

title: Fool Moon
description: Renowned physical comedians Bill Irwin and David Shiner present an evening of mime and comedy.

title: The Goodbye Girl
description: A dancer and single mother discovers that her boyfriend has abandoned her and sublet their New York apartment to an obnoxious Chicago actor. The conflicts and growing affection that result are musicalized by Marvin Hamlisch, David Zippel and Neil Simon, based on Simon's 1977 film.

title: The Sisters Rosensweig
description: Three Jewish-American sisters come together in London for the eldest's birthday and take stock of their busy lives and relationships with each other and with men.

title: The Song of Jacob Zulu
description: Tug Yourgrau's play is based on a true incident in which a young, seemingly ordinary South African black man bombed a shopping center during the Christmas season of 1985.

title: Candida
description: A minister's wife becomes an object of infatuation for an idealistic young poet, in George Bernard Shaw's comedic look at the changing views on gender and social equality.

title: Redwood Curtain
description: A half-Asian, half-American child prodigy meets a Vietnam War veteran and follows him into the Northern California redwood forest where he and other veterans live, hoping he is, or can help her find, her long-lost father.

title: Raffi
description: Children's entertainer Raffi performs a concert of old favorites and new songs, mostly dealing with protecting the environment.

title: Company
description: In a series of vignettes, New York bachelor Bobby learns about the perils and pleasures of love, marriage, dating and divorce from his married friends.

title: Three Men on a Horse
description: A meek writer of greeting cards has a knack for picking the winning horse at the race track, which brings him to the attention of some gamblers down on their luck, in this Depression-era farce.

title: Ain't Broadway Grand
description: Producer Mike Todd rescues a floundering musical and turns it into a smash vehicle for comedian Bobby Clark, just as his marriage to actress Joan Blondell is floundering, in this musical look at one year in the real Todd's life.

title: Wilder, Wilder, Wilder
description: An evening of three one-act plays by Thornton Wilder. In The Long Christmas Dinner, the ritual of a family Christmas dinner never changes, although the people performing it do over time. The Happy Journey to Trenton and Camden follows a seemingly pleasant car ride that is really hiding a family's grief, and in Pullman Car Hiawatha, the title car and the elements in and around it are controlled by a stage manager-like character.

title: The Who's Tommy
description: This stage adaptation of The Who's classic rock opera and film tells the story of a deaf, dumb and mute boy who becomes a world-famous Pinball Wizard and the leader of a cult of devotees.

title: Blood Brothers
description: Twin English brothers are separated at birth, with one raised in wealth and the other in poverty, and grow to be friends and then bitter enemies without knowing their blood connection.

title: Shakespeare for My Father
description: Lynn Redgrave explores her complicated relationship with her father, the acclaimed actor Sir Michael Redgrave, and performs Shakespearean speeches that illuminate that relationship, in this one-woman show.

title: Tango Pasion
description: Argentine tango dancers and vocalists recall the atmosphere of the 1920s, taking inspiration from the expressionist paintings of Richard Carpani.

title: Kiss of the Spider Woman
description: An Argentine revolutionary is thrown in a prison cell with a gay man jailed on a morals charge who escapes from the terrifying reality of prison life into fantasies featuring a mysterious 1940s movie star.

title: Angels in America: Millennium Approaches
description: In Tony Kushner's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, set in 1980s New York City, a gay man is abandoned by his lover when he contracts the AIDS virus, and a closeted Mormon lawyer's marriage to his pill-popping wife stalls. Other characters include the infamous McCarthy-ite lawyer Roy Cohn, Ethel Rosenberg, a former drag queen who works as a nurse, and an angel.

title: Yanni
description: The New Age symphonic composer Yanni gives a concert of his favorite pieces.

title: She Loves Me
description: A store clerk and a salesgirl in a Hungarian parfumerie cannot stand each other, but are unaware that they are conducting an anonymous romantic correspondence.

title: Camelot
description: King Arthur founds the kingdom of Camelot and the Knights of the Round Table, who fight for justice and right, only to see his ideal crumble when his wife Guenevere falls in love with his favorite knight, Sir Lancelot.

title: In the Summer House
description: The lives of two eccentric widowed mothers and their daughters are examined in Jane Bowles' absurdist comedy.

title: White Liars & Black Comedy
description: An evening of two comedic one-acts by Peter Schaffer. White Liars brings two surprisingly linked men together to get their fortunes told. In Black Comedy, a blackout occurs on the night a young sculptor plans to meet his debutante's millionaire father and a wealthy patron.

title: Mixed Emotions
description: A middle-aged widow and widower slowly begin a relationship in Richard Baer's comedy.

title: Tony Bennett in Concert
description: Legendary singer Tony Bennett performs in concert on Broadway.

title: The Twilight of the Golds
description: A gay set designer's pregnant sister learns through genetic testing that her child will also be gay, throwing their family into a debate of operatic proportions.

title: Wonderful Tennessee
description: Three Irish couples find themselves stranded on a pier when the ferryman who was supposed to take them to an uninhibited island for one of the men's birthdays never shows up. They come to confront the disappointments and regrets in their lives and relationships.

title: Timon of Athens
description: A rich and generous Athenian finds himself without a fortune and friends and angrily retreats from a society on the brink of war, in William Shakespeare's look at the relationship between money and corruption.

title: Jackson Browne
description: Folk-rock singer-songwriter Jackson Browne performs a concert in conjunction with the release of his latest album I'm Alive.

title: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat
description: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice musicalize the Biblical story of a young man whose brothers are jealous of their father's favoritism toward him and the beautiful coat he receives as a gift. They sell him into slavery in Egypt, telling their father he has been murdered, but he ultimately becomes important to the Pharaoh through his ability to interpret dreams.

title: The Kentucky Cycle
description: Robert Schenkkan's Pulitzer Prize-winning tells the story of three families who live in eastern Kentucky from the Revolutionary War era until the 1970s, and the familial, racial and political conflicts that ultimately tear them and their land apart.

title: Any Given Day
description: A family matriarch with clairvoyant tendencies oversees her disappointing family in Frank Gilroy's semi-prequel to his own play, The Subject Was Roses.

title: A Grand Night for Singing
description: This revue of the songs of Rodgers and Hammerstein includes both their classics and their lesser-known compositions.

title: Cyrano - The Musical
description: A large-nosed poet gives a dashing soldier the words to court the poet's beautiful cousin in this musical adaptation of Edmond Rostand's romantic play.

title: Laughter on the 23rd Floor
description: Neil Simon's play is based on his days writing for a live comedy show in the 1950s, with a temperamental star modeled after Sid Caesar.

title: Angels in America: Perestroika
description: In the second part of Tony Kushner's epic tale of AIDS, homosexuality and religion in 1980s New York, the plague of the illness worsens, relationships fall apart as new ones form, and unexpected friendships take form.

title: Gray's Anatomy
description: Spalding Gray discusses his worldwide search for treatment for his failing eyesight in this evening-long comedic monologue.

title: Abe Lincoln in Illinois
description: Abraham Lincoln's journey from unremarkable Illinois businessman to president of the United States is charted in Robert E. Sherwood's Pulitzer Prize-winning play.

title: My Fair Lady
description: An English professor of phonetics makes a bet that he can transform a Cockney flower girl into a lady, in Lerner and Loewe's musical adaptation of George Bernard Shaw's Pygmalion.

title: The Red Shoes
description: A girl who longs to be a ballerina is torn between an imperious ballet impresario and the young composer she loves, in this musical adaptation of the Michael Powell film based on the Hans Christian Andersen fairy tale.

title: Candles, Snow & Mistletoe
description: Canadian children's entertainers Sharon, Lois & Bram and their friend Elephant go to the North Pole to show a depressed Santa Claus the true meaning of Christmas, while performing new and classic holiday songs.

title: The Government Inspector
description: A well-dressed wanderer comes upon a small Russian town, where he is mistaken for a government inspector. He is able to swindle the town residents and politicians who want him to keep their own corruption quiet, in Nikolai Gogol's 1836 play.

title: No Man's Land
description: Two aged poets have a conversation in a strange home environment filled with hostile servants in Harold Pinter's enigmatic play.

title: Damn Yankees
description: A middle-aged man sells his soul to the devil to become a crackerjack baseball player who can help his beloved Washington Senators beat the Yankees in the World Series. But despite the devil's best attempts — including the sexy Lola — to keep him under his sway, the man wants to return to his wife.

title: A Little More Magic
description: The Canadian black magic troupe Famous People Players manipulate puppet versions of well-known figures, using ultraviolet light to create effects in which the puppets become invisible but the objects they are holding continue to be seen.

title: The Flowering Peach
description: Clifford Odets comically reimagines the Biblical Noah and his family debating the coming Great Flood — and then struggling to survive it on the ark they have built.

title: Carousel
description: Brash carousel barker Billy Bigelow and Julie Jordan, a quiet girl who works in the mill, fall in love, marry, and have a stormy relationship that leads to tragedy and an attempt at mending old wounds from beyond the grave, in Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical adaptation of Ferenc Molnar's play, Liliom.

title: Jackie Mason: Politically Incorrect
description: The controversial comedian Jackie Mason attacks perceptions of cultural stereotypes and addresses instances in which he has taken heat publicly for addressing those stereotypes.

title: Medea
description: A barbarian sorceress is abandoned by her war-hero husband for a Greek princess, turning to the ultimate murder for revenge in Euripedes' tragedy.

title: Twilight: Los Angeles, 1992
description: Anna Deavere Smith examines the aftermath of the Rodney King riots in Los Angeles, in a one-woman show in which she impersonates many of the people she interviewed about the event.

title: Beauty and the Beast
description: A beautiful young woman takes the place of her imprisoned father in the castle of a beast, who is really a cursed prince. She teaches him to be courteous and respectful, and they fall in love, in this stage adaptation of the animated Disney film, based on the classic fairy tale.

title: Picnic
description: A sexy drifter shakes up a Kansas town, particularly its female inhabitants, including a beautiful young girl who yearns for a more exciting life, her plain and bookish sister, and a moralistic but sexually frustrated schoolteacher.

title: Broken Glass
description: A Jewish couple considers their lives and their pasts in 1938 Brooklyn, as storm clouds gather in Nazi Germany.

title: An Inspector Calls
description: An inspector visits an engagement party in a middle-class home in the English countryside to question the guests about the recent suicide of a young woman, in J.B. Priestly's thriller.

title: The Rise and Fall of Little Voice
description: A shy, working-class English girl with the extraordinary ability to mimic the pop singers from her dead father's record collection may be a meal ticket for a low-rent agent, even as the girl's abusive mother hopes to land the agent as a husband.

title: Sally Marr...and Her Escorts
description: Sally Marr, the comedienne who was the mother of Lenny Bruce, gives a course in standup comedy that leads to recollections of the pain in her own life that fostered her standup persona.

title: Passion
description: A young Italian soldier has a passionate affair with a beautiful, married woman, until a transfer to a remote outpost causes him to meet a sickly, unattractive but devoted woman. Her love leads him to rethink the nature of passion, in Stephen Sondheim and James Lapine's musical adaptation of the film Passione d'Amore.

title: The Best Little Whorehouse Goes Public
description: In this sequel to The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas, Miss Mona is asked by the IRS to run the Stallion Fields brothel in Las Vegas, but must contend with right-wing politician A. Harry Hardast's efforts to close it.

title: Grease
description: Danny and Sandy fall for each other during a carefree summer fling. But when the school year begins, Danny is torn between his feelings for good-girl Sandy and his image with the T-Birds and the Pink Ladies.

title: Sunday in the Park with George
description: This Pulitzer Prize-winning musical follows painter Georges Seurat in the months leading up to the completion of his most famous painting, A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte. Consumed by his need to “finish the hat,” Seurat alienates the French bourgeoisie, spurns his fellow artists, and neglects his lover Dot, not realizing that his actions will reverberate over the next 100 years.

title: Gray's Anatomy
description: Spalding Gray discusses his worldwide search for treatment for his failing eyesight in this evening-long comedic monologue.

title: Ian McKellen: A Knight Out at the Lyceum
description: Sir Ian McKellen recalls his personal journey as a gay man and actor in this autobiographical one-man show.

title: Hedda Gabler
description: Ibsen's Hedda Gabler presents a psychological study of a cultivated woman, recently returned from her honeymoon, whose boredom and dissatisfaction in a stifling environment lead her to destroy others — and herself.

title: Philadelphia, Here I Come!
